story:
Who and what is Pip & Lola's?

Well, the boring answer is that Pip & Lola's is a Pittsburgh-area handmade soap company. This is true but that doesn't really explain to you WHO we are. Pip & Lola's was started in 2011 in Seattle, WA by Samantha and Bruce Story-Camp (that's us - yes, that's really our name). Pip is the nickname of our youngest son and Lola is his older sister. Poor Pip had every skin ailment known to man and would suffer with horrible bleeding rashes. Since Samantha (aka Sami aka The Soap Goddess) had been making soap for 5 years by that point, we researched like crazy to try to find a recipe that would work for his poor inflamed tush. Samantha is also an actress in her "spare time" and would make soaps as gifts for her cast mates. Over time more and more friends were requesting soaps and she was creating more and more recipes for Pip's rear and so ... you know, the rest is history.

Fast forward ten years: we find ourselves in Munhall PA just outside of Pittsburgh and (even though Sami swore she would never do this to herself again) we have one adorable little location on 8th Avenue in Homestead. Business is slow but steady and we are loving our growing, loyal fanbase. Then the COVID Pandemic hit.


In spite of having to have to close the storefront for 10 weeks, the shop was still doing okay. We offered up a 25% coupon code that will remain valid for the whole of this COVID crisis (12 months and counting). Online sales were consistent and local customers quickly adapted to door pickup and local delivery. Things were fine. Except one thing was nagging at us.  Since our first year, we have had our Suspended Soap Shelf for which customers can purchase soaps which we then match and donate when we get a bunch gathered together.  During lockdown, our customers really bringing it and we were able to donate 500 bars to food banks and homeless shelters in just a 2 month span.  We were also increasingly aware of the growing needs of domestic violence shelters. We knew that a time which was an annoyance for us was HELL for folks being forced to shelter in place with their abusers. We wanted to do whatever we could to help. We can't afford to write big fat checks.... but SOAP we can do.

Starting in August of 2020, for every TWO items that we sell each month we donate one full sized bar of soap to a local, regional or national domestic violence shelter or charity. In 2020, we were able to donate 3000 bars to Pennsylvania Domestic Violence shelters.

So that's us. Plus we are funny. You should check out some of our ridiculous videos and commercials.

What We Need & What You Get

At the beginning of 2021, we were approached to open not one but TWO locations. One of them is opening right after this campaign ends.
SO how can you help and what's in it for you? Well... this. Up to this point, Sami has been doing all of the soapmaking practically by herself in small batches. We know this is not sustainable long term so she is teaching our employees how to make the soaps. This is the part where she admits to having improvised her way through it all these years in terms of equipment. All of our making equipment has been second hand and adapted from regular household kitchen machinery (crockpots and turkey roasters). When we were only making 25-30 bars at a time, this worked just great. Since we are growing, the local thrift store no longer has the type and size of equipment that we need to keep up with demand. Commercial soapmaking equipment is stupid expensive. Whereas a used roaster can make a 25 lb. batch, we really are needing equipment that can handle 100lbs and more at a time.

And here is where YOU come in. These are the items we are hoping to purchase through this campaign and the prices and uses thereof. This is also the order in which we would be purchasing these items.

  • Lye Tank (20 gallon stainless steel lye tank for storing and dispensing the lye/water solution that is vital to the soapmaking process - the chemistry behind soap is awesome and a little terrifying) - $1800
  • Oil Melters (20 gallon stainless steel heated tank for keeping soaping oils melted in order to increase efficiency) - $1300 each - hoping for 3 tanks for our main three hard oils
  • Oil Melters (13 gallon - so this is basically the same as the above except that it has a flat bottom and we would be adapting it as a soap cooker instead. This would allow us to quadruple our current batch size. The alternative to this would be a steam kettle but those puppies are at minimum $8,000 or so EACH. We will make do) - $1100 - hoping for 3 for those 3 colored batches.
  • Industrial immersion blenders (These bad boys are 2.5 feet long and can reach the bottoms of above mention melters. These are needed to blend the soap mixture and add scents.) - $280 each. Definitely 1. Hoping for at least 2.
  • Larger scale soap molds (quadruple batch molds - soaps have to harden in molds for 24 hours before cutting. Larger molds allows us to mold up larger batches at once.) - $300
  • Commercial soap cutters. (We currently have one that can cut small loafs but if we end up doing larger and longer batches a longer soap cutter will become a necessity. They can cut up to 24 bars at once) - $225
  • Stretch Goal #1 - Soaping Oils (once we are able to purchase all of the above additional funds raised would be used to purchase these oils in 55 gallon drums which brings our cost per ounce down significantly).
  • Stretch Goal #2 - Essential Oils (Same as above. Purchasing these oils in larger quantities allows us to get more bang for our buck. For example, a 16 oz bottle of Lavender essential oil runs about $110 but we could purchase a 10 lb bottle for $380.)

What is in it for you? Oh, friends. We have had the BEST time coming up with a long list of glorious Campaign specific items and experiences for you to enjoy for months and years to come. Everything from Mystery soaps to Soap Goddess original paintings. Every contribution from $5 - $1000 will get a shout out on our social media. Plus SO much more.

The Impact You Can Make

We hope it is pretty obvious the difference you can make. Not just for Sami and her poor hands (soapmaking is very physical work) but also for all of those Domestic violence survivors. We appreciate you reading this far more than words can possible express and hope you will join on our goal to reach 10,000 bars (or more) donated per year.

 

Risks & Challenges

We know that there is always a chance we may not hit our goal. We know that we might have to just "keep on keepin' on" the way we have been and we are prepared for that but we hope that you are able to help us help others in any way you can.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are all being bombarded on all ends from folks needing financial help. We get it. All we ask is if you can't make a contribution that you:

  • Please get the word out to your friends. Friends are more likely to contribute to causes that people they care about care about. Please share our campaign, like us on Facebook and Instagram, join our Facebook group or heck, even just purchase some soapy goodness. Every bit helps.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools. They are super helpful and make helping US simple and easy.

Thank you SO much. And NOW..... have fun exploring and choosing your perks.

story:
Mental Health is everyone's problem

It seems we only talk about mental health in America when we lose a celebrity from depression or someone commits a terrible act of violence.  We view them as "one of those people," and it is just not our concern.  We stigmatize those in mental health resulting in people not seeking treatment.  

But mental health comes in all forms, from simple depression to isolation, phobias including agoraphobia, harm to self and more. Ultimately everyone is affected by mental health one way or another.   It seems as a nation we are on the verge of finally taking everyday, "garden variety" mental health seriously as politicians bring this topic to the national forefront.

Being Alive and Antioch University created a breakthrough mental health program that has made an amazing difference in people's lives while helping to ensure we bring an end to new HIV infections.  Our psychotherapy interns help intervene when someone in crisis and suicidal,  with clients who cut and self-inflict injury, those who suffer with very deep depression and a host of other psycho-dynamic issues.  How?

  • Eliminating barriers to HIV treatment by dealing with survivor's guilt.
  • Addressing internalized homophobia, isolation issues, religious and cultural barriers.
  • Working through depression and anxiety caused by medication & treatment.
  • Developing goals, working through co-factors including substance abuse, self- mutilation issues, harm reduction or other self destructive behaviors.
  • Returning clients to improved physical and mental health, getting them back to work or community, and assisting with re-socialization and integration.


Our clients have the highest success rates of maintaining their health and keeping their HIV viral loads to undetectable levels, keeping their CD4 Helper Immune Cells up and complying with adherence to their medication regimen.  This impacts community by insuring they are not spreading  HIV.  The community benefits with reducing HIV infection rates and all taxpayers benefit with reduced social service program burdens.

Antioch University - Los Angeles (AULA) graduate Psychology program’s LGBT Specialization, and Being Alive, a longtime HIV peer-driven support nonprofit in West Hollywood, brings together their LGBT activist visions to provide counseling and other services to those living with HIV/AIDS and their partners and families. This new LGBT Specialization clinical training program at Being Alive provides LGBT-Affirmative training to AULA’s LGBT Specialization trainees and interns.

Did you know that the lifetime healthcare cost of treating someone with HIV is $327,000.00 not including hospitalization?  That is the discounted rate and the majority of these costs are born by the taxpayers.  And did you know, for the first time in the 33 years of HIV history we can finally end new HIV infections? Absolutely!  You can help be part of history by getting those who are HIV Positive to achieve HIV undetectable viral load.  This, along with agencies who are doing prevention education, the new treatment as prevention (TasP) protocols, and the increasing availability of Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP), we can end HIV infections within just a couple of years.

Mission

In service of all living with HIV/AIDS, and with histories rooted in social justice and the psychological liberation of LGBT people, Being Alive and the LGBT Specialization at Antioch University have become partners as “Antioch Alive”. Our aim is to bring awareness of one’s own inner LGBT-intelligence through counseling, workshops, social activities, and creative projects facilitated by student/intern practitioners trained in LGBT-Affirmative psychology.

The Antioch Alive program is the only program in the nation integrated with supportive care services for all clients resulting in amazing outcomes and achieving better health maintenance and self-advocacy than the national average.  In fact, 82% of all Being Alive clients remain HIV undetectable and in treatment compared to the national average of 29%.

Why Do We Desperately Need More Rooms?

We need additional treatment rooms to service our growing clients base.  Our reputation for unrestricted mental health treatment plans has produced amazing successes, but also has increased the number of clients seeking our services.  Referrals from other collaborating social service agencies have also increased the need for additional treatment rooms for counselors to see clients.

Imagine, you can have a direct impact of the mental health outcomes of men and women who seek the best in mental health services.  No other agency achieves the results that Being Alive does in mental health with client-members affected by HIV. Your support ensures that we end HIV infections!  We also believe that we can be the primary agent in helping one city, the City of West Hollywood, to be the first city in the nation to end new HIV infections by 2017.  Wouldn't you love to be part of this historic goal?  In fact, the City of West Hollywood officials love Being Alive because we are a direct client-member impact service agency.  Being Alive services all of Los Angeles County's 2,045 square miles.  However, there are an estimated 13,000 - 19,000 HIV positive people in LA County still not in treatment and not HIV undetectable.


We currently have 8 psychotherapy counselors seeing clients in 4 treatments rooms, also shared throughout the week with acupuncture interns, intake health educators, chiropractic interns, hypnotherapist, and a cosmetic doctor all volunteering their treatment services or service-learning hours.

  • Last year 3,517 client-members came to Being Alive for 8,749 service visits!
  • Each week 8 psychotherapist provide 150 therapy sessions in just 4 rooms!
  • 4 staff members play "musical chairs" with staff office rooms so that interns can meet in private consultation.
  • Adding 3 additional treatment rooms can reduce the room shortage to service providers and the expected 1,100 new client-members for this year and provide for additional rooms for our psychotherapists to meet the growing demands of added counseling sessions needed.
  • The cost to reconfigure the existing rooms, moving doors and separation walls is only $10,000.  This includes electrical, phone, network wiring, lighting, carpeting, painting and minimal decor.

The Impact

Last year Being Alive had 8,749 client visits for services.  That is an astonishing number of client-members served all provided at No-Cost.  Most agencies provide mental health on a sliding scale.  But Being Alive provides this service at no cost for two main reasons:

  • 70% of client live below the FPG (Federal Poverty Guidelines).
  • 65% of our client-members are on fixed low income and have little to no money left over after rent, food and utilities.

Being Alive's "Antioch Alive" mental health program is the only HIV and LGBT specialized program in the nation.  Our psychotherapist receive extensive intense training in HIV health issues, co-factors and medical adherence complications.  This specialized training makes our psychotherapists uniquely qualified to understand some of the additional barriers in mental health our client-members face.  The end result is that client-members have better outcomes in their mental health treatment.


The results speak for themselves.  In fact, many HIV service agencies with their own mental health programs refer their clients to Being Alive.  Many clients have tried other mental health services at other agencies only to return to Being Alive feeling they get a better result.

Our client-members are not limited to the 26 weeks of treatment that other agencies hold to.  Each client-member is treated individually and the course of treatment is decided by the psychotherapist with clinical supervision guidance to aim for 26 weeks, but not limited to 26 weeks if treatment dictates otherwise.

Psychotherapy interns also provide

  • Crisis Counseling for newly HIV diagnosed clients in mental health crisis.
  • Provide mental health assessments of those brought into service
  • Ensure that Being Alive has a goal of "No Waiting List" for mental health services.

Why Our Program Works

Everyone at Being Alive is involved in our client-member healthy outcomes.  The goal is simple - to ensure that client-members get into HIV treatment, link to HIV services within Being Alive and to other HIV agencies, maintain medication adherence to ensure an HIV undetectable viral load to stop the spread of HIV, access our supportive care services to maintain good health, access our mental health services as determined by staff or when requested and to self advocate for medical literacy and health education.  Client-members are empowered to take charge of their health in ways that medical providers can't do alone.

How Funds Will Be Used

At Being Alive delivering no-cost services to those in need, linking them to services and assisting client-members with access to care is paramount.  Everything we do is client-member centric.   So funds raised will go directly to the project build-out with minimal administrative expense and that is a matter of room rescheduling of client-members and their providers during the construction phase.  Because of HIPAA Privacy Laws, client-member appointments may require room reschedules during construction.  Being Alive uses a third party private communication access for client-provider messaging to comply with HIPAA laws.  This is the only administrative expense that will be allocated for the project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us achieve our goal of adding these additional treatment rooms.

  • First, please participate by supporting our amazing results with your gift.
  • Second, spread the word to everyone you know by posting and sharing with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Google+, blogs and other social networks.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Enlist other friends to help promote this most worthy of causes.
  • Create an army of advocates and prove to the world that it doesn't take a lot to make a huge impact in community.
  • Talk about mental health with your friends and help end the stigma associated with mental health, then ask them to support our Antioch Alive program.
  • Friend us on Facebook.  We're listed as Being Alive LA to stay abreast of all the great things we are doing.

Being Alive thanks you for supporting our Additional Psychotherapy/Treatment Rooms Project.

Garry G Bowie - Executive Director

story:
What is Little Land?

Little Land is a place where kids can be kids… and where kids can grow, develop and interact with each other. Sometimes that may look like one-on-one therapy, other times it may be group sessions or open play. The Little Land concept was developed to revolutionize the way pediatric therapy is administered across our community and to make more developmental based play available to kids in our area.

At Little Land, we offer:

  • Pediatric Occupational, Speech and Physical Therapy
  • Open Play in an environment designed by therapists
  • Music and Art classes
  • Parent's Day and Night Out Programs
  • Birthday Parties and other events

Why are we different?

We've all been to an indoor playground, jumped in a bounce house and done flips on a trampoline. It was a ton of fun, right? Even though it is fun and helps tire a kid out, are your kids gaining anything from it? Are they developing while they play, socializing and developing themselves to be the best kid that they can be? 
We're not trying to replace other indoor playgrounds, we just plan on offering something new and different. We (Ernie & Debbie, aka the founders of Little Land) want to create a place that has all of the fun stuff, but also has a benefit for each kid that visits. Think of it this way; if you were to join a gym, would you want to be able to take part in activities or use equipment that helps your body develop, change and be the best that it can be? That's exactly what we want to have available for kids at Little Land!

What exactly does this mean?
  • Sensory Development Equipment and Activities
  • Fine and Gross Motor Skill Development
  • Social Skills and Interaction with Other Children
  • Development Based Play and Activities

Why is this important for ALL kids? Playing and having fun is how kids learn. Little Land will provide the ultimate environment for your kids to develop to be the best that they can be!


Articles:

Study: Too Many Structured Activities May Hinder Children's Executive Functioning

Playing is kids’ No. 1 job for development, socialization

PBS: Developing and Cultivating Skills Through Sensory Play

PBS: Why We Should Take Play Seriously


Not only do we want Little Land to be a place for kids to grow, but we want you (the parents, grandparents, aunts, uncles, friends, and everyone else) to enjoy yourself as well. What does this mean for you, you ask? We're investing in high quality and comfortable couches and chairs for you to relax in while your kids are playing. We'll start off by offering healthy snacks and fresh (delicious) coffee and teas. We will also have free wifi! Soon after opening, we hope to expand and open the Little Land Cafe & Bakery, too!


Where did Little Land Come From?

Little Land Pediatric Therapy & Play Gym was founded by Ernie and Debbie Beltz to provide top-notch therapy to kids across central Texas. Debbie is an Occupational Therapist and has worked in the pediatric field for over 13 years. Originally from Miami, she has put her skills to work at a number of facilities including children’s hospitals, private clinics and home health. She has a passion for helping infants, toddlers and kids grow to their full potential and realize what they’re truly capable of. Debbie’s husband Ernie is the business guy and takes care of the day-to-day operations of the business. Together, they make a great team and strive to provide the best service, treatment and fun to kids and their families across Texas.

What We Need & What You Get

To keep Little Land on track for a Spring 2015 opening, we need your help to purchase the necessary equipment for the Play Gym. As you can imagine, this equipment is quite expensive, considering it must be safe, durable and designed for a specific developmental, sensory or other childhood need. 

We've set our current goal at $25,000, to provide us with the additional funding that we need to purchase the rest of our equipment for Little Land. If we're able to raise more than that, we'll get started expanding right away. The money you contribute to our campaign doesn't just vanish after you give, you'll be generously rewarded! All of our "perks" are detailed on the right side of this page, but there's something extra that everyone who contributes will get -- an invitation to our grand opening!

The money from our goal of $25,000 will help us purchase:

  • Swings and Slides
  • Platform equipment and indoor zip-line setup
  • Ball pit, balls and ball cleaning and sanitizing machine
  • Various toys and therapeutic activities and equipment
  • Ladders, ropes and crash pads (foam for under the zip line)
  • Basic computer equipment for front desk
  • Refrigerator and coffee maker... yes, this is for you. :) You'll be able to get light snacks and hot/cold drinks while you watch your kids play!
  • Seating, such as comfy chairs and couches. After all, we want you to enjoy Little Land too!
(we added some similar images to the gallery. Click the link at the top of the page)

If we exceed our goal, we will expand and add the following at Little Land:
  • If we raise $35,000, we will open the "Snoezelen Room" (see some pictures here) You can also help us do this by contributing $10,000 -- and we'll even name the room after you! Learn more about Snoezelen here: 
    • http://www.snoezeleninfo.com
  • If we raise $45,000, we will open the Little Land Cafe & Bakery
  • If we raise $55,000, we will add an additional 3,000 sqft of gym space and activities
What are our perks, and why are they so cool you ask?
  • Get invited to our Grand Opening!
  • Day, month and year long passes to Little Land
  • Special Edition T-shirts
  • Get your name on our wall, forever!
  • Bumper Stickers
  • Birthday Parties

The Impact

We're opening this Spring, whether we meet our goal or not. If we don't meet our goal, we risk not being able to purchase all of the necessary equipment for opening day. :( Imagine going to a football game and not having any chairs -- we don't want that to happen at Little Land. With your help, we'll make sure your kids have more fun than ever before, and give you a nice place to sit back, relax and enjoy a cup of coffee while watching your little one play!

Risks & Challenges

We've already found our space, and plan on signing our lease in a couple of weeks. Construction will begin immediately. The biggest risk that we face is that without your help, we might not reach our goal. If we don't meet our goal, we won't have all of the fun stuff prepared in time for your kids to have as much fun as possible when you visit Little Land this spring or summer. 

We're in this together. We have the ideas and everything ready to go... we just need your help so that we can push the "order" button for our excellent games, activities and equipment!

Other Ways You Can Help

Now that you've read all of this great information about Little Land, you're pretty excited, aren't you! But maybe you can't help us out financially -- we totally understand! There are other ways that you can still help us meet our goal:

  • Forward this page, and our information to all of your friends and family.
  • Post a link to this page to Facebook, Twitter, Google+ (and anywhere else you might want to post it to) -- BTW, there are a bunch of sharing buttons at the top of this page to make this part really easy! :)
  • Lastly, come out and see us when we open! 
  • Visit our website at www.littlelandplaygym.com to sign up for other special offers, and promotions!

If you're interested in investing in the long term growth and success of Little Land, please contact us directly at contact@littlelandplaygym.com to learn more!

story:
Mission Statement: To raise the bar of the dining experience in an at-risk area. We service our customers with the highest regard of hospitality and humanity. Happy people serve happy people.

Our Beliefs: The Tea Room believes in respect and integrity. We want our patrons to feel comfortable dining with us and feel uplifted because something like this is in their neighborhood. We believe in establishing a clean, professional, environment that serves not only the people who patronize us but the community in general.

Our Target Customer: Our target customers are professionals 25-55 who work at the city appointed office down the street, the MTA worker, and the teachers who work in the schools. They are professionals who are currently stuck eating unhealthy food from the Chinese Restaurant and Burger King and is ready for a change. They will be very happy to see a eatery like The Tea Room especially because it will have free wifi and seating. This will give them a place to sit and eat lunch comfortably.

About East New York: The East New York area is not known to have eateries that focus on the customer. Most eateries in East New York are sweaty, grease spoon, places that serve their customer through a plastic glass. The furniture is worn, the people working there are tired, and the places are not renovated or modern exceptions to the new eateries in the gateway area which is a hassle to get to if you do not have a car. This area is also missing that creative appeal. There is no place to buy a good cupcake... In the first 3 months, we will try different brands out to see what our top five flavors are and will occasionally have a different kind to spice things up. Cupcakes are the new trend and we hope to also have big orders for people to purchase once we are opened around three months. The Tea Room is all about good energy, good ambiance, good customer service, and good presentation… All factors that are missing in the eateries nearby.

This is a google maps picture of our location. We are in between a barbershop and a beauty salon. As you can see this Cafe will be a good addition to the neighborhood!

What we will serve: This location will serve soups, salads, sandwiches, coffee, tea, oatmeal, cereal, custom drinks, paninis, chicken and waffles, fast small plate foods but most of all DESSERTS. The foods will be simple but creative. There is no one in the area that will serve the kind of foods that we serve. We will also sell the homemade fusion water for people who are on a diet. Also many different kind of teas which include diet teas. We will stay up on all of the trends in the fast casual dining industry such as Peter of Real Housewives of ATL new coffee called, Peter’s Brew. We believe that our customers will love our trendy appeal and will be introducted to products that they necessarily wouldn’t be normally introduced to.

What else will we do? The Tea Room will also have events such as open mic night (Brooklyn Idol) and Karaokee. We will also rent the space out to people looking to have a quaint business or personal event that promotes positivity such as a music related events, book signings, retirement parties, brunch, and/or baby shower.

Why should customers shop with us? Customers should do business with us because we are from the neighborhood and because we have a true love for the people and the community we serve. We are clean, we are cool, we are young, we are hip, we are black owned, and we are professional. Professionalism is a must in order to grow and thrive for years to come. We have free WIFI (with no problems logging on), great food, television, reading materials, and hardworking people who work for our establishment.

What is our edge over the comps in the area? Our edge over the competition is that we are locally owned by an Entrepreneur/Author/TV Personality who has been on television for five years and has over 100,000 followers collectively through Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. The Tea Room Instagram page already has over 700 people following it. Tionna Smalls also has ties with the community and the press that is a recipe for success. Our other competitive edge is that we will sell different kind of items that no one else has. How many places can say they have homemade salad dressing or homemade jam? Not any in this area. We are also hoping to make our own syrup later down the line.


                     

                             Tionna Smalls painting a wall of her new Cafe'...

Final thoughts: This cafe' will be a great addition to the neighborhood and will bring up the value of the neighborhood. We will also bring great events and jobs to the neighborhood. We are opening a business that will be something the neighborhood can be proud of. We will also give back to the neighborhood by giving away free food to the less fortunate on Thanksgiving, back to school supply giveaways, and toy giveaways on Christmas. We don't only want to be a business in the neighborhood but an ASSET in the neighborhood. 

Your donation will help us finish repairs such as the floors, new windows, and lighting. We will also buy some equipment with the money and will show you progress as we move along.


Updates:

These are the mugs we are going to serve our coffee and tea in. OMG, too cute. Do you guys think East New York is ready for all this fabness? 


Here is a photo of some electrical work being done on January 17, 2015 thanks to your donations! Lets keep it going... We hired contractors from the neighborhood. Spread love, it's the Brooklyn way!

                      


Please make a donation! No amount is to small. We thank you for the support ahead of time!

story:
About Dads Parent Cafe In A Box

Dads Parent Cafe in a Box is a tool for educating and supporting fathers in their critical role as a parent and nurturer. This new resource will help to generate conversations among all parents about the importance of a father's involvement and support the implementation of Parent Cafes for Dads only or mixed gender groups addressing fatherhood issues.

Be Strong Families Parent and Dad cafes provide the process and space for families to learn about the Five Strengthening Families™ Protective Factors that research shows keeps families strong and healthy (preventing abuse and neglect) while building them at the same time. 

The Five Protective Factors are: 

  1. Parental Resilience - Being Strong and Flexible

  2. Positive Social Connections - Parents Need Friends

  3. Knowledge of Parenting and Child Development - Being a Great Parent is Part Natural and Part Learned

  4. Concrete Support in Times of Need - We All Need Help Sometimes

  5. Social and Emotional Competence of Children - Parents Need to Help Their Children to Communicate


Be Strong Families Parent Cafes were adapted from the World Cafe Process  and for the past seven years thousands of parents have benefited from participating in this process based on self-reflection and peer to peer support. Parent Cafes provide a platform for learning and strengthening parenting skills in a non-judgmental, interactive environment that allows  parents to come up with the solutions to their own problems and solidify their support systems.  

Through the cafe process, Dads Parent Cafe in a Box will help bring to the surface what we know to be true in our hearts and that the research backs up—fathers play a critical role in raising their children. Often, as fathers, the role of nurturing and supporting the healthy development of our kids is placed on the mother and dads don’t have the space or opportunity to explore how they can be the best parent they can be. There’s no experience truer as a dad than meeting and holding your child for the first time and all at once feeling completely overwhelmed, while still firm in the knowledge that you are the best person for the job.  All dads have the resources and expertise within ourselves to raise kids to be strong and healthy and connecting Dads with their own innate ability to nurture their families is where Dads Parent Cafe in a Box comes in.  

What We Need

Be Strong Families has not received any special funding to develop this tool and your support will help us print this new resource. The cost for our first print run is $9,500. 

We've got some great perks that will help you make a difference and bring you into the Be Strong Families Family!

The Impact

Since 2007, Be Strong Families has been implementing, refining, and adapting the parent cafe process to make it effective for different audiences and organizations. In addition to Dads, other audiences such as Foster Parents, Birth Parents, parents involved with the child welfare system, teens / youth, teen parents, and parents of teens have been using the Be Strong Families Parent Cafe process.

Over 2300 people and organizations in 19 states and U.S. territories have been trained to host parent cafes and Be Strong Families staff, partners, and parent leaders have conducted over 100,000 Parent Cafes Worldwide. It was noted as a key strategy, by the Federal Administration on Children, Youth and Families in 2014 for implementing a protective factors / strengthening families approach.  


Risks & Challenges

Dads Parent Cafe in a Box is just one piece of the puzzle. Any individual or organization that is interested in implementing parent cafes needs to understand that parents, themselves, are the number one resource available to their families, and programs that support and strengthen parents need to value their role in order to provide the most effective support to help strengthen families.  

While anyone can make a deck of cards and say it keeps families strong, Be Strong Families has almost a decade of experience implementing and refining the Parent Cafe process. We've developed and tested thousands of questions that can be used in cafes, including the questions in Dads Parent Cafe in a Box, in order to know what works.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Parent Cafes are successful because people support them not only with donations, but with their time and dedication. Here are more ways you can help!

  • Like Us On Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BeStrongFamilies

  • Use Social Media and Indiegogo tools to share our campaign

  • Ask about our other trainings and how you can join the conversation!

Dads Parent Cafe in a Box is just one piece of the puzzle. Any individual or organization that is interested in implementing parent cafes needs to understand that parents, themselves, are the number one resource available to their families, and programs that support and strengthen parents need to value their role in order to provide the most effective support to help strengthen families.  
While anyone can make a deck of cards and say it keeps families strong, Be Strong Families has almost a decade of experience implementing and refining the Parent Cafe process. We've developed and tested thousands of questions that can be used in cafes, including the questions in Dads Parent Cafe in a Box, in order to know what works.  


Other Ways You Can Help


Parent Cafes are successful because people support them not only with donations, but with their time and dedication. Here are more ways you can help!

Like Us On Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BeStrongFamilies
Use Social Media and Indiegogo tools to share our campaign 
Ask about our other trainings and how you can join the conversation!

story:
Hello everybody!

My name is Alexandra and I'm 24 years old and living in Rhodes, Greece.
Yes, Greece the country tha has been in the papers intensively in the past
couple of months. Yes, we're poor. Yes, the system is fucked up.
Which brings me to my situation. This is a selfish campaign, just so
you know from the start. I don't have to explained to you smart,
well informed people that times are hard and getting fair pay for
a days work is even harder.

I work in a cafeteria 4 times a week and I get...wait for it....4 euros/hour!
WOW, that's amazing you say?!  Well, it's not. I can't get another job,
I can't pay my rent, and so many other things but this is a selfish campaign
as I said, not a greedy one, so I'm only gonna ask for money to pay the rent.
I wanted to ask for 300 euros but Indiegogo has set the lowest asking limit
to 500 euros so I guess I had to be a little greedy after all..Indiegogo made me do it! 

What happens if I can't pay the rent you say?
Well, I guess there are some nice sun beds at the beach which can
accomodate me and my pet grasshopper José.

That's all folks, simple and honest.

story:
Short Summary


"Stress cannot exist in the presence of a pie." 

---David Mamet

Powder River Pies has been a fixture at Farmers Markets and Trade Days, in Texas, since 2007. Honestly, though, I didn't start out to be a baker. I grew up in the saddle, up in the Texas panhandle. Then, one Thanksgiving, my Mom pulled up to my brother's house with two pecan pies in-hand. (She ALWAYS made at least ten pies, so I offered to fetch the rest.)

Mom said "This is it. I only made two."

There were 30 people in that house, waiting for the spread (and her pie) so --- rightfully --- I panicked. I asked her, "What am I going to do for pie when you die?" Her reply: "Well, I guess you just better get with it."

And so, I did. I spent the day learning how to make her crust and pies. And I've made thousands of pies, since then.

There have been many, many surprising results. I reckon the best compliment so far comes from my ex-wife who said "the best thing about gettin' away from you is that I dropped 40 pounds." (That's going on the website ..... HAR).

On the up side, I've gotten a few marriage proposals, strictly on the basis of my pies....so I guess it all evens out, in the long run. :>)

So, I guess you could say, Powder River Pies is a tip of the hat and a low bow to a grand gal, my Mom. She was a rodeo queen who broke her hip riding bulls, first rate cook, and a top hand at poker and didn't hesitate to teach you how to play every time she took a pot.

I guess it's the same with the pies = she shared the recipe and the love, which are the key ingredients in all Powder River Pies, with me.

So I'd like to share them with you, and the world!



What We Need 

Powder River Pies has been producing and selling some of the best pies anywhere, for eight years. Today, we are a destination at the Farmers Markets. People shop specifically for our pies.


Your funding will allow us to get to the next stage, and allow us to participate in more markets, and major venues, such as the State Fair of Texas.

In that regard, the State of Texas has a Cottage Industry law that lets you bake in a residential kitchen. But, to take Powder River Pies to the next level, I need to secure a Certified Food Manager card and a commercial kitchen.

Only then can we sell wholesale, on the Internet, and get FDA certified to sell across state lines.

So here's the breakdown of what we need, financially:

Pie Press                         $1,300  (Would allow me to produce 40 pies per hr)
Lease/Deposits             $7,000  (Includes finish out)
General Liability Insurance         $450  
Logo/Website/Graphic Design/Video   $3000
Convection Double Oven  $2500  (This would triple my baking output)
Carts/Trays/Pans      $750
20 qt. mixer                  $1500 (Now using a 1964, 5-qt Kitchen Aide)
Stainless Steel Tables/Sinks   $1000
Refrigeration               $3000 (Pies are cooled, shrink wrapped)
Trailer                           $3,500  (To haul refrigerator and booth displays, so to facilitate my ability to sell pies at fairs, special events, etc.)
Total Funding Needed                           $25,000

The purchasing plan is to buy the majority on the used/auction market. (For example, I just purchased a True Bar Back Cooler, online, for $100.00. They ordinarily retail for $1,800.00 new. So I know how to spend wisely!)

My humble beginnings.

...But It's Not All About Pie!

I'm really fortunate. I have a great product. I love going out to the Markets and Fairs. It's a hoot. And I believe that I have been given a gift....not out of birthright, so much as strictly based on great good fortune.

People may love the pies, but I love what the pies represent.

For me, they are the way for me to bring what I have been given to others, and that can show other folks --- single moms who need a job and a safe place for their kids, people who got twisted up in life and don't think they can have a second chance, or anyone who has lost faith in themselves and what they can do --- to hire these people and instill a sense of pride and ownership in their jobs.

For you, that means MORE AND BETTER PIES.

(So maybe, on that level, it really is all about the pie.)


Lastly

Once you have tasted our pecan pie, in particular, you'll turn and slap your mate (or yourself, upside the head), and wonder "HOW IS THIS GUY SINGLE???"* Well...I figure this Indiegogo campaign can, at least, get me on the right road.

In all honesty, I have been told repeatedly that I make the very best Pecan Pie that you've EVER had. And so, I want the world to taste it. Look over my Perks. 
MORE TO THE POINT: My philosophy, is this --> "If you don't think you have the best product on the market, quit. Get out. Do something else."

And a HEARTY THANK YOU, for taking the time to read this. There is so much more to say. You can always email me.

SPECIAL PERK: Everybody who ponies up on our funding have a standing invitation to drop by any fair we're at or drop by the kitchen, and get a 4" pie on us. We'd love to see you. Plus, you get braggin' rights, to be able to point at our pies and say how you're one of our benefactors. 

We'll have a picture taken with you. And your....OUR...pies! And put it up on our Hall of Fame.

Happy Trails,

Kirk "The Pieman" Pitman

Acknowledgments:

To Mr. John (Kat) Katsontonis for editing. He was able to interpret "Kirkspeak" and make it readable. And to Mrs. Carole Hayes "Shot by Carole" for her pie photos. (The ones that look like you could eat them right there, are HERS.)

*(Marriage Proposals: send a picture of your truck, bass boat and/or shotgun, and dog to hereiam@powderriverpies.com)

story:
Say hello to the first commercially available chocolate 3D printer on the market. You won’t have to wait any longer to be able to print out custom chocolate shapes
straight from your own space! Print Arsenal is now ready to sell its first working prototype for as low as $3,800. It prints out custom designs in dark, milk & white chocolate. We need your help to redesign our chocolate 3D printer to include better features! We are building a product that has never been made available to consumers before!  

We are now using 3D technology to bring chocolate goodness to consumers in unanticipated and exciting ways. 3D printing gives consumers nearly endless possibilities for personalizing their chocolate, and we look forward to continued development of this amazing technology.

Our amazing team of experienced & skilled engineers in NYC has helped us bring this printer to life, now it's your turn to help us fund it!



"CocoJet already has some competition. Print Arsenal launched an Indiegogo campaign just this week to make its $3,800, cocoa bean-liquefying 3-D chocolate printer prototype a reality. Let the 3-D printed chocolate wars begin. We’re happy to sample the spoils." - Yahoo! Finance 



"CocoJet is going to face some tough competition as Print Arsenal has also launched an Indiegogo campaign, a global crowdfunding engine. Print Arsenal, with the help of the funds, hope to make a cocoa bean-liquefying 3D printer." - International Business Times 



"If you saw something flying out the window just now as I revved up the car and took off, don’t bother to pick it up. It was just my mental New Year’s resolution fluttering away in the wind, firmly listing all the reasons I was never planning to eat anything enjoyable again — like sweet, delectable blocks of chocolate. After considerable time spent studying the Print Arsenal chocolate 3D printer this morning, I decided maybe cutting out the good things in life is not such a smart idea — not this week, anyway." - 3D Print

http://3dprint.com/35540/printer-arsenal-indiegogo/

                                                       


Print Arsenal's Chocolate 3D Printer is fitted with a twin-screw extruder, so that you would print out a chocolate pattern within a few minutes. Moreover, the printing size is relatively large, the maximum printing size is 100mm * 150mm * 100mm.


The chocolate 3D printer allows you to design custom chocolates and offer them fresh. You can model chocolate into aesthetically pleasing and delectable textures and shapes.

Traditional chocolate manufacturing machines have their limitations when it comes to forming precise and complicated shapes and patterns. In contrast, digital gastronomy, is allowing for the creation of flavors and textures that is completely unimaginable through other cooking techniques.

Big food manufacturers and companies that sell households appliances haven’t yet launched commercial-grade chocolate printers. We would like to be the first.

The 3D printer is equipped with a heated chocolate extruder and has a syringe to create the final product. Printed chocolate must be made with just the right application of mechanical force, plus a well-designed digital “recipe” using raw ingredients of the correct consistency. Raw ingredients must be soft enough to push through a syringe tip, yet stiff enough to hold shape after being printed. To print food, the printer must first be specially outfitted so it can work with edible raw material.

Like any other 3D printed goodie, chocolate printing starts as a design file. Food printing fans download their chocolate design file from a website or create their own design files from scratch using engineering design software.

The machine is mainly controlled by the computer, consisting of automation material and ingredients storage, extrusion structure, delivery devices. It enables the user to pick up their favorite shapes from three-dimensional models stored in advance, as well as to design their own unique styles according to their preferences by using the software. After all these preparations, once they click on the “Print” button, the nozzles will evenly extrude chocolate “ink”, so as to form the nutritious, healthy and interesting chocolate shape layer by layer.


                

                                       

To start, you have to put the chocolate chips into the hopper, the piston driven by double screw motor will squeeze the chocolate chips downward. When chocolate chips are pushed to the heating devices, the temperature will rise as high as 40 degrees Celsius. At this time, the solid chocolate will transform into liquid. Then the nozzle, with a diameter of 4 mm, will extrude liquid chocolate to form a real chocolate structure. When it’s done, you can take the printed chocolate away carefully and refill the syringe with chocolate for the next build, or could simply discharge the remaining chocolate out form the syringe to keep as back up.

The printed chocolate dries naturally. When the chocolate cools back to room temperature, it will harden again. As for the screen, you can use it to adjust the temperature & select the design from the SD card; it reads SD cards.

  

We live in a technical world where technology leaps are occurring very rapidly. Print Arsenal’s focus is to keep up with the current market and to constantly deliver you the latest high-end 3D printing technology.

Therefore, your contribution on Indiegogo.com will allow us to redesign our chocolate 3D printer, add amazing new features and invest in marketing. Further, we will develop a fully customized website that will have a custom software integrated into it which will be open-sourced. We will offer a wide variety of STL files on the website. We will set up an excellent customer service to guide you every step of the way and to be able to browse our website with ease. We will establish a program that will largely rely on feedback from our customers in terms of improvement suggestions; we will seek for your input & ideas during our progress to ensure effective operations.

Investing in a local factory in New York will also be necessary to provide a quick and adequate supply of our product in order to keep up with growing sales. 

Finally, we will continue to invest in developing new affordable & unique printers that won’t be available anywhere else. 


               

               



           

The chocolate 3D printer will allow chocolate artists, companies & pastry chefs to grow their clientele by giving them the opportunity to print out as many different chocolate shapes as they'd like at any given moment. 

Also, chocolate is the favorite food for many children. There are many chocolates for sale at stores, but none of them have your favorite custom shape. Our chocolate 3D printer is the solution.


We have worked with the printer & tested it several times. It functions perfectly. We don't anticipate delays in production and shipping, but will communicate to you if any occur.  We currently have a few complete operating prototypes and are establishing plans for commercial manufacturing.

Planned additional features & colors, software & hardware improvements, and future support will depend on continued success of the campaign with users like you and the developer community.


For any questions or inquiries, please don't hesitate to e-mail us at contact@printarsenal.com

Get your own "I Love Chocolate" mug, T-Shirt & keychain now by contributing! Don't forget to email us your size!



1. Is it okay to contribute several times?

Yes you can. If you wish to select an additional perk, you can do this in a separate contribution until the close of this Campaign. Please confirm Contribution Amount Restrictions at https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/526846-Common-Contribution-Errors#maximums

2. If I purchase the printer outside of Indiegogo, what will come with it?

You will receive a 1kg pack of cocoa powder that you will have to turn into liquid chocolate with your favorite flavor, to then feed the printer.

3. Does the printer come with warranty?

Yes. When you purchase the printer you get a free 5 year warranty. The warranty will also come with the printer when you contribute to our campaign.

4. Do you ship internationally?

Yes. We ship all around the world. We do not cover the cost of shipping.

5. Where can I get customer service?

We are currently a small group of hard working individuals ready to serve you at any given moment; our service is very personal. To contact us about any issues or concerns, you can email us at contact@printarsenal.com & we will assist you right away. Through this campaign, we expect to expand our customer support system to better suit our growing customer base.


You should already see the enormous value of our chocolate 3D printer. We’d like to serve as an inspiration for other entrepreneurs and startup enterprises to get out there and release their innovations to the world through the crowdfunding model. We already know a lot of people who need this product, so tell your friends to contribute so we can promote it to the world. Sharing this campaign on your social media profile is just as valuable to us as an actual financial pledge.

We’d like to serve as an inspiration for other entrepreneurs and startup enterprises to get out there and release their innovations to the world through the crowdfunding model. We already know a lot of people who need this product, so tell your friends to contribute so we can promote it to the world. Sharing this campaign on your social media profile is just as valuable to us as an actual financial pledge.

story:
Our World Today

If you could eat healthy – truly healthy – would you? Of course you would! And if you have children, you'd want them to eat healthy, too. Any parent wants the best for their kids.

Unfortunately, due to the lack of food outlets that sell fresh produce in urban areas and the cost of organic produce in the places that do, truly eating healthy in urban America is not a realistic option for many.

Even those who are able to buy fresh are not getting the flavor and nutrients they need due to GMOs and immature harvesting. Let's face it, produce these days, just isn’t what it used to be.

Enter SuperGrow™. We’re a company that has taken the concerns of nutritious produce to heart and have patented a technology that allows fresh, local, organic produce to be grown in soil, any season, anywhere … even in urban areas where it’s needed most.

Enter Boys & Girls Clubs.  Boys & Girls Clubs across America are often located right at the heart of urban centers and are already educating children with their core program, Healthy Habits. They're expanding this education by sharing it with the families, as well, through Family Plus. 

SuperGrow™ is working with the Boys & Girls Clubs of Greater Lee County, Alabama, to pilot a program which we believe will have high impact on the lives of the children at their Auburn and Opelika locations, touching the lives of their families and communities as well.  What we initiate here, too, has the potential to be replicated through Boys & Girls Clubs across the United States. 

_____________________________________________________________________________

Did You Know …
     •  23.5 million Americans lack reasonable access to fresh produce.
     • 50% of Birmingham, AL is classified by USDA as an Urban Food Desert
     • Auburn, AL has an Urban Food Desert located contiguous to the University

_____________________________________________________________________________

In fact 1 in 4 children in this area are food insecure, meaning they’re not getting the vitamins and nutrients they need.

An average 3 out of 10 kids are overweight or obese, putting them at risk for health problems throughout their lives.

What we do together here can have a resounding effect in our nation.


What Is SuperGrow and How Can It Help?

We at SuperGrow™ are forerunners in urban farming technologies and methods. We have developed a patented grow method  called “terraponics” that allows produce to be grown indoors, year-round, in soil – not hydroponically or aeroponically. This, we do in converted shipping containers called SuperGrow Containers™ or  buildings converted with the same technology called SuperGrow Centers™. These can be positioned locally right in the urban areas, themselves, by the establishments that serve the community.

Through our grow method, the result is produce that is free of pesticides, protected from the harmful impacts of the environment, 100% organic, free of GMOs, and grows in about half the time with predictable yields. We have virtually zero harvest lost due to spoiling or transportation. 98% of our produce is given a #1 rating for perfect size and shape. And, best of all, the flavor and nutrients are truly exceptional.

_____________________________________________________________________________

More Important Facts You Should Know ...
     •  About 5% of all crops fail each year without catastrophic weather events
     •  Between 45% to 68% of many produce items spoil between the time 
         they are harvested and the time they're sold at retail.
     •  Up to 20% more produce spoils at the retail outlet or restaurant prior 
         to purchase.

_____________________________________________________________________________


Our greatest desire is to positively impact communities. That’s why teaming with the Boys & Girls Clubs of Greater Lee County is so important to us.

Through this program – and with your help – we aim to provide the boys and girls with a grow center of their own … right on their premises.

By converting one of their existing storage rooms, we’ll be able to set them up with the same technology we use in our SuperGrow Containers™ and SuperGrow Centers™ and allow the kids to learn and enjoy growing their own produce. Since we are soil-based, what the children learn and experience is easily transferable. They’ll gain skills and knowledge they can use at home and carry the rest of their lives.  

With your help we will equip the Boys & Girls Clubs with our soil-based racking system, LED grow lights, watering, composting, and air management systems. We’ll be able to apply this to small rooms or closets. In fact, we’ve already tested this approach with 2nd and 4th graders in a local 4H program so we’re confident it will work with the Boys & Girls Clubs as well.

Most important, however, is the kids will not only get to learn to eat healthy, but they’ll be taking on a sense of responsibility. Through the program, they’ll learn about setting and accomplishing goals. In addition to the produce that they’ll keep for themselves, they’ll in fact be planting, growing, and harvesting produce for local restaurants as well. This means, meeting deadlines and working closely as a team. They’ll be learning – in a fun way – how to face challenges and grow something they can be proud of. And as they grow, so does their confidence. They’re not just gaining a healthy diet through this program, they’re gaining a healthy attitude. They’re learning to be Great.


What Are the Risks?

Who is Leading? Of course, before  supporting any venture, you want to make sure the people behind it can deliver what is promised and have integrity as well as good business and social impact sense.  Although we’re still a start-up company, we have a foundation of success you can depend on.

Let’s begin with our CEO, James Massa. James is a long-time veteran of success. For 25 years he was an executive in the high-tech industry helping 3 start-up companies achieve their initial public offering goals.  For 14 years he worked with Cisco Systems, finishing his term there as VP and Chief Strategist of Global Government Solutions. He has served the nation on the National Security Telecommunications Advisory Council to the President of the United States as Chairman of the Internet Architecture Task Force. And if that isn’t enough, he’s been named by USA Today as a leader in Social Impact.

James lives out Cisco’s theme of changing the way people live, work, play, and learn. He sets his sights on creating platforms that provide sustainable solutions for essential needs. His heart, and ours, is to help others impact their communities, through sustainability, in a way that can be duplicated globally.

Who is Helping?  James has assembled a team of highly motivated, like minded, young men and women with degrees in agriculture, sustainability, business, human sciences, and more.  To this he has added seasoned veterans in disciplines ranging from forestry to marketing to the hospitality industry.  

What is the track record so far?  With regard to SuperGrow™ as a whole, we have been growing in success since 2010.  We have had a clear vision forward and achieved planned milestones along the way. Our initial roots comprised of developing prototypes and refining methodologies. (click here to see a larger view of the diagram to the right). 
We have since advanced  our patent on terraponics and are providing produce weekly for local restaurants in the Auburn area, with ever-increasing  demand. To fulfill the requirement to meet this demand, we are opening our first SuperGrow Center™ this summer, with a vision to take things not just nationally, but globally. 
By supporting this program with the Boys & Girls Clubs, you will be investing in a purpose that touches communities far and wide, and it starts with the children. Together we can impact them, and provide for their needs.  What you do to touch the life of a child impacts society.


How Can You Help?

We’re glad you asked!

First and foremost, donate.

As you’ll see to the right, there are a number of Perks available to wet your palate. There is also a wide range of offerings to meet any budget. Every little bit counts. As you’re looking these over, here are examples of what you can get.

Note: To select a perk, click on one of the Perk boxes to the right or click the pink "Select a Perk" button at the bottom of this page.

Tshirts

Drawstring Bags

Pesto

Now, if you’re not able to donate at this moment, you can still help!  Thanks to social media these days, word gets around fast. The more people know about this, the more of an impact we can make – and not just on this immediate program.  We already have other Boys & Girls Clubs interested in the same. We’d love to be able to replicate this program for them as well. So when you help us exceed our goal, we’ll be able to do just that. 100% of anything you donate will go towards helping  implement programs with Boys & Girls Clubs in our nation.

Spread the word!  Here are some ideas to get you going:

  • Use the share tools at the top left of this page.
  • Like us on Facebook and share our posts.
  • Visit our Resources Page for promo images you can send by email and social media.
  • Forward our video with this link to our campaign: igg.me/at/supergrow-bgc
  • When you donate, get a perk for someone else. Tell them about it, and see what they do! (Some of our perks come with multiple items so you can keep one or more for yourself.)
  • If you’re in the Auburn area, come by SuperGrow headquarters and get some cards to pass out. Here’s an example of what they look like. Email us at  marketing@supergrow.ag if you'd like some.

And most of all have fun! You’re doing something amazing to touch the lives of children and their communities. In fact over 250 kids will be directly involved and affected by this. They’ll grow over 30 pounds of organic Romaine or Spring Mix lettuce, nearly 500 basil plants, or over 15 pounds of Arugula … per week!  That’s a lot of produce! 

Imagine the impact.

So join us and let’s Grow Greatness!!


New & Noteworthy

April 21, 2015 – Our focus has always been to grow as much variety of produce as possible. Currently, our supply includes romaine lettuce, spring mix, arugula, spinach, and basil but we are now installing a grow apparatus for tomatoes and cucumbers as well. 



_____________________________________________________________________________

Why Pink?

In our Perks, we offer a "GrowPink" option for the ladies. Believe it or not, when it comes to photosynthesis, plants only absorb red and blue light. In fact the reason plants are green is because it is only the green rays they reflect. Combining red and blue produces the pink hue shining on  our soil-based grow beds. The miracle is that our plants grow faster this way and we use 68% less energy! Pink LED lighting also lasts over 10 years, creating less waste in landfills, and when they’re disposed of they emit no harmful gases. Grow Pink. It’s the new Green!

_____________________________________________________________________________

story:
Experience, potential for the future

Just 70 years a go, Serbia was one of worldwide leading producers of industrial hemp. Today, the plant is nearly forgotten.

Industrial hemp creates a broad range of opportunities for local sustainable development. We would like to create a community center that will support planting and processing industrial hemp in the northern part of Serbia. We focus mainly on educational and promotional activities. 

Your help is needed to lend an old house and the land around, to use it for a series of seminars and workshops. 

We will teach anyone who shows their interest in hemp planting, rope production, canvas and paper making as well as we will provide natural hemp based cosmetics workshops and hemp chef courses. 

We will support our trainees to start their own hemp business, what should create new job opportunities in high unemployment rate area of Serbia

What We Need & What You Get

The total budget for this project is 2100 € that will be used for training center rental for a first 6 months. 

Any of your contributions will be rewarded in original way, but we are sure that best reward you will have from supporting our project is your power to make one dream to come true :). 

    The Impact

    Our project will:

    • Spread awareness of the benefits and advantages of industrial hemp.
    • Motivate local farmers to re-establish industrial hemp planting.
    • Create new plant processing capacities.
    • Open new employment opportunities for local people.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Finances are important, but it is not the only way you can support this project. So, please share, share, share.

    Every cent counts, and this is why we need to involve in the project as many people possible. Be part of our team and spread a word about this project among your friends.

    Thank you :)

story:
Why Should You Check it Out? Because it's an awesome website to enjoy, and to gain fresh, new insights on how to effectively access and develop your extraordinary, innate potential.

"At Zero Universal, our focus is to create higher technologies that will assist us to remember... that we are designed to be wondrous Human beings."




If you feel it's time to catalyze, maximize and super-charge
your world, then fabulous: We get excited about that!

Together we can accelerate this whole transformation process. 
Your contribution to this effort will play a huge part in Zero Universal's ongoing development. 


Our next steps are to continue our progress in the following areas:

  • Organize and fire up a GRAPHIC ARTS team of innovative, multidimensional professionals who will produce advanced content for a variety of media.  This group will formulate consciousness based, visionary graphics, charts, videos and uplifting multimedia offerings that will portray the new realities of higher Human experience.
  • Develop the web platform for the UNIVERSITY OF THE INFINITE, which will showcase higher consciousness education, assisted by expansive graphic templates that emphasize direct exploration of expanded awareness.
  • Implement the CONNECTION PORTAL, which will be a resource to inspire and connect people with others of like mind, to support the expression of their creative potential.

    • For more detail, please look at our Stretch Goals Chart at the bottom of this page.



    We have just launched our ZeroUniversal.com website, where you will find a more comprehensive understanding of the uplifting concepts outlined above. Below are 2 video overviews of our website:



    We invite you to explore the 1st phase of
    our creative output here: ZeroUniversal.com/Music




    Our master vision at Zero Universal is to share effective "upgrade technologies"
    and to collaborate in creating a coherent, harmonious and evolving
    planet through multimedia entertainment.

    We are developing a deep and brilliant portfolio of content for popular
    media that will tell the stories of Humanity's transformation
    into an inspiring new era of fulfillment.



    ... that will illuminate
    the expanding reality of Humanity


    Zero Universal Entertainment encourages you to look beyond the 5 senses and to experience a more complete picture of reality, where we can peer into the multi-dimensional levels of life and begin to know of the magnificent potentials that are available.



    http://igg.me/at/zerouniversal

    You can contact us at:  gordon@zero-universal.com



















    We have a bold attitude at the ZU, which is summed
    up by the phrase "Why hold back"... so here we go:


    CONGRATULATIONS ON MAKING IT ALL THE WAY THROUGH THE CAMPAIGN.



    JOIN US AND LET'S HAVE SOME FUN.    ALL THE BEST TO YOU, FROM GORDON, DOMINIQUE, MARTIN, FRITS AND MANY, MANY OTHERS.

    Click here to know more ABOUT US

story:
Hi! My name is Amy Pareezer and I work directly with a registered charity called Birds Of Passage in Sydney, Australia who help the disadvantaged by providing food, clothes and wellbeing services. As of August 2015, I will relocate indefinitely to an Orphanage in Talamarang, Nepal (two hours north of Kathmandu) as an ambassador for Birds Of Passage to help assist the locals in gaining a greater standard of living. 

After an eye opening trip to Nepal in 2011, I was deeply affected by the deteriorating economic conditions within the area and equally in awe of the local's resilience and capacity for joy under such deplorable circumstances. To imagine what the affect of providing a few basic needs will have on their daily lives and their heightened experience of happiness fueled my desire to help the orphans in the rural town of Talamarang. I would like to raise enough funds for the 4 items listed below, for which I will personally oversee the delivery of whilst based there. 


The Mission

There are 30 children living in the Talamarang orphanage, who live in deplorable conditions. All funds raised will go entirely towards the delivery of the following (in order of priority):

  • Fresh Water $10k
  • Security Fencing $4k
  • Buffalo $2k
  • Beehive $1k
I will personally oversee that every dollar contributed will go directly to the delivery of these projects.
You will also be able to track the delivery of these projects via the Birds Of Passage Facebook page, www.facebook.com/birdsofpassageau, with progress photos uploaded fortnightly.

called Birds Of Passage in Sydney, Australia who help the disadvantaged by
providing food, clothes and wellbeing services. As of August 2015, I will
relocate indefinitely to an Orphanage in Talamarang, Nepal (two hours north of
Kathmandu) as an ambassador for Birds Of Passage to help assist the
locals in gaining a greater standard of living. 
After an
eye opening trip to Nepal in 2011, I was deeply affected by the deteriorating
economic conditions within the area and equally in awe of the local's
resilience and capacity for joy under such
deplorable circumstances. To imagine what the affect
of providing a few basic needs will have on their daily lives and their
heightened experience of happiness fueled my desire to help the orphans in the rural town of Talamarang. I would like to raise enough funds for the 4 items listed below, for which I will personally oversee the delivery of whilst based there. 
The Mission
There are 30 children living in the Talamarang orphanage, who live in deplorable conditions. All funds raised will go entirely towards the delivery of the following (in order of priority):


Fresh Water $10k


Security Fencing $4k


Buffalo $2k


Beehive $1k

I will personally oversee that every dollar contributed will go directly to the delivery of these projects.
You will also be able to track the delivery of these projects via the Birds Of Passage Facebook page, www.facebook.com/birdsofpassageau, with progress photos uploaded fortnightly.

story:
Introduction

SearchCo.info is a business search engine and advertising classifieds. It is the brainchild of Ron Glenn, a producer and graphic/web designer. We provide free business information, job listings, ad postings, coupons, and other resources for new and established companies. The purpose of SearchCo is to provide easy business solutions and networking options to businesses locally, across the nation, and eventually worldwide. We create revenue by providing discounted ad services and ad space to local and major businesses. The key to providing these services is having a user friendly website and app that:

  • Includes every advertising, marketing, and promotional option available, including free and paid services
  • Provides a social network for business to business communication (B2B) through forums, listings, and ads
  • Provides free business information and discounts

What We Need & What You Get

SearchCo is currently raising  $10,000 to help launch our 3 month national marketing and advertising campaign this spring through summer. This will also be used to help enhance the current SearchCo.info website and build the future mobile application. Our marketing campaign will include the following:

  • Advertising in newspaper, magazines, radio and online publications
  • Local guerrilla marketing campaigns and grassroots advertising through events and interest meetings
  • Social media and keyword advertising, such as Facebook Ads, Google Ads, and Instagram
  • Promotional merchandise
  • Affordable Billboard & Metro Ad space

These ads will be launched in Virginia, New York, Miami, Philadelphia Washington DC, and Atlanta. 

Guerrilla Marketing & Street Team

SearchCo will hire 5-6 local promotional models per location to help distribute promotional materials such as flyers, posters and free merchandise for one or two day events. We will also facilitate the on-site sign up for the SearchCo.info site via laptop, mobile or tablet.

Business Events and Interest Meetings

SearchCo will have weekly interest meetings to provide SearchCo services to local businesses. These meetings will be promoted using radio, social media and email marketing. We will explain how the site and app work, how to sign up, our affiliate program, and adverting options and rates. This will not only expand our brand, but explain the benefits of using our system over other websites and services. 

Social Media & Online Advertising

SearchCo will advertise daily through social media and online platforms such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Craigslist and Linkedin. This will expand our network and allow our site and app to increase traffic exponentially, gain first time and repeat customers, and increase ad sales. 

Print, Radio and Online Publications

SearchCo will run advertising in local newspapers, magazines, radio and online publications, including select major publications, such as the Wallstreet Journal and Washington Post. This will expand our brand's visibility and help SearchCo.info become a trusted business information and networking resource. 

Affordable Billboard & Metro Ad space

SearchCo will also advertise in select local areas using billboard and regional public transportation ad space provided through CBS and other ad space providers. This will further increase our brand and make it easy for consumers to recognize the SearchCo logo and advertising. It will also allow us to compete on the same level as other sites that provide similar services such as Monster, Craigslist, and Angie's List. 

Further Website & App Development

With any website business, you have to stay ahead of the curve to remain relevant and provide the highest quality of services that customers deserve. With your help, we will be able to improve our current website and finish the development of our mobile application through Apple and Google Play. This will allow more people to have  access to our services and expand our network. It will also cover the expenses of web development, coding, and design. 

What You Get

We want everyone to feel like they are a part of the SearchCo.info brand.  Anyone who donates at least $1 will receive a certificate thanking them for their help. People who donate $10 or more to our cause will receive a SearchCo pen and notepad as a thank you for your contribution. You will also be listed on our website. 

The Impact

By donating to our campaign, SearchCo will expand and grow into a national and international business network. We have been able to provide advertising and marketing services to small and major businesses over the past 10 years. Our goal is to take our expertise from local to a national and worldwide level by growing our brand and advertising reach. Every business wants to utilize as many free resources as possible before having to spend their own capital. By providing these services and discounted paid options, it will empower every business, big or small, to expand their business through an easy system such as SearchCo.

Risks & Challenges

The challenge we face as a new company is that there are other businesses that provide similar services. Craigslist provides job listings and classifieds. Monster.com provides job listings. Angie's List provides information for local businesses. And Google and Yahoo provide an overall web search for business keywords. The problem is none of the sources include every feature a business would need in a easy to use platform. SearchCo provides all the business resources a company could need all-in-one. The only thing that separates us from our competition is having the capital to make our brand visible. With your help, we will defeat this obstacle.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help monetarily, please share this campaign on your social media and blogs to help us spread the word. Let's help make SearchCo the best resource for business information on the web!

story:
Hello and welcome to my campaign, I was born in Madeira and I have been living and working abroad for 6 years… 

After taking my driving licence I started to look for ways to move around Madeira Island when on Holiday. I’m a big fan of two wheels however I have been very shocked by the rental prices on the island, I didn’t expect to pay more to rent a scooter than a car. But that was the reality at that time and also the reason why I decided to set up my own business at the end of 2014.

We are the first Low Cost scooter rental on the island. However our fleet is currently very small (6) which limits our ability to have even lower prices.

This fundraising is the occasion for you to give us a hand to purchase  4 new 125cc scooters, each of them costing 2899€ (this price includes: Scooter, Registration and other legal fees, Insurance, Top Case and 2 Helmets).

Helping us is helping anyone that visits the island and wants to rent a scooter for a fairer price.

Thank you for stopping by!
