story:
Our Mission:

"Is to make shopping for American Made products easy, while enriching the American consumer experience."

Allow us to introduce ourselves.

We are an American company selling American Made goods specializing in Clothing, Accessories & Goods for Men & Women. To put it another way, We are an American lifestyle company tailored for the American Lifestyle. That's it, nothing more and certainly nothing less. 

Launched in 2014, the company was conceived after my wife and I took the Made in America Challenge. Frustrated with the effort it took to find the Made in USA products, yet, amazed by the depth, breadth and quality of the American Made goods available in the market, it was clear. There simply needed to be a better resource for the craftsmen, designers & makers of the American Made products to showcase their unique skills & talents in one easy to shop location. With the seed planted, One-Flag was born.

A Different Retail Model

What sets us apart and makes us different from every other Retail Store?

  • What we sell
  • Why we sell these products
  • How we source our products
  • How we classify the products we sell

What we Sell:

Everything we sell is Proudly Made in the USA.
We specialize in Products for Women & Men with a wide assortment of Accessories & specially curated Goods. To see our full assortment, visit our website at www.one-flag.com.


Our assortment is constantly growing & expanding; however, because we're a start-up e-commerce business, some of the larger makers and manufacturers were wary to offer their products for sale on our site. They liked what we were doing and told us that if we ever open a brick & mortar store they would be there to support us. Our first priority will be to support the brands and makers that have helped us get to where we are; however, in our to desire to bring a proper & full assortment to our customers, we will be offering even more All-American awesome when we open our flagship store this May.

Perks:


Why we sell these products:

  • We believe in American manufacturing
  • We believe in a balanced economy of Production & Consumption
  • We believe in Quality over Quantity
  • We want to know where the products we are buying come from 
  • We want to know the companies and brands that make those products
So now that we have given you some insight into who we are, let's look at where we stand regarding American manufacturing, specifically - apparel & garment manufacturing. 


or another way of looking at this Graph.

More then 850,000 Americans have lost their jobs in apparel manufacturing since 1990.

Source: Bureau of Labor Statistics: www.bls.gov/spotlight/2012/fashion

And there is this.....

Only 2.5% of all apparel sold in the USA, is made in the USA

or another way of looking at it...


Source: American Apparel & Footwear Association: https://www.wewear.org/aafa-releases-apparelstats-2013-and-shoestats-2013-reports/

These figures are troubling and eye opening enough to stand on their own and hopefully persuade you to begin questioning and changing your purchasing decisions. Unfortunately, these figures are only the beginning. Manufacturing has a much broader impact on economy outside of the jobs in the plant or factory. 

Manufacturing in the US drives research & development and has a wide multiplier effect on our economy, creating an estimated 2.9 additional jobs for every 1 new manufacturing job created. However, the reverse is also true: as we began exporting job overseas in record numbers starting in the 1990's and further escalating to ever higher levels since 2000, the loss of manufacturing jobs also had a negative multiplicative effect on our economy. 


If we, as Americans, want to have a strong, sustainable, and growing economy, we need to have a strong manufacturing base to support and fuel that growth. Buying American Made products will provide that long-term positive impact in our micro and macro economies. 

Not to worry:  it's not all Bad News.

The tide is beginning to shift and people are beginning to focus back on buying locally & from Made in the USA manufacturers, here are some recent articles on the ever growing Made in America shift. 

WSJ: Companies Tiptoe Back Toward Made in America

Forbes: Weather Techs Made in America Superbowl Message

CNN: Selling Made in America to the Fashion Forward Crowd


BCG's 2011 study on the shifting dynamic of Manufacturing in the US said it best:

"Rather than fixate on labor rates, this [US manufacturing cost] analysis should factor in worker productivity, transit costs, time-to-market considerations, logistical risks, energy costs, and other expenses in a range of scenarios. Companies should also make sure that their supply chains are flexible, dynamic, and globally balanced, providing the leeway to shift production and sourcing to other locations when the time is right."
We want to help lead this charge and by contributing to our Indiegogo fundraising campaign, YOU CAN HELP US DO JUST THAT!

The demand is there & One-Flag will be the supply

The reasons people have for buying American Made products as a varied as we are as individual. Thankfully, regardless of your reasons, the benefits are equally impactful. The Gallup poll below conducted in April of 2013 lists the most typical answers in response to a previously conducted poll entitled: "Do you actively search for products that are Made in the U.S.?"

It is true: products Made in the US on average cost more than a comparably imported product. This is primarily caused by two factors: raw material costs and labor costs. The labor costs are an expected higher expense, especially in a global economy. Paying an American worker is going to be more expensive than a worker in Asia, Mexico or India--a sentiment we have heard this from nearly every Craftsman & Maker we have spoken to. Fortunately, Americans are willing to pay more for a product manufactured in the US vs a comparable imported product. Typically, consumers are willing to spend anywhere from 10-25% more for a product with a Made in the USA tag.

The good news doesn't stop with just the consumers' willingness to pay a little bit more for garments or goods with a Made in the U.S. label. American workers are some of the most productive workers in the world and continue to become more productive as advanced machinery, lean manufacturing processes and improving technologies continue to increase production efficiencies. 
And then there is this:

In the above video is Bob Kidder, President, New England Shirt Co., talking to me on  a variety of topics that will be presented as part of our American Makers Series coming soon to One-Flag.com. Our apologies on the quality of the audio in this video, but that's what happens when you record in a working factory.

How we source our products

Sourcing is our sweet spot. It is where we truly excel. My background is in purchasing, interning at Filene's department store during my junior year of college. After graduation the following spring, I entered into the Assistant Buyer program, slowly learning the retail trade and honing my skills as a merchant. I didn't know it at the time, but my retail experience, background and contacts would serve me well in crafting and creating One-Flag.


Sourcing American Made Goods requires a whole different level of effort, expertise and skill. I am often on the road traveling to trade shows, factories and vendors to ensure we live up to our lofty goal of bringing the Best of What's Made in America to you. 

Unfortunately, we cannot attend every Trade Show in New York or LA markets.  This country we call home is incredibly large and full of great American craftsman, makers and designers. So if we are going to truly strive to bring the Best of What's Made in America to One-Flag, we need to elicit some help -- from you. So we created One-Flag to be a Social Commerce Company.  

"Social commerce[1] is a subset of electronic commerce that involves social media, online media that supports social interaction, and user contributions to assist online buying and selling of products and services". - Source Wikipedia 

The concept is simple: we ask our customers, friends and like-minded Americans to help us in our never-ending search for the next great Made in the USA product by letting us know when you come across a great American Made product. Here's how it works.


By participating in our Social Commerce model you are helping to shape what will be offered for sale on One-Flag. You will also have the ability to help promote a great local brand or company you love with us so we can share it with everyone! And by your being a part of our ever growing online community, we will pass along our appreciation by saving you money. Through discount codes, exclusive sales or product give-aways, your support, effort and involvement will most certainly be rewarded.

How we classify the products we sell:


Every single product we sell is categorized by the One-Flag principle: each flag represents a major step in the design & manufacturing process, and we will only sell products that have at least 3 Flags. We shall only sell products that at a minimum are: Made by an American owned company, Designed and Distributed in the US & Manufactured in the US. 

We believe in the power of choice, we believe educated consumers make educated purchases, and we want to provide the information and choices to you! To help ensure we are transparent in What, Where and from Whom the products we sell are offered, we created the One-Flag Principle. 

We need $50,000 for our Retail Store 

Here is a breakdown of where the funds will go:

$25,000 for our All-American Retail Inventory
$12,000 for 7 Months of Retail Rent, Liability Insurance Coverage & Legal Fees
$ 6,000 for Retail Store Displays, Build-outs, Signage & Supplies
$4,500 for Indiegogo Crowdfunding Fees
$2,500 for Store Promotional Advertising
Your funds will be helping Small Businesses across the country. Your funds will also be helping American Manufacturers, Craftsmen, Designers & Makers. Lastly, your funds will be helping us! 
I believe enough in the need to provide American Made products to you that I have already invested nearly all of my savings into building this company: from typical business start-up costs to website design, hosting & operational activities. I am fully invested into this business, and your support will help push me over the financing hump.
Any funds raised in excess of our goal of $50,000 will go directly towards additional retail inventory & fulfilling our perks. We will be able to expand our product assortments and offerings to you! 

What people are saying about One-Flag:

"...quite honestly, you have the most tasteful and attractive Made in America apparel site I’ve seen, hands down. Way to go! " Courtenay, Managing Director at Krammer & Stoudt
"First off, Love the site. Very well put together. There’s a million sites out there today and curating can be difficult. "  Ben, Founder & Owner of WoodChuckUSA
"...Your shop looks amazing! I will definitely be adding it to our list of featured shops! I'd love to offer you some advice but I think your shop is perfectly setup." Brad, Founder & Owner Out of the Sandbox

Risks & Challenges:

There are risks and challenges with every new small business one of the most prominent is funding and awareness. That is why we are using Indiegogo as our crowd funding resource. By creating this campaign we are looking to mitigate both risks by helping to raise the funds and awareness necessary to ensure we make an impact and provide a valuable resource to consumers everywhere. There are additional risks associated with creating a brand and business focused on American Made products. Specifically, changing the consumers' thought processes when shopping for the products they want or need. Currently 54% of consumers do not make a special effort to buy products made in the U.S.

We are ready to take these challenges head on, and your contributions will help us in overcoming these risks. By offering a great assortment for Men & Women including Accessories and Goods carefully curated to offer new, unique and quality crafted products in an easy to shop resource, we will begin to shift the tide back towards a more balanced economy of domestic Production and Consumption. Would you want to bet against America? 

We Feel the time is right. Right Now.

We hope you can contribute to our crowd-funding campaign and help us to create an American Lifestyle store, worthy of your contribution. If you do not have the financial resources to donate, we understand, as we are asking for money ourselves. But you can still help us out in a very big way by sharing our Indiegogo campaign with your all of your friends, family members, neighbors & co-workers.

Word of Mouth is still the best advertising and your help, support & sharing will go a long way in helping us reach our goal. Thank You for your support of One-Flag!

  

Exclusively American, Exclusively for You!

story:
Join us June 4-7 at Skidmore College!  

We think you'll agree -and we’re so excited to share that you generously donated over $5,000 to our first campaign in support of Women’s Voices, Women’s Visions, sponsored by the LivingKindness Foundation.


Wow! Your donations made a HUGE difference in the lives of 150 women. Thank you!


But...There is still more work to do.

This year, we hope YOU will help us bring 200 women (an increase of 33%!) to our powerful, transformative, 3-day symposium for women focusing on the use of the creative arts in culture-making, peacemaking, and social change.

Beyond that, you can personally help thousands to continue learning:

  • online, with exciting content geared to help women who cannot attend our annual event,
  • and in person at the Nigerian school that you help us to underwrite.
Today, you can ask any woman if she’s ever felt silenced, and chances are she’ll say yes.

Cultures have been silencing women for centuries, and as a result, women’s voices and creations are under-represented everywhere you look.

Why Should You Help Women's Voices, Women's Visions?

Because we are actively working to change that dynamic, but we can only do so with YOUR help.

Did you know? Of the 500 largest corporations, ONLY 13 have a female CEO.

In the 21st century. 

YOU can help us change these numbers.


Each year at this powerful and unique Symposium, women are ignited, inspired, and invigorated with new awareness about how to connect their creative energy with the world's deep hunger; how to find projects that need their gifts, and how to extend the reach of their influence and the range of their impact.

Your generous donation will allow us to provide a life-changing, consciousness raising event for 200 women who are generating positive change through their creative work.

Through this campaign, you have an exciting opportunity to directly and personally impact hundreds of women!

Your donation will help provide full scholarships to 25 women, to pay for Art & Activism Awardees, to pay teachers, to cover EVE talk expenses, and to change the dynamic for thousands of creative women in this country and in Nigeria.

The great part?

We ONLY need $20,000 to make such a huge impact!

Think about that for a second, will you?


Why do we need this money?

You know the truth - Doors are never going to just magically open up to a new reality for women.

In order to create a culture that is balanced and fair, where the power and voices of women are equal to that of men, it is our job as women to make that happen.

The Women's Voices Women's Visions Symposium is the only organization we know of that empowers women to live their fullest artistic lives AND create change in the world, but we need your help to bring more women to this transformative event. 

Your generous support will personally allow women to attend the Symposium, feed their souls, and to be inspired by the artistry, the genius, the social reach and impact of their fellow creators.

Beyond basic operating expenses, all profits go directly to a unique learning center in Nigeria through the LivingKindness Foundation.

That means every dollar you donate will be used to expand women’s access to the annual Symposium, while also helping women and children in Nigeria through The LivingKindness Foundation.

So far, your donations have helped us send $20,000 to build that learning center, and it's almost complete!


We put women and children first - so all profits from Women's Voices, Women's Visions are used to help provide leadership programs for women, programs that encourage art and activism, and educational opportunities for children.

Among nonprofits, Women's Voices Women's Visions is incredibly cost-effective. Thanks to existing donors and volunteers just like you, We have very low administrative costs (<10%).

Beyond money— we need your help spreading the word!   

At its heart, Women’s Voices, Women’s Visions is a grassroots movement driven by artists, activists, and women pioneers.

Whether you donate to our campaign or not, you can still help improve the position of women in the world.         

Ways you can help:                       

  • Stay connected. Follow Women’s Voices, Women’s Visions on Facebook and on Twitter to stay up-to-date on this empowering movement.

  • Spread the word by sharing through your social networks.

You can also join us at our 2015 event!

See Jan reframe activism and creativity so you see why this is the event for you:



Recognizing your generosity. Thank you!

The work we do touches women’s lives in a meaningful way. Every dollar you give will help women who will learn about your support. We thank you, and so do the women.


For more videos and to see proof of the creative changes we're supporting in the world, subscribe to our YouTube Channel:

Women's Voices, Women's Visions YouTube Channel


Frequently Asked Questions

Are you a non-profit?  Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?
Yes, LivingKindness is a registered public 501(c)(3) nonprofit. Contributions to WVWV and  LivingKindness are tax-deductible. Our Federal tax ID number is 27-2606735.

How can I get a tax deductible receipt?
When you contribute, you will receive an email from FirstGiving (Indiegogo’s nonprofit payments processor) confirming your contribution. This email receipt can be used for tax-deductible purposes. For all contributions over $250, you will receive an official receipt for tax-reporting purposes by email after the campaign ends.

How will the funds be used?
Your donations will go directly to the women who will benefit most! Thankfully, they won't be spent on administrative or overhead costs, because our staff is already funded.

HINT: The more donations we receive, the more we can increase these numbers!


In addition, the cost of just running the Indiegogo campaign is $1,000. Half of this is spent towards perks for you - the participating donors - and the remainder is spent on supporting the effort.

If other donors are already supporting you, why should I help?
To date, we’ve been privileged to have the support of many generous individuals. But to sustain our organization for the long haul, we need to engage women, community members, and other organizations worldwide. All donations, regardless of the amount, help further our mission and allow us to change the lives of more women and children.

Can I donate from outside the USA?
Absolutely! Indiegogo only accepts international credit cards, not bank or debit cards. Unfortunately we can’t accept PayPal, so the way to donate internationally is with a credit card.

What payment methods do you accept?
Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.

Large Contributions - How can I make a contribution over $10,000?
The nonprofit payment processor (FirstGiving) that is handling the transactions for this campaign is able to accept direct wire transfers for contributions of $10,000 or more. If you are interested in making a large contribution through a wire transfer to FirstGiving, please contact us at (Insert our crowdfunding contact email here). We’ll connect you with a specialist at Indiegogo who will assist you with the contribution transfer process.

Is shipping included with the donation to receive a perk?
Yup!

Does international shipping cost extra?
Not to you.

I have more questions. Who do I ask?
Please visit Women's Voices, Women's Visions or LivingKindness to ask your question. We’ll get back to you as soon as we can.

Perks!

Enhance your life with any one of the amazing perks that come with your donation. These are only a few:

story:
Ireland is a anguage like no other- Really.


We talk in ways that makes no sense to the untrained ear. We use sarcasm on a frequent evel that if people were listening to use, they woul think we're mad.

This poster wil be a large wal poster containing all the top phrases, sayings, slangs and all else us Irish use.

It is a great looking poster and Has an Irish themed picture on the background.

A fun girt to those who aren't Irish. And even a better gift if you are Irish as you'll be nodding your head saying 'Yes I say that'.


On selling these posters, The profit will be used to publish a self teaching Irish book for beginners, which will include a wall poster too with helpful Irish phrases, a digital CD and an Irish memorabilia.


The cost of the Poster is just €9 for the first 100 customers and then will be € onwards!


Please purchase as these are really cool and will be sent to you within a week.

Thanks,


Conor Roche

story:
Why Bagels?

Everyone likes bagels and we're putting bagels online. Currently we are based in London, UK but we are looking to expand our horizons this year to US, UAE & EU. 

We have $0 Budget, but we have shops

We are working with bagel shops around the world to provide an online bagel service that will be delivered fresh to you. As we already have established businesses we have no costs of machinery. We just need to update the marketing

  • We need funding for web development - Mobile and Desktop 
  • We need to find a team of skilled bagel makers
  • We need to have a marketing budget
We just need enough to get off the ground, We will run the business of the revenue it generates and grow proportionality.

The Future

We want people to have an alternative to traditional fast foods, a bagel is different. As we're working with various businesses we'll be able to provide you with a unique range of bagels, all different fillings and flavours.

The Downside

We understand not everyone feels the same ways as bagels as we do, so we're going to provide croisants as well. 

Tell a Friend

Whether you think this is a great idea that could change the way people have bagels or something ridiculous see what your friends think.

story:
Summary

Essentially, we are vigorous gamers and equally an active member of pop culture. Additionally, we have always been intrigued by the atmosphere of a karaoke bar and a convention center. Particularly for its competitive ambience and in which you can meet challengers or allies  at every corner.  In essence, we thought it would be interesting to combine the fundamentals of video games, pop culture and net café/ bar to essentially form the idea of The Grid.  As we have immersed ourselves into the video game culture and mainstream pop culture, we found that although there are conventions and social gatherings that cater to those in these groups, many events prohibit consumption of alcohol.  Thus the idea of The Grid blends all these social aspect into one social hub, where individuals may come in for a fun night in an atmosphere of gaming, pop culture and social drinking. As The Grid expands its ideals and values, we welcome those of other artistic talents to come in and display their projects, essentially to help independent artists to gain recognition and publicity that they have been investing their time in achieving their goals just as we have.


 The Grid consists of a dedicated floor space to LAN players and console gamers, a lounge section a bar under an umbrella of video game culture. It is a convenient place in which students can come to study, individuals can recline and drink or just play games. The idea of being surrounded by people whom share the same interests and passions that you hold dearly all under one amicable roof has been a longing for many. The Grid services to the gamers and encourage competitive gaming.


 As a contributor, you help us create a place where gamers, geeks and nerds can be more than just a title. It can be a coveited status and when you step through our door you are not just another person. You become a key member of a community.

The funds will be contributed to equipment and renovation. The equipment would consist of TVs, accessories, consoles, furniture’s and bars related items. As for renovations, we plan to have a Tron inspired theme just for creative foundation. So there is going to be quite a bit of back lighting. We have two monitors dedicated to twitter and Instagram. We will also have a photo booth which directly post pictures on our Instagram feed. Buying a number of pints will get you free game time. Operational hours for all ages gaming from 10am-8pm. The bar becomes a mature gaming atmosphere that starts from 8pm-3am. If we do not make our entire goal we will use what funds we do have to launch weekly, if not monthly tournaments and fantasy football league matches until we make enough to open The Grid. Every few months we plan to have a screening of films made by indie directors and producers.


 As a contributor with a gaming background, you are contributing to rid stereotypical ideas imposed onto a group of people whom are passionate about their hobbies. A stigma that many are familiar with. As a regular contributor, you get the chance to be a part of creating a community, one that every individual participates in further developing the community. An environment of understanding and friendly rivalries.

 The thing that makes us different from other bars and lounges is that we try to cater mostly to gamers and the encompassing world. This is one of our challenges. I admit from a certain point of view it does look like we are trying to have a specific piece of the pie. Honestly, I feel that The Grid will make anyone into a gamer. If anything, it will open new interests for many who step through our doors. Another challenge is location. We can have everything a gamer needs but if he cannot find us what is the point. We are aiming for a location near public transportation and somewhere near a college or university. A place with an abundant amount of foot traffic.

The Grid is built on a foundation of detailed planning which intertwines the various concepts and ideas influenced by the gaming and pop culture world. Our business plan includes the details to help enforce this idea of ours and to better convey the vision we wish to share with interested parties.

 This is more than just a business, it is a dream that is near and dear to our hearts. I was laughed at for this idea but one close friend believed this idea and before he passed he said to keep chasing this dream. So please, if you cannot contribute by funds then share this with your friends. Let them know that dream chasers are still here.


Business Background

Martin Hall spent a year in business school studying how to start a business. He was a business consultant for Syncup technologies Inc. He helped a friend found an IT company. We have been working on and refining this dream for four years.We  decided to open a console based arcade with all the good stuff of a bar, lounge and net café. To promote socializing between gamers and the outside world.

Business Vision

 The Grid is the next step for social gatherings. A place for official tournaments and unofficial bouts. Primarily for fun, but business is never too far behind. Students of all kinds can come and either study using our free wi-fi and computers, or relax with the wide selection of games, movies and other entertainment means. We offer a social, interactive, open, safe and sometimes very competitive gaming experiences. Where people come to play consoles in an arcade type environment while taking a moment to drink and discuss pop culture during a paused game. Build a profitable and respected business recognized nationwide that will crush all gamer stereotypes.

 After 8pm the bar and lounge opens. At this time customers can enjoy varieties of beer and liquor while taking advantage of our social media integration. Where most bars kick you out for drinking too much or completing questionable feats, The Grid rewards you with a shirt and/or pin from our achievements project. Eventually we will add a karaoke room and another room for games like guitar hero and just dance.


Business Objectives

Short-term Objectives 

Secure Bar space by April 2015

Obtain start-up financing of $80,000 by April 2015.

Open for business by June 2015

Long-term Objectives

Open up a second grid at another location or city.

Product Description

Day and week passes.

Access to internet.

Mass video games, board games and movie libraries.

Printing/faxing, drinks/energy drinks and snacks.

Alcohol

Competitive Advantage

Pricing.

Regular tournaments.

Variety of tournaments.

Exclusivity.

Console centered arcade.

One of few console based arcade.

Membership.

Tournaments every month.

Winner gets 8% of total tournaments earnings.

Runner-up gets 15% of the 8%

Achievements project

The Marketplace

Competitive Opportunities & Challenges

Thanks to the hardware of consoles now a days and the out dated titles at the arcade. The arcades are dying, only diehard fans remains. As well as for pc gamers. 

Target Customers at The Grid

Our primary targets are Gamers, specifically social and leisure gamers. These are the gamers that prefer to play games with groups of people and have an abundant amount of free time. They are more likely to return over and over with more customers every time. But they currently stay home and add on to gamer stereotypes or go to outdated arcades, bars and limited pc lounges. These customers will choose The Grid because the idea promotes socialization and “owning”. It reaches from the talkative and friendly gamers to the most aggressive and bold gamer so there is always a challenge. Most will come in person but you can reserve a time period online or by phone and the prices are more than understanding. With the research that I have done, you can see that The Grid appeals to 74% - 88% of the gamer market.

Sales & Marketing

Positioning

How our clients will benefit:

The customer’s would save lots of money because we buy the games, the consoles and everything else they need to feel comfortable.

They save about 50% of what they spend on games and other things game related. To make our members more comfortable we pay for their online accounts and their DLC downloads. We have tournaments and other things to give back to our customers.

Pricing

In general, The Grid prices are reasonable, compared to the other limited competition. Here are the intended prices for representative gaming services.

Day pass     $5

Week pass    $30

Monthly membership  $100

Tournaments

Our first recurring tournament is named and dedicated after a friend that passed away it is called the K7 tournament. The K7 is a week long point based tournament of 64 participants. At the end of every day the lowest scoring half is eliminated until the final 2 remain. The victor wins a cash prize, an achievement shirt and the Kenny

The price varies depending on the Food and/or Drink(s). Other services will become available soon after opening for example: rock band/ guitar heroes. Singstar/ karaoke.

Promotion

 As for means of promotion the main sources we will use are:

 - Facebook.

 - Other business owned by friends.

 - Business cards.

 - Newspaper.

 - Reviews/critiques.

 - Local radio station.

 - Forums.

 - Freebies.

 - Tournaments.

Achievements project

If you are familiar with the achievement and trophy system on your consoles then your one step ahead. We take that concept and apply it to real life achievements. The achievement project gives you points and shirts for feats completed in and around the lounge. For example, coming on the first day gets you an achievement. Participating in tournaments and events gets you points and a collectible shirt. The points can be traded in for free “swag”. If you are a collector you can buy shirts and stuff from the center hub (bar) or online. But the earned achievement shirts have a better material and design to make it more memorable.


Sales

New clients will be referred by previous clients. Mainly because of our one month free of gaming for every new client referred, or they will learn about the gaming lounge through our promotional efforts. Unfortunately, we cannot afford to start a credit system. At the moment it will be cash only. All of our services are in store which will be sold by a couple of other friends and me. There is no price for the comfort of the clients.

Events

Every few months we will have events like a Marvel or Dc party. On these days we encourage people to cosplay. Participants will get discounts and an achievement related to the events taking place. We plan to show movies/films made by film makers in and around the city. During this time the film makers get a percentage of that days earnings.

  In conclusion, we hope that The Grid gains traction with your support so that we may allow a large community of like-minded people to embrace their hobby in a social environment. The blending of these worlds culminates into a social hotspot inviting all to be at ease and enjoy a great time with others. The time you have taken to read through this proposal is forever appreciated and that efforts of all involved from the beginning and thought is much appreciated. Thank you all for this opportunity

Management Team, The Grid

Martin Hall, Jonathan D. Griffith, Pirassanth Sellasamey

Business Background

studying how to start a business. He was a business consultant for Syncup
technologies Inc. He helped a friend found an IT company. We have been working
on and refining this dream for four years.We  decided to open a console
based arcade with all the good stuff of a bar, lounge and net café. To promote
socializing between gamers and the outside world.
Business Vision
 The
Grid is the next step for social gatherings. A place for official tournaments
and unofficial bouts. Primarily for fun, but business is never too far behind.
Students of all kinds can come and either study using our free wi-fi and
computers, or relax with the wide selection of games, movies and other
entertainment means. We offer a social, interactive, open, safe and sometimes
very competitive gaming experiences. Where people come to play consoles in an
arcade type environment while taking a moment to drink and discuss pop culture
during a paused game. Build a profitable and respected business recognized
nationwide that will crush all gamer stereotypes.
 After
8pm the bar and lounge opens. At this time customers can enjoy varieties of
beer and liquor while taking advantage of our social media integration. Where
most bars kick you out for drinking too much or completing questionable feats, The Grid rewards you with a shirt and/or
pin from our achievements project. Eventually we will add a karaoke room and
another room for games like guitar hero and just dance.
Business Objectives
Short-term Objectives  
Secure Bar space by April 2015
Obtain start-up financing of $80,000 by
April 2015.
Open for business by June 2015
Long-term Objectives
Open up a second grid at another location
or city.
Product Description
Day and week passes.
Access to internet.
Mass video games, board games and movie
libraries.
Printing/faxing, drinks/energy drinks and
snacks.
Alcohol 
Competitive Advantage
Pricing.
Regular tournaments.
Variety of tournaments.
Exclusivity.
Console centered arcade.
One of few console based arcade.
Membership.
Tournaments every month.
Winner gets 8% of total tournaments
earnings.
Runner-up gets 15% of the 8%
Achievements project
The Marketplace
Competitive Opportunities & Challenges 
Thanks to the hardware of consoles now a
days and the out dated titles at the arcade. The arcades are dying, only
diehard fans remains. As well as for pc gamers.  

Target Customers at The Grid
Our primary targets are Gamers,
specifically social and leisure gamers. These are the gamers that prefer to
play games with groups of people and have an abundant amount of free time. They
are more likely to return over and over with more customers every time. But
they currently stay home and add on to gamer stereotypes or go to outdated
arcades, bars and limited pc lounges. These customers will choose The Grid because the idea promotes
socialization and “owning”. It reaches from the talkative and friendly gamers
to the most aggressive and bold gamer so there is always a challenge. Most will
come in person but you can reserve a time period online or by phone and the
prices are more than understanding. With the research that I have done, you can
see that The Grid appeals to 74% -
88% of the gamer market.
Sales & Marketing
Positioning
How our clients will benefit:
The customer’s would save lots of money
because we buy the games, the consoles and everything else they need to feel
comfortable.
They save about 50% of what they spend on
games and other things game related. To make our members more comfortable we
pay for their online accounts and their DLC downloads. We have tournaments and
other things to give back to our customers.
Pricing
In general, The Grid prices are reasonable, compared to the other limited
competition. Here are the intended prices for representative gaming services. 
Day pass     $5
Week pass    $30
Monthly membership  $100TournamentsOur first recurring tournament is named and dedicated after a friend that passed away it is called the K7 tournament. The K7 is a week long point based tournament of 64 participants. At the end of every day the lowest scoring half is eliminated until the final 2 remain. The victor wins a cash prize, an achievement shirt and the Kenny
The price varies depending on the Food
and/or Drink(s). Other services will become available soon after opening for
example: rock band/ guitar heroes. Singstar/ karaoke.
Promotion
 As
for means of promotion the main sources we will use are:
 -
Facebook.
 -
Other business owned by friends.
 -
Business cards.
 -
Newspaper.
 -
Reviews/critiques.
 -
Local radio station.
 -
Forums.
 -
Freebies.
 -
Tournaments.Achievements projectIf you are familiar with the achievement and trophy system on your consoles then your one step ahead. We take that concept and apply it to real life achievements. The achievement project gives you points and shirts for feats completed in and around the lounge. For example, coming on the first day gets you an achievement. Participating in tournaments and events gets you points and a collectible shirt. The points can be traded in for free “swag”. If you are a collector you can buy shirts and stuff from the center hub (bar) or online. But the earned achievement shirts have a better material and design to make it more memorable.
Sales
New clients will be referred by previous clients. Mainly because of our one month free of gaming for every new client referred, or they will learn about the gaming lounge through our
promotional efforts. Unfortunately, we cannot afford to start a credit system.
At the moment it will be cash only. All of our services are in store which will
be sold by a couple of other friends and me. There is no price for the comfort
of the clients.
Events
Every few months we will have events like a
Marvel or Dc party. On these days we encourage people to cosplay. Participants
will get discounts and an achievement related to the events taking place. We
plan to show movies/films made by film makers in and around the city. During
this time the film makers get a percentage of that days earnings. 
  In
conclusion, we hope that The Grid gains traction with your support so that we
may allow a large community of like-minded people to embrace their hobby in a
social environment. The blending of these worlds culminates into a social
hotspot inviting all to be at ease and enjoy a great time with others. The time
you have taken to read through this proposal is forever appreciated and that
efforts of all involved from the beginning and thought is much appreciated. Thank
you all for this opportunity 
Management
Team, The GridMartin Hall, Jonathan D. Griffith, Pirassanth Sellasamey

story:
If you are here you came here for a reason for an ideal the ideal of helping a family fulfilling a dream so that we can survive on our own so please give and help us out help make our dream come true


What we need?

Currently we have a 1 color press and not enough supply to take in orders

  • I have over 11 years in Graphic design .

  • This is important to not just my self but to my family because this would be for my children and there children i want to turn this hobby into a family business.

  • By helping us you are donating to humanity to community and to family to make our family self sufficient to be able to go off of of HUD , Food stamps to be ourselves and actually be able to provide for ourselves instead of needing to get help from everyone else all the time.

What do we need, and what do will you receive for your donation.

so here is the break down:

  • We are needing 5000.00 or more this would allow us to buy the equipment we need winch would be a 4 color press a flash dryer screens emulation and emulation scoops squeegee inks and shirts.

  • For anyone who donates 15,00 or more you will receive a Digital Urban Studio original shirt .

  • Any funds that are left over after buying the need equipment will be donated to SSM CardinalGlennon in St. Louis.

What this means to us

This means the world to me I'm a father that is 30 years old and i have two children what legacy will i leave for them so far nothing but i am hoping with your help i can teach them this trade and they will never be with out work and will be able to teach others how to do this also.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you can't give that's fine spread the word out share this on your Facebook on your twitter email your friends tell your family shout it from the tree tops any way you can spread the word do it , because to me and my family this means everything 

  • What we have already put in to the business we have bought a Epson wide format printer capable of printing transparent photo positives  we have bought some ink we could not afford a lot because the printer was a very large buy we have also gotten ink jet transparent film so we can go into production when we are able to get the rest of the equipment we need. so PLEASE HELP US HELP OUR SELFS AND BECOME SELF SUFFICENT

story:
Funds will provide the base for our dream to completely assemble the highest quality ice fishing rig in Alaska. The design is tested and proven and provides "ooohs" and "aaahs" by whoever has seen it in action. The first wooden versions were refined to a completely acceptable standard however, the latest prototype incorporates state of the art HDPE (similar to a cutting board) providing a product that will last many years.

A summer conversion kit is also envisioned and prototyped to provide a summer alternative to a winter sport that has hundreds of tournaments the largest of which exceeds over 150,000 participants! A majority if the demographic will purchase several of the products putting our potential market in excess of a potential of 35 million units! More importantly we believe that once the products quality is seen, the "brand" will become a trusted industry leader representing quality of the highest standard.

story:
Kind Summary:

Our motto is, be Kind, buy Kind - be kind to people, kind to animals, kind to the environment, kind to your body and to your pocket. My name is Freya and for several years I've been committed to buying cruelty-free products. What I've noticed is, it isn't easy! Even people that want to buy ethically often don't because labelling isn't clear, the products are more expensive or just difficult to find, especially on an emergency dash to the supermarket when you need something quick for dinner, or want to clean the bathroom when you forgot the in-laws are coming round. We realise that buying ethically is often more expensive, I'm a new mum and now I have even less money and time, but small changes to our shop can make a big impact without breaking the bank. That's where Kind comes in. We want to help you buy Kind!

We're building a website (the address will be www.buykind.info) full of product reviews, links to suppliers, profiles of high street supermarkets and shops so you can make ethical decisions when shopping, and also a list of local independent shops and suppliers. Alongside this, we'll offer information on like-minded organisations, news and issues surrounding green commerce, animal testing, fair trade, high welfare farming, etc. The website will cover fashion, food, beauty and household products at first, and will extend into services and transport too. Ultimately, we want to offer some of these products for sale, too, so you have a one-stop shop you can go to for everything you need and don't have to worry about whether it is green, animal-friendly, or fair trade, because if we offer it, it will be. We also want to help promote campaigns from other organisations and perhaps even get to the stage where we can run our own campaigns and lobby for changes that makes business of all kinds fairer and better for everyone.

Any funding we receive will help build our website content and launch a campaign to raise awareness of ethical consumerism. If you donate, you'll be helping to achieve more than launching a website and shop, you'll be helping people, animals and the environment all over the world. You'll make it easier for those already inclined to shop ethically, and you'll help us to inform others of the reasons why it is important to think about the impact our purchases have.

What We Need & What You Get

We want to get things started with an initial £8000. That will help us to get a slick, easy to navigate website (because we want to make it easy for consumers, right?) 

It will also pay for great, experienced bloggers and writers to provide well-researched, honest and valuable content. We don't want to palm people off with terribly researched or badly written articles. There's a lot of ground to cover, and while we could ask writers to volunteer articles based upon a belief in our message, this route would inevitably take longer and produce less. Equally, we believe that it is only fair people are given something in return for the work they produce. We want people to leave our site better informed and having gained something, whether that is knowledge of where to buy bleach that doesn't test on animals, where to find a fantastic local coffee shop that's proudly fair trade and eco-friendly, or what the numbers printed on eggs mean in terms of welfare, or how green their favoured supermarket really is.

We will also use this money, initially, to buy products for review. We hope that ultimately manufacturers and suppliers will come to us, recognising the worth of having their products reviewed, but we need to start somewhere for this to happen.

We've taken the decision not to include perks, because we want to put the money into paying for great writing and a fantastic website. It was also restrictive in terms of fixing amounts that people were able to donate. However, we will have a page of thanks on our new website, letting others know that you've helped put a brick in the path to a better, fairer, kinder world of commerce.

The Impact

What we want is not only to be a place where Kind consumers, (those that are ethically minded), come for information and to shop, we want to change the face of business and commerce. We want to make it normal for people to care about where their food has travelled from, how the workers were treated on the farm or in the factory, how much they are paid, whether their product has been tested on animals, whether the animals they eat were reared in a natural, high welfare environment and how they were slaughtered. We want people to care about the impact their shopping choices have on the environment, whether the packaging is truly necessary, whether it is recyclable, how it is produced and how the growers / manufacturers / transportation companies / vendors (and all others associated with bringing a product to the consumer) ensure they operate as cleanly, greenly and ethically as possible. We don't want a Kind shopper to be in the minority, we want them to be the majority. Kindness over profit is only possible if the consumer says that is the way it has to be. Consumers will only put kindness over cost if they know why it's important and how they can do it. Please help us get there.

Risks & Challenges

We feel that compiling the information to help consumers shop kindly is going to be a long process, it is also something that will need continual updating. Stock changes quickly, companies change their policies, their suppliers and their ethics. We can't just write a company profile or place a link to a particular stockist to buy a product and leave it at that, we will need to be continually checking, re-evaluating and updating our content. That is, of course, a challenge, especially when (initially) we are working for free in our spare time. However, because we truly believe in this, we will ensure it is done. We also want to open honest channels of communication with companies that want to be featured or that want to improve their profile on our site and encourage them to keep us informed of changes in the way they operate.

When we begin to sell goods (which may be some way in the future), we will need to convince suppliers of our ability to sell their product. We envisage opening the Kind shop once we have built up a reputation and following, ensuring that the shop will automatically have a ready market in our audience.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, but you like the sound of this venture, can you volunteer your time to help build our content? 

Perhaps you're a web developer or a graphic designer, who could help make our website really great to use, or could give us a unique logo?

 Are you a writer or blogger? If so, you could offer us product reviews, company profiles, news and current affairs (on campaigns and other ethical consumer issues), or you could write an opinion piece on having a meat free day a week, how to read packaging to ensure you're really buying high welfare food...etc, etc.  We're open to your ideas, and we want to hear from you!

Maybe you're a charitable organisation that wants to donate information / downloadable content for our site? If it's already written and you want to spread your information as far and wide as possible, we'll post it!

Please email freya@brightbuttonproductions.com for more information on volunteering your particular talent.

Of course, most of all, you can help by being Kind and buying Kind yourself.

Thanks for reading this far, and if you do donate, THANK YOU for being Kind.

story:
My name is Phillip. I am trying to start a mobile steel fabrication business. I am a welder/fabricator. My campaign is going to be used to fund the start-up equipment required to make this dream a reality. Every contribution is helpful and will help me to achieve my ultimate goal of providing skilled trade jobs and training to new welders entering the workforce. Many new welders entering the workforce face a problem of no on the job experience. Many employers opt for experience. Which is understandable. With this business, once grown. I will take on only new welders and teach them the real world application of welding and give them the experience  that other larger employers look for in a applicant.


My campaign goal is $75,000, with that money I will be able to purchase all of the start-up equipment needed to pursue this venture. No contribution goes unnoticed, there will be unique perks to coincide with all donation amounts. If the goal is not reached all funds received will be used to make every effort to distribute perks. To avoid any delays please share this campaign with your friends! 


This campaign could impact the lives of welders and people everywhere. This business could grow to employ multiple skilled trades and provide necessary job experience to new welders entering the trade. Many people do not understand how much welding affects their life. This business will be located on the outskirts of Hampton Roads, Virginia. A major steel fabrication location. There is work at every corner and contracts always available to bid. Not to mention surrounding locality's full of marinas and other small businesses that sub contract work to small welding and fabrication set ups. Everything from your car to your Stove has been welded at some point. So help me bring this goal to life!


No campaign or business goes without its risks or challenges. I have been welding and fabricating for many years now. I have seen myself grow from a moderately skilled welder to being the guy who is called to fix complex problems and go places no other welder/fabricator will.  I enjoy a challenge, with that I know I can overcome any challenge and learn from it. I am not afraid to work seven days a week sun up to sun down. I am willing to put 150 % into this and work harder than ever to grow this business and bring skilled trade jobs to the area. I will also post constant updates to all progress made along the way.


Not able to contribute? That is okay. There are other ways that you could help. Share this with your friends and family. It may be the last bit of help needed to make this campaign successful.


Perk options. All perks will differ for the final product since all are personalized to each contributor!

story:
NaturePunk Creations is a licensed fur-dealer and taxidermy arts business in the State of Oregon, with respect for the environment and the beings who inhabit it at the forefront of all its products. All animal parts used are sourced from roadkill, Fish and Wildlife auctions, are donated by supporters, or are purchased from secondhand sources such as fellow artists, auctions houses, estate sales, and antique stores. In this way, no animals are killed solely for the sake of artworks produced.

The goal so far has been to create beautiful and functional works of art from recycled and repurposed animal remains while maintaining a dedicated respect to the environment as a whole. While in college, I studied environmentalism, and have been actively involved with many different conservation groups around the country - and even internationally, as well!

The business started on Etsy while I was still in high school, and as support has flourished, I have, too. Learning the arts of taxidermy, leatherworking, bone carving, and hide tanning has allowed me to give “new life” to countless wildlife specimens. My unique products and openness about the origins of all my materials has garnered a lot of support over the years, and as a direct result of that support – often from people just like you - I’ve been able to create a career for myself based entirely on my arts.

Now that summer is right around the corner, it’s time to start sending in my applications to vend at various events throughout the Pacific Northwest. I will be joined this season by a few very special guests, who plan to help me run my booth and share in the festival spirit.

Each festival has different vendor application and space rental procedures, but generally speaking, for most large-scale events in the area, setting up a 10X10 booth runs between $250.00 - $500.00. Unfortunately, this winter has been a tough one business-wise, and obtaining enough funding to secure these spaces has been tough. However, summer vending is vital to the continued survival of my business, and, by extension, my entire lifestyle as a self-employed artist.

The goal of this fundraiser is to raise enough money so that my summer guests and I can attend at least THREE large-scale festivals in the area. Any additional funds raised will go directly toward production of new products and wares, travel expenses, and possibly vending fees for even more great festivals further away, if enough money is raised!

Those who live in the Pacific Northwest are invited to stop by, chat, and spend some time with NaturePunk and Co. if you attend any of the fairs we visit! I’ve already sent in multiple applications to such events as Pacific Northwest Fire Festival and Okanogan Barter Fair. I am currently pending approval for many of these festivals, but will only be accepted if I have the funds in hand at the time my application is reviewed and given the "Okay!" which is why this fundraiser so important. Every dollar counts in getting us just one step closer to our goal!
story_txt:
NaturePunk Creations is a licensed fur-dealer and taxidermy arts
business in the State of Oregon, with respect for the environment and the
beings who inhabit it at the forefront of all its products. All animal parts
used are sourced from roadkill, Fish and Wildlife auctions, are donated by
supporters, or are purchased from secondhand sources such as fellow artists,
auctions houses, estate sales, and antique stores. In this way, no animals are
killed solely for the sake of artworks produced. 
The goal so far has been to create beautiful and functional
works of art from recycled and repurposed animal remains while maintaining a dedicated
respect to the environment as a whole. While in college, I studied environmentalism,
and have been actively involved with many different conservation groups around
the country - and even internationally, as well! 

The business started on Etsy while I was still in high school, and as support
has flourished, I have, too. Learning the arts of taxidermy, leatherworking, bone
carving, and hide tanning has allowed me to give “new life” to countless
wildlife specimens. My unique products and openness about the origins of all my
materials has garnered a lot of support over the years, and as a direct result
of that support – often from people just like you - I’ve been able to create a
career for myself based entirely on my arts. 

Now that summer is right around the corner, it’s time to start sending in my
applications to vend at various events throughout the Pacific Northwest. I will
be joined this season by a few very special guests, who plan to help me run my
booth and share in the festival spirit. 

Each festival has different vendor application and space rental procedures, but
generally speaking, for most large-scale events in the area, setting up a 10X10
booth runs between $250.00 - $500.00. Unfortunately, this winter has been a
tough one business-wise, and obtaining enough funding to secure these spaces
has been tough. However, summer vending is vital to the continued survival of
my business, and, by extension, my entire lifestyle as a self-employed artist. 

The goal of this fundraiser is to raise enough money so that my summer guests
and I can attend at least THREE large-scale festivals in the area. Any
additional funds raised will go directly toward production of new products and
wares, travel expenses, and possibly vending fees for even more great festivals
further away, if enough money is raised! 

Those who live in the Pacific Northwest are invited to stop by, chat, and spend
some time with NaturePunk and Co. if you attend any of the fairs we visit! I’ve
already sent in multiple applications to such events as Pacific Northwest Fire
Festival and Okanogan Barter Fair. I am currently pending approval for many of these festivals, but will only be accepted if I have the funds in hand at the time my application is reviewed and given the "Okay!" which is why this fundraiser so important. Every dollar counts in getting us just one step closer to our goal!

story:
Background

Hi, I’m Karen Orlich, the founder of k.o. kidz and creator of 'the POWCH’. 

This idea started out simply.  I wanted an easy, on-the-go container to feed my son healthy snacks.  I thought giving him one of those disposal fruit and veggie pouches would be a good idea.  But they’re expensive, hold very little food, and they’re terrible for our environment.  Most of the packaging can’t even be recycled and 2.5 BILLION single use pouches go into our landfills EVERY year.

So I decided to do something about it and....  

it’s called the POWCH!

Working in my basement over several months, I came up with a 12 oz pouch made of a soft, eco-friendly, waterproof fabric with the same built in straw as the disposables.  I filled it with applesauce or yogurt and my son loved it! 

What I discovered was that I liked using the POWCH too.  It was easy to use when commuting, after a work-out, in the car, even hiking and biking.  So, it has become more than an option for just my son, it’s an option for our entire family.

I’ve spent 2 years and my life savings designing, developing, and testing this product with kids and adults.  But I need your help to get this convenient, reusable product into your family’s hands. 

Giving Back

I also want to make this about more than just selling products so I’ve taken it a step further and with every POWCH that you purchase, I’ll donate to a children’s education or environmental conservation charity.

Request

If you buy right now, I’ll be one step closer to production.  The thing is...I need a minimum order of 2,500 to make it possible.  

The $10,000 goal will cover a portion of the following:

  1. Production Equipment
  2. Raw Material & Fabric Expenses
  3. Inventory (minimum orders are required on all components to make cost effective) 

Stretch goal:  $20,000 

Let's work together to get there!!

What Our Testers Are Saying…

"The kids enjoy it.  Seals completely without risk of leaking and it's easy to store and clean.  My son didn't want to give it back after testing!" - Mina F.

"Our daughter loves this type of product (squeeze pouches), but you can't control what is in them (how much sugar, etc).  I like that you can take it on the road with you and that it doesn't require utensils. The "mess" that is left is contained in the pouch which is nice too. No worries about crumbs, etc that come from a bagged item." - Merryl B.

“Love the way it washes and cleans up so easy - you can flip it inside out.  Love the concept and how you can reuse and reuse." - Sara R. 

THE PERKS  

THE Best SMOOTHIE RECIPE eBOOK

Eating healthy on-the-go has never been easier!  Enjoy this month long daily dose of our favorite meal and snack smoothie recipes the whole family with LOVE.  The Oatmealie, The Simple & Spice, The Meat & Potatoes - Delish! 

THE MAGNET 

THE ECO T-SHIRT (Available in two designs, kids and adult sizes S-XL)

 1. Front (please specify number when ordering)

2. Front

Back (optional-$10 extra)

THE POWCH Colors: 

1. Spring Green   2. Purple   3. Pink   4. Royal Blue (Please specify number and color when ordering)

Limited Edition POWCH Patterns: (Please specify number and pattern name when ordering)

1. Galaxy                                                2. Fashionista

3. Americana                                                  4. Camo

THE ECO-FIGHTER FOR A DAY 

Become the unstoppable, eco-fighter superhero for a day and be featured on our logo, website, and all active social media (see below for samples).  Kids and pets encouraged!  

NOTE:  Final designs will be completed by an experienced graphic artist and suitable for framing (and t-shirt printing).

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Are you passionate about our mission and ....    
  • Then, please spread the word!  Share on social media and email.  Statistics show that personal email messages are the most successful in persuading others to contribute.
  • Indiegogo has easy sharing tools too! 

The Impact & Result

Disposable, single use pouches are expected to reach 35.8 BILLION by 2018!  

With your help, we can prevent this from happening and provide our kids, grandkids, and families a fun, earth friendly way to eat a healthy snack while on the go.

Please make a difference.  Encourage healthy eating and fight for a greener planet today.  Thanks all!

story:
Short Summary

This photography cross-country road trip will start 4 miles north of downtown Chicago, where I call home. I’ll head north-northeast for my first major scheduled stop. It’s not in the U.S., but it’s where my passion for photography began. In 1995 several of my friends and I banded together, hopped in a car and meandered our way across the United States / Canadian border. Nine hours later we crossed  the 45th parallel and arrived in Toronto, ON, Canada. 

Crossing the 45th parallel  in 1995 is the tipping point for this cross-country road trip.  It will be twenty years later that I take the trip again. I'll be traveling with several cameras, including my first camera, a 35mm Canon AE-1 and an even greater passion for photography.


What I Need & What You Get

As a donor you should expect transparency in how the funds will be allocated. I created a detailed spreadsheet of all the road trip necessities. Below are my major expected expenses.

Car $4,500*
Car Insurance $440
Tolls $100
Park Entrance Fees $100
Fuel $630
Lodging $9,000**
Film $100
Batteries $40
Food $3,600
Car Maintenance $300

* I am on the hunt for a late model (early 2000s) hatch-back Subaru or Volvo.
** This allows from approximately $100 per night, which is frugal. I expect to camp and couch-surf (http://www.couchsurfing.com) along the way to keep costs from escalating.

The costs above don't include website development, book publishing and other miscellaneous incidentals. 

If you’re wondering what you get out of this, check out the "Select a Perk" column on the right. There are a plethora of perks depending on your donation level. If one of the perk levels doesn't fit your budget you can donate any denomination. A donation at any level will be greatly appreciated.

If my financial goal isn’t met I will adjust my travels. The road trip will still occur, but it will be scaled accordingly.


Helping Out

Five percent (5%) of the purchase price of any additional prints purchased through my website (http://www.frissonphotography.com) will be donated to The Nature Conservancy (http://www.nature.org).


Check Me Out

If you want to know more about me, what I enjoy photographing and how to contact me, please check out the social media outlets below.

Instagram account: @marcusmuccianti

Website where you can view and purchase prints: http://www.frissonphotography.com

(the website is not fully operational, but if you enter your email address you'll be notified when it is)

I will be live Tweeting (@marcusmuccianti) as I travel across the country. Please join me as I share the day’s activities, beauty and adventures.

story:
Help us do the feasibility study to build a community owned Dairy facility in Khovsgol, Mongolia.

Short Summary

The project aims to build and establish a Dairy Facility, which will be owned by a cooperative of the local milk farmers from the Khatgal village area situated in Khovsgol, Northern Mongolia.

We need your support to be able to complete the feasibility study successfully.

The feasibility study will consist of a two-week field trip to Khovsgol, Mongolia where three dairy technicians, one architect, one support coordinator and two local Mongolian translators will conduct a feasibility study to do a registration and investigation of existing conditions. Danish Dairy Technicians without Borders and the participants are actively supporting the feasibility study, however we still need to raise 4,100 US$ to be able to fully cover the study trip (see details futher down). All participants are working for free and donating their time and expertise for this exciting community project but WE ALSO NEED YOUR SUPPORT.

After the returning from Mongolia the project group will compile the field trip findings and evaluate if the project is feasible and establish the requirements to successfully complete the project. The next step will then be to finding further associates and partners, completing the project proposal, establishing the milk farmer´s cooperative in Khovsgol and apply for the economical funds for the realization of the project.

Both participating project partners, Danish Dairy Technicians without Borders and Danish Architects without Borders, have successfully realized this size projects with funding from Danish, European and International institutions. The project has already received interest from the Dairy Industry and Institutions that have expressed a desire to participate once we are able to present a full feasibility study and project proposal.

The Khovsgol Dairy Facility will improve the local milk farmer’s possibility to produce milk products of a high quality that can be sold to a third party. As it is now, the farmers can only sell their products locally and in a short period, because of the traditional and primitive storage and production methods. Building a Dairy facility with international standards for food safety and hygiene, will improve the possibility for the farmers to sell their products outside the village to the bigger city’s where there are potential costumers. The products will mainly be traditional Mongolian milk products, supporting the Mongolian lifestyle and creating a livelihood and job opportunities for the local farmers and community.

We will leave for Mongolia 4th of July 2015 and after two days in Ulaanbatar with meetings and a visit to a working dairy.  We will travel up the Khovsgol to do the field study and registration of milk production and identification of possible dairy site.

Should this campaign raise more funds that the needed 4,100$ all additional funds will be used to help the milk farmers and the local community through ecoLeap foundation www.ecoLeap.org 

For more information follow us on www.khovsgoldairyproject.org

or on facebook www.facebook.com/KhovsgolDairyProject

Feasibility study budget July 4th-18th, 2015

Three Dairy Technicians

Travel cost to Mongolia 3*(1,574$+337$):      5,733$

Food,Travel and Other (*) cost in Mongolia  3*2,500$:     7,500$

Architect and support

Travel cost to Mongolia 2*(1,574$+337$):      3,822$

Food, Travel and Other (*) cost in Mongolia (*) 2*1,500$:    3,000$

Mongolian Translators in Mongolia:    1,100$

Total Budget:  21,155$

(*) Other cost consist of car rental (incl. driver) to visit milk farmers and existing dairy facility (near Ulaanbaatar), equipment for milk testing and measurements, meeting hall rental in Khatgal Village, Tent for project presentation at the Naadam festival, presentation equipment, legal translation to Mongolia (i.e. cooperative bylaws) and contributions to milk farmers for participate in the study. 

Sponsorship obtained

Danish Dairy Technicians without borders:    13,233$

Travel cost covered by Architect and support personally:    3,822$

Total funded  17,055$

Needed funding    4,100$
