story:
Latest Update


June 15th - New tees!

I Shelter Nepal Tee  - $75 Donation

Rebuild Nepal Tee - $75 Donation


Nepal Badge Tee  - $75 Donation


On April 25th, a magnitude 7.8 earthquake rocked Nepal leaving many homeless. Today we're partnering with survivors to build durable shelters that keep families warm, dry, and safe from aftershocks & monsoon season.  Join our team in rebuilding Nepal by contributing to the construction of Portal Shelters.



The Plan



  1.  Provide shelters before Monsoon season. These smart, reusable shelters cost just $100 & house one family.
  2.  Give a Portal Cargo Bike to families in need of work. These bikes are great for transporting huge loads & are designed to fit many attachments (including a washing machine, corn husker, or phone charger), making everyday tasks more efficient & transporting a small family much easier.
  3. Providing jobs with one simple concept. These bikes are built for business! Haul large loads of cargo, easily get around town, or start a service business using one of our simple attachments (like our washing machine)!


The Shelter


Open Source

We provide free, 30 minute, shelter building classes for NGOs, villagers, and small teams. All of our training is also online, and we have seen many take our instructions to build shelters on their own. More info at: www.portalbikes.org/shelters

Cost Effective

Each shelter costs $100 and can be assembled in 30 minutes or less.


Designed To Last

These shelters can withstand the rigors of monsoon season much better than a tarp or a tent, and when the monsoon is over, they can be reused or repurposed.


Zero-Waste

All the materials used to construct Portal Shelters can be reused to build more permanent homes. The frames can be reused to create greenhouses for food, the roofing can be reused in a permanent home, or the entire shelter can be reused as a barn.

The Bike


Cargo

Carry your kids to school and your goods to market. The Portal cargo bike has a huge cargo capacity but still rides like a normal bicycle.



Machine Compatible

Our bicycle quickly converts into a pedal powered machine. A rotating shaft provides power whenever the rear wheel is turning. A sturdy kickstand supports the bicycle, allowing it to be pedaled in a stationary position. Tools easily connect to the bicycle, allowing the user to pump water, grind grain, generate electricity, wash clothes, etc. If it rotates, chances are pretty good you can power it with our bicycle Power Take Off (PTO).



Tools & Accessories

Side wings can be exchanged to deliver different types of cargo. Tools can be connected and powered by the bicycle. Bags can be attached and removed. These building blocks allow the bicycle to adapt to a broad variety of applications quickly and easily. The range of possibilities is virtually infinite.


The Funding


20% of our funding will be allocated toward building 200 more temporary shelters.

40% of funds will be allocated toward building a manufacturing warehouse for cargo bikes.

40% of funds will go toward the shipment of 200 cargo bikes.


The Perks

Honorable Mention - $3 Donation

We will mention your name in one Facebook post as thanks for your donation!

Portal Vinyl Sticker - $10 Donation

The small sticker looks great & is long lasting. We will ship one directly to you for your $10 donation. 


Portal Tee  - $75 Donation

This comfortable tee is soft to the touch & a great way spread awareness for Nepal!
50% poly 25% combed and ring-spun cotton 25% rayon, 40 single 3.8 oz.


Portal Tank - $100 Donation

Must-have unisex tank, featuring a rounded neck and designed with superior combed and ring-spun cotton.
50% poly 25% combed and ring-spun cotton and 25% rayon, 40 single 3.8 oz.

Portal Hoodie  - $200 Donation

An incredibly soft and relaxed unisex pullover that lends itself to everyday wear. Spun from a plush poly-cotton blend, this style features a modern fit, hood with white drawstrings, kangaroo pocket and ribbed cuffs and waistband.
100% poly, 32 single 6.5 oz.

Cargo Bike  - $2,000 Donation

Your very own Portal Cargo Bike shipped directly to you! This useful cycle will help you get around with large loads and surprising ease.

8 Days Exploring Nepal - $10,000 Donation

Eight day trip for two through Nepal's beautiful Middle Hills while staying at some of the best lodging around. Incredible Himalayan views, culturally rich day hikes, delicious food, and warm hospitality abound. Round out the trip by peddling a Portal Bicycle through the historic attractions of Kathmandu and visiting a family who is rebuilding their home from a dry location thanks to Portal Shelters. 

*flight not included.

Learn more at Over The Edge Travel


Stories


This woman was severely injured by the earthquake.  Her home was completely destroyed and she had been living in her outhouse for 7 days.  When a Portal Shelter was provided for her, she was overcome with gratitude and joy.  She is already making plans for maintaining the shelter.



We were able to build a shelter for family who, after sleeping in a cow shed with a cow (and copious amounts of manure), was very excited to have a nice place to sleep.

After losing their home, this family of 7 is very happy with their week-old shelter. It is now complete with, brick end walls, a bed, a stove, and even a back window.



When we met Mr. Koirala, he had been pushing his overloaded Indian bicycle for years.  With his new Portal Cargo Bike, he is able to carry more product, meet more customers, and earn more money to take care of his family. 


Legal


We are a 501(C)(3) certified nonprofit. Each contributor will receive a receipt after donation.

About Us

  

 At Portal, our vision is to transform lives and communities by creating pathways out of poverty. Right now in Nepal, the first step on that pathway is a home. These are affordable, secure, reusable homes that will shelter a family for several months while they rebuild their lives. Moving forward, we will provide the Portal Cargo Bicycle as a tool of empowerment that can generate longterm income. Help us provide shelter now and work for years to come!
 
portalbikes.org
story_txt:
Latest Update




June 15th - New tees!



I Shelter Nepal Tee  - $75 Donation

Rebuild Nepal Tee - $75 Donation




Nepal Badge Tee  - $75 Donation








On April 25th, a magnitude 7.8 earthquake rocked Nepal leaving many homeless. Today we're partnering with survivors to build durable shelters that keep families warm, dry, and safe from aftershocks & monsoon season.  Join our team in rebuilding Nepal by contributing to the construction of Portal Shelters.











The Plan






 Provide shelters before Monsoon season. These smart, reusable shelters cost just $100 & house one family.
 Give a Portal Cargo Bike to families in need of work. These bikes are great for transporting huge loads & are designed to fit many attachments (including a washing machine, corn husker, or phone charger), making everyday tasks more efficient & transporting a small family much easier.

Providing jobs with one simple concept. These bikes are built for business! Haul large loads of cargo, easily get around town, or start a service business using one of our simple attachments (like our washing machine)!







The Shelter


Open SourceWe provide free, 30 minute, shelter building classes for NGOs, villagers, and small teams. All of our training is also online, and we have seen many take our instructions to build shelters on their own. More info at: www.portalbikes.org/shelters


Cost EffectiveEach shelter costs $100 and can be assembled in 30 minutes or less.


Designed To Last
These shelters can withstand the rigors of monsoon season much better than a tarp or a tent, and when the monsoon is over, they can be reused or repurposed.



Zero-WasteAll the materials used to construct Portal Shelters can be reused to build more permanent homes. The frames can be reused to create greenhouses for food, the roofing can be reused in a permanent home, or the entire shelter can be reused as a barn.






The Bike







Cargo

Carry your kids to school and your goods to market. The Portal cargo bike has a huge cargo capacity but still rides like a normal bicycle.







Machine Compatible


Our bicycle quickly converts into a pedal powered machine. A rotating shaft provides power whenever the rear wheel is turning. A sturdy kickstand supports the bicycle, allowing it to be pedaled in a stationary position. Tools easily connect to the bicycle, allowing the user to pump water, grind grain, generate electricity, wash clothes, etc. If it rotates, chances are pretty good you can power it with our bicycle Power Take Off (PTO).





Tools & Accessories
Side wings can be exchanged to deliver different types of cargo. Tools can be connected and powered by the bicycle. Bags can be attached and removed. These building blocks allow the bicycle to adapt to a broad variety of applications quickly and easily. The range of possibilities is virtually infinite.










The Funding






20% of our funding will be allocated toward building 200 more temporary shelters.
40% of funds will be allocated toward building a manufacturing warehouse for cargo bikes.

40% of funds will go toward the shipment of 200 cargo bikes.





The Perks




Honorable Mention - $3 Donation

We will mention your name in one Facebook post as thanks for your donation!

Portal Vinyl Sticker - $10 Donation


The small sticker looks great & is long lasting. We will ship one directly to you for your $10 donation. 

Portal Tee  - $75 Donation


This comfortable tee is soft to the touch & a great way spread awareness for Nepal!
50% poly 25% combed and ring-spun cotton 25% rayon, 40 single 3.8 oz.


Portal Tank - $100 Donation







Must-have unisex tank, featuring a rounded neck and designed with superior combed and ring-spun cotton.

50% poly 25% combed and ring-spun cotton and 25% rayon, 40 single 3.8 oz.


Portal Hoodie  - $200 Donation





An incredibly soft and relaxed unisex pullover that lends itself to everyday wear. Spun from a plush poly-cotton blend, this style features a modern fit, hood with white drawstrings, kangaroo pocket and ribbed cuffs and waistband.

100% poly, 32 single 6.5 oz.

*flight not included.

This woman was severely injured by the earthquake.  Her home was completely destroyed and she had been living in her outhouse for 7 days.  When a Portal Shelter was provided for her, she was overcome with gratitude and joy.  She is already making plans for maintaining the shelter.







We were able to build a shelter for family who, after sleeping in a cow shed with a cow (and copious amounts of manure), was very excited to have a nice place to sleep.





After losing their home, this family of 7 is very happy with their week-old shelter. It is now complete with, brick end walls, a bed, a stove, and even a back window.










When we met Mr. Koirala, he had been pushing his overloaded Indian bicycle for years.  With his new Portal Cargo Bike, he is able to carry more product, meet more customers, and earn more money to take care of his family. 






Legal




We are a 501(C)(3) certified nonprofit. Each contributor will receive a receipt after donation.






About Us



  
 At Portal, our vision is to transform lives and communities by creating pathways out of poverty. Right now in Nepal, the first step on that pathway is a home. These are affordable, secure, reusable homes that will shelter a family for several months while they rebuild their lives. Moving forward, we will provide the Portal Cargo Bicycle as a tool of empowerment that can generate longterm income. Help us provide shelter now and work for years to come!

story:
Listen to Niki's compelling back-story...

       It seems that for both of us our lives have been an unending journey that centers around the theme of rebirth…          

                                         



Chronic illness has a debilitating effect not just on the person suffering from the disease but also from the friends and family who chose to stand by those afflicted.  The challenges to maintain an emotional equilibrium are magnified when the illness is one that is as misunderstood and unknown as Fibromyalgia. Still, even after years of struggling to keep our heads up and our hearts full we feel we have been truly blessed by the gifts that we have received in the form or love, support and above all knowledge.  We faced Fibro as a family and have over the years learned what works for us in terms of bringing me to a point in my life where the medications are no longer required for the living of a normal life. 

                          


The final stage of that remarkable journey is to move me to an environment where my body thrives… Through the years, working as an independent author, artist, radio show host and documentary producer, my work has brought me to two amazing countries that not only changed my life, but taught me that it was possible for me to life that life with full health and vitality.  The warm, humid climates gave me back my strength and allowed me to pour all of who I am into my work.  Eventually however I would have to return home and in doing so return to the inevitable chronic pain and fatigue that come along with living in an environment that my body does not like.  As a result, my family and friends here in Canada have never seen me truly healthy; this year that all changed…

                                                           


My husband and I were gifted with a trip to Costa Rica where he witnessed for the first time in our 4 years together a woman who was energized, enthusiastic and filled with joy.  We knew then what we had to do… We began immediately looking for the perfect place to build our vision and our dream… a Costa Rican home base where we could launch a Fibromyalgia foundation that would organize and raise funds to provide healing retreats for Fibromyalgia Patients.  We would need a small start-up business that would allow us to make enough money to cover our basic needs and that would be easily maintained allowing us to have the time and energy to dedicate to building the vision that is the Feenxrising Fibro Foundation.  We would also need something that was purely in alignment with our spirits, a place where we could free express our love of nature, art and music… a place where we could share our time and space with like-minded free spirits that embrace the world outside the box of societal norms.  A place that could grow and expand with us and allow us the creative freedoms that we are both driven to explore… We found that place in Cabina’s Felix.   To learn more about our vision visit our website...

Feenx Nest



What we Need...

We are asking for 250,000

This will cover the purchase price of Felix Cabina's - currently listed at $195,000

$200,000 Residency investment - In Costa Rica if you can invest 200,000 into the country then your residency is taken care of; since we plan to start a foundation we would prefer to have everything legal and in alignment with the governmental policies of the country we are moving to.  In order to meet the financial requirement we plan to invest any money over and above the cost of purchase into renovations and improvements to Felix Cabina's.  This will ensure that not only the government is happy but also that our guests are happy as well. (updates and pictures of improvements being made, will be sent to anybody who signs up for the Feenxnest.com newsletter)  
sign up at --->>> Feenx Nest

It will also cover - moving expenses - we are not taking much but we will have to move ourselves - our pets - possibly one of our girls (the two oldest are remaining in Canada) and half a shipping container with our family heirlooms. 

Lawyers fees - for the title search, transfer fee's, corporation registration (a must have to own property safely in Costa Rica (we've done our research) - we will also be changed the name from Felix Cabina's to Feenx Cabina's - it just makes sense.

FeenxRising Foundation registration - although we do not have a cost on this as of yet we are in contact with a woman in Costa Rica who specializes in registering 'not for profits' in Costa Rica - as soon as we have a number - you will have a number (updates will be made continuously on the fundraising page and through the Feenxnest.com newsletter)
sign up at --->>> FEENX NEST

Accountants Fee's - We believe very strongly in TRANSPARENCY and as such we will need an accountant on hand to help us keep track of our accounts - all of our the money we get either through the donation site or by way of selling our belongings will be listed on a page at Feenxnest.com as well as any expenses we have.  We want to start both our business and our foundation with integrity and quite frankly we both think you all simply have the right to know at any given moment where your money is going.

ANY EXTRA FUNDS RAISED will be donated directly into the FeenxRising Fibromyalgia Foundation as a kick off to the start of a new life not just for us but for others out there who we are blessed to have the opportunity to help.

 What YOU will get...


Other than the opportunity to be a part of something that will in time be able to help thousands of people get their health back... we are offering...
Copies of Niki's book - Truth 'My Synchromystic Journey' 

  Does it take a miracle to save a woman who has lost everything?

     Does God really step in and carry those who cannot or will not for the moment carry themselves? Are the prayers we scream to the heavens in our most desperate hour of need really answered?

     The answers can be found in the remarkable journey of the woman who went from laying curled up on the bathroom floor praying for God to take her home, to the woman who now believes that faith in the Divine is just the beginning of this incredible adventure we call life.

Niki's author website


In alignment with our offer of transparency I will honestly tell you that each book costs us $5 US dollars to print - include shipping them here from our publishing company Grave Distractions Publications in the USA and any costs to ship them to you... Plus the time to write you a letter of gratitude ;) You're really getting quite the deal.

YOUR NAME OF THE FEENX CABINA HALL OFF FLAME...
Since 2006 Niki has been painting murals on walls... as part of our work on the Cabina's she will be filling all the empty walls with murals once they have fresh coats of paint.  There is one large exterior wall that faces the road and is the first thing people see when they enter the gate; this wall will be dedicated to a stylized piece of art that will include the names of each and every person who donates to the campaign.  Once completed, this art piece will grace the front page of our website as a special tribute to all of your amazingly supportive people.  
One example of Niki's word art...

From The Heart

2006

Canvas - Metallic Acrylic 

Auction Piece for Sick Kids Charity Ball



This very special piece was designed to be auctioned to the Toronto Sick Kids Hospital Charity Ball.  Aprox. 3.5 feet wide by 5 feet tall it was a complex piece that integrated all the words that represent Sick Kids Hospital into a nature Scene - There are 8 words hidden in the painting - Understanding - Faith - Hope - Love - Life - Family - Care - Dream. 

you can see more of Niki's art by visiting -> Feenx Art Page - Feenxrising Bog Site

A STAY AT FEENX CABINA'S


Beginning 6 months after our purchase of Felix Cabina's (to give us time to do some upgrades and get settled in) and claimable for 3 yrs - AIRFARE - TRANSPORTATION - FOOD and SPENDING MONEY  - NOT INCLUDED (unless we win the lottery) and completely gift-able (you prefer Alaska - no problem - give your rooms to friends or family members or even to a boss you want to impress) - Available on a first come first serve basis :) (have to be fair about these things)

Now for the why's 

Why Costa Rica? 


Warm humid air agrees with Niki's body... when she is in that environment she can work all day without tiring and WITHOUT being in pain - fresh fruit is readily available (pick it off the tree) and almost all the food in the market is organically grown and grass fed meats (both extremely important to her body and very expensive to get in Canada) - More than that, the culture suits us - we are very simple people - we don't need a lot of stuff (which is why we are selling almost everything we own) - we have discovered that the more stuff you have the more stuff you have to answer to - do you realize how much time and energy we waste of caring for - finding space for - cleaning - maintaining - repairing our stuff... literally - we are slaves to our stuff - no more...  Costa Rica is an environmentally conscious country with an amazing laid back culture - they no longer have a military (which excites us because we really don't understand war) and the people are very in tune with the basic human values that matter - family - faith - friendship...

We have contacts with people there who own larger facilities that would be able to house the fibro retreat attendees and who are also members of the natural health and wellness community.  Basically - it has EVERYTHING we need...

Why Felix Cabina's?

Because it's small, easily manageable (it will still leave us lots of time for Foundation and retreat work) - it caters the to backpacking community (whom we happen to adore spending time with) and it has VAST POTENTIAL - with a little bit of paint - some construction and some creative artistic ingenuity the place could be FABULOUS... as it stands it's already a gem... we just want to take what they have created and expand on it - speaking of expanding - there is an vacant lot right next to it that may come up for sale in the future and would allow us to expand the cabinas to accommodate more guests.  It is a ten minute walk away from the beach (morning coffee and sunrise stroll anyone) and it is close to all the amenities that the town of Uvita has to offer (you can walk to the grocery store if you feel so inclined) 

Why US - WHY NOW?

As for the why now... this has quite possibly been Niki's hardest winter.  there were weeks at a time when it was impossible for her to even get dressed with out help. It turns out that the only thing left that her body does not appreciate is extreme cold/dry weather.  In the summer she thrives; but once winter comes she slows down to a crawl and has to seriously limit her diet in order to reduce the symptoms to a tolerable limit.  So the short answer is, whether or not we have a place to go to, we're going... This is our family saying that we will do WHATEVER it takes for her to be healthy.  She has been teaching 'self first' to others through her work for the last few years and we all feel that it would be unfair of us to not practice what we preach.   How can she ask people to fight for her health if she won't do it herself.  

It was actually her fellow film makers Lucien Noe and Richard O'Shields who made this all possible - Lucien thanks to his unquestionable dedication and concern for her well-being and Richard for his gift of a trip to get her somewhere that he knew would make her feel better.   Their efforts inspired a much needed and timely shift in mindset and has set us both on a path with purpose.  She has already begun writing about her experiences with Fibro -->> Niki's Fibro Blog and promises to continue to do so in the hopes it will help others out there who are suffering from the same illness.  

As to why us... Well between our experiences with Fibromyalgia, Pascal's vast experience with construction and renovation, Niki's 20 yrs customer service experience in the service industry, Niki and Pascal's artistic skill (yes Pascal can draw too)  and Niki's last 4 years of work as an author, radio show host (which has connected her with health and wellness specialists around the world, independent film maker... who better than us to pull this off and make it AWESOME?

Here is an example of some of the work Niki has done in the past to help others out there find their way to health and wellness...


If you want a little reassurance that we have the resources  you can stop by the radio show website to listen to the archives...           Everyday Connection

One of Niki's all time fav interviews - > Everyday Connection with Dr. Terry Wahls

Or a little reassurance about what Niki is capable of when she puts her heart and soul into it...     BEYOND STRENGTH - THE MOVIE

Or if you simply want to connect personally with us and ask a question...

Connect with Niki on Facebook 

Connection with Pascal on Facebook

We certainly aren't hiding...

NOW FOR THE BIG BIG QUESTION... 

How else can YOU help???

SHARE SHARE SHARE!!!

No seriously SHARE !!!

but beyond that - you can support us financially by other means as well and still get something in return... 

You can go to Niki's publishers website and BUY HER BOOK 

Grave Distractions Publications

Contact her directly to commission art work

CONTACT NIKI

But beyond that - What is most important to us is AWARENESS - UNDERSTANDING and above all COMPASSION <3 <3 <3 

Educated yourself and others... we have found some fantastic info out there and we would like to share a bit with you now in the hopes that you will pass it along...

First - A video we stumbled upon on you tube - it's not ours but it is a fair representation of what life with Fibro is like... What struck us so much was a statement by one of the women in the video who claims that heat triggers her flare-ups - this is just more confirmation for us that Fibro is an extremely complex disease and that each individual patient needs to be treated in a unique way - this is NOT a one size fits all disease and there is NO one size fits all solution.


And of course there are tonnes of articles out there from reputable Fibromyalgia awareness websites that are helping to shed light on this disorder...

This AMAZING article ABOUT HEALTH on the challenges of living with Fibro

This INCREDIBLE read from BUT YOU DON"T LOOK SICK called 'The Spoon Theory'

Extensive SYMPTOM list by LIVING SMARTER WITH FIBROMYALGIA

12 Steps to Understanding Someone With Chronic Pain by WIKI HOW

Having Fibromyalgia sucks!!! For many who have it there is a fear of speaking openly to friends and family about it - there has for far too long been the misconception that Fibro in all in the mind... combine that belief with the complex, invisible, hard to explain symptoms and many simply feel that they have no way to be heard - LET'S END THE SILENCE...

 Talk about it - write about it - make video's about it...

Tweet it - Blog it - Tumblr it - Facey Spacey it...

Get LinkedIn to it... 

WHATEVER YOU HAVE TO DO to let the people out there who have this disease know that THEY ARE NOT ALONE < 3 

you never know - just telling somebody you care just may be enough to save a life <3

Stay tuned for up dates like...

Fibro Blogs

Pictures of Felix Cabina's and our ideas for improvements

Update video's

Pictures of our trip

Pictures of the things we are selling and a careful account of both what we bring and in and what we spend

THANKS SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT <3 <3 <3

Niki & Pascal

Warm humid air agrees with Niki's body... when she is in that environment she can work all day without tiring and WITHOUT being in pain - fresh fruit is readily available (pick it off the tree) and almost all the food in the market is organically grown and grass fed meats (both extremely important to her body and very expensive to get in Canada) - More than that, the culture suits us - we are very simple people - we don't need a lot of stuff (which is why we are selling almost everything we own) - we have discovered that the more stuff you have the more stuff you have to answer to - do you realize how much time and energy we waste of caring for - finding space for - cleaning - maintaining - repairing our stuff... literally - we are slaves to our stuff - no more...  Costa Rica is an environmentally conscious country with an amazing laid back culture - they no longer have a military (which excites us because we really don't understand war) and the people are very in tune with the basic human values that matter - family - faith - friendship...
We have contacts with people there who own larger facilities that would be able to house the fibro retreat attendees and who are also members of the natural health and wellness community.  Basically - it has EVERYTHING we need...
Why Felix Cabina's?
Because it's small, easily manageable (it will still leave us lots of time for Foundation and retreat work) - it caters the to backpacking community (whom we happen to adore spending time with) and it has VAST POTENTIAL - with a little bit of paint - some construction and some creative artistic ingenuity the place could be FABULOUS... as it stands it's already a gem... we just want to take what they have created and expand on it - speaking of expanding - there is an vacant lot right next to it that may come up for sale in the future and would allow us to expand the cabinas to accommodate more guests.  It is a ten minute walk away from the beach (morning coffee and sunrise stroll anyone) and it is close to all the amenities that the town of Uvita has to offer (you can walk to the grocery store if you feel so inclined) 
Why US - WHY NOW?
As for the why now... this has quite possibly been Niki's hardest winter.  there were weeks at a time when it was impossible for her to even get dressed with out help. It turns out that the only thing left that her body does not appreciate is extreme cold/dry weather.  In the summer she thrives; but once winter comes she slows down to a crawl and has to seriously limit her diet in order to reduce the symptoms to a tolerable limit.  So the short answer is, whether or not we have a place to go to, we're going... This is our family saying that we will do WHATEVER it takes for her to be healthy.  She has been teaching 'self first' to others through her work for the last few years and we all feel that it would be unfair of us to not practice what we preach.   How can she ask people to fight for her health if she won't do it herself.  
It was actually her fellow film makers Lucien Noe and Richard O'Shields who made this all possible - Lucien thanks to his unquestionable dedication and concern for her well-being and Richard for his gift of a trip to get her somewhere that he knew would make her feel better.   Their efforts inspired a much needed and timely shift in mindset and has set us both on a path with purpose.  She has already begun writing about her experiences with Fibro -->> Niki's Fibro Blog and promises to continue to do so in the hopes it will help others out there who are suffering from the same illness.  
As to why us... Well between our experiences with Fibromyalgia, Pascal's vast experience with construction and renovation, Niki's 20 yrs customer service experience in the service industry, Niki and Pascal's artistic skill (yes Pascal can draw too)  and Niki's last 4 years of work as an author, radio show host (which has connected her with health and wellness specialists around the world, independent film maker... who better than us to pull this off and make it AWESOME?
Here is an example of some of the work Niki has done in the past to help others out there find their way to health and wellness...

If you want a little reassurance that we have the resources  you can stop by the radio show website to listen to the archives...           Everyday Connection
One of Niki's all time fav interviews - > Everyday Connection with Dr. Terry Wahls
Or a little reassurance about what Niki is capable of when she puts her heart and soul into it...     BEYOND STRENGTH - THE MOVIE
Or if you simply want to connect personally with us and ask a question...
Connect with Niki on Facebook 
Connection with Pascal on Facebook
We certainly aren't hiding...
NOW FOR THE BIG BIG QUESTION... 
How else can YOU help???
SHARE SHARE SHARE!!!
No seriously SHARE !!!
but beyond that - you can support us financially by other means as well and still get something in return... 
You can go to Niki's publishers website and BUY HER BOOK 
Grave Distractions Publications
Contact her directly to commission art work
CONTACT NIKI
But beyond that - What is most important to us is AWARENESS - UNDERSTANDING and above all COMPASSION <3 <3 <3 
Educated yourself and others... we have found some fantastic info out there and we would like to share a bit with you now in the hopes that you will pass it along...
First - A video we stumbled upon on you tube - it's not ours but it is a fair representation of what life with Fibro is like... What struck us so much was a statement by one of the women in the video who claims that heat triggers her flare-ups - this is just more confirmation for us that Fibro is an extremely complex disease and that each individual patient needs to be treated in a unique way - this is NOT a one size fits all disease and there is NO one size fits all solution.

And of course there are tonnes of articles out there from reputable Fibromyalgia awareness websites that are helping to shed light on this disorder...
This AMAZING article ABOUT HEALTH on the challenges of living with Fibro
This INCREDIBLE read from BUT YOU DON"T LOOK SICK called 'The Spoon Theory'
Extensive SYMPTOM list by LIVING SMARTER WITH FIBROMYALGIA
12 Steps to Understanding Someone With Chronic Pain by WIKI HOW
Having Fibromyalgia sucks!!! For many who have it there is a fear of speaking openly to friends and family about it - there has for far too long been the misconception that Fibro in all in the mind... combine that belief with the complex, invisible, hard to explain symptoms and many simply feel that they have no way to be heard - LET'S END THE SILENCE...
 Talk about it - write about it - make video's about it...
Tweet it - Blog it - Tumblr it - Facey Spacey it...
Get LinkedIn to it... 
WHATEVER YOU HAVE TO DO to let the people out there who have this disease know that THEY ARE NOT ALONE < 3 
you never know - just telling somebody you care just may be enough to save a life <3
Stay tuned for up dates like...
Fibro Blogs
Pictures of Felix Cabina's and our ideas for improvements
Update video's
Pictures of our trip
Pictures of the things we are selling and a careful account of both what we bring and in and what we spend
THANKS SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT <3 <3 <3
Niki & Pascal

story:
Our NGO - Sustainable Society Association, is legal entity of the Hrankoop movement - the largest sustainable society initiative for direct link between farmers and consumers in Bulgaria so far and pioneer in organizing the farmers' markets in our country. The most important problem facing the initiative is too high requirements for market access of the small producers and that the homemade food sales are not regulated yet.
    

To resolve the need for more sustainable food on the market by more implemented organic farmers and food artisans, this project aims at providing them cooperative advantage for learning, creating, producing, selling and training new generation of entrepreneurs. Deprived farmers and artisans can share common resources now to meet the legal requirements, to develop and pass further their valuable skills and knowledge.

The Farm Craft Kitchen is a creative and innovative place in Plovdiv, Bulgaria combining kitchen, shop, takeaway corner for cooked local food, training space and  farmers’ market in the open. Local farmers will produce and deliver sustainable production to the shop and kitchen, the chefs will cook seasonal local food, and all together will be trained in entrepreneurship, will work together and grow as a community and mentors for future talents. It is a pilot project, that in the near future we plan to implement in 3 other cities in Bulgaria where our NGO is also organizing farmers' markets (Sofia, Varna and Burgas).

Нашата НПО - Сдружение "Устойчиво общество", е юридическото лице на движението Хранкооп - най-мащабната инициатива на устойчивото общество в България до момента за директни връзки между фермерите и производителите, както и пионер в организирането на фермерски пазари в страната. Най-значимият проблем пред инициативата са твърде високите изисквания към малките производители за достъп до пазара, както и че продаването на домашно приготвена храна, все още не е регламентирано.

За да разреши необходимостта от повече здравословни храни на пазара с повече реализирани биопроизводители и кулинарни занаятчии, този проект дава кооперативно решение за тяхното обучение, креативност, производство на продукция, продажби и подготовка на следващо поколение предприемачи. Фермерите и занаятчиите без възможности вече ще могат да споделят общи ресурси, за да отговарят на законовите изисквания, да се развиват и да предават нататък ценните си умения и знания.

Занаятчийска кухня "Фермата" е място за творчество и иновации в Пловдив, което комбинира малка кухня, магазин и щанд за приготвени местни храни, пространство за обучения и фермерски пазар на открито. Местните фермери ще произвеждат и доставят чиста продукция за магазина и кухнята, младите даровити кулинари ще приготвят сезонни храни от нея, а всички заедно ще се обучават за предприемачи, ще работят заедно и ще се развиват като общност и ментори за бъдещи занаятчии. Това е пилотен проект, който планираме в близко бъдеще да имплементираме в други 3 града на България, където нашето сдружение също провежда фермерски пазари (София, Варна и Бургас).

Hundreds of young people in Bulgaria are engaged passionately with organic gardening and authentic food handicrafts as bakery, confectionery, cheese making, traditional vegetable and fruit processing, beekeeping and others. But most of them have serious difficulties to access the market because of papers, no financial capacity and experience, the local food market being undeveloped. Generally, the Bulgarian food legislation is based on the industrial model with very high requirements for small producers that impose unnecessary investments and monitoring.

By sharing common production space, procedures, resources, consumers and knowledge the deprived talents will have better opportunities for realization. Through this project of cooperation we create conditions for practicing their passions, market access, enriching their knowledge and experience and the opportunity further to be mentors to new talents. Moreover, we strive to create a small producers community in which they can outshine. A community where they will grow as trainers and status quo reformers. 

Стотици млади хора в България сърцато се занимават с биоградинарство и кулинарно занаятчийство - хлебарство, сладкарство, приготвяне на сирене, традиционна преработка на плодове и зеленчуци, пчеларство и други. Повечето от тях обаче имат сериозни затруднения за достъп до пазара поради сложна документация, липса на финансов капацитет и опит, както и заради неразвития пазар на местни храни. Като цяло българското законодателство за храните се основава на индустриалния модел с твърде високи изисквания за малките производители, които налагат ненужни инвестиции и мониторинг.

Чрез споделянето на общо производствено пространство, процедури, ресурси, потребители и знания талантливите производители без възможности ще имат по-добри шансове за реализация. С този кооперативен проект ние създаваме условия те да следват мечтите си, осигуряваме им достъп до пазара, даваме им възможности да обогатяват своите знания и опит, както и перспективата да бъдат ментори на следваща генерация занаятчии. Освен това, ние се стремим да създадем общност на малките производители, чрез която те да преуспяват. Общност, в която те ще се развиват като обучители и реформатори на статуквото.

We already found Our Place- it’s a renovated small house in the heart of the historical district in Plovdiv- Kapana, center of the creative industries and crafts.

The total budget needed to open The Farm Craft Kitchen in July 2015  is € 7,210. We already gain funding for rent the house - € 2,000 from the Municipal Foundation Plovdiv 2019.  This crowdfunding campaign aims to gain € 5,210 by June 20 with which we are going to buy the kitchen equipment, the shop furnishings and the kitchen registration.

Ние вече намерихме Нашето Местенце. Това е една малка реновирана къща в сърцето на квартал Капана в Пловдив - център на творческите индустрии и занаяти.

Общият бюджет, необходим за да отворим Занаятчийска кухня "Фермата" през юли 2015 г. е € 7210. Вече спечелихме финансиране на наема за 1 година (€ 2000) от Общинска Фондация "Пловдив 2019". А с тази фондонабираща кампания целим да спечелим € 5210 до 20 юни, като с тези средства ще можем да закупим кухненско оборудване, обзавеждане на магазина и регистрация на кухнята.


Young and deprived food talents are the core of The Farm Craft Kitchen. We will train and support them in food preparation, food entrepreneurship and food justice. They'll also take part in The Farm Craft Kitchen decision making and have equity in our business.

In benefit of the local economic we will support the growth of many small farmers who will have stability in selling their production. They will be motivated to vary their products and will be fairly paid for the labour. The money which the consumers spend will leave in the local economics instead of foreign supermarket chains.

Citizens will have better access and variety of sustainable local food.

We will revive and develop the culinary history of local, national and European level.

Creativity of our youth educations and workshops, open for the society will lead essential role in minimizing the consumerism effect.

The project implementation at the national scale will improve potential and knowledge of the food artisan’s community so they will push policies to simplify the requirements for small producers and will contribute to the regulation of homemade food production in Bulgaria.

Младите и лишени от възможности талантливи занаятчии са ядрото на Занаятчийска кухня "Фермата". Ние ще ги обучаваме и ще подкрепяме тяхното желание да приготвят автентични храни, да развиват предприемачески умения и хранителна справедливост. Те също така ще участват във вземането на решения във "Фермата" и ще имат равнопоставеност в нашия бизнес.

В полза на местната икономика ще подпомагаме растежа на много малки фермери, които ще имат повече сигурност за реализация на продукцията си. Те ще бъдат мотивирани да разнообразяват асортимента си и ще получават справедливо заплащане за труда си. Парите, които потребителите плащат, ще остават в местната икономика, вместо в чуждестранните вериги супермаркети.

Гражданите ще имат по-добър достъп и разнообразие от чиста местна храна.

Ще съживим и развием кулинарната история на местно, национално и европейско ниво.

Творческият аспект на младежките ни обучения и семинари, отворени за обществеността, ще допринесе съществено за минимизиране ефекта на консуматорството.

Надграждането на проекта в национален мащаб ще подобри потенциала и познанията на общността от кулинарни занаятчии, така че да могат да водят успешни политики за опростяване на изискванията към малките производители и ще допринесе за регламентиране на домашното производство на храни в България.

Gergana Kabaivanova - Gery is the chairman of Sustainable Society Association, former Brand Manager for Bulgaria of Nuxe cosmetics . She will manage the events and the finance of the projects.

Daniela Gozmanova - Dani will be the kitchen and shop manager. Previously she was a Marketing manager of two Plovdiv hotels.

Mariana Georgieva will be the Kitchen Chef. She is a professional cook with a passion for the vegetarian cuisine.

Rossen Chakarov is a chef, a master of the culinary demonstrations of the Farmers market in Plovdiv, professional cook with rich experience in the national and healthy cuisine. Excellent presenter. He will lead the mentoring program of the chefs. 

Гергана Кабаиванова - Гери е председател на Сдружение "Устойчиво общество", бивш бранд мениджър на Nuxe cosmetics за България. Тя ще ръководи събитията и финансите на проекта.

Даниела Гозманова - Дани ще бъде управител на кухнята и магазина. Преди това е работила като Маркетинг мениджър на 2 пловдивски хотела.

Мариана Георгиева ще бъде главен готвач в кухнята. Тя е професионален готвач с афинитет към вегетарианската кухня.

Росен Чакъров е майстор готвач, специалист по кулинарните демонстрации на Фермерския пазар в Пловдив, професионалист с богат опит в националната и здравословната кухня. Отличен презентатор. Той ще води менторската програма на кулинарите. 

·  We already have active partnership with the expert local producers of organic food which will lead informal trainings.

·  We have join projects for youth educational activities with the fondations EEA Grants, Prosveta 21 century and Bioselena.

·  Our media partners are PloveDiv.com, MediaCafe.bg, PodTepeto.com.

·  We cooperate with local touroperators which will attract tourists for our open events.

- Имаме вече активни партньорства с местните биопроизводители - експерти, които ще провеждат неформални обучения.

-  Имаме съвместни проекти за младежки обучителни активности с фондациите EEA Grants, "Просвета 21-ви Век" и "Биоселена".

- Наши медийни партньори в Пловдив са PloveDiv.com, MediaCafe.bg, PodTepeto.com.

- Имаме изградени взаимоотношения с местните туроператори, които ще привличат туристи за отворените ни градски събитията.

For our contributors we prepared the following perks and bonuses:

- Client card with a 5% discount

- A culinary workshop attendance

- Branded cotton shopping bag

- Branded cotton apron

За тези, които ни подкрепят, сме подготвили следните бонуси и подаръци:

- Клиентска карта с 5% отстъпка;

- Посещение на кулинарна работилница;

- Брендирана памучна чанта;

- Брендирана памучна престилка

We will be forever grateful if you share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, email or other ways!

Contact us if you have any questions, comments, ideas of just to say “Hello”:  info@organichno.com.

Ще ви бъдем вечно благодарни, ако споделите нашата кампания във Facebook, Twitter, чрез електронната ви поща или по други начини!

Свържете се с нас, ако имате някакви въпроси, коментари, идеи или пък само за да ни кажете "Здрасти": info@organichno.com.

се развиват като обучители и реформатори на статуквото.



We
already found Our Place- it’s a renovated small house in the heart of the historical
district in Plovdiv- Kapana, center of the creative industries and crafts.
The
total budget needed to open The Farm Craft Kitchen in July 2015  is € 7,210. We already gain funding for rent the house - € 2,000 from the Municipal Foundation Plovdiv 2019.  This crowdfunding campaign aims to gain €
5,210 by June 20 with which we are going to buy the kitchen equipment, the shop furnishings and the kitchen
registration.
Ние вече намерихме Нашето Местенце. Това е една малка реновирана къща в сърцето на квартал Капана в Пловдив - център на творческите индустрии и занаяти.


Общият бюджет, необходим за да отворим Занаятчийска кухня "Фермата" през юли 2015 г. е € 7210. Вече спечелихме финансиране на наема за 1 година (€ 2000) от Общинска Фондация "Пловдив 2019". А с тази фондонабираща кампания целим да спечелим € 5210 до 20 юни, като с тези средства ще можем да закупим кухненско оборудване, обзавеждане на магазина и регистрация на кухнята.






Young and deprived food talents are the core of The Farm Craft Kitchen. We will train and support them in food preparation, food entrepreneurship and food justice. They'll also take part in The Farm Craft Kitchen decision making and have equity in our business.
In benefit of the local economic we will support the growth of many small farmers who will have stability in selling their production. They will be motivated to vary their products and will be fairly paid for the labour. The money which the consumers spend will
leave in the local economics instead of foreign supermarket chains.
Citizens will have better access and variety of sustainable local food.
We will revive and develop the culinary history of local, national and European level.
Creativity of our youth educations and workshops, open for the society will lead essential role in minimizing the consumerism effect.
The project implementation at the national scale will improve potential and knowledge of the food artisan’s community so they will push policies to simplify the requirements for small producers and will contribute to the regulation of homemade food production in
Bulgaria.
Младите и лишени от възможности талантливи занаятчии са ядрото на Занаятчийска кухня "Фермата". Ние ще ги обучаваме и ще подкрепяме тяхното желание да приготвят автентични храни, да развиват предприемачески умения и хранителна справедливост. Те също така ще участват във вземането на решения във "Фермата" и ще имат равнопоставеност в нашия бизнес.
В полза на местната икономика ще подпомагаме растежа на много малки фермери, които ще имат повече сигурност за реализация на продукцията си. Те ще бъдат мотивирани да разнообразяват асортимента си и ще получават справедливо заплащане за труда си. Парите, които потребителите плащат, ще остават в местната икономика, вместо в чуждестранните вериги супермаркети.



Гражданите ще имат по-добър достъп и разнообразие от чиста местна храна.
Ще съживим и развием кулинарната история на местно, национално и европейско ниво.
Творческият аспект на младежките ни обучения и семинари, отворени за обществеността, ще допринесе съществено за минимизиране ефекта на консуматорството.

Надграждането на проекта в национален мащаб ще подобри потенциала и познанията на общността от кулинарни занаятчии, така че да могат да водят успешни политики за опростяване на изискванията към малките производители и ще допринесе за регламентиране на домашното производство на храни в България.



Gergana Kabaivanova - Gery is the chairman of Sustainable
Society Association, former Brand Manager for Bulgaria of Nuxe cosmetics . She
will manage the events and the finance of the projects.
Daniela Gozmanova - Dani will be the kitchen and shop manager. Previously she was a Marketing manager of two Plovdiv hotels.
Mariana Georgieva will be the Kitchen Chef. She is a professional cook with a passion for the vegetarian
cuisine.
Rossen Chakarov is a chef, a master of the culinary
demonstrations of the Farmers market in Plovdiv, professional cook with rich
experience in the national and healthy cuisine. Excellent presenter. He will lead the mentoring program of the chefs. 
Гергана Кабаиванова - Гери е председател на Сдружение "Устойчиво общество", бивш бранд мениджър на Nuxe cosmetics за България. Тя ще ръководи събитията и финансите на проекта.

Даниела Гозманова - Дани ще бъде управител на кухнята и магазина. Преди това е работила като Маркетинг мениджър на 2 пловдивски хотела.
Мариана Георгиева ще бъде главен готвач в кухнята. Тя е професионален готвач с афинитет към вегетарианската кухня.
Росен Чакъров е майстор готвач, специалист по кулинарните демонстрации на Фермерския пазар в Пловдив, професионалист с богат опит в националната и здравословната кухня. Отличен презентатор. Той ще води менторската програма на кулинарите. 




· 
We
already have active partnership with the expert local producers of organic food which
will lead informal trainings. 
· 
We
have join projects for youth educational activities with the fondations EEA
Grants, Prosveta 21 century and Bioselena. 
· 
Our
media partners are PloveDiv.com, MediaCafe.bg, PodTepeto.com.
· 
We
cooperate with local touroperators which will attract tourists for our open
events.
- Имаме вече активни партньорства с местните биопроизводители - експерти, които ще провеждат неформални обучения.
-  Имаме съвместни проекти за младежки обучителни активности с фондациите EEA Grants, "Просвета 21-ви Век" и "Биоселена".
- Наши медийни партньори в Пловдив са PloveDiv.com, MediaCafe.bg, PodTepeto.com.
- Имаме изградени взаимоотношения с местните туроператори, които ще привличат туристи за отворените ни градски събитията.




For our
contributors we prepared the following perks and bonuses:
- Client
card with a 5% discount
- A
culinary workshop attendance
- Branded
cotton shopping bag- Branded cotton apron
За тези, които ни подкрепят, сме подготвили следните бонуси и подаръци:
- Клиентска карта с 5% отстъпка;
- Посещение на кулинарна работилница;
- Брендирана памучна чанта;
- Брендирана памучна престилка

We will be forever grateful if you share our campaign on
Facebook, Twitter, email or other ways!
Contact us if you have any questions,
comments, ideas of just to say “Hello”:  info@organichno.com.
Ще ви бъдем вечно благодарни, ако споделите нашата кампания във Facebook, Twitter, чрез електронната ви поща или по други начини!
Свържете се с нас, ако имате някакви въпроси, коментари, идеи или пък само за да ни кажете "Здрасти": info@organichno.com.

story:
Food on the Run

Veganism is such a great cause and it's worth sacrificing for, but sometimes it's just so hard! Where do you go for fast food? What about ready meals for when you don't have time, or don't feel like cooking? It's not only hard on vegans, but it's also a barrier to mainstreaming veganism itself. It is a new lifestyle for those contemplating it. Any new lifestyle, regardless of the motivation, requires massive commitment and change on behalf of each individual. This in itself stops many people becoming vegan that otherwise may have if it was easy for them. (It doesn't matter to the animals why people do or don't go vegan, as long as they do.)


Remove the barriers to veganism and the cause will take on a new life. 


'The meat industry will die because we run out of excuses.' Phil Wollen


We have a vision to be Australia's (and perhaps the world's) first vegan fast food destination! Imagine walking into a fast food shop and knowing that you can have anything on the menu! Instead of looking for the one little thing that you can pick at and pull apart until it's vegan, you can order straight from the menu and know it's cruelty free! A fast food place where your options are the focus of the menu instead of a little known option.


What will be on our menu?

We already have amazing pizzas that just keep getting better, but we'd like to offer other fast foods like burgers, fried foods and of course, Faux Fish 'n Chips! For our ready meals we have mastered some amazing vegan versions of old favourites you may not have had in a while - like a delicious quiche!

And for dessert... we already have vegan apple crumble and we have the most divine vegan pavlova and meringues to come!


Who are we?


We currently run Pizzarea Capalaba, where we have an extensive vegan pizza menu and a large loyal customer base.  We started serving vegan pizzas about 3 months ago. In less than a month we have over 700 likes and 29 five star reviews on our dedicated Facebook page  (425 likes and 12 five star reviews within 24 hours of creating the page).


We have been so inspired by the dedication and general spirit of our vegan customers. They are so passionate about their cause that they will go to great lengths to support their beliefs, many of them driving an hour or more just to get pizza! It just doesn’t seem fair to us that people who are so driven to make the world a better place, should miss out on things that come so easy to everyone else – easy food. This led us to evolving to become a complete fast food destination for vegans.


Why Do We Need Funds?


We would like to test our vision by expanding this store to include other vegan fast food options and ready meals. It will be a very expensive project to fund as we need to extend our trading hours to double what we currently do (which means double our staff costs and utilities etc), buy new equipment and to stock up on retail.

As a small family business we simply do not have these funds available to us. We can turn to investors, but to us, it seems like a long-term solution for a short-term problem. Besides, we need to test the market before we can embark on such a venture.




How Will We Use The Funds


Our solution is to use crowd-funding and pre-orders to fund the initial operating costs to give us time to build our customer base. As our customer base grows and the funding allows, we will open more stores in more central locations, such as in Brisbane City. It is our belief that nothing mainstreams like commercialisation. Turn veganism into big business and society will follow. The more stores we can open, the more veganism will become accepted and something people want to do.

We are confident we will create a large vegan fast food industry, but we want to remain the market leaders and to do so we need to grow quickly. We plan to have a store in every main city in Australia and New Zealand, and then hopefully the world! The more money we raise, the quicker we can grow!


How You Can Help


It’s not really donations we’re seeking, so much as pre-paid vouchers to spend in store. For every voucher you buy you will receive bonuses to spend in store. We are already trading and offering vegan options so it’s risk-free for you. It’s a win win!

To make sure we are testing the market accurately, we are selling 2 types of vouchers. One is for use in the first 4 weeks – this is the trading period we are testing, and the other is to use in the first 12 months so that our supporters are able to take advantage of the bonuses for the future as well. These vouchers can not only be used in our current store, but in any location we open in. The more you can prepay now, the more money you’ll save! (And the quicker we can grow, and the more vegan meals we can serve)

In addition to this, your name will appear on a wallpaper that we will have specially designed for use in every outlet!


Milestones

4 week vouchers

$10,000 - Open for lunch/ retail and buy new equipment

$15,000 - Open everyday for breakfast


12 month vouchers

$20,000 - Redesign store for retail

$80,000 Open a new store with new concept and branding

story:
Short Summary

This is my picture taken at Seneca College before graduating from Computer Networking  program offered by School of Computer Studies, at York Campus, Toronto. My professional background is Geosciences. Technical background is Geographic Information Systems with Computer Networking and Technical Support. You may view PROFILE in Soft Grids Canada web page. 

The proposed business is registered as “Soft Grids Canada” to operate from its head quarters located at Toronto. The MISSION is to provide customized GIS and professional Geosciences services to meet its clients and partners goals for profit. Soft Grids Canada will reasonably participate with organizations involved in bringing a social impact around GTA.

I am looking forward to combine location based intelligence such as GIS with Information Technology and provide services to the resource based sector for clients around GTA and rest of the world. Clients can shop around for services at SHOP and book for services. The website will be improved by adding more categories and subcategories of services as we progress. You can view our INTERESTS to know more about us.

What We Need & What You Get

What Soft Grids Canada needs from you ?

The proposed Small Business is looking for a startup costs of around $15000 to kick start its business. Out of which, $1500 will go towards obtaining professional licensing as an individual practitioner and for registering Soft Grids Canada with Association of Professional Geoscientists of Ontario. $6500 will be spent towards renting / purchasing of software, $2000 towards hardware. The remaining amount of $5000 will be in company account to meet marketing and  advertising costs for promoting business.

What you get by contributing to Soft Grids Canada ?

Some of the statements made here are forward looking statements. We could not avoid mentioning these forward looking statements, as our intentions and passion are honest. You will be proud as each one of your combined contributions will help create a  Small Business that stands on ethics, you will be proud as  Soft Grids Canada will generate future employment opportunities, you will be proud as your contributions will go towards a startup that is building its foundations based on environmental values and ethics. It will really be a kick start if $15000 amount is reached. Otherwise, from whatever amount generated, the company will spend each penny received as per priorities to build its infrastructure and will move forward to meet its goals. 
The Impact

As an individual you will not only be making a difference for a good cause such as employment generation but will consciously be contented as each one of your contributions will help build a company such as Soft Grids Canada that will not only be the best in the local community, not only be the best in the world but will be BEST FOR THE LOCAL COMMUNITY and BEST FOR THE WORLD, A part of this message is borrowed from BCORP LABS (https://www.bcorporation.net/). Your contributions will help us to build a company which will work to obtain certification as a  B Corporation as we progress.

Risks & Challenges 

The intentions are honest, but there may be few challenges such as obtaining the first contract, building its sales, creating a office space in future to accommodate new hires.

As an individual I am very confident to overcome the challenges as Soft Grids Canada is building its foundations brick by brick with strong ethical commitment. 

To obtain the first sale, the founder of Soft Grids Canada plans to contact former employers to enter into rate contract. Soft Grids Canada will also vigorously participate in the tendering process at all levels of government. To overcome the second challenge "SALES", we will be committed in building a strong professional sales team and it will be the highest priority. We will overcome the last challenge which is accommodation,  by strengthening our financial portfolio by introducing best financial practices. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You may  just can't contribute for your current financial status, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Within your network please get the word out and broadcast this  campaign. Your word of mouth will make a huge difference.
  • You may use the Indiegogo share tools! for helping SOFT GRIDS CANADA

story:
To support the launch of Ashoka Italy, Anke and I (both working in Ashoka Italy) are organizing a fundraising walk along the Camino de Santiago from Portugal to Spain. From August 8th to the 18th, We will walk 189 km each, for a total of 378 km. You can support us buying one km for 22$. We will use a small part of the raised found to cover the cost of the flight to Portugal: the rest will be used to finance Ashoka Italy activities, which include supporting social innovators and social entrepreneurs, organizing events for strengthening the Italian community and helping associations, citizens and supporters to connect in order to create a framework for change.

------
Per sostenere il lancio di Ashoka in Italia io e Anke (colleghe di lavoro in Ashoka Italia) stiamo organizzando un fundrasing sul cammino di Santiago, dal Portogallo alla Spagna. Dall'8 al 18 agosto cammineremo 189 km ciascuna, per un totale di 378 km. Ci puoi sostenere comprando un chilometro per 20 euro. Utilizzeremo una piccola parte del totale raggiunto  per coprire I costi del volo per il portogallo:  tutto il resto sarà usato per sostenere le attività di Ashoka Italia, che includono: supportare innovatori e imprenditori sociali sul territorio nazionale, organizzare eventi per sostenere la comunità italiana ed aiutare associazioni, cittadini e sostenitori a connettersi per creare un sistema di cambiamento.

Right after the end of our trip all our supporters will be invited to attend an Happy Hour in Rome to share our experience  (and receive a thankful hug from us:).

Tutti i nostri sostenitori saranno invitati ad un aperitivo a Roma per ringraziarli e per condividere la nostra esperienza!


OUR STORIES (Italian below)

Natalia:

What is wrong with you? In which part of the world are you now?

Those kind of questions I was asked, when I left for volunteering in India, Middle East or Latin America, when I quitted a prestigious job to go and work for free in social innovation, when I stubbornly continued to believe that a change can happen. "What we are doing is just a drop in the ocean. But if that drop was not in the ocean, I think the ocean would be less because of that missing drop". This has always been my motto. And that’s why I found myself in Ashoka (or Ashoka found me, as you prefer).  After reading a book on “how to change the world” while working in Washington DC in international cooperation, I was sure I wanted to be part of Ashoka’s Everyone a Changemaker vision. Therefore, after that first seed of change, I left my previous job, came back to Italy and started this adventure of building an Everyone A Changemaker world in my own country. Why Santiago?  I need a time to look into myself in order to discover what my best way of becoming a changemaker is!

Anke:

I first heard the word "Ashoka" years ago in Chile, when one of the most admired young professional women from our generation all of a sudden quit her job as director of a prestigious magazine, took the kids and her husband and went to work for Ashoka in …Washington. Yes, Washington. The amazing detail is that Ashoka not just another guru capable of turning reasonable people into devotees, but an ancient Indian emperor who sought social justice in his reign, over two thousand years back in time.  So, when already living in Italy I read about the implementation of a local Ashoka in Rome, I immediately applied as an admin volunteer. And I met their young executive Natalia, who puts "The Best Of" religion into practice and proposed to walk The Way of St. James in order to tell more people about this worldwide network of social entrepreneurs with system-changing ideas.A good idea here is a better idea tomorrow at your place. Internet has no borders - act local, think global.  Get inspired by others and realise your own ideas that suit your community best…

----------------------------------

Chi siamo:

Natalia e Anke, lavoriamo insieme per Ashoka in Italia. Queste le nostre storie:

Natalia:

Cosa c’è di sbagliato in te? In quale parte del mondo sei adesso?

Queste le tipiche domande che mi venivano fatte  quando sono partita per fare volontariato in India, Medio Oriente e America Latina, quando ho lasciato un lavoro prestigioso per fare volontariato per l'innovazione sociale, quando ho ostinatamente continuato a credere che qualcosa possa cambiare."Quello che facciamo è una goccia nell’oceano. Ma se questa goccia non ci fosse all’oceano mancherebbe” . E’ sempre stato questo il mio motto. Così mi sono ritrovata ad Ashoka (o Ashoka  ha trovato me;).Dopo aver letto il libro "Come cambiare il mondo" mentre lavoravo a Washington nel campo della cooperazione internazionale, ho capito che volevo far parte di Ashoka, che vede in ciascuno di noi un portatore di cambiamento. Così ho deciso di lasciare il mio lavoro precedente, sono tornata in Italia ed ho iniziato questa avventura in Ashoka Italia.

Perché Santiago? Perché ho bisogno di un momento per riflettere dentro di me, per capire meglio qual è la via migliore per portare un cambiamento positivo.

Anke:

La prima volta che ho sentito parlare di Ashoka ero in Cine, quando una delle più ammirate giovani professioniste della nostro generazione di punto in bianco ha lasciato il lavoro come direttore di una rivista prestigiosa, preso bambini e marito ed è andata a lavorare per Ashoka a... Washington. Sì, Washington.La cosa soprendente è che Ashoka non è solo un altro guru indiano in grado di coinvolgere centinaia di devoti, ma un imperatore indiano che, più di duemila anni fa ha cercato di realizzare la giustizia sociale nel suo regno. Così, quando, già residente in Italia, ho letto della creazione di un ufficio di Ashoka anche in Italia, ho subito fatto domanda come volontaria per l’amministrazione. Così  ho incontrato Natalia, la giovane project manager di Ashoka Italia, che vive la religione nella sua vita di tutti i giorni, che mi ha proposto di fare il cammino di Santiago, e di farlo con Ashoka, per far conoscere a tante altre persone la filosofia di Ashoka, Network globale di imprenditori sociali con idee che cambiano il sistema. Una buona idea oggi è un’idea ancora migliore domani. Internet ha abbattuto tutte le barriere: agisci localmente, pensa globalmente. Lasciati ispirare dagli altri per realizzare le tue idee che rendono migliore la tua comunità
story_txt:
To support the launch of Ashoka Italy, Anke and I (both working in Ashoka Italy) are organizing a fundraising walk along the Camino de Santiago from Portugal to Spain. From August 8th to the 18th, We will walk 189 km each, for a total of  378 km. You can support us buying one km for 22$. We will use a small part of the raised found to cover the cost of the flight to Portugal: the rest will be used to finance Ashoka Italy activities, which include supporting social innovators and social entrepreneurs, organizing events for strengthening the Italian community and helping associations, citizens and supporters to connect  in order to create a framework for change.------Per sostenere il lancio di Ashoka in Italia io e Anke (colleghe di lavoro in Ashoka Italia) stiamo organizzando un fundrasing sul cammino di Santiago, dal Portogallo alla Spagna. Dall'8 al 18 agosto cammineremo 189 km ciascuna, per un totale di 378 km. Ci puoi sostenere comprando un chilometro per 20 euro. Utilizzeremo una piccola parte del totale raggiunto  per coprire I costi del volo per il portogallo:  tutto il resto sarà usato per sostenere le attività di Ashoka Italia, che includono: supportare innovatori  e imprenditori sociali sul territorio nazionale, organizzare eventi per sostenere la comunità italiana ed aiutare associazioni, cittadini e sostenitori a connettersi per creare un sistema di cambiamento.Right after
the end of our trip all our supporters will be invited to attend an Happy Hour in
Rome to share our experience  (and receive
a thankful hug from us:).Tutti i nostri sostenitori saranno invitati ad un aperitivo
a Roma per ringraziarli e per condividere la nostra esperienza!OUR STORIES (Italian below)Natalia:
What
is wrong with you? In which part of the world are you now?
Those kind of questions I was asked, when I left for
volunteering in India, Middle East or Latin America, when I quitted a
prestigious job to go and work for free in social innovation, when I stubbornly
continued to believe that a change can happen. "What we are doing is just a drop in the
ocean. But if that drop was not in the ocean, I think the ocean would be less
because of that missing drop". This has always been my motto. And that’s why I found myself
in Ashoka (or Ashoka found me, as you prefer). 
After reading a book on “how to change the world” while working in
Washington DC in international cooperation, I was sure I wanted to be part of
Ashoka’s Everyone a Changemaker vision. Therefore, after that first seed
of change, I left my previous job, came back to Italy and started this
adventure of building an Everyone A
Changemaker world in my own country. Why Santiago?  I need a time to look into myself in order to discover
what my best way of becoming a changemaker is!
Anke:I first heard the word "Ashoka" years ago in Chile, when one of
the most admired young professional women from our generation all of a sudden
quit her job as director of a prestigious magazine, took the kids and her
husband and went to work for Ashoka in …Washington. Yes, Washington. The amazing detail is that Ashoka not just another guru
capable of turning reasonable people into devotees, but an ancient Indian
emperor who sought social justice in
his reign, over two thousand years back in time.  So, when already living
in Italy I read about the implementation of a local Ashoka in Rome, I
immediately applied as an admin volunteer. And I met their young executive Natalia,
who puts "The Best Of" religion into practice and proposed to walk
The Way of St. James in order to tell more people about this worldwide
network of social entrepreneurs with system-changing ideas.A good idea here is a better idea tomorrow at your place. Internet has no
borders - act local, think global.  Get inspired by others and realise
your own ideas that suit your community best…----------------------------------
Chi siamo:
Natalia
e Anke, lavoriamo insieme per Ashoka in Italia. Queste le nostre storie:
Natalia:
Cosa
c’è di sbagliato in te? In quale parte del mondo sei adesso?
Queste
le tipiche domande che mi venivano fatte 
quando sono partita per fare volontariato in India, Medio Oriente e

ritrovata ad Ashoka (o Ashoka  ha trovato
me;).Dopo

parte di Ashoka, che vede in ciascuno di noi un portatore di cambiamento. Così
ho deciso di lasciare il mio lavoro precedente, sono tornata in Italia ed ho

La
prima volta che ho sentito parlare di Ashoka ero in Cine, quando una delle più

coinvolgere centinaia di devoti, ma un imperatore indiano che, più di duemila
anni fa ha cercato di realizzare la giustizia sociale nel suo regno. Così,
quando, già residente in Italia, ho letto della creazione di un ufficio di
Ashoka anche in Italia, ho subito fatto domanda come volontaria per
l’amministrazione. Così  ho incontrato
Natalia, la giovane project manager di Ashoka Italia, che vive la religione
nella sua vita di tutti i giorni, che mi ha proposto di fare il cammino di
Santiago, e di farlo con Ashoka, per far conoscere a tante altre persone la
filosofia di Ashoka, Network globale di imprenditori sociali con idee
che cambiano il sistema. Una buona idea oggi è un’idea ancora migliore domani.
Internet ha abbattuto tutte le barriere: agisci localmente, pensa globalmente. Lasciati
ispirare dagli altri per realizzare le tue idee che rendono migliore la tua
comunità

story:
THANK YOU TO ALL OF OUR FUNDERS!!!  We appreciate each and every donation you have made!

OUR STORY
In 2007, with a new baby at home and the murmurings of a recession on the way, Afzal Hossain and Julie Nymann made a commitment to Jackson Heights and opened Espresso 77, an independent coffee bar and café.  With much work by our staff, the diehard support of our amazing Jackson Heights community, and visits from customers near and far, the business has flourished and grown into a neighborhood gathering place for food, drink, art and music.

THE PROJECT 
From the first day we opened, Espresso 77 has been bursting at the seams in our retail space.  Almost daily, someone has said, "Wouldn't it be great if you could get that space next door?"   Just a few short weeks ago, we learned that this dream of all of ours could come true.  Right now, the lease is signed and the space is ours.  The plans are drawn up, we are talking with contractors and we are busy shopping for great deals on restaurant equipment that we need in the new space. 

We've been saving up all these years and we have $70K in capital socked away, but we need a bigger budget to accomplish all of our goals for the renovation. 

And this is where you come in - with your financial help, we can turn those dreams that we have had together into a terrific reality for our neighborhood.  Here are some of the features that your contributions will help us incorporate into the new turbo-powered E77:
     
  • More seating inside
  • More benches outside
  • An improved Air Conditioning System
  • Draft Beer
  • Food Delivery
  • A larger restroom
  • More selections of food and drink
  • A new storefront system to cover our enlarged space

PLEASE GIVE!

We've created a menu of giving opportunities and perks that we hope will inspire you to make your own financial commitment to this bright corner of music, art and community for our neighborhood.  If you've ever thought about how you could do something to make our neighborhood just a tiny bit better, this is your chance!

OTHER WAYS TO HELP OUT

We appreciate any and all help that you can give!

  • Share this campaign page with neighbors, friends, family, coffee-lovers, art-lovers, music-lovers - anyone you think would be inspired to contribute.
  • Use the share tools on this page to share our campaign with your own social media communities.
  • Talk us up with your fellow e77 fans and encourage them to donate at a level that is right for them - every little bit helps!
  • Follow us on Facebook!
  • Follow us on Twitter!
  • Follow us on Instagram!
  • Have other ideas for fundraising? Stop by the shop and talk with Afzal or Julie!
