story:
I'm Monika. In the photos you can see my daughter Lily. I've suffered the tragedy of medical malpractice during the labour. When I was told that my daughter can't be saved I have founded the foundation that has been working for a year www.lilkapomaga.pl
I'm working on prevention of medical malpractice during the labour and educating mothers before the labour. Only now I know that there are so many risks that can eventuate in death or disability of a child. Perinatal asphyxia is mostly caused by medical errors, malpractice and wrong examination.
My mission has started. Please support me in this mission:


We are the mothers- ordinary women- and our tragedies has brought us together. Our children could have a normal life. We think that our current life is caused by lack of perinatal standards that in consequence has led to medical malpractice. We believe, that this situation can be changed. Each of us proves every day that change is possible.

We want to make one common perinatal standard that will protect mothers, children and also create health care standards for children disabled because of medical malpractice during the labour. 


We believe that every European woman has the right for safe childbirth no matter if she is using public health care or she wants to give birth in home. We categorically oppose to breaking procedures and perinatal health care standards. No matter if the woman is giving birth naturally or the labour has complications (for example when caesarean section is necessary) women always have right for safety standards.

In many European countries perinatal procedures are reduced. There are no standards for prenatal examinations. Frequently lack of the right qualification cause problems for European  hospitals. Only fully healthy mothers can give birth naturally. Stress and other environmental factors are the main reasons for increasing number of non-natural labours.

We want all babies to have safe childbirth. Unfortunatelly lack of european standards is putting both mothers and doctors in very bad situation. Women and doctors don't have ability to provide professional and early help to mothers and children which were prenatally diagnosed with serious disorders, like for example Down syndrome or spina bifida.

Only complex european solutions can be a guarantee of safety during the labour and also on following years if the child would need further rehabilitation or different medical care. In practice in many European countries mothers of disabled children (including children disabled because of medical malpractice) can rely only on help of non-governmental organisations.

Our fight for equal perinatal european standards are worth supporting. „Safe Childbirth” is a project of people and organizations from different countries that are engaged in creating equal european standards of perinatal health care. Our goal is to educate and to get funds from European Union for buying medical devices to the hospitals and training doctors, midwifes and patients. We believe that mothers need to know their laws and when they should be aware of medical staff. Our purpose is safety of mothers and children and in consequence- higher number of births.

We want to prepare the goverments and EU's institutions to increase expenditure for perinatal health care, so the growth of healthy new generation would be possible. To make it happen it is essential to make informative action which could convince them to our postulates. Otherwise more and more European women will decide not to have babies, which will be a cause of European demographic problem.

Our goal is to get funds from European Union for buying medical devices to the hospitals and training doctors, midwifes and patients. We believe that mothers need to know their laws and when they should be aware of medical staff. Our purpose is safety of mothers and children and in consequence- higher number of births. Howether we can't do it without your help. We must prepare statistics from all European countries's hospitals and departments, make brochures, pay for our organization's website servers... also to get the petition to be implemented, there are obligatory consultations in Brussels that the Organization must attend. There are even more things that we must do to be sure the babies can be safe. And you can help us to make childbirth safe.

Please visit our website and support us! www.safechildbirth.org

https://www.facebook.com/lilkazbonifratrow

Media about problem:

According to Barbara Kutryba, the chairperson of the EU Patient Safety and Quality of Care Expert Group, one of the key issues Poland must address is a set of standards and a system for reporting undesired medical events.“Poland doesn’t have the necessary standards like other member states,” she said. Poland also has no supervisory organization for monitoring patient safety and quality of care.                                                             http://www.politico.eu/article/poland-lags-data-health-quality/

The annual bill for NHS negligence in pregnancy has reached £1 billion after more than 1,300 babies were killed or maimed last year.

One basic error accounts for a quarter of payouts, with campaigners saying it was a “scandal” that the health service was failing to learn from its mistakes. They blamed divisions between midwives and doctors, saying that the desire for “natural” births — without interventions — sometimes went too far.
http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/health/news/article4465692.ece



WHO’s new guidance WHO recommendations on interventions to improve preterm birth outcomes has been launched to help prevent the complications and consequences of preterm birth. It will be useful for people working across the health sector, from health-care workers who directly provide care to pregnant women and preterm infants, to health-care policy makers and programmers, as well as those working on the development of job aids and training tools for health-care workers.
http://www.who.int/reproductivehealth/topics/maternal_perinatal/preterm-birth-guidelines/en/#.Vd7yBNlxO7U.facebook


Preterm birth complications account for more than 15% of deaths in children younger than 5 years and survivors often have long-term consequences with respect to their health, growth, and psychosocial functioning. WHO publishes new recommendations on interventions for pregnant women in whom preterm birth is imminent to improve preterm birth outcomes. http://thelancet.com/journals/langlo/article/PIIS2214-109X(15)00183-7/abstract#.Vd7wT6H9vSo.facebook

A demographic crisis is unfolding across the continent. Europe desperately needs more young people to run its health services, populate its rural areas and look after its elderly because, increasingly, its societies are no longer self-sustaining. Populations of the whole nations are dangerously shrinking. http://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/aug/23/baby-crisis-europe-brink-depopulation-disaster?CMP=share_btn_fb

The 293,000 women who die in pregnancy and childbirth every year (and the seven to 10 million who suffer severe or chronic illnesses caused by pregnancy-related complications) do so without public recognition of any kind. Heads of state do not stand in silence for the mothers who have fallen.
The joy and pleasure in new motherhood has been de-emphasised even though new studies show that the autonomic activity (heart rate and other involuntary nervous system activity) of two-day-old sleeping babies is 176% higher during maternal separation.                           http://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2015/jul/11/should-women-really-be-rushing-back-to-work-after-giving-birth?CMP=share_btn_fb

The data released by the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ) revealed that “most physicians, nurses, pharmacists and other health professionals working in hospitals believe their organizations are still more interested in punishing missteps and enforcing hierarchy than in encouraging open communication and using adverse-event reports to learn what’s gone wrong.” http://injurylawyer-news.com/2015/02/cerebral-palsy-lawsuit-sheds-light-problems-health-care-culture/

Samantha Cameron has said that the grief and pain of losing her profoundly disabled oldest son six years ago would never leave her. The Prime Minister has also spoken about the strain on the couple of caring for their his oldest son, and the pain of losing him. He told the Sunday Times: “When he died, your whole world collapses.” Ivan was born with Ohtahara Syndrome, a rare brain disorder which left him with epilepsy and cerebral palsy.  http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/politics/david-...

Help us and take PERK

story:
Saving the World, One R/C Vehicle at a Time!

Well, not really (but that video pumps us up every time!).  The truth is, our mission at R/C Playground (RCP) is not to save the world.  It is neither dangerous, daring nor particularly radical.  In fact, if you're like us and have been around the hobby for a while, the idea behind RCP makes perfect sense:  create a friendly place where folks  who love R/C can just PLAY, LEARN, and SHARE.   Don't get us wrong, we love R/C racing -- but the truth is, for a variety of reasons, organized racing accommodates only a fraction of the many enthusiasts out there. For most of us non-racers, including kids and those still learning the hobby, our choices for getting the most out of R/C have been slim to none.   

Until now.

Crawler competitors at the RCP Summer Jam!

Who is R/C Playground?

First, RCP is NOT a hobby shop!  In fact, we're partnered with lots of great local and online hobby shops who support what we're trying to do, which is to provide a fun, safe place to enjoy your hard earned gear!  Into drifting?  Bashing?  How about crawling?  We know, maybe SPEED's your thing?  Like boats?  Planes?  Quads?  Want to just have fun with your toys?  Settle a friendly bet?  Tired of running all your awesome gear alone?  Want a friendly place to learn the ropes? Or perhaps you're more of a tinkerer than a driver?  Love to paint and design? You get the picture:  WHATEVER it is that you love about this great hobby, we want RCP to be the place where you can enjoy R/C the way YOU want to enjoy it!

Our staff has over 60 years of combined experience in R/C, and we've met tons of new friends who share our passions!  We've spent the last 6 months blasting away on social media, touring Georgia with promotional R/C events and exhibitions featuring our pro drivers (Team RCP), talking with fellow enthusiasts, hobby shops, community organizations, spreading the word about RCP, and trying to get an idea of exactly how the Playground can best accommodate the wide range of R/C interests out there.  Each event has been bigger than the last, and we've literally met hundreds of folks eager to share their ideas about the perfect R/C facility.  

RCP Founder Jimmy knows it's all about the customer experience!!

In a nutshell, here's what we learned:  you want a welcoming yet competitive place to play and hang out with fellow enthusiasts. You want fresh ideas and innovation, and fewer rules and restrictions. You don't want to feel like an outlaw, no matter who you are or what you run.  You want a place to go big, no compromises, no half-measures.  And you want it now.  

Most importantly, your enthusiasm convinced us that RCP could be the answer.  

The Next Step for RCP

We're closer than ever to making our dreams of a permanent facility a reality! RCP is working closely with consultants to develop a strategic business plan that is scalable and relatively low risk, and we've found several great locations in the surrounding metro Atlanta area that would be perfect for the new RCP!  

While we work on the "business end" and securing a new facility, it's time to start planning RCP's next community event, and with your help, we hope to make it our biggest and best yet!   Much more than our typical promotional event, we need to show our many supporters in the R/C community, including our fellow hobbyists, local businesses, team sponsors, and investors, that our team is ready for the next step!  If you've been to any of our events, you know we work hard to provide a fun, challenging, and open environment for all of our guests -- but this time, we're raising the bar to really show how great a permanent RCP can be! There's even a chance the event could be held at a potential long-term site!

Tentatively scheduled for late-August, the multi-day event will feature:

  • INDOOR tracks for RC drift, crawl, on/off-road, and more!
  • Additional outdoor features for off-road, touring, bashing, quads, and more!
  • Indoor pit area with work space, power, DIY tools, and full service offerings -- space for 30+ drivers!
  • Rental and demo vehicles of all types!
  • Build/maintenance/upgrade/repair workshops for enthusiasts of all levels!
  • Lounge area with TVs, video games, and concessions!

How YOU can help!

We are so grateful for the continued donations of time, labor, skills, equipment, and valuable advice -- your enthusiasm has kept us going from day one!  We've taken that energy and put everything we have into turning RCP into something we can all be proud of!  Our dedicated team of staff/supporters is ready to keep working -- but now we need YOUR help to take this event to the next level! 

Your contributions of ANY amount can make a huge difference to us and will go directly toward getting the venue ready for the event (and hopefully, beyond!).  This includes:

  • Track materials, including lumber and landscaping supplies
  • Pit/service area materials for work space and shop supplies
  • Operating costs, including facility rental and utilities
  • Promotional/advertising/community outreach costs
Most of the materials you help us secure can be used well beyond this next big event (ie for the permanent home and/or future events) so your valuable donations won't just be helping us throw the biggest R/C party this area has ever seen, but are an important investment into RCP's future!

Until now, we've never asked for a penny (outside of select competition entry fees to cover admin costs).  But we're at an important crossroads now as we begin to transition from promoting an idea to running a business.  We knew it would be a tough road, but we have also been encouraged by all the support we've gathered along the way -- we know that together, we can build the R/C utopia we've always dreamed of!  If you support what we're trying to do for our R/C community and beyond, please contribute!

What's In It For You?

Aside from knowing you're investing in something new and exciting for the R/C community and a new way to have fun with friends and family, you can choose from lots of different perks that suit your budget and needs.  Our list of perks include:

  • Exclusive RCP apparel!
  • Single and Group Event passes!
  • R/C Vehicle packages!
  • Early VIP access so you can help design tracks and features!
  • Service offerings for your R/C vehicle!
  • Individual and group sponsorship packages!
We're trying to take radio-control to the next level, and we really hope you'll join us in building the next big thing in the R/C hobby!  If you can't donate now, no worries -- there are plenty of ways you can still be involved!  Just reach out to us on our Facebook page (linked below) or email us at info@rcplayground.net to see how you can help!

Thanks SO much for your time and consideration!  Please don't hesitate to get in touch if you have any questions or comments about RCP, the campaign, our perks, or anything else on your mind -- we'd be glad to help!
story_txt:
Saving the World, One R/C Vehicle at a Time!
Well, not really (but that video pumps us up every time!).  The truth is, our mission at R/C Playground (RCP) is not to save the world.  It is neither dangerous, daring nor particularly radical.  In fact, if you're like us and have been around the hobby for a while, the idea behind RCP makes perfect sense:  create a friendly place where folks  who love R/C can just PLAY, LEARN, and SHARE.   Don't get us wrong, we love R/C racing -- but the truth is, for a variety of reasons, organized racing accommodates only a fraction of the many enthusiasts out there. story:
For the Love of Protectors...and Pizza

We're a team of five Venture for America fellows with a mission that's two-fold: to help our community and, of course, to eat pizza. 

Finding a project for that mission wasn't easy. After hours of agonizing brainstorm sessions, we found ourselves sprawled out over the floor at 2:30 am, tired, frustrated, and — hungry. Hangry Josh, our team hustler, turned to us and proclaimed with confidence: "I'm hungry. Let's order pizza." 

After scarfing down the last slices of pizza, we realized something. This was just one late night out of the 350 nights a year many of our city's nurses, EMTs, firefighters, and police officers must brave. Often times, on an empty stomach.

The rest is history. We launched Pizza for Protectors to deliver slices of deliciousness to the hungry souls working around the clock to save lives and protect our cities.

Here's our game plan: 
  1. Launch a kick-ass IndieGogo campaign to crowdfund a buttload of pizzas. 
  2. Run late-night pizza deliveries in person to emergency rooms, fire stations, and police stations across Providence. 
  3. Remotely call pizza delivery services to deliver pizzas to protectors across America.
Let's make our community happy, one slice at a time.


What We Need & What You Get

We need $2,500 to buy a boat load of pizza, and hand it out to hospitals, fire stations, and police stations all over Providence as well as remotely delivering to the entire US of A. Every single dollar will go towards feeding your community's protectors. In the end, we're just here to spread the cheer. 

By contributing to our crowdfunding campaign, you will be the first to join the Pizza for Protectors community. Happiness is contagious, and we need your help.



The Impact

Ever had someone random make your day? We sure have! Random acts of kindness  make the world go round. With a happier community, we'll see a happier world. We're not saying handing out pizza will make the world better overnight. But, hey, it sure can't hurt ;)


Can we do it?

On Sunday, July 19th, we will deliver late night pizzas to the Rhode Island Hospital ER. The more money we raise, the more pizza we can spare. You get the gist. 

Feeding Providence is going to take some serious time, cash, and pizza dough. We can do it, but we need your help. Every dollar counts!



Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Follow us on social @pizzaforamerica, like us on Facebook, and tell your friends. Help us make our city a better place, one slice at the time.

I mean... just look at us.

story:
S/Squared Hospitality Concepts is the  latest venture from bartender and entrepreneur, Shawn Soole. Shawn has been in the hospitality industry for almost 20 years. He has been a pioneer in the industry in Canada and worldwide since moving here 10 years ago.

S/Squared is the culmination of those years, his writing (he wrote Cocktail Culture in 2013), his passion and his knowledge of the inner workings of quality, utilitarian bar equipment. His first muddler, the Viva! Stick was ordered by the majority of the major franchise restaurants (The Keg, Joey's, Earl's, Cactus Club) in North America in 2010. This is a redesign and evolution of that muddler with the addition of the Lewis Bag & the introduction of "Muddler Muck".

The Excalibur Muddler & S2 Lewis Bag along with the Muddler Muck are the products that this campaign will help achieve the start-up to release these worldwide. The products are made locally in Victoria by small businesses that are as innovative as ours.

The Excalibur Muddler is as the name suggest designed after the look and ergonomics of a sword completely with a hilt and a grip. The handle end of the muddler has been fashioned to resemble a coffee tamper, being able to mould to any hand or grip necessary. The handled grip is designed for different grip options. All this with a moulded end that is wide enough for any Boston glass as well as wide mouth highball glasses. Turned from Canadian Maple, turned locally in Victoria, BC  and pre oiled for durability.

S2 Lewis Bag is constructed from 10Lb canvas with quadruple stitching (double nylon stitching, double heavy duty cotton). With its rounded edges to stop ice accumulation, an eyelet for hanging to dry and a durable flap to the keep the ice in. This is a working bartenders Lewis bag.

Finally, the development of the Muddler Muck will revolutionise how working bartenders & enthusiast maintain their wooden bar tools. A specially formulated preservation wax that is used weekly to condition and add years to your wooden muddlers, chopping boards and wooden handles.

WHAT WE NEED?

We need $2000 to use towards proper production of the products, website development and to continue with development of more bar products from local and international sources. We would like to continue to develop tools for the working bartender including a solid plastic version of the Excalibur Muddler called X2. This muddler is geared more towards the high volume locations & liquor brands for rebranding.

Pledge $25 - Excalibur Muddler valued at $40

Pledge $50 - Excalibur Muddler & S2 Lewis Bag valued at $72

Pledge $75 - Excalibur Muddler, S2 Lewis Bag & 4oz tub of Muddler Muck valued at $90

Pledge $100 - Excalibur Muddler, S2 Lewis Bag, 4oz tub of Muddler Muck & a signed copy of Cocktail Culture valued at $115

This entire project is based on producing working tools, educating bartenders and enthusiasts alike on how to look after their tools and putting better tools in the hands of novice industry professionals.

The hurdles in this project are few, but overcomable. Development of tools takes a lot of R&D and money, creating and manufacturing something and then testing, tweaking and recreating. Once the tool is complete, then the next task is to have distribution channels to get it into people's hands as quick as possible.

The R&D is done, tested, retested and proven. It is capital that we have put forward to get the ball rolling, we have a working product ready for market. Distribution is something that Shawn has dealt with in the past for the Viva! Stick and has contacts and networks ready to use in the market.

Challenges & risks aside, we have industry experience, design know how and quality suppliers prepared to start selling the tools tomorrow.

The S2 Bar Tool range while small right now, will grow and be widely available by the year's end with the North American market being the first target and internationally within the year.

story:
Short Summary

Many physically challenged people find it difficult to muster the confidence necessary for romantic relationships; others battle the perception that they are incapable of those relationships. Not the King Production is developing a short educational musical video to publicize these issues and to provide support for those affected by them.  

What We Need & What You Get

The accomplishment of our goals will ultimately require a community effort. Not the King Production is seeking sponsors to assist  in covering the following required investments:


Total Cost of Making Production:

Cost of Music production: $ 3000

Cost of Video production:  $ 12000

In return, you will get an empowered community and access to the products of Not The King Productions.  

The Impact 

Not The King Production normalizes the daily lives of the physically challenged and educates others about members in the physically challenged community. This project has been written by Sama Doh, a man who lives with the challenges of being disabled and who is now inspired to share his feelings with the world. 

Risks & Challenges

The risk is not making the musical video. The challenge is in uniting a global audience around the cause.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share the Not The King Campaign with your family and friends.

story:
This plea is to raise money to help those dwelling in the 'squatter camp' in Moriteng, near Finetown S.A. 

At this point I should point out that we are not talking about people who move into other people's houses. We are talking about people who are at rock bottom, have done their best to erect some kind of shelter and are getting on with the business of living. It's called a squatter camp because it is not acknowledged by government so doesn't qualify for power, roads and general infrastructure. The community put in standpipes for water but these are limited - and their own toilets which are shared one to around 20 people. This is poverty in the extreme - but I never fail to be floored by the warm smiles and bright eyes of these people. There is so much to be done. a 'decent' shack made of solid joists and corrugated steel, weather proof, with a window and lockable door costs £400 key in hand - and I would dearly love to be able to offer even that small luxury, and believe me that IS luxury.
However that's the big picture, and with this appeal I want to raise funds to provide tools, seeds and expert guidance for one year so that the people in the squatter camps can grow their own veg, a major step towards improved health. I once suggested bottle gardening, but it turned out it wouldn't work, because so many people eke out a subsistence by selling bottles to the recycling plant :-( Nevertheless, the joy of turning your vegge patch and watching your veg grow is beyond price. Please, please help. I am just one of the great giving family that is striving so hard to help these people, but we are all 'small people' not rich - just with big hearts. Every penny we raise will go to the people of the squatter camp - Not the least penny goes for administration costs - so please help - every little counts, and I would be so proud if my little appeal could make a difference. I am Rowena Fuller, a foster mother residing in France, and sincerely desirous to offer a better life to these forgotten people - I have not paid taxes in 10 years because I don't earn enough - but I give what I can - I believe that the world is full of people like me. We cannot save the whole world all at once, but we can make an enormous difference with not a lot. 


Every penny raised by my fundraising will be handed over to The Winnie Mabaso Foundation, a registered charity that is incredibly active in and around Finetown SA, and which spares no efforts in improving the lot, not only of these people, but of many more.

Please, please help. I am just one of the great giving family that is striving so hard to help these people, but we are all 'small people' not rich - just with big hearts. Every penny we raise will go to the people of the squatter camp - Not the least penny goes for administration costs - so please help - every little counts, and I would be so proud if my little appeal could make a difference. I am Rowena Fuller, a foster mother residing in France, and sincerely desirous to offer a better life to these forgotten people - I have not paid taxes in 10 years because I don't earn enough - but I give what I can - I believe that the world is full of people like me. We cannot save the whole world all at once, but we can make an enormous difference with not a lot. Every penny raised by my fundraising will be handed over to The Winnie Mabaso Foundation, a registered charity that is incredibly active in and around Finetown SA, and which spares no efforts in improving the lot, not only of these people, but of many more.

story:
We own Monticello, a farm to fork restaurant in Davis, CA and source ingredients from our partner Jim Eldon's organic farm. We need your help because our landlords are evicting us from our restaurant in order to replace us with a tenant who covets our beautiful space but does not want to compensate us for it. While we have expressed our willingness to leave peacefully and have made many win/win proposals, the landlords are going for our throats by refusing to credit us for any of our numerous tenant improvements, laying claim to all of our trade improvements and equipment, and have threatened to put a lien on the farm and our homes for money they claim we owe them for back rent.  We stand to lose everything we have worked so hard for over the years and need to raise money to legally protect ourselves from their greed.

The Back Story: More than four years ago, we turned a filthy space in a neglected 1960’s era auto mall into a beautiful restaurant.  The lease stated, “the earth and groundwater at the shopping center was or may have been contaminated with various chemicals” by a former dry cleaner.  The same document stated the “Landlord is using its best efforts to re-mediate the aforementioned contamination.” The landlords also claimed they had plans to fill the vacant storefronts and upgrade the exterior of the mall. 

Fast forward to today when the landlords historical and ongoing refusal to take responsibility for mitigating the toxics is negatively impacting our business, neighboring businesses, and creating blight in the neighborhood,  The empty spaces now total 2/3 of the mall which looks worse for the wear every minute while the rent continues to rise. 

After communicating our financial distress, the landlords accepted reduced rent payments.  Early this year, we decided it would be a good idea to cut our losses and try to find someone to take over our lease and pay us something toward  the solid infrastructure and high quality trade fixtures we would leave them. However, more recently, they asked us to sign a document requiring us to pay full rent plus arrears for the "rent reduction" as of 2016.   We told their attorney we would consider signing the document if the landlords would also agree to address the toxics, upgrade the mall, and fill the empty spaces by 2016.  The landlords backed off, we continued to pay a reduced rent, and they continued to cash our checks.

 Some local people made us an offer saying, "We love what you’ve done and the atmosphere that you’ve created."  The issue was these folks asked us to finance their "offer" for ten years. 

We  needed a business that could pay us up front so we could to settle up with the landlords and take care of our other business obligations.  Needless to say, we were totally shocked to discover the landlords were working behind our backs to replace us with the aforementioned party. 

In addition to evicting us, the landlords are refusing to credit any of our tenant improvements towards the amount they claim we owe them, although the value is more than double.  They are also claiming rights to all our trade fixtures and equipment and have threatened to put a lien on the farm and our home for "outstanding" rent they claim was never "officially reduced." 

We have been forced hire a local attorney to protect ourselves from the landlords greed and desperately need financial assistance to save our farm and home.

story:
This Place Needs Some TLC

The haunted house in Hinsdale, perhaps the most famous haunted house in all of the WNY area, has all the elements of a good ghost story: a mysterious history, strange sightings, unexplainable events and even an exorcism. There are two books about the house, "Echo's of a Haunting" by Clara Miller and "You know they're here" by Paul Kenyon. The house gained further notoriety when the Discovery Channel made an episode for their "A Haunting" television series, "Dark Forest," which first aired in September 2006. Discovery Channel has plans to come back once again in 2015 to film another Documentary. 
We are dedicated to the restoration and preservation of the Historic Hinsdale (Dandy) House. Our goal is to keep it viable for Paranormal Research for years to come. We also want to turn this House into a museum that people can visit and learn about its history and stories. 
We are in need of wood, Paint, Roofing Materials, New Windows, locks and for basic upkeep up the land. While we do not wish to change anything in regards to the inegrity of the house, we want to make sure it is weather proof and safe for patrons to visit. 
We are going to have some Perks for Donating, no amount is too little! Thank you in advance for helping our cause!
The Hinsdale House Resoration Project

story:
"Remember the first time you laid your eyes on your newborn? You promised to give only the best to her. You were determined to breastfeed. But a few days after birth, her constant cries got you very nervous. Did you have milk? Why did your breasts feel hard but nothing is coming out? Your worried family can't bear to see your baby crying. They insist that your baby be given formula to get her out of danger. You agreed heavy heartedly. You didn't know who to turn to. Nobody told you that the early days could be so challenging."

Sounds familiar?

The Breastfeeding Advocates Network (TBAN) is a registered society and an online support group for breastfeeding in Facebook. Established in September 2009, we have grown to almost 65,000 members and are currently receiving more than 100 new members daily. Majority of our members are from Malaysia, while we also have members from all over the world like Singapore, Australia, Hong Kong, Japan, Germany and USA, just to mention a few.

Mummies and daddies receive help and support in the group to breastfeed their babies. When the need arise they may receive home visits from qualified Breastfeeding Peer Counselors in the group. Our aim is to educate the modern parents on breastfeeding and to normalize breastfeeding. We have frequently been asked by members why they don’t see advertisements or promotions on breastfeeding especially about support groups like TBAN. Many lamented if they have known about TBAN earlier, they would have an easier time breastfeeding their babies with the support they received.

We too felt that there is no Malaysian-made video promoting the goodness of breastfeeding and to raise awareness on this topic. Thus, we decided to take it upon ourselves to do it. In our continued efforts to spread awareness of breastfeeding to the public, our key project for 2015 is to launch our inaugural Breastfeeding AD – The Father’s Love, with the goal to inspire breastfeeding initiatives beyond mothers.

“Dads, remember when you first laid eyes on your baby? You promised to give him the best. You supported your wife when she said she wanted to breastfeed. All she wanted to eat, you went out of your way to get for her. But when you watched her struggle, you almost broke too. She cried when the baby cried. Baby won't latch and her breasts were so full with milk, she was in so much pain. You didn't know where to look for help. You knew you have to do something! Upon the insistence of your family, you bought a can of formula milk. Afterall, your mom said you were fed with formula milk and you turned out okay.”

Sounds familiar?

This is what we see happening everyday as Breastfeeding counsellors. We realized the awareness on Breastfeeding in the mainstream media is still so low that panicked parents and grandparents turn to formula before turning to Breastfeeding experts. Why is this so? Formula milk companies spent millions of dollars yearly in advertising and marketing of their products. And they are VERY effective. This account for the very low breastfeeding rates in most countries including Malaysia.

This first ever MALAYSIAN BREASTFEEDING AD will be filmed in English with Malay subtitles, and it will be aired via social media, and hopefully via television airtime to reach out to those who do not have access to the internet.

We will heed your call and make this dream a reality, and most importantly, we NEED YOUR HELP AND SUPPORT. Since last year, we have been working closely with CREATIVE JUICE, an advertising agency in the creation of this BREASTFEEDING AD. Our team members for this special project include the 4 admins of TBAN, Ayuni Zainuddin, Eva Liew and Connie Goh. We are now at the stage of raising funds for the production cost of USD65,000.

We hope that you can be part of this milestone by pledging either USD5, USD10, USD50 or more. Your support will be greatly appreciated. We and all the breasfed babies and future babies you will be indirectly supporting thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

In the event that we fall short of the targeted fund (we hope not because we really want to realize this ad), the total collected fund, which we will declare, will be appropriately use for other grassroot breastfeeding initiatives to normalize breastfeeding and support the community in Malaysia. Thank you so much for your support. 


Please visit our open Group here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/TheBreastfeedin...

ps/- an image of the quotation from the ad agency can be found in the GALLERY

story:
Short Summary

My name is Brie Handgraaf and I am the proud owner of Kansas Sweetie Barkery (KSB).  While I’ve always had a passion for animals, dogs have a special place in my heart.  My dog, Opie, inspired me to start this business.  Back in 2008, after a long, sleepless night of smelling his breath, I set out to find a solution.  After discovering all of the mass-produced dog treats were full of unrecognizable chemicals, I knew I could make a better treat using high-quality, all-natural ingredients.

 In 2013, I started selling treats professionally at the Farmer’s Market in Rocky Mount, NC.  It didn’t take long to develop a loyal customer base that eagerly anticipated my next treat offering.  Since then, I’ve expanded into two retail locations: Pet’s Best Friend, a doggie daycare in Rocky Mount, and Quirky and Quaint, a cute little gift store in Nashville.  I’ve also formed a partnership with Twin Oaks Farm to sell pre-packaged treats at the Pitt County Farmer’s Market in Greenville and have participated in numerous special events including Barktoberfest, Bark & Wine and Bark for Life.  I love interacting with new and repeat customers at all of these venues.  Not only do I share the knowledge I’ve gained in my research to make a top-notch product, I listen to what customers are looking for (gluten-free, wheat-free, etc.) and adjust my product line based on those needs. 

 With sales growing exponentially, I knew it was time to showcase my business on a daily basis.  With that in mind, I recently purchased a new Transit Connect Wagon and have been working with a printing company to have a custom wrap put on it to advertise my business.  Not only will this colorful rolling banner elevate Kansas Sweetie Barkery’s visibility in the community, it will serve as a pseudo-food truck wherever I am.  Just like an ice cream truck, customers will know they can pick up a special treat for their beloved pup anytime, anyplace. 

I need your help as we move from the drawing board to reality with the Kansas Sweetie Barkery custom advertising wrap.  Any contribution, no matter how small or large, would be greatly appreciated.   Thank you so much for all you do to make my business a success!  --Brie Handgraaf--

 

What I Need:

All funds raised will go toward the print and installation of the Kansas Sweetie Barkery custom-designed wrap.  Any additional donations will be used to pay down the cost of purchasing the vehicle.  If I don't collect enough to pay for the cost of the wrap, then I’ll eat ramen for however long it takes to pay for the project because that’s how much I believe this is the right step to get more dogs eating good quality treats.

Why Me?

As a newspaper reporter and mass communication specialist, I recognize publicity is a huge component to a successful business.  The Kansas Sweetie Barkery (KSB) custom-designed advertising wrap will be an eye-catching reminder that high-quality, all-natural treats are for sale anytime you see the KSB vehicle.  Every sale is an opportunity to share my passion and knowledge learned as I’ve grown this business.  It is my goal to provide a superior product to all of my dog-loving customers! 

 Other Ways You Can Help

While I love my job as a newspaper reporter, I understand what it’s like to live on a limited budget.  If you can’t donate to this fundraising campaign, that’s OK, there are still plenty of ways you can support Kansas Sweetie Barkery (KSB).  Word of mouth is a powerful tool and it would be great if you could tell all your dog-loving friends about our handmade, all-natural treats.  Pass along the information about KSB’s Indigogo campaign and share it on social media.  Hopefully, they will be inspired to donate.  Visit our webpage at KansasSweetieBarkery.vpweb.com and follow us on Facebook.  Any support is valued and very much appreciated!

FAQs

This campaign is being run with the flexible funding model, so even if I don't make the full goal of $5,000, the money I do raise will go toward Kansas Sweetie Barkery. Also, some people have asked how much Indiegogo gets out of the campaign. Of course, they do take a cut, but it is only 5%. When it comes to receiving the funds, Indiegogo holds the funds until 15 days after my campaign has ended and then the amount will go into my business' bank account. Also, I've had several contributors request that I save the perks and invest the savings back in the biz... I LOVE YOU GUYS and if that is what you'd like, feel free to send an email to KansasSweetieBarkery@gmail.com saying so (I wish the site had an ability for you to click a box and skip the gifts, but apparently that isn't an option). Hopefully this answers all the main questions you all have. If not, feel free to email me at the above address and ask away!!!

story:
Cardiff Carnival 

Workshop Materials:

Bigger. Brighter. Beautiful.

Cardiff Carnival is Wales’ biggest and brightest carnival — now in our 26th year! It’s the most colourful celebration OF Cardiff BY Cardiff; a creative explosion with sequins, glitter and feathers, and many more materials besides. The carnival annually transforms the city centre with a riot of flamboyant carnival art, music and dance, bringing together community participants and our large family audiences for one of Cardiff's biggest free summer events. 


Carnival Workshops

Here at SWICA Carnival we believe carnival is for everyone and at the heart of Cardiff Carnival every year are 3 weeks of free carnival arts workshops where people of all ages and abilities are welcome. You need no previous arts experience whatsoever, just the desire to have fun and be creative. Our expert team help you to develop your creative ideas, show you how best to use the materials on offer and teach you how to dance for the parade. 


This year we need your help to make our Carnival Workshops bigger, brighter and more beautiful. 

Since April we have had more and more youth and community groups approaching us wanting to get involved with this year's Cardiff Carnival Workshops. However, we now have so many groups that we're in danger of not going to have enough materials to go around. We believe carnival is an artform for everyone. Carnival can really empower disadvantaged individuals and communities, giving them the chance to celebrate collective creativity and strengthen the bonds of community  and increase social cohesion across Cardiff and south Wales. Your generous donations will allow us more money to buy more materials, to help transform more people in true carnival style. 

Some of the raw materials we go through every year include:

Glues of all sorts
Paper, card and cardboard
Fibre-glass rods
Willow sticks 
Bamboo poles
Paints of all descriptions
Plasterzote foam
Metres of fabrics, ribbons and braiding
Feathers, sequins and glitter 

Please help us get as many people as possible involved in our colourful and creative artform and donate.

"What a wonderful three weeks of free workshops - thank you so much for opening your treasure box of wonderous materials for us. You are such a lovely bunch - the extremely talented, and patient carnival artists are so kind and helpful and such fun."  

   


More about SWICA Carnival

SWICA Carnival's mission is to celebrate collective creativity through large-scale participatory carnival arts projects, empowering the disadvantaged in our society. We believe in, and work by five key ideas:

     Inclusivity

     Inter-culturalism 

     Inter-generationalism

     Innovation 

     Inspiration

Our activities are characterised by mutual appreciation, joy and creativity and coming together to improve the lives of those around us. Our artistic activities aim to be fun, exhilarating and life-enhancing, bringing people together and then demonstrating the flamboyant fruits of their creativity to the wider community.

We believe that creative opportunities should be for all, not the privileged few, and so we aim to enrich communities, targeting marginalised groups and aiming to improve individual wellbeing and self-confidence. SWICA Carnival actively celebrates the modern and inclusive Wales we live in, challenging austerity to empower those around us and bring some carnival joy into as many lives as we can.

“All SWICA Carnival staff are fabulous, very helpful, supportive and creative in so many ways. They are also good fun to be with and love what they do with a passion!" 

[Pictured below: a sneak preview of some of this year's designs]



Why we need your support

As we all know, times are hard right now, and the arts especially are feeling the pinch. Yet, as always, our future plans remain ambitious and artistically challenging, and we want to see Cardiff Carnival continue to grow year on year. 

What’s more, SWICA Carnival’s absolute commitment to free access to our art and activities means that we really can reach new participants - people for whom the opportunity to see and feel the benefits of taking part in the arts are yet unknown.

However, with more and more community groups seeking to get involved with the Carnival Workshops, we want to make sure we can really provide sufficient materials for everyone. We want to transform people through our work, however we run the risk of not having enough materials to go around. 


Your generous donations will allow us more money to buy more materials, to help transform more people in true carnival style.


"All great - high quality workshops provided by experienced artists who were keen to work inclusively with everyone. Many thanks to all SWICA Carnival team."
“Every SWICA Carnival artist was very professional in their delivery of the project to the highest standard, ensuring the lively carnival atmosphere was an intrinsic part of the process" 


Thanks for reading and thanks in advance for donating!


Cheers

The SWICA Carnival Team


p.s. some dates for your diary...

Here at
SWICA Carnival we believe carnival is for everyone and at the heart of Cardiff
Carnival every year are 3 weeks of free carnival arts workshops where people of all ages and abilities are welcome. You need no previous arts experience whatsoever, just the desire to have fun and be creative. Our
expert team help you to develop your creative ideas, show you how best to use
the materials on offer and teach you how to dance for the parade. 

This year we need your help to make our Carnival Workshops bigger, brighter and more beautiful. 
Since April we have had more and more youth and community groups approaching us wanting to get involved with this year's Cardiff Carnival Workshops. However, we now have so many groups that we're in danger of not going to have enough materials to go around. We believe carnival is an artform for everyone. Carnival can really empower disadvantaged individuals and communities, giving them the chance to celebrate collective creativity and strengthen the bonds of community  and increase social cohesion across Cardiff and south Wales. Your generous donations will allow us more money to buy more materials, to help transform more people in true carnival style. 
Some of the raw materials we go through every year include:
Glues of all sortsPaper, card and cardboardFibre-glass rodsWillow sticks Bamboo polesPaints of all descriptionsPlasterzote foamMetres of fabrics, ribbons and braidingFeathers, sequins and glitter 

Please help us get as many people as possible involved in our colourful and creative artform and donate.
"What a wonderful three weeks of free workshops - thank you so much for opening your treasure box of wonderous materials for us. You are such a lovely bunch - the extremely talented, and patient carnival artists are so kind and helpful and such fun."  


   

More about SWICA Carnival
SWICA Carnival's mission is to celebrate collective creativity through large-scale
participatory carnival arts projects, empowering the disadvantaged in our
society. We believe in, and work by five key ideas:
     Inclusivity
     Inter-culturalism 
     Inter-generationalism
     Innovation 
     Inspiration
Our activities are
characterised by mutual appreciation, joy and
creativity and coming together to improve the lives of those around us. Our artistic
activities aim to be fun, exhilarating and life-enhancing, bringing people
together and then demonstrating the flamboyant fruits of their creativity to the wider
community.
We believe that creative opportunities should be for all, not the privileged few, and so we aim to enrich communities, targeting marginalised groups and aiming to improve individual wellbeing and self-confidence. SWICA Carnival actively celebrates the modern and inclusive Wales we live in, challenging austerity to empower those around us and bring some carnival joy into as many lives as we can.

“All SWICA Carnival staff are fabulous, very helpful, supportive and creative in so many ways. They are also good fun to be with and love what they do with a passion!" 




[Pictured below: a sneak preview of some of this year's designs]





Why we need your support
As we all know, times are hard right now, and the arts especially are feeling the pinch. Yet, as always, our future plans remain ambitious and artistically challenging, and we want to see Cardiff Carnival continue to grow year on year. 
What’s more, SWICA Carnival’s absolute commitment to free access to our art and activities means that we really can reach new participants - people for whom the opportunity to see and feel the benefits of taking part in the arts are yet unknown.
However, with more and more community groups seeking to get involved with the Carnival Workshops, we want to make sure we can really provide sufficient materials for everyone. We want to transform people through our work, however we run the risk of not having enough materials to go around. 

Your generous donations will allow us more money to buy more materials, to help transform more people in true carnival style.


"All great - high quality workshops provided by experienced artists who were keen to work inclusively with everyone. Many thanks to all SWICA Carnival team."
“Every SWICA Carnival artist was very professional in their delivery of the project to the highest standard, ensuring the lively carnival atmosphere was an intrinsic part of the process" 

Thanks for reading and thanks in advance for donating!

Cheers
The SWICA Carnival Team


p.s. some dates for your diary...

story:
Hello!

I'm the founder of a startup called Bytmap and we as a team need your help to launch ourselves!
I'm trying to recruit more engineers and need funding to carry out the tasks specified below.
Our main mode of operation would be to make technical contributions in the form of literature. We currently operate in stealth mode and most of our product ideas are proprietary and are connected to AI and Computer Vision. The technical contributions would be in the form of scientific journalism and short video explanations of how relevant technologies work. This in turn would alert potential investors of the gap between possibilities and reality.
We're working on Computer Vision tools that help automating tasks.
Other set of products shall be based on a face tracking based 3D scene. This is in a stage requiring more research and is the longer term goal. It will be something on the lines of the demo below.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uHPUCuOlS9o
We do realize that your support would be valuable in helping us carry out this task.
I hope you are patient enough to help us out! Thank you! Spread the word and do contribute!

story:
Imagine an auto repair shop that caters to women. It hires female mechanics, technicians, and managers. It has a clean, comfortable lounge tailored to women. And it is a safe space where women can come to feel confident about themselves, their cars, and their buying choices. Girls Auto Clinic Repair is this repair shop! We educate and empower women through their cars! We have created an environment to remove the anxiety and stress that traditionally comes with buying and owning a car. We offer full automotive services to women by women. The BEST part of Girls Auto Clinic repair is our on site nail salon and blow out bar, High Maintenance.  Get a mani-pedi while you wait for your car!  Please help us change this industry by catering to our number one customer, WOMEN!

story:
Making Tea

Jitu Keshav explains in his own words how he invented this product: Our story begins in 2010 on a typical morning in the Keshav family’s kitchen. Pratima, the multi-tasking mom (and my wife) was busy preparing a full breakfast for the family. She turned her attention away from the stove where the traditional Indian tea was furiously boiling, only to find the milk had overboiled. The pungent smell of burnt whole leaf tea, herbs, and spices had left its mark throughout the house.

I rushed to the stove side to clean the mess, and made a few smart comments as I vigorously scraped the burnt remains. Pratima, the true inspiration behind this project, requested that I make both our lives easier—build a machine to make our chai every morning, and save us from constantly tending to the stove.

You see, tea, and the associated caffeine, is a serious part of a successful day for the Keshav family. This was going to be a challenge, but was I up for it? For over a year, I tested concepts, developed prototypes and recalled my engineering lessons from decades back that were now clearly in hibernation mode.

Countless clean-ups over twenty-eight years of marriage gave me enough incentive to find a solution.

Prototype in hand, I was lucky enough to stumble upon a family owned German company who promised to take my concept to reality. With design and production expertise, they were ready and able to make the patented, precision engineered, state of the art induction appliance, utilizing a proprietary vortex technology to make the Ultimate Tea Maker™.

The Product

CRAFTEA™ makes tea and chai easy, while keeping creativity in your hands. It simplifies tea and chai preparation by automating steeping temperatures and times, ensures even distribution of heat, so that your beverage will never boil over. It gives you the ability to design your own beverages—be it herbal infusions, milk infusions, and even those fun tea cocktails.



This revolutionary new device is the world’s first tea and chai maker for home and personal use. Using proprietary vortex technology, CRAFTEA simplifies the chai making process and prevents messy boil-overs, allowing the user to create gourmet beverages in a matter of minutes, extracting maximum flavors from ingredients. CRAFTEA is the result of over three years of research, development and engineering by co-founders Pratima and Jitu Keshav. “Our vision was to make a revolutionary appliance that brings convenience, consistency and customization to a time honored beverage,” Jitu explains. “We believe in the tradition of serving tea and chai—with each individual having their own special twist. CRAFTEA is inspired by heritage, refined by design. It’s about your ritual, remixed.

What’s better than fresh ingredients? No more messy cleanups. Experience the Ultimate Tea Maker for yourself and pour to a successful day!


2015 World Tea Expo Winner 

We won the coveted World Tea expo award for biggest tea ware innovation. This is very prestigious because it is the biggest gathering of tea growers, manufacturers, distributors and retailers in North and South America.

Why We need You

We have a product made and ready to go - but we haven't sold anything yet. We have a container of 600 on its way and our first shipments can go out the last week of July. If you contribute to this campaign and buy the product, you are helping us change how tea is made worldwide. And you'll be among the first to get this new innovative product.  By contributing to our campaign you are investing money so that we can get our company off the ground. We have a website, a cool product, and now we need customers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our product on social media. We need to get the word out!

http://www.craftea.com/

*Good for US/Canada electrical plugin. 1000 Watts.

story:
The Story

My name is Karen Gay. I am a holistic health practitioner residing in Hanoi, Vietnam. I work with the physical body employing deep tissue massage and craniosacral therapy. I also work with the subtle body using energy work such as Reiki, Jin Shin Jyutsu and other modalities. My work over the last couple of years has shifted from working less on the physical aspects of healing to more of the mental, emotional, and spiritual elements of our make-up.

More and more people, challenged by social pressures, are turning to energy medicine to help them on their path to healing, and it is this deeper work that I am drawn to.

I have recently received the 9 initiation Rites of the Munay-Ki. The Munay-Ki are the codes for the new human, one who lives free of fear and resides in their transcendent nature.

By transmitting the nine Rites to as many people as possible, it is believed that we will witness the birth of a new human, a new civilization that possesses divine wisdom and power.

I am drawn to receive the "Deepening" of the Munay-Ki Rites that only a Q’ero Shaman can transmit.

The Elders believe that we are at a critical juncture in human history and that these Rites need to be transmitted to as many people as possible.

It is for this reason I ask for your assistance in accomplishing this task. I feel that it is time now for me to receive this Deepening by traveling to the sacred sites of Peru and Bolivia in company of spiritual teachers and guides.


Our Energy Exchange

The funding necessary for this educational expansion is broken down below. Your greatly appreciated contribution is recognized with an exchange for value that I trust is mutual. Please refer to the "Perks" sidebar for your investment value.

Funding Costs - $11,000USD

  • Tour Cost - $5,000USD
  • Estimated Flight Cost - $ 3,000USD
  • Food & Miscellaneous Cost - $500USD
  • Housing/Maintenance/Utility Costs while away - $1000USD
  • Campaign and Fee Transfer Costs - $1,500USD

A Global Shift

The Rites of the Munay-Ki empower us to step up to the task of assuming stewardship of the Earth and all Creation.

As I take the steps to realign, attune and shift my consciousness so too can the global collective move forward on its path of transformational healing.

    By the nature of Oneness and as a result of our energy exchange and mutual support, you will join me on this discovery of Inner Truth and Divine Essence. Together we will dream an entire new world into being.



    Deep Gratitude

    It is with deep gratitude and humility that I thank you for your contribution to the global expansion of humanity as I assume my role as Steward of Mother Earth and all Creation.

story:
Welcome to RudeInk Tattoo and Piercing Studio

My name is Eric Scott and I've been a professional tattoo artist for the past seven years and have done over hundreds of tattoos. I grew frustrated working in shops that didn't allow me to grow as an artist and insisted on a one size fits all mentality. People get tattoos for all different reasons. I don't believe in tracing or slapping on a tattoo. I believe in customizing tattoos that are unique to the individual. I'm looking to open my own shop that features respectable tattoo artists where people of all backgrounds can feel welcome. It doesn't matter if you're 16 or 60, you are welcome in our studio!

Free tattoos!?? Keep Reading

So here's the scoop. I need $25,000 to get this studio up and running so we can start creating these tattoos.  This is going towards equipment and remodeling. Quality tattoos don't come cheap! I know your money is valuable so as a thank you for your support RudeInk Studio would like to offer the following:

$20 Level: Rudeink Sticker
$50 Level: RudeInk T Shirt (plus above)
$100 Level: 1 Custom Rudeink Design Print (plus above)
$300 Level: 3 Custom RudeInk Design (plus above)
$500-$1000 Level: Complimentary RudeInk tattoo (plus above)

The Impact

In addition to offering one of a kind tattoos, RudeInk Tattoo and Piercing Studio will employ local tattoo artists and bring jobs to the local economy. Our projections indicate that opening our studio will create a minimum of five jobs for the area. So when you donate, not only do you get some sweet tattoos you're also supporting your local economy. How's that for a win.


Risks & Challenges

I know it's hard opening a business. They are expensive! Our studio's opening will be delayed until we can secure enough funding. I have applied for loans to help subsidize the cost of opening the studio but there's no guarantee it will come through. The sooner we can secure funding, the quicker we can start providing custom tattoos and precision piercings. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know a fellow ink lover who you think would like to learn more about our shop and what we're doing please spread the word!! To learn more check out my portfolio at: http://www.Instagram.com/rudeink

story:
Hey there! We are Marshall Wible (Grindbore) and Genevieve Koberstein (Brunhildurrr), two illustrators based in Savannah, Georgia. We both attended the Savannah College of Art and Design, and when we’re not working our day jobs, we create illustrations, books, comics, flash sheets and stickers. We have quite the multitude of work, and we’ve decided that we want to take it to the next level.

Here’s a little information on who we are:

Marshall “Grindbore” Wible went to the Savannah College of Art and Design for Sequential Art and now utilizes his hard-earned scribbling abilities to churn out pages upon pages of artwork nobody ever sees. His story began in grade school when he was the uncool kid drawing totally cool pictures of dragons and swords during class. To this day, he remains the uncool kid drawing totally cool pictures of dragons and swords, but has also branched out to stuff like skulls, wizards, daggers and stuff from old video games. It has long been a dream of Grindbore’s to clothe and bedazzle the masses. Let him clothe you.

Contact - sgt.marshie@gmail.com

Instagram - thatdudegrindbore

Genevieve "Genni" Koberstein is a freelance illustrator originally from Eugene, Oregon. She has a Bachelors in illustration and a minor in scientific illustration. Her influences consist of nature, biology, astronomy, the complex patterns that are found in our macroscopic world, as well as the microscopic world invisible to the human eye.

She is always open to freelance work (including scientific illustration), collaborations, and trying entirely new ways of executing work. Her favorite mediums include watercolor, ink and digital, although she is experienced in many different materials and techniques.

Her website - genevievekoberstein.com

Contact - k.genni@gmail.com

Instagram - brunhildurrr__

  We’ve had the idea of an online store for a long time, and we want to make it a reality. Our issue is that between rent and student loans, we are low on the extra funds to make it happen. Although we have prints and stickers, we want to produce higher quality prints, stickers, buttons, T-shirts, patches, shrinkydink (keychains, necklaces, earrings, etc.) and eventually tapestries. Who knows, maybe we could even have full bedspreads with our designs! Or produce a monthly zine! All of this could be a reality, but we are in need of your help.

We have broken down the costs of the ability to produce buttons, patches, prints, T-shirts, shrinkydinks (necklaces, keychains, earrings, etc.) and stickers as such:

BUTTONS

Button maker – $250

Prints for buttons - $50

Price we’d sell these at - $1 each

Funds needed - $300

PATCHES

We are hiring a print maker to make our patches, therefore his rates may depend on how popular these patches become. We have therefore raised our funds needed for this particular piece of merchandise, in case we sell many and require him to create more.

Canvas for patches - $21.95/yd (4 feet)

Price we’d sell these at -

5” x 5”  - $5 each

8” x 11” - $10  each

Funds needed - $500

PRINTS

Prints of our artwork in various sizes, color as well as b&w - $400

Price we’d sell these at -

4” x 6” -  $3 each

8’’ x 11” - $5 each

11” x 17” - $10 each

12” x 18” - $20 each

18” x 24” - $30 each

T- SHIRTS

Price to produce T-shirts at B&W – $3.98 – $6.12 per bulk

Price we’d sell these at (all sizes) - $15 each

Funds needed (allowing for possible future orders) - $15

STICKERS

Using Stickerapp!

Marshall

3” x 2” – square - 32 pieces - $21

Price: $2 each

Genni

Valentine’s Day Lady – 4” x 4” – 25 pieces - $43

Price - $5 each

Mermaid Lady – 10” x 5” – 25 pieces - $92

Price - $8 each

Mysterious Night – 3” x 2” – 32 - $21

Price - $2 each

Moon Child – 3” x 2” – 32 - $21

Price - $2 each

3 Different Flash sheets- 5 sheets each – 5 pieces each $45 per sheet - $675

Price - $10 each  

Funds needed: $873

SHRINKYDINKS (necklaces, keychains and earrings)

Shrinkfilm set of 6 - $6.00 with tax each

10 sheets needed - $60

Price we'd sell these at -

keychains - $5 each

necklaces - $15 each

earrings - $10 per set


TOTAL FUNDS NEEDED - $2,148

We are asking for - $2,000 even (we can make up the difference)


PERKS!

This is quite the project we’ve taken on, and if you decide to support our online store there is a great selection of perks you can choose from! Most of them are available on the right-hand side of this page, and are commission-based, meaning that you get to call the shots on what you'd like to receive, whether it be a custom flash sheet or a custom painting, we have lots of options to choose from! If you have something in mind that is not listed, please email Genni at k.genni@gmail.com

We can work something out (:

Thanks for your support!

"Genni" Koberstein is a freelance illustrator originally from Eugene,
Oregon. She has a Bachelors in illustration and a minor in scientific
illustration. Her influences consist of nature, biology, astronomy, the complex
patterns that are found in our macroscopic world, as well as the microscopic
world invisible to the human eye.
She is
always open to freelance work (including scientific illustration),
collaborations, and trying entirely new ways of executing work. Her favorite
mediums include watercolor, ink and digital, although she is experienced in
many different materials and techniques.
Her website - genevievekoberstein.com
Contact - k.genni@gmail.comInstagram - brunhildurrr__

story:
We believe that people can do amazing things when they put their hearts and minds together. Imagine what could happen if we increased our love, compassion, and wisdom, for ourselves, for our communities and for our world. 


The word drupchen means “great accomplishment.” Guided by the Vajra Master during this week-long celebration, we will practice elaborate visualization, mantra, and mudra, as well as joyful dharma dancing. We will also make sumptuous offerings and create precious holy substances. Together we will practice to completely transform all anger into compassion, jealousy into love, pride into renunciation, greed into faith, ignorance into wisdom and ordinary perceptions into the pure realm of all Buddhas

This is why we’re inviting you to join these virtuous activities! Unite your intention with ours and create the virtuous cause in your heart to generate extraordinary merit. Giving material support is one of the easiest ways to join others' virtuous activities. Your contribution will help us to expand our virtuous activities to be an even more powerful condition for world peace.

What We Need & What You Get

 Many holy obects are required for our grand Drupchen. Your assistance with the gathering of these items for the success of this event will not only benefit this year’s practice, but these precious items will be used by the Sangha for many future drupchens


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our fundraising efforts with your dear friends and family!

story:
Resurrecting a Local Landmark

For the better part of the 20th century, the State Theatre of Anderson, Indiana, existed to entertain the masses through feature films and live acts, including Rodney Carrington and George Carlin. Originally opened in 1930, the State Theatre boasted the first geothermal cooling system in the state, allowing patrons to watch some of the first "talkie" films in a "healthfully cooled" atmosphere. 

Much to the dismay of Anderson residents and those passionate about the local landmark, the State Theatre eventually closed and fell into disrepair. To this day, despite numerous repairs already made, the theatre sits along Meridian Street still waiting to experience new life like its older "cousin", the Paramount Theatre just down the street.

We represent MadCo Entertainment, LLC., a new entertainment company spearheaded by Brent Doster and Branden Holder, two passionate entrepreneurs who already operate their individual businesses in the area. Both Anderson University alumni a decade apart, we have worked together professionally and personally for almost six years. Our collaboration presents a uniquely balanced yin and yang of business acumen and marketing/brand management that hopes to breathe a new existence into the State Theatre as a multi-purpose live entertainment venue. 

What We Need

Our undertaking at the State Theatre is a project with multiple phases due to the scope of repairs, upgrades, etc. that are necessary to make the State the best it can be. The basics of our initial plan are as follows:

  • The State Theatre (Live Venue)

The first phase of our overall vision is the State Theatre itself, which includes bringing the space into the 21st century while maintaining its more classic architectural features around the space (many of which are still in tact).

For this phase, we are seeking funds to cover basic renovations for bathroom upgrades (ADA compliance, aesthetic and structural renovations), water damaged plaster, damaged paint, ceiling and plaster repairs/upgrades in the balcony,  seating options, sound/light equipment, and materials to rebuild the front of the stage, as well as our nominal food/drink equipment if possible. The building will also need to be tuck pointed in the near future for preserving the exterior brick facade and for maintaining long-term watertightness. Our goal will be to complete rehabbing and upgrading the facility to host the best local, regional, and touring music/comedy/entertainment acts available.

In order to remain economical on construction costs, we will be performing a large portion of the basic "ground floor" renovations ourselves--including some of the plaster repair, bathroom upgrades, repainting, etc. Additional funds are needed to hire contractors for the "higher up" repairs/upgrades to the ceiling, medallions, and any residual plumbing/electrical necessities.

Additional phases will continue to evolve as we open the doors and begin booking shows.

What You Get

Given the unique areas we have in store for our guests, we are excited to offer a variety of great rewards for your support on this grand adventure. The preview of our rewards are as follows:

 

The Impact

In the heart of downtown Anderson a renaissance is taking place where passionate individuals are planting their roots and building bridges to create a new kind of city where community, creativity, and culture form the structure of day-to-day life.  The State Theatre offers a multi-tiered approach to creating a positive contribution to downtown Anderson's revitalization and entertainment push. Through hosting live music and comedy events, noteworthy regional attractions, and eventually affordable family events inside the theatre, the landmark's resurrection and utilization will draw individuals (students, working adults, families) from within Madison County and beyond to watch the performances. This pedestrian foot traffic will expose many individuals to other businesses and offerings of downtown Anderson, thus playing a vital role in fostering the unique lifestyle district the city hopes to achieve. Our venue also offers the opportunity for private event space, as well as the ability to host charitable concerts/events to promote synergy within the community and regional non-profits.

The State Theatre is the first portion of our "Hit the Bricks!" revitalization concept to help shine a brighter light on Meridian Street (and by proxy, downtown Anderson as a whole). By increasing the foot traffic in the area, we hope to a) draw even more quality, independent shops and eateries to the area, and b) expand some of MadCo Entertainment's other concepts out into the Meridian Street area with additional entertainment-related business ventures over the next decade.

Risks & Challenges

We won't lie...this is a MASSIVE undertaking and the capital required to make everything perfect (as can be) is large. There's a lot left to do inside and outside the State, a lot of upgrades and equipment that needs to be purchased, a lot of promotion and bookings required to launch properly once we have the renovations finished. A significant portion of the basic renovation work can be performed by us, but there are key components that will require contractors and skilled professionals to accomplish.

Successful crowdfunding would mean a significant jump on essential, unavoidable costs associated with getting this massive undertaking off the ground, but we are aware that if funding (both crowdfunding and beyond) proves "choppy" in the short term, we have a tiered/phased approach at renovating that would still allow us to open in a timely fashion while completing remaining renovations as we grow. The State is an old building, approaching the 90 year mark in a few years, so there are repairs waiting to be made, which is a challenge that awaits us, but so many historical buildings nationwide have received the same treatment and are still shining to this day...that is our hope for the State.

Anderson has a well-known history of ups and downs as far as growth and revitalization are concerned, but with the addition of Oakley Brothers Distillery, Burro Loco, Buckskin Bikes, Kettle Top Brewhouse, among other upcoming ventures downtown (e.g. a new "farm to table" eatery), this new wave of businesses entering the city is actively demonstrating a trend toward the specific lifestyle culture that the State Theatre hopes to amplify through live shows and events.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help in any other way, shape, or form (be it financially in the form of a larger contribution or investment, physically through volunteering, etc.) please feel free to get in touch with us via email (on our website: http://www.andersonstatetheatre.com) or on Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/andersonstatetheatre)
