story:
Short Summary

In the eastern suburbs of Pittsburgh, Braddock, PA is a town that refuses to die. Once a booming community the town was the site of steel mogul Andrew Carnegie’s first mill.

By 2009, when The New York Times described it as “a mix of boarded-up store fronts, houses in advance stages of collapse and vacant lots” the town had a mere 3,000 residents, down from 22,000 in its heyday.

Still, there are tough, lifelong residents who remain and are determined to stick it out until the town's fortunes turn around. Individuals who are working hard to make it happen. One of those residents, Isaac Bunn, has been fighting the majority of his adult life to insure that if ever the time became opportune for community advancement in his life time that all those who stuck around would have a fair shake at upward mobility as well. 

After witnessing the devastation of de-industrialization, political neglect  and going up against the County Authority  to hold on to property that's been in his family since 1949  he founded The Braddock Inclusion Project in 2014, a community organization, providing a voice for community residents who are marginalized and without a voice. The organization is also fighting for economic inclusion for all residents and not just a select few. With the town now on the brink of major redevelopment, the opportunity to foster a inclusive environment is at hand.

Visual Landscape Gallery Boutique, a subsidiary of the Braddock Inclusion Project, is located right in the center of where the communities redevelopment is taking place. The space will not only serve as an art gallery featuring the work of world renowned photographer and Braddock native, Latoya Ruby Frazier, Artist Chiaka Zulu, who spent most of his life homeless or a place to seek out one of a kind, handmade apparel.

This unique space will also serve as a community resource center for those in the community who now have no voice and are seeking to become actively engaged in the process of reinventing the community, It’s redevelopment, uplifting the lives of themselves and their children and becoming a major part of the community’s bright future instead of being uprooted or displaced. The space will also offer special programming such as sewing classes, clothing design workshops, entrepreneur development skills and life improvement skills to name a few.

Also special events at the space will bring people together from diverse backgrounds who would normally not meet. The topics of these events will generate dialog and understanding to what is happening to communities like Braddock. These special  events will encourage conversation about solutions. Conversations about how common everyday, hardworking individuals can work towards building a more inclusive and bright future for all Americans.  

Many outsiders now come through Braddock with a fear of seeing or experiencing something that is devastating and broken. What you learn and take from it, if you take the time too, is the strength, knowledge, wisdom and understanding that you’ll absorb from those who’ve stuck it out. Those who’ve lived through and witnessed true despair. The space will provide an atmosphere allowing one to absorb such an experience.  

It's very easy to leave when things go wrong. To just walk away. To turn a blind  eye on those who are down and out. To come in as a outsider and use the plight of those suffering to enrich yourself as some have done. But to stick around and give life to a town because of all the history, memories and love that it gave you, generation after generation after generation, is what defines a true American.

Sticking together when it gets really rough is a reflection of what true humanity means. Braddock, PA is a town that's been hit extremely hard. A town that’s been abandoned by the grid lock in Washington D.C. and by those tax payer funded agencies that were formed to protect it and it's citizens. But with your support- it’s a town that can be a model of what can take place when we set aside our differences, come to middle ground and do what’s best for hard hit communities like Braddock, PA.

To date we have secured our space, secured utilities, started renovations and developing inventory. But in our efforts to create a part time management job for a unemployed/underemployed  area resident, complete renovations, secure a POS system(Point of Sale), security system and to help with over head coast we will need a estimated $20,000.

With many working class individuals/communities now locked out of emerging economic opportunities and access to start up resources your support in helping us to get our story out there is critical. By making noise about the challenges we've endured, the risks we've taken and your contributions; no mater how small, you will be helping to breath life back into a community that's been broken for decades. Your efforts will be vital to our push to build a more inclusive society for all the residents of Braddock and not just a selct few.

Contributions will ensure a smooth opening and more importantly set an example for residents in our emerging community and those in other hard hit communities like Braddock something to aspire towards. To give authentic Hope to those who have been left behind.  A hope that has eluded many suffering Americans for decades.

story:
PLEASE TAKE THE TIME TO READ, IT IS NOT LONG. and Please help me by:

- Donation.               

- Invite your friends to support us.

- Pray for us.

I'll keep this part as brief as I can, My name is Heyam, and I live in Gaza, Palestine, where every day is a fight for survival. We are deprived of even the most basic of human needs and services. Israel has imprisoned us with walls, fences and checkpoints. Their soldiers and armed vigilanties stalk, harass, beat, shoot, kidnap, torture and kill us. We have no clean running water, no sanitation. Our single electric generating station was bombed by Israel, and now due to the increased cost of fuel to run the plant, we have electricity for just four hours per day. Much of our city lies in ruins, bombed for weeks in 2014, and sporadically to this day, and because of the Israeli siege, no building supplies are allowed to enter to make repairs. So children, many of them orphans, their families exterminated by Israel, try desperately to survive amid the rubble with next to nothing to eat, clinging to hope in their young hearts that maybe tomorrow something good might happen. But for most of them - for most of the populace of Israeli-occupied Palestine and the West Bank, tomorrow ends up being the same or even worse. It is in the midst of this horror that I have been determined to provide these most unfairly deprived Little Ones with what comfort I can manage with the very limited resources available to me.

Who are we?

We are group of youth live in Gaza strip, we have various skills and we graduated from universities with high degrees.

Because of the siege on Gaza , we can’t get any opportunity to work that provides us a decent living requirements and help us to achieve our goal.

Palestine has a special level in the field of education in the Arab World, the percentage of knowledge of reading and writing reaches to 99%. Also people are intelligent from the innovative side, everyone has his smart phone. But the most challenging thing in this case is the unemployment; its percentage reaches 60%. Because of that we started to search for smart idea to set up our own business. We use technology and marketing via internet all over the world.

 

Women's groups from Palestine, I began to think about a creative project to cope with unemployment and help children and their families through the production of hand-embroideries and marketed in countries across the website. Donation idea to become a reality on the ground. In Palestine This is for achieving some of our targets and participating in the bringing up of our society.

#We_Are_All_The_Same

 

The idea of the project :

The idea of our project is making Palestinian embroidery manually or automatically and marketing them via internet all over the world and for who like this embroidery. It is worth mentioning that Palestinian embroidery taking a special international increased importance. foreign and Palestinian traders and institution work on promoting this embroidery and the demand increasing everyday on this industries for the importance of them .this embroidery refer to the age of Canaanites and represent to the Palestinians and the solidarity a symbol from the symbols of the Palestinian history . Also it shows how they are connected to their land and gives them a glitter of hope to come back to their homeland. We really started in showing a part of these products on a number of customers outside Palestine and we found that we have the ability to reach for more numbers of customers.

 

#Let's_save_lives.

 

The benefits of this project :

1- A chance for a lot of youth to start their own business and open the doors for their future

2- The decline of unemployment percentage and marketing local products for the sake of the society.

3- Creating work opportunities for housewives who work in the manual embroidery.

4- The use of technology in marketing all over the world

5- Spreading the Palestinian heritage and embroidery which represent the symbol of Canaanites culture.

6- Providing these products for who need them, they have a good demand.

 

The needed budget:

1- The rent of the place (250$ monthly); 3000$ annually

2- Furniture (tables ,painting, chairs and decoration): $1500

3- Machines for automated embroidery (every machine worth’s 400$).

We need 10 ones: The total 4000$

4- Raw materials (cloth, wool and embroidery and spinning tools.): 2000$

5- Trainers for training group of youth for the manual embroidery. We need 4 trainers everyone will be paid 400$ (the total 1600$)

6- Electronic site for offering and marketing the products all over the world in English, French and Arabic languages:

*programming sites 1000$

*web design 700$

*hosting site yearly 200$

 

* the total needed budget: 14000$

 

 

Notes (to purchase):

• Trust completely: by your contribution you will help at the beginning of a better life for many of those who exhausted by wars and siege, without slightest guilt.

• Do not say you can’t help, if you are unable to contribute financially, you can publish the campaign link to people you know and believe that they can help (Do not let it stop in front of you. You can help us a lot).

• The prices of handmade embroidery is expensive because it needed great effort and a lot of time.

• Prepare any product needs two month.

• Delivery of products after the end of campaign.

• We can deliver these product to any place in the world via DHL but also the cost of delivering products from Gaza is expensive (70$ per half kilo).

• There is a discounts for large quantities.

 

Hope in humanity, hope in caring and love.

Thank you for not turning away.

Join us.

 

​ Palestinian pillows embroidered :

 

Palestinian keffiyeh :

 

Palestinian embroidered purse:

 

Palestinian embroidered bag:

 

Palestinian dress for children:

 

Palestinian embroidered dress:

Evening dress:
story_txt: PLEASE TAKE THE TIME TO READ, IT IS NOT LONG. and Please help me by:- Donation.               - Invite your friends to support us.- Pray for us.I'll keep this part as brief as I can, My name is Heyam, and I live in Gaza, Palestine, where every day is a fight for survival. We are deprived of even the most basic of human needs and services. Israel has imprisoned us with walls, fences and checkpoints. Their soldiers and armed vigilanties stalk, harass, beat, shoot, kidnap, torture and kill us. We have no clean running water, no sanitation. Our single electric generating station was bombed by Israel, and now due to the increased cost of fuel to run the plant, we have electricity for just four hours per day. Much of our city lies in ruins, bombed for weeks in 2014, and sporadically to this day, and because of the Israeli siege, no building supplies are allowed to enter to make repairs. So children, many of them orphans, their families exterminated by Israel, try desperately to survive amid the rubble with next to nothing to eat, clinging to hope in their young hearts that maybe tomorrow something good might happen. But for most of them - for most of the populace of Israeli-occupied Palestine and the West Bank, tomorrow ends up being the same or even worse. It is in the midst of this horror that I have been determined to provide these most unfairly deprived Little Ones with what comfort I can manage with the very limited resources available to me.Who are we?We are group of youth live in Gaza strip, we have various skills and we graduated from universities with high degrees.Because of the siege on Gaza , we can’t get any opportunity to work that provides us a decent living requirements and help us to achieve our goal.Palestine has a special level in the field of education in the Arab World, the percentage of knowledge of reading and writing reaches to 99%. Also people are intelligent from the innovative side, everyone has his smart phone. But the most challenging thing in this case is the unemployment; its percentage reaches 60%. Because of that we started to search for smart idea to set up our own business. We use technology and marketing via internet all over the world. Women's groups from Palestine, I began to think about a creative project to cope with unemployment and help children and their families through the production of hand-embroideries and marketed in countries across the website. Donation idea to become a reality on the ground. In Palestine This is for achieving some of our targets and participating in the bringing up of our society.#We_Are_All_The_Same The idea of the project :The idea of our project is making Palestinian embroidery manually or automatically and marketing them via internet all over the world and for who like this embroidery. It is worth mentioning that Palestinian embroidery taking a special international increased importance. foreign and Palestinian traders and institution work on promoting this embroidery and the demand increasing everyday on this industries for the importance of them .this embroidery refer to the age of Canaanites and represent to the Palestinians and the solidarity a symbol from the symbols of the Palestinian history . Also it shows how they are connected to their land and gives them a glitter of hope to come back to their homeland. We really started in showing a part of these products on a number of customers outside Palestine and we found that we have the ability to reach for more numbers of customers. #Let's_save_lives. The benefits of this project :1- A chance for a lot of youth to start their own business and open the doors for their future2- The decline of unemployment percentage and marketing local products for the sake of the society.3- Creating work opportunities for housewives who work in the manual embroidery.4- The use of technology in marketing all over the world5- Spreading the Palestinian heritage and embroidery which represent the symbol of Canaanites culture.6- Providing these products for who need them, they have a good demand. The needed budget:1- The rent of the place (250$ monthly); 3000$ annually2- Furniture (tables ,painting, chairs and decoration): $15003- Machines for automated embroidery (every machine worth’s 400$).We need 10 ones: The total 4000$4- Raw materials (cloth, wool and embroidery and spinning tools.): 2000$5- Trainers for training group of youth for the manual embroidery. We need 4 trainers everyone will be paid 400$ (the total 1600$)6- Electronic site for offering and marketing the products all over the world in English, French and Arabic languages:*programming sites 1000$*web design 700$*hosting site yearly 200$ * the total needed budget: 14000$  Notes (to purchase):• Trust completely: by your contribution you will help at the beginning of a better life for many of those who exhausted by wars and siege, without slightest guilt.• Do not say you can’t help, if you are unable to contribute financially, you can publish the campaign link to people you know and believe that they can help (Do not let it stop in front of you. You can help us a lot).• The prices of handmade embroidery is expensive because it needed great effort and a lot of time.• Prepare any product needs two month.• Delivery of products after the end of campaign.• We can deliver these product to any place in the world via DHL but also the cost of delivering products from Gaza is expensive (70$ per half kilo).• There is a discounts for large quantities. Hope in humanity, hope in caring and love.Thank you for not turning away.Join us. ​ Palestinian pillows embroidered : Palestinian keffiyeh : Palestinian embroidered purse: Palestinian embroidered bag: Palestinian dress for children: Palestinian embroidered dress:Evening dress:

story:
A History of Russian Hill Bookstore

We began as Sunset Bookstore in 1974, a small used bookshop servicing the Sunset District west of 19th Avenue in San Francisco. Under the sole proprietorship of Carol Spencer, a second used bookshop was opened in the Russian Hill neighborhood in 1993, Russian Hill Bookstore.  Sunset bookstore has since closed, but the Russian Hill location endures.  We have been in continual operation for the past 43 years.

Today, during this time of transition, we are asking for your assistance in helping Russian Hill Bookstore stay in the neighborhood for many more years to come!

What We Need & What You Get

We have set our fundraising goal at $50,000 to help cover renovations and necessary repairs in our new location, and moving expenses.  Any amount we can raise here will be so greatly appreciated!  We have put our entire life savings into this project in the hope that we can keep Russian Hill Bookstore open.  All of the funds raised here will go directly into the business, and will be of immeasurable benefit in helping us to begin this new chapter in the life of our bookshop.

The $50,000 we are seeking here will go toward renovating the new shop, tenant improvements, and moving expenses.

  • Removing floor mats and repairing/renovating floors
  • Replacing tinted store front windows and tinted glass entry doors with clear windows and doors
  • Installing anchors to secure our high bookshelves into the walls
  • Carpentry
  • Building new bookshelves and fixtures
  • Replacing and making two new awnings, signs, and hanging signs for the exterior of the shop
  • Rentals of trucks, boxes, and dollies for moving

DESCRIPTION OF PERKS!

* Photos of additional perks will be added shortly

*If you would like to pick up any of the perks in person, please choose "Zambia" for your destination.

Limited Edition Russian Hill Bookstore Tote

Designed by a local San Francisco artist, the tote bag is offered exclusively to backers of this fundraising campaign.  Available for shipment within the U.S., or can be picked up in person at Russian Hill Bookstore.

Limited Edition Russian Hill Bookstore Bookmark 

Designed by a local San Francisco Artist, and offered exclusively for backers of this fundraising campaign.

Limited Edition Russian Hill Bookstore Pin

Designed by a local San Francisco artist, this pin is offered exclusively to backers of this fundraising campaign.  

Vintage Sheet Music and Rare Books

( Left to Right, Top to Bottom )

  • The San Francisco classic "Baghdad-By-The-Bay", adapted from the writings of the beloved former San Francisco Chronicle columnist Herb Caen.  Music by Conrad Susa.  Presented by the San Francisco Chronicle, and published in 1987.  Own a little piece of San Francisco history!
  • Vintage San Francisco Sheet Music from the 1915 World's Fair.  Words and Music by C.E. Olson.  Published by Up-to-Date Music Publishers.  Very Rare.  The front cover is detached.
  • Set of three Vintage California Sheet Music.  "San Fernando Valley", words and music by Gordon Jenkins.  Published in 1942.  "San Jose", words by Al Bryan and music by Leo Edwar.  Published in 1915.  "Sunny San Joaquin", words and music by Lucy M. Thompson.  Published in 1924.
  • Vintage Disney Sheet Music for Pinocchio's "When You Wish Upon a Star".  Rare collectible item of Walt Disney, published by Irving Berlin Inc. in 1939.  Lyrics by Ned Washington, and music by Leigh Harline.
  • Vintage sheet music for "April Showers Bring May Flowers", words by Leo Wood, music by Nat and Jack Shilkret.  Published in 1920.
  • Two vintage Little Golden Books: "Five Little Firemen" by Margaret Wise Brown and Edith Thatcher Hurd, with pictures by Tibor Gergely.  Scarce 1st Edition, published in 1948 by Simon and Schuster, and "Scuffy the Tugboat" by Gertrude Crampton, with pictures by Tibor Gergely.  Third Printing, published in 1946 by Simon and Schuster.
  • "The Call of the Wild" by Jack London.  Early 7th Printing of Jack London's classic novel, published by The Macmillan Company in 1904.  Volume is in pristine condition!
  • "Plutonian Ode, and Other Poems 1977-1980".  SIGNED and dated by the poet Allen Ginsberg on title page.  First Printing, published by City Lights Books in 1982 as a part of their Pocket Poet Series.

 

Dedicated Bookshelf

Your generous donation will be immortalized forever with a bookshelf of your choice dedicated in your name, or in the name of a loved one.  A bronze plaque with your name will be placed on a bookcase within your favorite subject.

 

If we do not reach our goal

All funds raised will go directly into the repairs and renovations needed in the new space to enable Russian Hill Bookstore to move in this June.  Any amount we can raise will be so immeasurably helpful.  We cannot thank you enough!

The Impact

With the loss of over 12 bookstores along the Polk Gulch corridor alone since the year 2000, Russian Hill Bookstore is one of the only independent used bookstores left in San Francisco. Our bookstore is a gathering place for our neighbors and the city's visitors, providing a sense of nostalgia for a lost era of San Francisco that is quickly being pushed out. Russian Hill Bookstore, with its general used books, new books in classics and best sellers, antiquarian and rare books, children's books and toys, the largest collection of note cards in the Bay Area, calendars, board games, journals, gift wrap, &c., is the type of general store that meets the daily needs of the community, but which is quickly becoming extinct.

Bookstores have always been a part of the intellectual infrastructure of a community.  They are a community center and gathering place for its neighbors and tourists.  Every neighborhood should have at least one independent bookstore.

Risks & Challenges

There are inherent risks in any Small Business venture, especially with the closure of so many independent bookstores over the past few years  The sky rocketing rents and costs of doing business in San Francisco make it even more difficult for a bookstore to compete with retail chains and online behemoths.  However, we believe in the power of books and bookstores, and the support of our community.  Furthermore, we believe that books are making a comeback!

  • Russian Hill Bookstore has been in business for the past 24 years.
  • Russian Hill Bookstore is currently applying for Legacy Business Status in San Francisco.  We have exceeded all of the requirements for this distinction, and fully expect to be added to the Legacy registry within the next few months.
  • Benjamin and Jessica have a combined 20 years of experience running Russian Hill Bookstore, and are confident in their ability to take on the role of ownership.
  • We have secured a new 10 year lease that will allow us to stay in our neighborhood
  • Our new space will be larger, allowing us an opportunity at expansion, and the ability to host events and book readings.  This is something our original location did not have the space to fulfill.
  • We are currently working with San Francisco city officials on building permits and business licenses, and with the local SBA (Small Business Association) in shaping our business plan.
  • The original owner of our shop, Carol Spencer, will indefinitely be a guiding mentor for new owners Benjamin and Jessica.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are a book lover and lover of used bookstores, but you can't afford to help out by donating, please consider sharing this campaign with your friends and family, other book lovers and lovers of used bookstores everywhere.

If you live in San Francisco or the greater Bay Area, and would like to help us move boxes of books one block South from our current location, we can definitely use your help!  Beginning June 1st, we will be moving roughly 50,000 books, and all the extra hands we can get will be greatly appreciated!

The most helpful thing you can do is to stop by the shop sometime once we have opened and say hello, and buy a book (or two).  We look forward to seeing you in our new home this June!

story:
Story in English(top) and Russian(bottom) languages


Introduction

Long awaited moment has finally arrived – you got driver's license! It took a long road to get it. You put a lot of your time and effort to learn a much needed everyday skill - ability to be able to drive a car.

Here you are, confident and ready to start looking for your first car. After long research, looking and reading about cars you finally settle for the one car of your choice. You know you have to buy this one. Not everyone today can afford to by a new car, so another option is to look at used car market. You arrive at a dealership to look at your options and find your first car. Does this situation sound familiar to you?

“My grandfather drove this car to go grocery shopping on the weekend!”

Hooray! You have been impressed with the condition and mileage of the car, and you become its’ next owner. You are super excited about your newly purchased vehicle which is in a good condition with lower than average cost and mileage. A month goes by and all of a sudden your dream car begin to have problem after problem. You cannot put two things together in your mind to understand – what has happened to that great car of your dream? How could it start breaking all of a sudden? The car was almost new and you barely drove it? Every visit to service department is becoming a growing bill with more repairs to come for your ‘’dream’’ car. List of work done on a car with low mileage in good condition does not make sense any longer.

At that moment you realize that you became the next victim of a dishonest seller and that your dream turned into a nightmare for you - you have bought a car with a rolled back mileage!

Many car drivers have been faced with the same situation.

About project

This project’s main goal is to resolve on going dilemma in the world of car sales all around the globe. Mission of our project is to create online resource with the introduction of a single global car database. It will hold information from manufacturers, car dealers, registration centers and monitor vehicles in service which in turn will be logged into database system. Anyone from anywhere in the world, having a VIN number will be able to check car’s history.

Our team has already made an agreement with many car manufacturers and service centers to participate in this joint effort.

Thanks to this project rolling car’s mileage will have no sense and we will be confident  when we are buying a used car - we will be sure in that we buy.

You can ask “What is so special in this project? There are a lot of online resources with same functionality!” and partially you will be right. Main difference is that our project will cover 95% of the world’s second-hand car markets. There will be no difference where the car came from – Germany, Russia, United States of America or any other country. You will have all the information about the car you plan to buy.

Project features:

  • Detailed information about car
  • Accessible from anywhere in the world
  • Available to anyone
  • Information from trusted sources
  • Fraud Protection

Project development is devided into 3 stages:

  • 1st Stage - Global car mileage database(completion deadline - 1st of April 2016)
  • 2nd Stage - Information about accidents and damage(completion deadline - 1st of August 2016)
  • 3rd Stage - Full information about car's servicing(completion deadline - 1st of February 2017)

What we need 

In order to realize this project we have calculated our required budget to be 68,000EUR.  The vast majority of this expense will cover building of private and completely safe server network – 39,800EUR. 23,000EUR are needed to cover necessary traveling costs, revenue for translators(to translate our project to all common languages) and other to the project related activities. Remaining 5,200EUR will be invested in maintenance and public services till the year 2018. After the year 2018 project will cover costs for maintenance and public services from revenue for placing advertisements on the project page. Our team will cover 8,000EUR to fund this project.

Support us

We are looking forward to working together with you. Joint support of our project will not only help us implement this database but also help numerous people around the world to escape from fraudulent deal.  Please support us, tell your family and friends, and together we can make a difference in defeating black market roll back of mileage on used cars.


Предисловие

Настал долгожданный момент - ты получил водительские права! Ты долго к этому шел, приложил немало усилий и потратил много времени, чтобы стать обладателем столь необходимого в нашей жизни навыка - умением управлять автомобилем.

И вот ты, уверенный в собственных силах, начинаешь подыскивать себе свою первую машину. Долго ходишь, присматриваешься, читаешь, узнаешь и наконец выбрав то, что нравится, отправляешься покупать. Не каждый сегодня может себе позволить новую машину, потому обращается к рынку подержанных авто. И вот ты приезжаешь осматривать свой выбор, свой первый автомобиль. Знакомая ситуация?

"На этой машине ездил мой дедушка по выходным, раз в неделю, в магазин за продуктами!" 

Ура! Ты, впечатленный состоянием и пробегом авто, становишься его следующим владельцем. Ты счастлив, ведь только что ты купил машину в прекрасном состоянии за среднюю или даже низкую стоимость и с небольшим пробегом. Проходит месяц и вдруг у с твоей машиной мечты начинаются проблемы, одна за другой. Ты никак не можешь понять - в чем же дело, машина же почти новая, совсем чуть-чуть проехала?! И каждые раз, обращаясь в сервис, тебе называют огромные суммы за ремонт твоей "мечты" и список выполненных работ совершенно не соответствует списку работ необходимых при твоем пробеге авто.

В этот самый момент ты понимаешь, что стал очередной жертвой нечестного продавца и что твоя мечта обернулась для тебя кошмаром - ты купил машину со скрученным пробегом!

Многие из автомобилистов сталкивались с такой или очень похожей ситуацией. 

О проекте

Данный проект должен стать решением этой проблемы по всему миру. Целью нашего проекта является создание онлайн ресурса с введением единой мировой автомобильной базы данных. Информация полученная от производителей, дилерских центров, центров регистрации и контроля автотранспорта а так же сервисных центров будет заноситься в базу данных. Любой человек, из любой точки земного шара, обладая VIN кодом, сможет проверить историю данного автомобиля. Нашей команде уже удалось достигнуть соглашения о сотрудничестве со многими авто производителями и центрами сервисного обслуживания. 

Благодаря данному проекту скручивание пробега автомобиля станет бессмысленным и при покупке подержанного автомобиля мы будем уверены в том, что покупаем.

Вы спросите “Что в вашем проекте такого особенного? На просторах интернета много подобных проектов!“ и в чем-то окажетесь правы. Главным отличием нашего проекта от других является то, что он покроет 95% рынка подержанных автомобилей всего мира. Не имеет значение откуда прибыл автомобиль – будь то Германия, Россия, Соединенные Штаты Америки или любой другой страны. У вас всегда будет вся самая подробная информация об автомобиле, который вы желаете приобрести. 

Особенности проекта:

  • Подробная информация о транспортном средстве
  • Доступность из любой точки планеты
  • Доступность каждому человеку
  • Подлинная информация о пробеге только от достоверных источников
  • Информативная защита от мошенников

Разработка проекта разделена на 3 этапа:

  • 1-ый этап – Единая мировая база данных пробега авто(завершение этапа – 1-ое Апреля 2016 года)
  • 2-ой этап – Информация о происшествиях с авто и его повреждениях(завершение этапа – 1-ое Августа 2016 года)
  • 3-ий этап – Полная информация о техническом обслуживании автомобиля(завершение этапа – 1-ое Февраля 2017 года)

Нам необходимо

Для реализации этого проекта необходимо 68,000EUR. Основная часть средств пойдет на создание частной защищенной сети серверов – 39,800EUR. Для покрытия необходимых туристических расходов, расходов связанных с переводом на все основные мировые языки, а так же на другие, связанные с проектом, расходы  требуется 23,000EUR. Оставшиеся 5,200EUR будут потрачены на обслуживание и поддержание проекта до 2018 года. Начиная с 2018 года поддержание и обслуживание проекта будет производиться за счет средств, вырученных от размещения рекламы на вебсайте проекта. Наша команда вложит в создание проекта 8,000EUR из собственных средств.

Поддержите нас

Мы будем очень рады любой поддержке с Вашей стороны. Поддержав наш проект Вы не только поможете нам в его реализации, но и себе, а так же многим людям во всем мире. Поддержите нас, расскажите друзьям и знакомым и вместе мы сможем победить мошенничество с автомобильным пробегом.
story_txt:
Story in English(top) and Russian(bottom) languagesIntroduction
Long
awaited moment has finally arrived – you got driver's license! It took a
long road to get it. You put a lot of your time and effort to learn a much
needed everyday skill - ability to be able to drive a car.
Here you
are, confident and ready to start looking for your first car. After long
research, looking and reading about cars you finally settle for the one car of
your choice. You know you have to buy this one. Not everyone today
can afford to by a new car, so another option is to look at used car market.
You arrive at a dealership to look at your options and find your first car.
Does this situation sound familiar to you?
“My
grandfather drove this car to go grocery shopping on the weekend!”
Hooray! You
have been impressed with the condition and mileage of the car, and you become
its’ next owner. You are super excited about your newly purchased vehicle which
is in a good condition with lower than average cost and mileage. A month goes
by and all of a sudden your dream car begin to have problem after problem. You
cannot put two things together in your mind to understand – what has happened
to that great car of your dream? How could it start breaking all of a sudden?
The car was almost new and you barely drove it? Every visit to service department
is becoming a growing bill with more repairs to come for your ‘’dream’’ car.
List of work done on a car with low mileage in good condition does not make
sense any longer.
At that
moment you realize that you became the next victim of a dishonest seller
and that your dream turned into a nightmare for you - you have bought a car
with a rolled back mileage!
Many car
drivers have been faced with the same situation.
About project
This
project’s main goal is to resolve on going dilemma in the world of car sales
all around the globe. Mission
of our project is to create online resource with the introduction of a single
global car database. It will hold information from manufacturers, car dealers,
registration centers and monitor vehicles in service which in turn will be
logged into database system. Anyone from anywhere in the world, having a VIN
number will be able to check car’s history.
Our team has
already made an agreement with many car manufacturers and service centers to
participate in this joint effort.
Thanks to
this project rolling car’s mileage will have no sense and we will be
confident  when we are buying a used car - we will be sure in that we buy.
You can ask “What is so special in this project? There
are a lot of online resources with same functionality!” and partially you
will be right. Main difference is that our project will cover 95% of the
world’s second-hand car markets. There will be no difference where the car came
from – Germany, Russia, United States of America or any
other country. You will have all the information about the car you plan to buy.

Project features:

Detailed information about car
Accessible from
     anywhere in the world
Available to anyone
Information from trusted sources
Fraud Protection

Project
development is devided into 3 stages:

1st Stage - Global car
     mileage database(completion deadline - 1st of April 2016)
2nd Stage -
     Information about accidents and damage(completion deadline - 1st of August
     2016)
3rd Stage - Full
     information about car's servicing(completion deadline - 1st of February
     2017)

What we need 
In order to realize this project we have
calculated our required budget to be 68,000EUR.  The vast majority of this expense will cover
building of private and completely safe server network – 39,800EUR. 23,000EUR are needed to cover necessary traveling costs, revenue for translators(to
translate our project to all common languages) and other to the project related
activities. Remaining 5,200EUR will be invested in
maintenance and public services till the year 2018. After the year 2018 project
will cover costs for maintenance and public services from revenue for placing
advertisements on the project page. Our team will cover 8,000EUR to fund this
project. 
Support us
We are
looking forward to working together with you. Joint support of our
project will not only help us implement this database but also help
numerous people around the world to escape from fraudulent deal.  Please
support us, tell your family and friends, and together we can make a difference
in defeating black market roll back of mileage on used cars.
Предисловие
Настал долгожданный момент - ты получил водительские
права! Ты долго к этому шел, приложил немало усилий и потратил много времени,
чтобы стать обладателем столь необходимого в нашей жизни навыка - умением
управлять автомобилем.
И вот ты, уверенный в собственных силах, начинаешь
подыскивать себе свою первую машину. Долго ходишь, присматриваешься, читаешь,
узнаешь и наконец выбрав то, что нравится, отправляешься покупать. Не каждый
сегодня может себе позволить новую машину, потому обращается к рынку
подержанных авто. И вот ты приезжаешь осматривать свой выбор, свой первый
автомобиль. Знакомая ситуация?
"На этой машине ездил мой дедушка по выходным, раз в
неделю, в магазин за продуктами!" 
Ура! Ты, впечатленный состоянием и пробегом авто,
становишься его следующим владельцем. Ты счастлив, ведь только что ты купил
машину в прекрасном состоянии за среднюю или даже низкую стоимость и с
небольшим пробегом. Проходит месяц и вдруг у с твоей машиной мечты начинаются
проблемы, одна за другой. Ты никак не можешь понять - в чем же дело, машина же
почти новая, совсем чуть-чуть проехала?! И каждые раз, обращаясь в сервис, тебе
называют огромные суммы за ремонт твоей "мечты" и список выполненных
работ совершенно не соответствует списку работ необходимых при твоем пробеге
авто.
В этот самый момент ты понимаешь, что стал очередной
жертвой нечестного продавца и что твоя мечта обернулась для тебя кошмаром - ты
купил машину со скрученным пробегом!
Многие из автомобилистов сталкивались с такой или очень
похожей ситуацией. 
О проекте
Данный проект должен стать решением этой проблемы по всему
миру. Целью нашего проекта является создание онлайн ресурса с введением единой
мировой автомобильной базы данных. Информация полученная от производителей, дилерских
центров, центров регистрации и контроля автотранспорта а так же сервисных
центров будет заноситься в базу данных. Любой человек, из любой точки земного
шара, обладая VIN кодом, сможет проверить историю данного
автомобиля. Нашей команде уже удалось достигнуть соглашения о сотрудничестве
со многими авто производителями и центрами сервисного обслуживания. 
Благодаря данному проекту скручивание пробега автомобиля
станет бессмысленным и при покупке подержанного автомобиля мы будем уверены в
том, что покупаем.
Вы спросите “Что в
вашем проекте такого особенного? На просторах интернета много подобных
проектов!“ и в чем-то окажетесь правы. Главным отличием нашего проекта от
других является то, что он покроет 95% рынка подержанных автомобилей всего
мира. Не имеет значение откуда прибыл автомобиль – будь то Германия, Россия,
Соединенные Штаты Америки или любой другой страны. У вас всегда будет вся самая
подробная информация об автомобиле, который вы желаете приобрести.  
Особенности проекта:


Подробная информация о транспортном средстве


Доступность из любой точки планеты


Доступность каждому человеку


Подлинная информация о пробеге только от достоверных
источников


Информативная защита от мошенников


Разработка проекта разделена на 3 этапа:


1-ый этап – Единая мировая база данных пробега авто(завершение
этапа – 1-ое Апреля 2016 года)


2-ой этап – Информация о происшествиях с авто и его повреждениях(завершение
этапа – 1-ое Августа 2016 года)


3-ий этап – Полная информация о техническом обслуживании
автомобиля(завершение этапа – 1-ое Февраля 2017 года)


Нам необходимо
Для реализации этого проекта необходимо 68,000EUR. Основная часть средств пойдет на
создание частной защищенной сети серверов – 39,800EUR. Для покрытия необходимых
туристических расходов, расходов связанных с переводом на все основные мировые
языки, а так же на другие, связанные с проектом, расходы  требуется 23,000EUR. Оставшиеся 5,200EUR будут потрачены на обслуживание и
поддержание проекта до 2018 года. Начиная с 2018 года поддержание и
обслуживание проекта будет производиться за счет средств, вырученных от размещения рекламы на вебсайте проекта. Наша команда вложит в создание проекта 8,000EUR из собственных средств. 
Поддержите нас
Мы будем очень рады любой поддержке с Вашей стороны.
Поддержав наш проект Вы не только поможете нам в его реализации, но и себе, а
так же многим людям во всем мире. Поддержите нас, расскажите друзьям и знакомым
и вместе мы сможем победить мошенничество с автомобильным пробегом.

story:
Short Summary

In Denver alone, we estimate that there are 1,200 homeless teenagers ranging from ages 12-24. Purple Door Coffee is a non-profit coffee shop in Denver, Colorado that hires and job-trains homeless youth and young adults who want to leave street life behind. We have been open for over two years and have hired and supported 11 brave people who wanted to leave homelessness forever. 5 of our employees have graduated our program and have moved onto jobs in the community and there are 3 on track to graduate soon!

We have been honored to employ the individuals that we have, but the need for employment with job and life skills for homeless teens is great. As it is now, due to the small size of our cafe, we have only able to employ 3 program employees at a time. Yet, there are many individuals submitting applications and asking for life change. With experience under our belts, we are ready to expand our business model and add a coffee roaster to our portfolio. This alone will enable us to grow our program employee size by more than double!

Donating to this campaign truly helps offer life change to people who have been handed lives that are full of challenge, struggle and pain. This roaster will offer hope not only for the lives of our employees, but also the lives of their children and grandchildren. Donating to this campaign offers change for generations to come!


What We Need & What You Get

To get this roaster started we need at least $100,000! We have never in our history tried to raise this much money in such a short amount of time. We are nervous, but very excited and hopeful.

Starting a roaster requires an investment up front. On its own, a coffee roaster costs around $40,000. In addition to that, we need other items such as commercial grinders, scales, shelving, packaging for the coffee, shipping materials, warehouse space for the roaster, construction costs for the warehouse space and much more. $100,000 will allow us to have the things we need to start a small roastery. 

Our ideal goal is $135,000. Raising this money will allow us to purchase extra roasting equipment such as a coffee destoner, a coffee mixer, cupping materials and more. We will also be able to purchase a mail meter for mailing coffee, furniture for the warehouse, and stock up on supplies. 

If you give to this project you will get to taste the first batches of coffee ever roasted by the Purple Door Coffee team! You can also receive awesome rewards such as thank you notes from our employees, handmade artisan coffee mugs and a tour of the roastery (once we are opened).


The Impact

With the opening of the roaster, we will immediately be able to offer 2 jobs (and life skills!) to individuals who want to leave homelessness behind.  Once we have established business for the  roaster, we will be able to add even more. Our hope is to have 5 program employees working at the roastery- which more than doubles the amount of jobs we can offer annually! 

In addition to adding employees, a roaster will enable us to move towards becoming more self-sustainable. Currently, Purple Door is supported by our in-store sales and private donations, 65% to 35% respectively. With the roaster as a second stream of income, our business will see a greater shift in our support and get us one step closer to functioning entirely on our own.


Risks & Challenges

With the people we have employed, leaving street life is not a simple one-time decision to make. Instead, it is a constant choice. A choice to leave behind everything they have ever known as safe. A choice to leave behind their only support system. And it is a choice to trust us at Purple Door Coffee.

Here, we work to teach our employees how to hold a job and work well. We teach coping skills and life skills. But, what is most meaningful is the environment in which this learning takes place. With grace and patience and compassion, we offer a  healthy and loving support system. We offer a year of undivided attention and support to each employee as they constantly choose to transition out of street-life. This proves to be the most surprising and impacting thing for our employees - that they have an encouraging and gracious support to lean on amidst much change. 

Though it is hard, this work is worth it because the homeless teens we employ are worth it. And so is the life change prompted by this project. It is our desire that the support offered at Purple Door Coffee can create change for our employees and break cycles of unhealthiness. This work: our time, energy and effort, can forever impact an entire family for good- offering change from generations of homelessness and addiction to generations of hard work and contribution.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that there are many folks out there who love what we do, but can not give financially. That does not make your support any less valuable! Sharing our story with friends and through social media is a huge way to support this project and it means so much to us! Heck, even the fact that you are reading this means that you have already supported us in a way. And for that, we thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Are you a lover of Halloween?  Do you eagerly anticipate the chill autumn air, the glow of the jack-o'lantern, the rustle of leaves?  My name is Laurie Tomé and together with Maria Calleja, we are the founders of Halloween in the Village in historical Wortley Village, London, Ontario, Canada.   Five years ago we created a grassroots community event run completely by local volunteers known as The Graceful Dead Volunteer Krewe.  It is our goal to provide our community and beyond with an opportunity to celebrate that time of year most conducive to creative impulses, laughter and fun...Halloween! 

It is important to us that Halloween in the Village is a FREE event. There is no charge to participate in any of the activities.  All materials are either donated or purchased through our budget.  It is our wish that it remain accessible to all.

This year will be our 5th anniversary and we need your help!  In order to provide the best for our community we need to be able to operate with fewer financial constraints than usual.  Halloween in the Village is a family-friendly festival, which operates solely on support from local community and business organizations. Unfortunately this means we have had to run our awesome event on the tightest of budgets.  We don't always manage to secure the same amounts from the same donors so each year is a scramble and we are usually tapped out by the end.  

In cooperation with our local library and merchants, Halloween in the Village offers a carnival of games, live bands, "haunted house", scavenger hunt and pumpkin carving among other cool and exciting kid-friendly activities.  On top of all of this is the PARADE through Wortley Village in which anyone in costume can join. The crowning glory to our parade is the amazing homemade, non-motorized floats!  

We continue to be delighted and surprised by the effort and ingenuity displayed by those in attendance.  We recognize the time and expense that often goes into these ventures and wish to recognize such high levels of creativity with worthy PRIZES!  It's our way of saying thanks to fellow Halloween lovers in our community.  

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise $2000.  This is our campaign in a nutshell:

SAFETY FIRST

  •  Our parade requires a police escort.  Depending on the number of intersections and individual officers needed, we can expect to pay $800 - $1000. 
LIVE ENTERTAINMENT
  • Live Bands.  Last year the bands played for free! This year we would like to give them a small honorarium if possible.   At the very least, we would like to be able to provide them with food and drinks.  $500
PRIZES
  • In order to encourage people to strive for the extraordinary, we believe it's important to provide a juicy incentive!  $500
  • 5 Top Prizes of $100 each: Best Adult Costume, Best Float, Best Group Costume, Best School Float, Best Youth Costume
That's it!  We will continue to seek out support from our usual sources to cover expenses like advertising costs, materials and permits, rental units such as the portable stage, washrooms and sink unit, etc. The cost of operating an event this size is considerable.  Raising money through a crowd-sharing environment will relieve our volunteers of having to scrounge!!  
PERKS
We believe in rewarding generosity.  For your kind support, we offer original design collectibles and one-of-a-kind pieces of Halloween art.  Our "Cork Spirits" are skillfully crafted by Halloween in the Village Co-Founder and artist Laurie Tomé. Each has it's own unique personality.  Check out all of our perks on our website halloweeninthevillage.com or look for us on Facebook. 

The Impact

Our ability to raise additional funds through Indiegogo means that Halloween lovers anywhere within walking or driving distance of Wortley Village have a unique opportunity to participate in a FREE event that caters to the inner child in us all.  It brings people together in a shared desire to live within a vibrant community that cares about the health and well being of its citizens whether they live down the street, across the city or around the world. Halloween in more than a commercial cash cow.  It's about reaching inside and seeing what else lies within.  Sometimes it means embracing the dark side just a little bit.  Halloween allows us to face our deepest fears and emerge triumphant!  

Visit our website or look for us on Facebook to see the many happy, smiling faces of the past 4 years.  Halloween in the Village is growing and we need your help.  Help us to spread Halloween cheer to all.  

Risks & Challenges

This year we are facing cuts to our funding from one of our major supporters.  This has caused us considerable concern. A great amount of time and effort is required to organize an event of this scale.  Fundraising is time-consuming process.  A lack of funds means a lack of resources.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Would you like to contribute but are feeling a bit tight in the wallet?  There are many ways in which you can still help us spread the word:

  • Visit us on Facebook. Like and share our page.  Feel free to comment on what your may find there.  We post all sorts of fun stuff!
  • Discover what Indiegogo can offer with their sharing tools.

In cooperation with our local library and merchants, Halloween in the Village offers a carnival of games, live bands, "haunted house", scavenger hunt and pumpkin carving among other cool and exciting kid-friendly activities.  On top of all of this is the PARADE through Wortley Village in which anyone in costume can join. The crowning glory to our parade is the amazing homemade, non-motorized floats!  
We continue to be delighted and surprised by the effort and ingenuity displayed by those in attendance.  We recognize the time and expense that often goes into these ventures and wish to recognize such high levels of creativity with worthy PRIZES!  It's our way of saying thanks to fellow Halloween lovers in our community.     What We Need & What You Get We are hoping to raise $2000.  This is our campaign in a nutshell:
SAFETY FIRST   Our parade requires a police escort.  Depending on the number of intersections and individual officers needed, we can expect to pay $800 - $1000. 

LIVE ENTERTAINMENT
Live Bands.  Last year the bands played for free! This year we would like to give them a small honorarium if possible.   At the very least, we would like to be able to provide them with food and drinks.  $500
PRIZES

In order to encourage people to strive for the extraordinary, we believe it's important to provide a juicy incentive!  $500
5 Top Prizes of $100 each: Best Adult Costume, Best Float, Best Group Costume, Best School Float, Best Youth Costume


That's it!  We will continue to seek out support from our usual sources to cover expenses like advertising costs, materials and permits, rental units such as the portable stage, washrooms and sink unit, etc. The cost of operating an event this size is considerable.  Raising money through a crowd-sharing environment will relieve our volunteers of having to scrounge!!  

PERKS
We believe in rewarding generosity.  For your kind support, we offer original design collectibles and one-of-a-kind pieces of Halloween art.  Our "Cork Spirits" are skillfully crafted by Halloween in the Village Co-Founder and artist Laurie Tomé. Each has it's own unique personality.  Check out all of our perks on our website halloweeninthevillage.com or look for us on Facebook. 

   The Impact Our ability to raise additional funds through Indiegogo means that Halloween lovers anywhere within walking or driving distance of Wortley Village have a unique opportunity to participate in a FREE event that caters to the inner child in us all.  It brings people together in a shared desire to live within a vibrant community that cares about the health and well being of its citizens whether they live down the street, across the city or around the world. Halloween in more than a commercial cash cow.  It's about reaching inside and seeing what else lies within.  Sometimes it means embracing the dark side just a little bit.  Halloween allows us to face our deepest fears and emerge triumphant!  
Visit our website or look for us on Facebook to see the many happy, smiling faces of the past 4 years.  Halloween in the Village is growing and we need your help.  Help us to spread Halloween cheer to all.     Risks & Challenges  This year we are facing cuts to our funding from one of our major supporters.  This has caused us considerable concern. A great amount of time and effort is required to organize an event of this scale.  Fundraising is time-consuming process.  A lack of funds means a lack of resources.  
Other Ways You Can Help
 Would you like to contribute but are feeling a bit tight in the wallet?  There are many ways in which you can still help us spread the word:  Visit us on Facebook. Like and share our page.  Feel free to comment on what your may find there.  We post all sorts of fun stuff! Discover what Indiegogo can offer with their sharing tools.

story:
Creative Equity Investment Fund

Investment Objectives

This fund seeks to invest in culture in the City of Dallas, including but not limited to cultural events, concerts, art exhibitions, festivals, markets, rentals, web technology, media enterprises, structural operations, urban planning, real estate development, and small businesses. This fund will prioritize opportunities to invest in creatives and community of color, but will also invest in other opportunities across the city regardless of race and ethnicity in an equitable manner.  

Principal Investment Strategies

The CEIF fund will take advantage of the funding gap that exists in the area of culture with creatives of color and communities of color, as well as generally throughout the city. This funding gap will give the fund access to established and proven opportunities, as well as emerging opportunities. Identifying opportunities where investments of $250 to $500 can make an outsize impact and return will be the core of fund activities.  As a small fund, the CEIF can be nimble and decisive with investments, enabling the fund to achieve a high volume and variety of deals. As there are very few outlets for investment available to creatives in Dallas, this should enable the fund to have the deal flow needed to make high quality investments across a diversified area of culture. The fund will be active in the community when it comes to bridging gaps, and creating opportunities, sharing our networks and knowledge, alongside our resources to those we invest in to ensure their success and maximize our return.

Fund Management

The fund will be managed by Darryl Ratcliff, who is a poet and social practice artist with a curatorial and writing practice. Ratcliff is a member of the award winning Michelada Think Tank (MTT), an art collective who works nationally on the issue of cultural equity. Ratcliff’s other current projects include Ash Studios and Creating Our Future. Recently, Ratcliff was the Community Engagement Associate at SMU Meadows School of the Art and the inaugural artist-in-residence for Rick Lowe’s Trans.lation Vickery Meadow initiated by the Nasher Sculpture Center.  Ratcliff most recently curated, Viola Delgado’s Transformation of a Thought, the first retrospective of a Latina artist in Dallas, at the Latino Cultural Center in Spring 2015, and has curated over a dozen solo shows since 2011. As a noted writer and thinker on art and culture Ratcliff has written for Glasstire, Centraltrack, and the Dallas Morning News. From 2009-2013, Ratcliff ran the company The Green Bandana Group which focused on art commerce and received a Best of Dallas award from The Dallas Observer in 2013. From 2008-2010, Ratcliff held both the Series 7 and 66 licenses and worked as a securities agent and investment advisor for AXA Financial.  Projects Ratcliff has been involved with have been featured in the Dallas Morning News, D Magazine, FD Luxe,  Glasstire, Art in America, Hyperallergic, Wall Street Journal, and the New York Times, to name a few. Ratcliff has also been the recipient of numerous awards and honors. Most recently he is the recipient of the City of Dallas Office of Cultural Affairs Special Projects grant award.

story:
RE-VOLT provides clean, affordable light and power to rural Haitian families. Here's how we do it:

  • We lease single-home solar energy systems to our customers; these systems include a solar panel, a home/battery unit with USB power outlet, and several lights.
  • Our locally-based sales and service team personally installs these systems in new customers' homes, and immediately fixes/replaces systems that experience any technical issues.
  • Customers pay us a low (250 HTG / about $4.50) monthly fee in return for the unrestricted use of their systems via a mobile banking service whose use is widespread in Haiti.

Over the last nine months, our self-financed pilot project has surpassed 800 households and 4,000 people served on the island of La Gonâve. We launched this Indiegogo campaign in order to raise the working capital necessary to reach 2,000 households / 10,000 people by early 2016. 

Starting in early-mid 2016, we plan to add additional Haitian communities to RE-VOLT's service area, and in the long run we intend to expand to other developing countries where the rural poor lack electricity.

With your help, we can make it happen. Please consider donating, and help spread the word by sharing this campaign with others.

Pi Gwo Byen is a school on La Gonâve serving students aged 8-12 who have not had the opportunity to attend Haitian public schools due to family circumstances. Over a three-year period of instruction, the school takes children who have never sat in a classroom and prepares them for Haiti’s 6th Grade Exam, a standardized test of reading, writing, and arithmetic whose passage is a de facto requirement for most full-time jobs in Haiti. The national pass rate is well under 50%, yet Pi Gwo Byenconsistently achieves over 95%. This year, every student passed!

In return for a $300 donation to our campaign, we’ll provide a RE-VOLT system to the family of a Pi GwoByen student, which will allow the student to do schoolwork at home at night, and we’ll waive the monthly RE-VOLT subscriber fee for the remainder of their studies at Pi GwoByen. We’ll also send you a picture of your sponsored student and their family; please provide us with a valid email! 

Pi Gwo Byen is a truly remarkable organization and we at RE-VOLT have a tremendous amount of admiration for both its tireless director, Kelly Kobza, and its American nonprofit sponsor, Greater Good Haiti. We encourage you to check out their website at greatergoodhaiti.org!

Our sales and service team uses Jialing 150cc off-road motorcycles – ubiquitous in Haiti and other developing countries – to visit customers for installation and service calls.For a $1,500 donation to our campaign, you can sponsor a new motorcycle, which is the main one-time fixed cost we incur in onboarding new sales and service team members. We’ll put your name or organization’s logo on the gas tank (see rendering above), and if you can make it to La Gonâve, one of our team members will give you a tour of the town of Anse-a-Galets on “your” motorcycle!

Most roads on the island of La Gonâve are rocky trails that demand rugged vehicles. Help us move new units around our service area with a Toyota Landcruiser Diesel 4x4, the undisputed heavyweight champion of off-road workhorses. We’ll prominently place your name or your organization’s logo on a door, side panel, or the hood. If you can make it out to La Gonâve, we’ll give you a half-day tour of the island in the truck you sponsored!

See the impact of your donation to RE-VOLT with a 4-day, 3-night camping trip for 4 people to the island of La Gonâve. We will cover most of the island, visiting local communities, barbequing fresh seafood, and camping under the stars. Tents and cots will be provided. All expenses will be covered following your arrival in Port-au-Prince, including transportation to/from the island and all meals while on La Gonâve. Airfare to/from Port-au-Prince is not included.

The La Gonâve Adventure could easily serve as the highlight of a longer visit to Haiti. There’s a lot to see and experience here, from the stunning mountains of the Massif du Nord to the exuberant nightlife of Port-au-Prince to the pristine beaches of Île-à-Vaches, and we’d be happy to help plan the rest of your itinerary.

Please note: we can accommodate children over 12 and, to a limited extent, people with mobility issues; please let us know if you have specific questions in this regard by emailing us at indiegogo@re-volt.com.

RE-VOLT's seeds were planted in the aftermath of the January 2010 earthquake, when our co-founder and CEO, Maarten Boute, was two months into his tenure as CEO of Digicel Haiti, the country's preeminent mobile network operator. Digicel's cell towers withstood the earthquake and provided a critical piece of communications infrastructure for rescue and relief coordination. Several months after the quake, Digicel Group (a multinational telecoms provider and Digicel Haiti's corporate parent) decided to double-down on investing in its Haitian business, and its board encouraged Maarten to rapidly grow Digicel Haiti's subscriber base.

Under Maarten's leadership, Digicel Haiti grew from fewer than 2 million subscribers in 2010 to over 4.5 million in 2014. Maarten and RE-VOLT co-founder/COO Darragh Dolan, then Digicel Haiti's Head of Commercial Development, learned innumerable lessons along the way. Perhaps the most important was that new-user adoption of mobile phones is highly dependent upon affordable, reliable access to electricity. Customers who didn't have access to the power grid (80% of all Haitians and over 90% of rural Haitians) had to rely on pay-per-charge street electricity services, which cost 10-15% of an average family's daily budget. Digicel Haiti set up free charging stations to help reduce the impact of energy poverty on its subscribers, but these services proved especially hard to distribute in rural areas. For Maarten and Darragh, the idea of building a business that provides reliable, affordable, and clean energy to all Haitians began as an interesting side project and rapidly became a personal mission.

RE-VOLT began operating in early 2015 on the island of La Gonâve, one of the most isolated and underserved communities in Haiti. Once a rainforest-covered paradise affectionately known as the "Vodou Island", La Gonâve suffered massive deforestation in the mid-to-late 20th century, and currently supports itself mostly through fishing, subsistence farming, and remittences from abroad. Fewer than 5% of La Gonâve's residents have access to a small state-run power grid in the town of Anse-a-Galets, which provides 4 hours of power a day (6 to 10pm). A few of the wealthier residents have diesel generators, and fewer still have installed makeshift or kit-built solar energy systems. The vast majority of La Gonâve's residents light their homes at night with candles or kerosene lanterns and pay street vendors to charge their cell phones -- but we're starting to change that.

In under eight months of operation, RE-VOLT has created a measurable positive impact on La Gonâve; we're currently serving over 3,500 people every day. We've learned a tremendous amount from our customers already, and continue to make  iterative improvements to our marketing, sales, and service operations on a daily basis.

We're launching this Indiegogo campaign to raise working capital so that we can invest in our local sales and service staff and distribution infrastructure, which will allow us to serve more customers. We're targeting $50,000 because that's an amount we can put to immediate and effective use, and we believe that reaching this goal would allow us to scale our customer base to 2,000 households / 10,000 people by January 2016.

RE-VOLT's presence on the island of La Gonâve has already benefited the community in the following ways:

  • Connectivity - RE-VOLT systems come with a USB outlet that allows customer households to charge their cell phones 24/7. Haiti's GDP per capita is under $3/day (it's closer to $1/day in rural communities like La Gonâve), but that hasn't stopped the expansion of mobile networks; the number of active cell phones in Haiti exceeds 90% of its adult population. Without even taking into account the benefit of having light in the home, RE-VOLT systems provide significant cost savings to families that would otherwise be spending around $15/month to street vendors just to keep their phones charged.
  • Education - At night, Haitian families are often forced to share one or two weak light sources (such as candles); for a typical family of five or more people, this means that some children get access to light and some don't. Children who can't do their homework at night are at severe risk of non-advancement in Haiti's government-standardized school curriculum. Sadly, Haiti's energy poverty also impedes the advancement of women; in conditions of light-scarcity, male children are often given priority of access to lighting, resulting in higher dropout rates for girls. The high-efficiency LED room lights that come with the RE-VOLT system provide ample light for the entire family to do housework, homework or any other evening activity.

  • Safety - the combustion-based indoor light sources currently used by most Haitian families, such as candles or kerosene lanterns, don't just weigh heavily on household budgets as an ongoing expense; they're also unsafe, because they produce toxic smoke and present a fire hazard. RE-VOLT customers no longer have to continually purchase dirty, dangerous energy sources in order to light their homes at night.
  • Jobs - RE-VOLT has created good-paying, steady jobs on La Gonâve, and we intend to create many more as we continue to grow. We reach our customers through a robust on-the-ground marketing, sales, and service team staffed by La Gonâve locals; their knowledge of the community, personal relationships, and ability to elicit candid feedback have been instrumental to our success thus far. Furthermore, we have found that customers have used their RE-VOLT systems to improve their own incomes; for example, mechanics can work into the evening hours on high-priority jobs, and farmers who live far away from the nearest pay-to-charge station can not only save money, but also keep their cell phones on, allowing them to stay in closer contact with market vendors.

RE-VOLT currently offers customers a modified d.light D20 system which has been augmented with a GSM antenna, SIM card, and associated firmware, allowing RE-VOLT to remotely manage units. Customers pre-pay for power usage in 7- or 30-day increments via the Mon Cash mobile banking platform, which is already a well-established service within Haiti.

The units' hardware consists of the following:

  • Solar panel
  • Home unit with battery, on/off switch, GSM antenna, and light / USB connections
  • 3 high-efficiency LED lights; two ceiling-mounted with wall switches, and one which is detachable for use as a lantern
  • USB charging cable with extensions for all commonly used mobile phones (Nokia, Android, etc)



Startups are inherently risky enterprises, especially when their target markets are in developing countries. The Haitian business climate presents a moderate degree of political risk, and RE-VOLT's margins are vulnerable to exchange rate fluctuations between the Haitian Gourde and the U.S. Dollar. We believe these risks are mitigated by the following factors:

  • Our leadership team has an extensive track record of success growing businesses in developing markets, including (and most recently) our target market of Haiti.
  • RE-VOLT provides a service that is transformational for our customers in ways that few others are; gaining access to reliable in-home electricity is, without exaggeration, a turning point in our customers' lives. As such, we are cautiously optimistic with regard to RE-VOLT's value proposition and our long-term ability to attract and retain customers.
  • State-sponsored rural electrification in Haiti is very limited and meaningful expansion in the short/medium-term is seen as highly unlikely. We therefore believe that there is a significant "competitive moat" around our business. To the extent that RE-VOLT is subject to direct competition, we believe that viable competitors would come in the form of similar off-grid, single-home services, and we believe that we are well-situated to compete within this market if others decide to enter it.

Please send us an email at inquiries@re-volt.com.

We're looking for people who like to hack on hardware and/or software, who want to make a positive impact on the world through the rollout of emerging technologies, and who thrive in challenging and complex environments. Proficiency in French is a major plus; si ou pale Kreyòl, menm pi bon!

If this sounds like you, we'd like to meet you. Email us at careers@re-volt.com.

We believe these risks are mitigated by the following factors:  Our leadership team has an extensive track record of success growing businesses in developing markets, including (and most recently) our target market of Haiti. RE-VOLT provides a service that is transformational for our customers in ways that few others are; gaining access to reliable in-home electricity is, without exaggeration, a turning point in our customers' lives. As such, we are cautiously optimistic with regard to RE-VOLT's value proposition and our long-term ability to attract and retain customers.
State-sponsored rural electrification in Haiti is very limited and meaningful expansion in the short/medium-term is seen as highly unlikely. We therefore believe that there is a significant "competitive moat" around our business. To the extent that RE-VOLT is subject to direct competition, we believe that viable competitors would come in the form of similar off-grid, single-home services, and we believe that we are well-situated to compete within this market if others decide to enter it.




Please send us an email at inquiries@re-volt.com.
We're looking for people who like to hack on hardware and/or software, who want to make a positive impact on the world through the rollout of emerging technologies, and who thrive in challenging and complex environments. Proficiency in French is a major plus; si ou pale Kreyòl, menm pi bon!
If this sounds like you, we'd like to meet you. Email us at careers@re-volt.com.

story:
“Once upon a time there was a wonderful Mommy, three mischievous little children all-a-giggle…and one very strange looking Daddy Redbeard. They lived in a magical place called South Africa where majestic creatures roamed the land.

But a great and terrible curse had befallen the land. The fields lay barren, the people hungry, and so many had become homeless.

The family could take the sadness no more. Daddy Redbeard knew they had to do something. So he got amazing spells and potions from the Great Permaculture Wizard, Geoff Lawton, and immersed himself in its permie teachings.

With his family by his side, they devised a plan to help the great nation break free from its curse and get back to the land. It would take much sacrifice, yet they did not mind. They sold off everything they had, packed what little belongings they had, and set off on the journey of a lifetime.”

Do you believe in happily ever after? We do. Our fairy tale is just beginning, and we’d like to share it with you. What do you say – Will you join us?

Please support our call for funds to ease the financial burden of our first implementations. In return, we'll share our learnings with you via the many video's we'll be making. PS: While we endeavour to ensure best quality, please note that these video's will be shot and edited by amateurs (ourselves) :-)
