story:
Our proposal

Quelonios del Caribe is a sea turtle conservation organization located on the mouth of the Pacuare River. Quelonios envisions a self-sustainable community and invests in sustainable employment projects as well as conserving sea turtles. Approximately 95% of the community on Pacuare relies on sea turtles as a means of income whether by selling the meat, eggs, shell, or by attracting international volunteers. This adds further pressure on the existing sea turtle populations that have been reduce by 90% in the last two decades. Due to this, there is increasing need for alternative sources of income for the community in order to sustain themselves and lessen pressures on sea turtle populations in the long term. Quelonios hopes to be able to employ members of the community to offer an alternative source of income to poaching to relieve the pressures on the sea turtle populations. 

We want to process and use all parts of the coconut. Coconut is a potential resource for the community as it is abundant and can be processed into numerous products: Whit Coconut fiber is possible make baskets, ropes and clothes. Coconut soil is an extremely efficient substrate in which to grow plants. The shell of the coconut can be used to make artesian crafts, such as cups, bottles, and jewelry. The meat can be used to make coconut milk, coconut oil, and as a feed for animals. The Caribbean coast of Costa Rica is rich in coconut and it is believed that it is an untapped resource that could benefit the community. Coconut can be sustainably collected as it does not require harvesting but the collection of fallen coconuts.

The implementation of this project can create new jobs approximately 15, for the community while avoiding the conflict of interest of employing potential poachers in turtle conservation.  By processing the coconut, the value also increases. Untreated coconuts are worth approximately 125 colones each (US $0.23). With some processing coconuts can be worth 900 colones (US $1.7). Also increasing the benefit to producers

In total we need US $ 20,000, distributed as follows:

·  US $ 3,500 to purchase a machine to separate the coconut substrate and coconut fiber.

·  US $ 1,500 for the purchase and construction of oil distillers.

·  US $ 15,000 to build a small factory where coconut processes are performed.

As a first step, we will collect US $ 5,000, to start with fiber, substrate and coconut oil, using a small, rustic house as a factory, then collect the necessary funds for the construction of the factory leading to consolidation of the project.

Not be collected a total of US $ 5000, the project has the versatility to use the funds as proceeds, for example if they raise between US $ 1,000 and US $ 2,000, would be used for processing oils, if the proceeds exceeds US $ 2,000 but less than or equal to US $ 3500 funds will be used to process coconut fibers and substrates.

How will this happen!

Coconut as a resource

  The implementation of this project can create new jobs approximately 15, for the community while avoiding the conflict of interest of employing potential poachers in turtle conservation.  By processing the coconut, the value also increases. Untreated coconuts are worth approximately 125 colones each (US $0.23). With some processing coconuts can be worth 900 colones (US $1.7) depending on the product. Increasing the benefit to producers

Prior to making coconut products, coconuts must be collected and opened. Coconut is abundant on the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica and can be collected from the ground. The collection and opening of coconut can employ six people.

Coconut fibers

  Once the skin of the coconut has been removed, the vertical fibers can be accessed. There are two types of coconut fibers – long fibers, which are located surrounding the shell, and short fibers which are found connecting the shell to the stem. A simple machine can be used to separate the two types of fibers. Baskets can be made directly from the extracted fiber, and can be used to grow various plants. With further processing, long fibers can be used to produce rope, shoes, clothes, or carpets. Short fibers can be mixed with soil to increase water retention. It is possible to remploy five people for transporting coconuts, working the machines, processing the fiber, and producing items such as baskets, ropes and clothes.

Coconut soil

  Coconut soil is found between the fibers and can be extracted by sifting broken down fiber produced by the machine. Coconut soil is an extremely efficient substrate in which to grow plants, as it provides the plant with ideal conditions for growth. It has excellent water retention while allowing adequate aeration and allows the roots to better access soil nutrients. Due to the efficient conditions, photosynthesis can occur at a faster rate. It can be mixed with compost to make a highly nutritious soil. Five people can be employed in the processing of coconut soil.

Coconut shell

  The shell of the coconut can be used to make artesian crafts, such as cups, bottles, and jewelry. The processing of the shell can employ two more people.

Coconut meat

  Coconut meat is found directly under the shell. The meat itself can be used to prepare various dishes.  This can employ three people. The meat can also be used to make coconut milk, coconut oil, and as a feed for animals. Coconut milk is made by boiling the coconut in water and straining off the meat. Coconut oil is a valued commodity and highly sought after in the market. Processing coconuts into coconut oil alone raises the value from 25 cents to a dollar per coconut. It is made by boiling the milk further and skimming off the residue left on the surface of the mixture. This can employ three people. The waste resulting from both these products can be processed to form a nutritious feed for animals such as fish, crabs, chickens, or pigs. This can employ a further three people. 

Risks and Challenges

our primary challenge will open the domestic market of oil, fiber, substrate and all the innovative products we make.

Our pincipal virtue is perseverance and optimism with which we are facing this project, besides the excellent quality of our products, because for the last 14 months, we have been experimenting with fibers, substrates and oils. To determine the quality, with excellent results

Other ways you can help

  • You can come and perform volunteer or internship with us at: sustainability, biodiversity, community and turtles www.queloniosdelcaribe.org
  • Please spread this campaign and generates echo among your contacts.
  • Remember use the tools to share Indiegogo

story:
Donate to fund the first Community Land Trust in the Birmingham, AL area. Give by November 9, 2015 to be a part of this inspiring historic event! You can be a voice for justice in the Birmingham city!

The Dynamite Hill – Smithfield Community Land Trust:

  • In honor of the bravery of those black families who defended their homes and resisted the egregious oppressions of the Bull Connor era.
  • As a community effort to resist gentrification.
  • To preserve the cultural integrity of the Smithfield Community. 

Today, Birmingham’s Western Area Framework Expansion efforts towards the revitalization of the city can be used to either gentrify the community or to address racial, economic, and environmental justice.

STAND with us to ensure justice is finally served in Birmingham, Alabama! DONATE by November 9!

The Dynamite Hill – Smithfield Community Land Trust would be the first community land trust in the Greater Birmingham Area.

Once established, the land trust will be used to maintain black and working class land ownership, develop low-income homeownership programs, and create affordable land options for community based cooperative businesses.

How Your Money Will Be Used

By giving, your valuable donation will be used to provide a historic change for the city of Birmingham, and the “Dynamite Hill” and Smithfield Communities in particular:

  • $2,000 for incorporation of the land trust, and to send two East Thomas community members and one MCAP staff person to the National Community Land Trust Network training in Lexington, Kentucky in October.
  • $7,000 for purchase of the first plot of land.
  • If we go over goal: Any additional money raised will be earmarked towards the purchase of a second property which has already been identified.


Background:

The Dynamite Hill – Smithfield Community Land Trust is a community land trust initiated by Susan Diane Mitchell, a 24-year resident of Birmingham. For Susan and her family of nine children, Dynamite Hill is home, and it’s a home with a rich and vibrant history that deserves cultural preservation and recognition.

“Dynamite Hill” is an important neighborhood in Birmingham’s history. This area of Smithfield earned its nickname site of numerous bombings against black citizens of Birmingham by the Ku Klux Klan and others because these black residents were moving into the area after segregated zoning laws were overturned in 1950. The Angela Y. Davis family home at the top of Dynamite Hill is a central feature of this community, and serves as a constant source of visual inspiration from the view of Susan’s porch across the street. Angela Y. Davis is a personal heroine for Susan, and her inspired writings on the liberation of black people have informed much of Susan’s graduate studies.

Comprehensive Plan, Regional Planning, and Community Land Trusts:

In 2014, the Birmingham City Council and Mayor approved a Comprehensive Plan for the redevelopment of Birmingham. The City of Birmingham suggested the creation of Community Land Trusts, which can be found in sections 8.11 and 8.12 of the Comprehensive Plan. 

In May 2015, the Birmingham City Council and the Regional Planning Commission of Greater Birmingham (RPC) adopted the Western Area Framework Plan to develop three communities (Smithfield, West End, and 5 Points West). Within this plan, Magic City Agriculture Project worked with community leaders and the RPC to include Community Land Trusts into the “Affordable Housing” section of the plan (page 26 of the Western Area Framework Plan).The RPC recommended Magic City Agriculture Project as a partner in the implementation of that plan.


Be a part of history by giving today! Together, we are creating a democratic and sustainable Birmingham, now!

story:
Help support a Syrian Refugee family get a new life in Oakville area, Ontario, Canada


We are witnessing the suffering of fleeing men, women and children from the conflict in Syria, and we can no longer ignore it. The tipping point for me, and many others around the world, was the haunting photo of the boy on the beach. We should never have let this happen to him, his family or others in similar situations.

A few of my neighbours and I are getting together to help sponsor a family to start a new life in Oakville, Ontario, Canada. We ask for your help. To sponsor a family of four, we learned that we need to raise approximately 30,000.  

Of course, if we reach 60,000, we will be able to sponsor two families to come to live in Oakville area, Ontario. 

For more information, please go to:  https://lifelinesyria.ca


What We Need & What You Get


A neighbours' group in Oakville, Ontario, has come together to sponsor a refugee family start a new life in Oakville. The biggest hurdle for us is securing the financial sponsorship for the family. The funds raised will go directly to help a refugee family set up in their new home. In addition to financial donations, we, the neighbourhood group will assist them in adapting to their new home environment. Our priorities will be to ensure that they are well supported in order to get back to a normal family life. We, the Oakville Family Sponsor group, will assist them in getting the children back into school, finding employment for the parents, getting parents into english language lessons, securing healthcare services, helping them navigate around the city, and of course provide them with emotional support from loving and concern citizens and neighbours.  


The Impact

The impact on this refugee family will be immeasurable. They will be able to raise their children in a stable, peaceful and prosperous community. 


Risks & Challenges


We are a newly formed group of neighbours who are concern with the plight of the Syrian people and the refugees fleeing the conflict in Syria.  All funds raised will go directly to supporting this family to adapt to their new lives in the Oakville area.

If we are close to our target, we will continue to fund raise to ensure we have sufficient funds to support the refugee family in the most critical time in their lives.

If we do not reach our target and other fundraising activities do not yield enough funds we will donate the accumulated funds to: 

 Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) International 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate but would still like to help, we will be looking for household item donations for the family.  Please help us get the word out and ensure that at least one family can resettle in the Oakville area, Ontario.

story:
Facts:

  • 80% of women's deaths in the Dominican Republic are domestic violence related.
  • Machismo, femicide, sex tourism and lack of employment are the major issues that women live with in the Dominican Republic on a daily basis.
  • Domestic violence homicides and tragedies against women have been categorized as a “national tragedy” in the Dominican Republic.

Femicide [fem-uh-sahyd] (noun) : The act of killing a woman by a man who considers her his property.

Our Story

Empress Luxe Punta Cana is an innovative mobile spa project created to help mitigate the alarmingly high percentage of women exposed to and murdered by domestic violence and sex trafficking in the Dominican Republic. Currently, the Dominican Republic is one of the most dangerous countries for women to live in due to lack of employment and abuse.

Empress Luxe Facts:

  • Empress Luxe will start as a mobile spa in Punta Cana, Dominican Republic and will provide victims of domestic violence and sex trafficking with dignified work.
  • Empress Luxe works to enable women and single mothers to escape from domestic violence and sex trafficking in order to become financially independent and self empowered.
  • Empress Luxe organizes counseling and workshops for the psychological, emotional and physical healing of victims in conjunction with non profit organization partnerships.
  • Empress Luxe will provide beauty/spa school training, tuition and book stipends for victims of domestic violence and sex trafficking leading to work at Empress Luxe Spa throughout the Dominican Republic.
  • Empress Luxe also creates employment for victims through handmade, luxury locally grown spa products.

Challenges:

Challenges include the safety of individual victims after escaping violent situations, however Empress Luxe has safety plans in place.

A little about me:

My name is Aida Ortiz Pereyra. I am a humanitarian, beauty professional, wife and mother of two beautiful children; an eight-year-old boy named Numa and a 7-month-old girl named Gabriella.

My family is originally from the Dominican Republic and my sisters and I (there are 4 of us) are the first generation born in the United States. My parents worked hard to raise us. You can learn a little more about me and my family through a brief recap of a documentary made about us called "My American Girls A Dominican Story." The documentary was made when I was a sophmore in high school and I am now 33 years old; that was about 17 years ago (sigh). I'm the middle child of the story.

"My American Girls A Dominican Story" creatively portrayed the common theme in my life; an American girl with a Dominican story. Although I was born and raised in New York, a big part of my heart is centered in my Dominican roots. Over the last 15 years, violence and abuse has, unfortunately, become a part of Dominican culture; in particular violence and abuse against women.

My father recently retired and moved back to the Dominican Republic after 30 years of hard work and citizenship in the United States. In October 2015, just six weeks after my daughter Gabriella was born, my father was robbed at gunpoint in his own home and was nearly killed. This has become common during the last five years due to lack of employment and emerging social challenges throughout the Dominican Republic. After learning about his story and about the stories of many people I know in the Dominican Republic (mostly women), my heart was broken. I decided that I had to try to solve this problem one way or another and the idea for Empress Luxe Punta Cana was born.

My idea for Empress Luxe began with the idea to offer luxury spa services through non-toxic beauty products and green juices (for beautification from the inside out). Later, my idea grew to incorporate the mitigation of social issues, in particular those of women with little to no resources. It has taken me years to put all of the pieces of this beauty, spa and social injustice puzzle together. I am extremely happy to finally be moving forward in order to mitigate social injustice.

Thank you for being a part of this journey. Thank you for helping victims of violence move into a more positive world. Thank you for being a humanitarian and for your compassion. I look forward to keeping you updated in the progress of this mission.

Sincerely, 

Aida Ortiz - Pereyra
story_txt: Facts:80% of women's deaths in the Dominican Republic are domestic violence related.Machismo, femicide, sex tourism and lack of employment are the major issues that women live with in the Dominican Republic on a daily basis.Domestic violence homicides and tragedies against women have been categorized as a “national tragedy” in the Dominican Republic.Femicide [fem-uh-sahyd] (noun) : The act of killing a woman by a man who considers her his property.Our StoryEmpress Luxe Punta Cana is an innovative mobile spa project created to help mitigate the alarmingly high percentage of women exposed to and murdered by domestic violence and sex trafficking in the Dominican Republic. Currently, the Dominican Republic is one of the most dangerous countries for women to live in due to lack of employment and abuse.Empress Luxe Facts:Empress Luxe will start as a mobile spa in Punta Cana, Dominican Republic and will provide victims of domestic violence and sex trafficking with dignified work.Empress Luxe works to enable women and single mothers to escape from domestic violence and sex trafficking in order to become financially independent and self empowered.Empress Luxe organizes counseling and workshops for the psychological, emotional and physical healing of victims in conjunction with non profit organization partnerships.Empress Luxe will provide beauty/spa school training, tuition and book stipends for victims of domestic violence and sex trafficking leading to work at Empress Luxe Spa throughout the Dominican Republic.Empress Luxe also creates employment for victims through handmade, luxury locally grown spa products.Challenges:Challenges include the safety of individual victims after escaping violent situations, however Empress Luxe has safety plans in place.A little about me:My name is Aida Ortiz Pereyra. I am a humanitarian, beauty professional, wife and mother of two beautiful children; an eight-year-old boy named Numa and a 7-month-old girl named Gabriella.My family is originally from the Dominican Republic and my sisters and I (there are 4 of us) are the first generation born in the United States. My parents worked hard to raise us. You can learn a little more about me and my family through a brief recap of a documentary made about us called "My American Girls A Dominican Story." The documentary was made when I was a sophmore in high school and I am now 33 years old; that was about 17 years ago (sigh). I'm the middle child of the story."My American Girls A Dominican Story" creatively portrayed the common theme in my life; an American girl with a Dominican story. Although I was born and raised in New York, a big part of my heart is centered in my Dominican roots. Over the last 15 years, violence and abuse has, unfortunately, become a part of Dominican culture; in particular violence and abuse against women.My father recently retired and moved back to the Dominican Republic after 30 years of hard work and citizenship in the United States. In October 2015, just six weeks after my daughter Gabriella was born, my father was robbed at gunpoint in his own home and was nearly killed. This has become common during the last five years due to lack of employment and emerging social challenges throughout the Dominican Republic. After learning about his story and about the stories of many people I know in the Dominican Republic (mostly women), my heart was broken. I decided that I had to try to solve this problem one way or another and the idea for Empress Luxe Punta Cana was born.My idea for Empress Luxe began with the idea to offer luxury spa services through non-toxic beauty products and green juices (for beautification from the inside out). Later, my idea grew to incorporate the mitigation of social issues, in particular those of women with little to no resources. It has taken me years to put all of the pieces of this beauty, spa and social injustice puzzle together. I am extremely happy to finally be moving forward in order to mitigate social injustice.Thank you for being a part of this journey. Thank you for helping victims of violence move into a more positive world. Thank you for being a humanitarian and for your compassion. I look forward to keeping you updated in the progress of this mission.Sincerely, Aida Ortiz - Pereyra

story:
My name is Marshall Hanbury Jr and while working as a Research Specialist at the Judgment and Decisions Lab at the University of Virginia's Frank Batten School of Leadership and Public Policy, I quickly became aware of the large circle of thinkers, educators and leaders that shape the vibrant business, innovation and entrepreneurship ecosystem of the Charlottesville area. I was not only impressed by the magnitude of change that they were inspiring in our world, both locally and globally, but I also really, really wanted to chat with them and find out what really made them tick. That is why, in June of 2015, I decided to start Conversion Factor. In that brief time I have had the honor to talk with such business luminaries as R. Edward Freeman, Dr. Bobby Parmar, Dr. Christine Mahoney and Victor Schiller. On top of that, my conversations have ranged from the exciting, with local Charlottesville business innovation guru Tracey Greene, to the inspiring, with Public Benefit Corporation Madidrop CEO David Dusseau, to the truly spectacular, with University of Virginia Professor of Astronomy and team member of NASA's Cassini-Huygens mission to Saturn Dr. Anne Verbiscer. All of this provided free of charge to innovative and entrepreneurial listeners both young and old.

Fast forward to the present. Since our founding in 2015 we have gained 4800 new and unique listeners (we continue to gather an average of 500 new listeners each month) and have sponsored a variety of inspiring events, including TEDx Charlottesville 2016 and ReinventED Lab's ProblemSolvathon . If we continue this trend, we are set to not only grow as a viable media brand name in the Charlottesville area but become the go-to clearing house of ideas in Central and Western Virginia. Additionally, our sponsorship of events has expanded the conversation of innovation and entrepreneurship to the citizens and students of the region. But we can't do anything but tread water without your support.

There is an extreme upwelling of interest in our blooming entrepreneurial ecosystem here in Central and Southern Virginia and I feel we are on the brink of an exciting era of change. Conversion Factor will place itself in the midst of that change and champion our triumphs to other parts of the nation and, for that matter, the world.

What We Need

These are the costs I and my team anticipate for the coming year:

  • Rebranding costs $500
  • Internet costs $200
  • $1000 towards sponsorships directed toward education, innovation and business causes in the region
  • $300 marketing costs

The Impact

Ultimately, it is our goal at Conversion Factor to properly represent and promote all business, entrepreneurship and innovation topics in the Central and Southern Virginia region and your sponsorship would benefit business leaders and innovators throughout the Commonwealth as well.

story:
Short Summary

Tony's Pizza Ovens was created out of the love for family and good quality food. Our love for Pizza and wood-fired foods started the development of a regular sized portable oven that creates one of the best Pizzas you'll ever make.  Giving you a way to cook high-end quality foods in your own backyard.  You'll never go out for Pizza again.  

  • I'm Tony G, my family and I want you to be able to enjoy cooking in your backyard as much as we have.
  • We've designed and tested our portable backyard wood fired oven and we're ready for the next step.
  • It's time to get our wood fired ovens into production with your help.

What We Need & What You Get

Reaching our goal of $125,000.

  • Will allow us to finish R&D on our 1st generation oven.
  • Manufacture a sizable inventory to bring our oven to the general public.
  • Develop a marketing program for large box stores.  i.e. Home Depot, Costco, Sam's Club.
  • Set up a warehouse to store inventory for fast and easy delivery.
  • We've got perks from personal pizza peels all the way up to letting us cook for you  in your very own Tony G Pizza oven.
  • Every dollar raised will go into the final development and manufacturing of our 1st 100 units.

The Impact

  • When you select a Tony's Pizza Oven Perk, you will receive one of the finest outdoor ovens on the market.
  • Smaller Perks will include some of the best recipes for anything from pizzas, steaks, to roasted vegetables and salmon.  
  • We have successfully created (what we feel) is the most user-friendly outdoor oven available today.   
  • Our passion in delivering the highest quality oven and the best possible food recipes to our Contributors is truly Tony's Pizza Ovens mission.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is creating a market that currently does not exist.  There are many outdoor options for cooking food, most revolving around the grill, not an oven.  We have created an option that has been accepted by all those we have cooked for and sold several of our unique oven and interest around Tony's Pizza Ovens is growing.  This gives us the confidence we need to formalize Tony's Pizza Ovens as the leader into a new market.  

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who are interested in Tony's Pizza Ovens but cannot contribute all we ask is that you forward this campaign to as many people as possible.  We will appreciate any and all of your support and can add you to our email list for updates.  We look forward to delivering  Tony's Pizza Ovens quarterly progress reports everyone interested.

PLEASE HELP US GET THE WORD OUT.  PASS THIS LINK ON TO ALL YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY.  THANK YOU!

story:
Who we are:

Located in New Paltz, New York, Good Dog Good Bone is a subscription service for your dog:

  • We are working with local beef farms to get your dog the freshest and highest quality bones. 
  • Your donation will contribute to the start up costs of our business.
  • We are committed to obtaining the best bones, and with minimal processing ship them frozen fresh to our customers. By supporting us you are aiding in our initial setup so that we can offer you the top rate service you will come to love and expect from us.
  • Unlike other subscription services, ours is specifically geared toward the true consumer of our product: your dog. We are not pandering to the dog owner, we are giving a good dog a good bone. Simple as that. 

What We Need & What You Get:

We are estimating that $2,000 will get our business going. The break down on the use of funds raised is as follows:

  1. Freezer for storage of bones before shipping. $250 (found used on craigslist)
  2. Packing materials/Shipping Supplies for safely shipping frozen bones. $300 (approx.)
  3. Vacuum Sealer for preserving freshness from the farm to your dog's drooling mouth. $200 (approx.)
  4. Scale and printer for ensuring full transparency between GDGB and our customers. You will sign up for a weight range based on the size of your dog. $400 (webstaurant.com)
  5. Tools for cutting and cleaning up bones $250 (approx.)
  6. Website and business startup Expenses- Owning our URL, the hosting of the subscription service, and the paperwork processing of starting a business adds up fast! We would like to to use Quickbooks, which will be critical in effectively organizing and running the company. Help us offset the cost of creating a business out of thin air and determination! $600 (approx.)
  • We are excited to offer you perks in appreciation of your contributions:
  1. We will be extending shout outs to contributors, thanking them and featuring their beautiful pets on our social media platforms.
  2. We will be using this as an opportunity for people to sample our product before committing to our subscription service.
  3. Larger contributions will unlock secret perks like free shipping on subscription service and more!
  • All funds used will go towards the materials listed above. If we don't meet our goal, they are listed in order of priority for launching our business.

The Impact

  • Your contributions will help move a fledgling business into existence. All your support is appreciated. We are excited to get off the ground and make doggies and their owners happy!
  • Good Dog Good Bone is run by Emily Crocetti, who is inspired by her love and gratitude for dogs. She hopes to adopt a canine companion in the very near future! GDGB is an idea for a simple service that is convenient and wholesome. Supporting us will be helping offer a great product to people who may not be able to make a trip up to a beef farm to buy bones regularly for their dog.

Challenges

We have already done the research, filed the paperwork, and contacted our state's department of Agriculture Pet Feed department. We have the go-ahead to start sending our good bones to our customers! The biggest challenge is raising funds to get moving. With your help, we can be on the way to making tails wag and people smile.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute but would like to help us out, we thank you too!

  • Make some noise! Share our indiegogo page on your social media platforms and help us gain traction.
  • Like and share our Facebook page, follow us on Twitter and Instagram, help us by posting photos and giving us some love!
  • Tell your friends about www.gooddoggoodbone.com (currently under construction) and get excited for the launch!


THANK YOU!

story:
Short Summary

8 Hour Energy Patches was formed in 2011 to answer the need for an all natural alternative to energy products currently on the market. After years of usage, consumers have begun to see the adverse effects of highly concentrated caffeinated products to their bodies which include but are not limited to:

1. Palpitations

2. Tremors

3. Agitation

4. Gastrointestinal upset

5. Chest pain

6. Dizziness

7. Paraesthesia (tingling or numbing of the skin)

8. Insomnia

9. Respiratory distress

10. Headache

11, Death

Over the past five years, we have perfected our proprietary adhesive technology (for seamless trans-dermal delivery) as well as refined our product packaging for mass market retailers.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We value our Indiegogo contributors as early adopters of our product and to show our sincere gratitude and appreciation, an early adopter discount will apply to our perks for the duration of our campaign. The greater the quantity, the greater the discount. With your support and contributions, we hope to achieve our ultimate end goal: The seamless ability to satisfy a production run for a mass market retailer with over 4000+ retail stores nationwide.

 

The Impact

Bringing our product, an all natural energy alternative and what we believe to be a disruptive force among competing energy products to mass market retail allows any and everyone to have easy access to a safe, effective, all natural energy alternative.

Risks & Challenges

Our company is a full functioning entity, and we are 100% prepared and ready to meet all demand for this campaign. The only foreseeable challenge to our end goal is the time-frame to execute a mass market retail launch. We have identified this may very well be rolled out in stages, such as a regional launch initially before reaching a national stage. Our optimism suggests an executed agreement by Q1 2017 but the patience during our development process, has taught us to always leave room for error or delay.

Other Ways You Can Help

Visit our website at www.eighthourenergy.com

If you like our product, please tell others about it!

An Interview with Our CEO

Mass Market Retailers Vol. 32 No. 12 - August 17, 2015

Certifications

 

Trademarks

story:
Hey everyone, like other kids on my childhood I love electronic gadgets and struggle to buy a new gadget from my savings, hate my life whenever the gadget becomes faulty, then I learned to fix it and had a dream of Inventing a gadget which last for 100 years.

Few years before I was able to understood the reason for less durability of devices and its source.

Do you know the devices which are completely powered by battery are more durable than one which are connected to electrical power grid ?

Yes stable and clean voltage triples the lifespan of all electrically powered device, using this information I made a research on traditional high voltage protection technology, finally discovered the core reason for less durability and reason for acceleration of e-waste generated globally.  

Then I have Invented a novel device called e-Waste Buster, first version of it was tested and certified at IIT Madras, e-Waste Buster was selected as one best Innovation at UNIDO GCIP (Global Cleantech Innovation Programme).

 

e-WasteBuster is an Eco-friendly, compact and low cost device

capable of reduce 20 % e-waste of future.

Freshelectron award winning startup focused on green innovations, invented a hybrid voltage protection device based on new discovery and novel technology, it is capable of reduce 20 % e-waste of future, three time durability for your electronics and electrical devices so it improves productivity, saves thousands of dollar and time.

                                                       

 

 

 

 

 

 

e-Waste Buster

Smartest Hybrid Protection Device

Filters & Regulates Temporary Over Voltage -- Unsafe Voltage  Cutoff -- High Current Cutoff & Neutral Fault Cutoff -- Advance Safe Spike Protection  

 

 

 

As this device helps to a great extent, in enhancing the durability and triples the life span of electrical and electronic devices, there would be huge reduction regarding e-wastage's, hence enables a greener environment.  since it prove to be cost effective and reliable the recurrence of spending on the same device because of malfunctioning would be drastically reduced. When it comes to industries, this product helps a lot for the smooth functioning of machinery there by helps increasing the volume of production phenomenally.

 

Discovery about e-Waste

 

 

 

No any viable and clean innovation in high voltage protection for past 30 years !!

High voltage event and neutral fault event are most common electrical line fault event, but the technology found in today electronics and electrical devices are more sophisticated than ever before and very sensible to this temporary over voltage and neutral fault event, so they get wear off and easily damaged by this events.

 

High Voltage Fault Event  are classified into Temporary Over Voltage (TOV)  and Very High Voltage like spike event with different characteristics.

A Metal Oxide Varistor (MOV) is the key component used in almost all electronic & electrical devices to protect from high voltage fault condition, but traditional MOV  based high voltage protection technology are only capable of protecting from spike and it actually degrade and damage your devices on Temporary Over Voltage events, so it don't have a right technology to protect from Temporary Over Voltage event and provide incomplete protection.

So in traditional high voltage protection they use MOV with very low clamping voltage to decrease the damage and shutdown the system completely, this make the system unstable  the protected device becomes dead or e-waste soon.

Important thing to consider is this Temporary Over Voltage event is more frequently occurring event than spike, it the one which makes your smartest devices degrade and dead in short life!

So apart from obsolete technology more than 50 % of e-waste are created by traditional high voltage protection technology,  we are the first to address this hidden issue about e-waste and incompleteness in traditional high voltage protection technology.

 

 

 

    Product Types Available

    1. USA standard of 120 volts 16 A Type B

    2. Indian standard of 240 volts 8 A Type D

    3. UK standard of 240 volts 8 A Type G

     

     

     

    Alpha release (e-Waste Buster v.1), R&D,Testing some of Prototypes..

    A CCTV installation company that has tested this product vouch for the competence and cost worthiness of this product. The same has been the feedback from a wide array of individual from different walks of life.

     

     

     

    Testing some of our prototypes..check this link.

    https://www.facebook.com/freshelectron/videos/v...

     

    About Us  

    Freshelectron team, we are young, innovative, fun and creative team passionate to green innovations. 

    Muthu kumar from India, an artist, designer, inventor and passionate to become a entrepreneur, I have spent more than 8 years in R&D, have invented some devices and received national level award for one of my Innovation on year 2011.

    I became a electronic service engineer from my age 15, then I realized that I can use my drawing skills and creativity in science and nature, I follow Leonardo da Vinci's, he's my source of inspiration to focus in science, nature and green innovations.

    I am here because, i have all-ready spent more than 4 years waiting to get My grant from My government, but in reality it take more time than what we Dream :)

     

     

    Let us Make our Green Planet

    • Help us to reach our words and make some noise about our campaign.
    • use the Indiegogo share tools!

    Thanks for you Time :)

e-Waste Buster
Smartest Hybrid Protection Device
Filters & Regulates Temporary Over Voltage -- Unsafe Voltage  Cutoff -- High Current Cutoff & Neutral Fault Cutoff -- Advance Safe Spike Protection  

 



 
 
As this device helps to a great extent, in enhancing the durability and triples the life span of electrical and electronic devices, there would be huge reduction regarding e-wastage's, hence enables a greener environment.  since it prove to be cost effective and reliable the recurrence of spending on the same device because of malfunctioning would be drastically reduced. When it comes to industries, this product helps a lot for the smooth functioning of machinery there by helps increasing the volume of production phenomenally.
 

Discovery about e-Waste
 
 
 
No any viable and clean innovation in high voltage protection for past 30 years !!
High voltage event and neutral fault event are most common electrical line fault event, but the technology found in today electronics and electrical devices are more sophisticated than ever before and very sensible to this temporary over voltage and neutral fault event, so they get wear off and easily damaged by this events.
 
High Voltage Fault Event  are classified into Temporary Over Voltage (TOV)  and Very High Voltage like spike event with different characteristics.
A Metal Oxide Varistor (MOV) is the key component used in almost all electronic & electrical devices to protect from high voltage fault condition, but traditional MOV  based high voltage protection technology are only capable of protecting from spike and it actually degrade and damage your devices on Temporary Over Voltage events, so it don't have a right technology to protect from Temporary Over Voltage event and provide incomplete protection.

So in traditional high voltage protection they use MOV with very low clamping voltage to decrease the damage and shutdown the system completely, this make the system unstable  the protected device becomes dead or e-waste soon.
Important thing to consider is this Temporary Over Voltage event is more frequently occurring event than spike, it the one which makes your smartest devices degrade and dead in short life!
So apart from obsolete technology more than 50 % of e-waste are created by traditional high voltage protection technology,  we are the first to address this hidden issue about e-waste and incompleteness in traditional high voltage protection technology.
 


 
 

Product Types Available

1. USA standard of 120 volts 16 A Type B
2. Indian standard of 240 volts 8 A Type D
3. UK standard of 240 volts 8 A Type G
 
 
 
Alpha release (e-Waste Buster v.1), R&D,Testing some of Prototypes..
A CCTV installation company that has tested this product vouch for the competence and cost worthiness of this product. The same has been the feedback from a wide array of individual from different walks of life.
 
 

 
Testing some of our prototypes..check this link.
https://www.facebook.com/freshelectron/videos/v...
 
About Us  

Freshelectron team, we are young, innovative, fun and creative team passionate to green innovations. 

Muthu kumar from India, an artist, designer, inventor and passionate to become a entrepreneur, I have spent more than 8 years in R&D, have invented some devices and received national level award for one of my Innovation on year 2011.
I became a electronic service engineer from my age 15, then I realized that I can use my drawing skills and creativity in science and nature, I follow Leonardo da Vinci's, he's my source of inspiration to focus in science, nature and green innovations.
I am here because, i have all-ready spent more than 4 years waiting to get My grant from My government, but in reality it take more time than what we Dream :)
 

 
Let us Make our Green Planet
Help us to reach our words and make some noise about our campaign.
use the Indiegogo share tools!
Thanks for you Time :)

story:
Who We Are:

As a gender studies major, one of Anansi’s founders, Lindsey Bacon was motivated by the injustice of women all over the world. At the age of 22 she traveled to Ghana. Lindsey fell in love with the culture of West Africa and began building relationships with women in the fishing villages. She learned that when women don’t have jobs, it causes lasting effects on families and the entirety of the local economy. Lindsey became aware that 48 percent of youth in Ghana do not have access to jobs.

Lindsey knew she could not just vacation to Africa and never come back; she needed to be a part of the solution. As a result, she paired up with the CEO of Field Services Unlimited, Sue Shalley to create digital training and meaningful jobs for underemployed youth around the world.

Serendipitously, Lindsey met Vera Asuamuzuah in their international development masters program at Regis University and discovered that Vera was born and raised in Ghana and shared many of the same passions. Now Vera is on the ground in West Africa, as Anansi’s first trainer teaching young adults AutoCAD skills.


Sue and Lindsey on the left, and Vera on the right.

 

Anansi International is creating digital jobs for youth starting in Ghana, West Africa so that they can stay within their communities while supporting their families, and receive the opportunity to go to University.

There is an untapped pool of qualified young adults from disadvantaged communities who are unemployed. We provide them with job opportunities and skills training so that they become eligible to obtain digital jobs for companies around the world.

Through our model, people who are in poverty are employed and receive training and support while receiving pay. Once they receive the necessary training, they begin work, which in turn, results in personal and local economic boost. Jobs turn into careers, wages continue to increase and resumes are built.

 

What We Do:

Anansi International provides quality technical services for businesses while creating job opportunities for those who need them.

Our first service provided is CAD - Computer-Aided Design and Drafting. CAD skills are utilized in a multitude of industries including architecture, engineering, design and fashion. Through Anansi, trainees are learning how to draft in AutoCAD software for architectural projects, yet the skills learned can be applied to any area of interest with partnered universities in the future.

2D Architectural CAD Sample drafted in AutoCAD

 

How it Works:

We begin with on-site measurements and hand-drawn blueprints, then transform them into digital form with AutoCAD (computer-aided design and drafting). After that, our US-based quality control team evaluates the digital drawings for quality and consistency. Finally, completed digital floorplans are delivered to the client.

AutoCAD is computer-aided design and drafting software used to create 2D and 3D models and drafts. It is used in many sectors including architectural planning, engineering including mechanical, electrical, and civil, graphic design, 3D printing, video game design, fashion industry including jewelry design, and industrial design for manufacturing.

While we are starting with what we are experts in (AutoCAD), we understand that there is a thriving technological market, and we aim to spread our web into various sectors that offer growth and opportunity.

                       

Through the use of high technology skills like AutoCAD, Revit, Quickbooks and more, youth will simultaneously be brought through basic entrepreneurship training to empower their ability to apply these skills in their communities. They will be given the opportunity to create a business plan and encouraged to utilize their technology skills to enhance the impact of their socially conscious business initiatives to address local problems they see in their community.

 

What We Need:

We are raising $50,000 in seed funding in order to support our start-up costs including:

Technical training

Software

Equipment

Travel expenses

Stipends for trainees

With a donation, you get:

For your support, we’ll send you a handcrafted item from our partner organization, Conscious Collaborative. All items are made by economically-empowered local artisans in beneficiary fishing communities in the Western Region of Ghana.

Why this campaign?

There are 223 million unemployed or underemployed young adults around the world today. With your support we are creating dignified tech jobs for hundreds of young adults that will impact the lives of thousands.

Each young adult we work with has an average of 4 dependents at home that their salaries go to help support. That means by creating even one digital job, we are impacting the lives of 5 people in disadvantaged communities and boosting their local economies.

Within the first year of operations, Anansi International will create 15 jobs impacting the lives of over 60 peoples lives in disadvantaged communities.

 

Can you donate from outside the USA?

Absolutely. International donations are accepted via credit card. Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.

 

Want a tax-receipt?

No problem. If you would like a donation tax receipt for your contribution please email our partner non-profit Conscious Collaborative at consciouscollaborative@gmail.com and write Donation Designation - Indiegogo in the subject line. Please indicate the amount and name of the donor that would like their contribution to be tax-deductible.

 

Thank you for being a part of the solution!

story:
The Vision of Twisted Eggroll

Being an avid cooker, it is not abnormal to receive a request from a loved one to cook.  This is exactly what occurred for the first two eggrolls I made: cheesecake and cheese steak.  Shortly after, a vision was placed on my heart to create Twisted Eggroll.  I started it as a catering business in 2015 to see the response from potential clients, and the reviews have been excellent.  Now it is time for phase two in taking this vision on the road with a food truck!

I have accomplished a multitude of facets in life thus far: two degrees, teaching English in Costa Rica, owning property, chairing committees, serving on a board, volunteering, maintaining a successful career and more.  But to date, the greatest accomplishment of all has been surviving the loss of my father to ALS.  The void I have from within, I fill with pursuing my passion to make him proud.  In the years I was blessed to have him, he instilled some amazing things in me; one being to become an entrepreneur and another being that the greatest thing you leave behind is your legacy.  

Therefore, the VISION, is to take my passion for cooking and leave an unforgettable legacy through Twisted Eggroll.  My choice of charity through this vision will be the ALS Association (http://www.alsa.org/).  I would be more than grateful for any donations to stand in agreement with this vision and to bless as many people as possible with these incredibly delicious eggrolls!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2-qpLnaL4BA

Dreams Can Come True With Support From You

As you can see, I have big dreams, but it needs funding.  This is where you come in!  I have chosen the contractor, Midwest Food Trucks (http://midwestfoodtrucks.com/), which I would like to work with to build Twisted Eggroll's food truck.  
  • Used truck under 100,00 miles - $20,000
  • Contract Work (frying baskets, flat top, burner, hot holder, ventilation hood, refrigerator, etc) - $60,000
The contractor needs half of the money to start work.  Therefore, the purpose of this campaign  is to raise half ($40,000) of the total amount ($80,000) to help towards purchasing the truck and making a down payment to start the project.  The contractor advised work could take 3-5 months for completion. 
Your gift will be contributed towards this final amount whether or not the campaign is reached in full.  A business loan will be obtained for the balance that remains.  The impact of your gift will start Twisted Eggroll out on a positive road and require less debt as licenses, permits, and initial food supplies are just a few of many other things that still need to be funded outside the truck.  Moreover, your contribution will aid in bringing a unique concept that will twist the concept of eggrolls as we know them.  

Testimonials

“Dear Miss Randle: 

  In this world where so many entrees were just starting to get a little boring and repetitive, your infusion of these multi-diverse eggrolls have been just what I needed to add another option to my food choices and pleasures.  I must say that the cheese steak eggroll is my favorite dinner eggroll with the apple cheesecake eggroll being my favorite dessert eggroll, although everything I had so far has been so delicious.  Now, with that said, there are still so many options of eggrolls on the menu that I have not experienced yet, and I so look forward to hopefully trying them all!!!  Please continue blessing us with your cooking skill and ability while using that wonderful imagination of yours to keep us surprised to know what type of eggroll can she come up with next?! “

-  Stanley (Atlanta, GA)

“I recently came across Twisted Eggroll at a family birthday party.  Everyone was talking about the egg rolls. As I manned the grill I kept seeing the trays of egg rolls disappear.  I had someone quickly make me a plate and I asked that they put the egg rolls on my plate first.  After I was done grilling I ate my plate and quickly devoured the egg rolls.  I had to see what all the hub bub was about.  I was not disappointed. I had the pepperoni/sausage pizza egg roll first.  I was surprised at the flavor and the fact that it was real pepperoni, Italian sausage, and mozzarella cheese inside.  I quickly devoured it and moved on to the second one, the philly cheese steak.  As soon as I bit into it I went back to get another.  This egg roll was so good that I stole one off of my cousin’s plate.  I had three philly cheese steak rolls before I touched anything else on my plate.  As the young kids say nowadays “it was fye”.  I live in Detroit and the next time I come back to Chicago I will be ordering some Twisted Eggroll.  I can’t wait to try the dessert ones!!!!”

-  James G (Detroit, MI)

“When I first found out about Twisted Eggroll I was intrigued but when I tasted it, I was blown away! I didn't know so many flavors and so much creativity could be done with just a simple eggroll! From now on Twisted Eggroll will definitely be my new, and favorite, way to snack.”

-  Hassan (Burnham, IL)

“I love the sweet potato pie egg rolls! Perfect dish for any event. I ordered the egg rolls for a family holiday party and my family loved them!”

-  Lakecia (Calumet Park, IL)


Risks & Challenges

  • Generator Theft: Although this has been a trend, the vehicle will be well insured and will be stored in a secured location when not in use.  
  • Licenses & Permits:  By working with a great contractor, they will have all the necessary codes that need to be met in Chicago.  Starting off with a truck up to standard makes it an easier process to obtain licenses and permits.  Although, it will be a difficult process, being proactive with the right build will minimize the delay in licenses and permits.  
  • Health & Safety:  I have already passed my ServSafe Sanitation test and have my certification to work in the State of Illinois and the city of Chicago.  
  • Commercial Kitchen:  It is required for all food trucks to store, prepare, and cook food in a commissary or commercial kitchen although the options are limited which makes it difficult.  I have visited a few kitchens and have settled on using Kitchen Chicago (http://www.kitchenchicago.com).  

Other Ways You Can Support

If you are unable to financially contribute, please know that you can still support by spreading the word.  Feel free to pass the URL for this campaign to family and friends.  Also, please keep Twisted Eggroll in mind for future events to cater.  Thank you so much for your consideration and time.  Be blessed!

story:
We Need Your Help


Are you worried about your elderly loved ones?  In realizing how quality care continues to top the list of needs and aging in place continues to top the list of wants.

Mind-Body-Soul Connection LLC, is transitioning from in-home personal care service to a full-fledged elder day services.  In doing this, we will be able to serve a greater number of older adults, and  take some of the responsibility off caregivers.

 A Research Report by the National Conference of State Legislatures... 

We need backers.  It would be greatly appreciate it if you could help us and make a donation of $20, and ask 20 social media friends, associates and family members to donate $20 to our campaign, and ask them to pay it forward to 20 others.  So together we can make a difference in empowering and enriching lives of older adults keeping them connected with their family and in the community.

Donations comes from the heart and are appreciated and would be acknowledged on our Face Book, Twitter, Website or in our Newsletter in your name or loved ones' name or business.  Refer to campaign list for additional perks.

The health and wellness of the caregiver is as important as the health and wellness of elderly loved ones.  Our goal is to serve both through 5 Dimensions of Wellness Program.  Our programs will provide much needed socialization, education and wellness opportunities for older adults with chronic conditions and early stage memory loss and their caregivers as well.  We know that generations of families will benefit from a community program such as this. 

Serving our aging population is a great way to make a difference in the lives of our aging population and help them to build strong relationships which are a significant component to improve and extend quality of life among people of all ages. 


Meet Crystal, a Millennial Caregiver shares her story of the stress and frustration that comes with the responsibility of being a caregiver for her 79 year old mother.



Meet Shawanta, a Millennial Caregiver express the worried, stressed & frustration that comes with the responsibility of being a Caregiver for her 79 year old grandmother. 




Meet the Founder

Hello,

My name is Janet Y. Mackins.  For more than 10 years I have been serving aging senior citizens.  I have been a Caregiver, Certified Home Health Aide, and for the John H. Boner Community Center in Indianapolis, Indiana, I was the Senior Socialization and Wellness Coordinator.  I want to make a difference in the lives of senior citizens.  I am a passionate advocate for seniors and volunteer my time as an Ambassador for the Marion County Council On Aging.

Throughout my life's journey I have had the privilege of living out different career paths that have developed, cultivated, and catapulted me to where I am today.  About midway through my professional career I decided to change direction.  I pursued and obtained a Master's Degree in Gerontology from Ball State University.  Living as a baby boomer myself I began to see firsthand where I could be an asset to redefining the quality of life in aging.  I continue to explore the different facets of issues facing senior citizens today.  Quality care continues to top the list of needs and aging in place continues to top the list of wants.  I believe MBS Connection Elder Day Services addresses both.

I am a woman of faith, a mother and grandmother.  My starting point in honoring God is serving others, especially our elders, and enriching every life I touch.  I feel privileged and grateful to be able to pursue my calling through this God-given business, Mind-Body-Soul Connection LLC. 



What We Need?

Mind-Body-Soul Connection LLC hopes to raise $150,000 for the Startup Capital for first year expenses.  All proceeds from this campaign are to be used exclusively for:

  • 4,200 sq. ft. facilities expense includes Security Deposit, Rent, Build-out, Utilities and Internet etc.; for potential location on the Northwest sector of Indianapolis, IN. 
  • Operating Professional Costs includes Attorney Fees, Liability Insurance, Accountant Fees, and Quarterly Taxes.
  • Payroll & Benefits includes staff  to be in compliance with staff-to-clients ratios according to FSSA guidelines.
  • Registered Nurse
  • Certified Medication Aide 
  • 4-Certified Nurse Aides(CNA)
  • Administrative Assistant
  • Appliances include Refrigerator, Freezer, Range and Microwave Oven.
  • Office Furniture/Equipment includes Computers, Printers, Fax Machine, Office Supplies, and Marketing Material.
  • Furniture and Adult Care Equipment includes a mininal of 5 6-ft round tables, 20-cushion arm chairs, sofa & chair, handicapped accessible toilet seats, Dehumidifier, Storage Organizers, Corelle Dishes & Flatware etc.
  • Television/Entertainment Equipment includes Television, DVR, Stereo Entertainment System  and 5 Headsets (for music therapy).
  • Medical Equipment includes AED Defibrillator, First Aid Kit, and Blood Pressure Monitor.
  • Additional miscellaneous equipment and materials to meet the needs of clients.

In addition to monetary donations, we will also be very grateful to receive any in-kind donations of the above mention items.

We have a 3-year Financial Projections in place; below is a graph of our first year projection that projects MBS Connection Elder Day Services will generate a net income within a year from our opening date based on serving a minimal of 19 clients per month  and raising $150,000. 


Total Payroll & Benefits:  $96,160

Total Facilities Cost:  $36,075

Total Operating Cost:  $38,512

If we don't reach our entire funding goal we will consider three options:
  • We will reach out to local churches and community organizations to incubate MBS Connection Elder Day Services in a church or other facility, instead of a traditional elder day services serving maximum of 25 clients in our own facility.
  • If we raise $50,000 we will be able to provide the basic level services which is non medical, this would decrease staff and other facility expenses. 
  • We will add intermediate and advance level services as funding and resources increases.
  • Our last option will be to apply for a business loan from a Small Business Association (SBA) Lender; however this is a last resort as we are hoping to start MBS Connection Elder Day Services debt free. 
If we surpass our goal we will be able to offer scholarships to clients with a combined annual income at or below 150% of the Federal Poverty Guidelines.

We are dedicated to making this a reality for older adults, their caregivers, and the community.

We will implement 5 Dimensions of Wellness:

SOCIAL WELLNESS -


SPIRITUAL WELLNES -


PHYSICAL WELLNESS -


EMOTIONAL WELLNESS -


INTELLECTUAL WELLNES -



What will you receive for your donations?

We are offering several tokens of appreciation for donations:

  • Thank You Card
  • MBS Ceramic Mug
  • Acknowledgement of contribution on Mind-Body-Soul Connection's Website, Face Book, Twitter, and LinkedIn.
  • Your name, loved ones' name,  or company logo on our monthly event calendar for 6 months or a year.
  • Your name or loved ones' name, business listed on a business card size advertisement on our website for a year.
  • Your name, loved ones' name  or company's name engraved on 1/3" plate on a Portrait Frame Perpetual for display in our facility.
  • A scholarship for 3 months (3-day week) in your name, loved ones' name or company's name for an older adult of your choice or selected applicant with households combined annual income at or below 150% of the Federal Poverty Guidelines (Value $2700). 

The Impact

Mind-Body-Soul Connection LLC is the beginning of one woman's journey guided by a God-given vision and passion to help improve and extend quality of life among older adults through transformation wellness.

As more senior citizens, baby boomers, and millennial are drawn to managing the responsibilities of caregiving for their elderly loved ones, are working outside of the home and still have a substantial need for quality adult day services.

According to the Charlene Davis & Entrepreneur Press -June 2010, the senior population in America is expected to double within the next 25 years, from 35 million to 71.5 million. This will create an ever-growing need for quality adult day services.

Did you know that caregivers of the elderly are highly likely to experience the following challenges?

  • Depression (23-85%)
  • Anxiety (16-45%)
  • Chronic illness
  • Social isolation
  • Financial hardship, and/or to retire in poverty






MBS Connection Elder Day Services will provide valuable and much-needed services for a maximum of 25 clients for a successful person-centered approach.  To engage our clients in social, spiritual, physical, emotional and intellectual wellness, and to help caregivers reduce depression symptoms, feeling stress and burnout, and the feeling of isolation.


INTERGENERATIONAL  PROGRAMS -



PERSON-CENTERED APPROACH -



  • TOOLS:  We will also provide tools to help develop confidence to manage challenging behaviors, and problem-solving skills.
  • EDUCATION & RESOURCES:  In addition, we are committed to educate and provide resources to address caregiving and health issues for caregivers and the community.
  • STAY CONNECTED:  We will strive to keep elderly loved ones at home and active in the community for a longer period of time and delay institutionalization. 
  • QUALIFICATION:  The highlights of my qualifications include a Master's Degree in Gerontology from Ball State University.
  • EXPERIENCES:  I have more than 10 years' experience serving senior citizens.  I have been a Caregiver, Certified Home Health Aide, and as the Senior Socialization and Wellness Coordinator for the John H. Boner Community Center in Indianapolis, IN.
  • PROGRAMS & ACTIVITIES:  Over this time, I planned implemented preventive and health promotion activities and programs designed to meet the needs of senior citizens, to enhance their functional abilities and self-esteem; also I facilitated the The Seven Dimensions of Wellness programs at 11 other senior community centers in Indianapolis. 


Ricks and Challenges

The quote from the film My Date With Drew, "If you don't take risk, you'll have a wasted soul."  It is worth taking the risk to begin my journey!

  • PROVIDE A HEALTHY ENVIRONMENT:  We will exercise a sick policy for our clients and staff due to illiness.  Failure to have a proactive policy against contagious diseases and illness may cause caregivers to perceive that our policies fail to minimize risk, and we can lose customers.
  • OPEN COMMUNICATION AND TRUST:  Caregivers need to trust in the safety  of their loved ones under the care of MBS Connection Elder Day Services.  For this reason, we will keep a line of open communication with caregivers, and be open and honest with families about disruptions and concerning situations.  Our staff will be trained in a way that will establish a strong relationship with families. 
  • ENVIRONMENT SAFETY:  We will always have insurance coverage, but above all, we'll be aware of the environment our elders will be in and take as much precaution with each individual safety.  This will prevent or limit an unsafe environment and  risk of a lawsuit.
  • PROPER LICENSING:  MBS Connection Elder Day Services will have proper certification or licensing in place before opening for services.  Failure to comply with FSSA and IAADS presents the risk of fines or having our business shut down.
  • LOSS OF INCOME:  It is important for services and the welfare of our program that we have a payment plan policy  included in our application package.  Customers will be responsible to pay for the services even when absent on required dates of service requested of the customers.  Customers often move away, loved ones health decline, or financial situations change they may mean losing business without notice.  There isn't much we can do about this risk, but plan fundraising events.
  • A plan is in place to tract our prospective customers/clients:  Our plan for December 19, 2015 is to host a "Silver Citizens Comedy Social Matinee" event for Caregivers and their elderly loved ones to enjoy a day of fun and laughter (for approximately 100 participants).
  • We will plan at this event to do a focus group survey, designed for caregivers and their elderly loved ones to share their perceptions of adult day services.  We will  provide pre-registration enrollment.
  • RAISING FUNDS:  Establish donor relationships may or may not be a challenge.  While employed at The John H. Boner Community Center, I cultivated donor relationships and raised more than $10,000 in funds and in-kind donations from businesses that supported our successful and profitable events and seminars for approximately 175 to 200 senior citizens (such as Mind Body Soul Conference in 2012 & 2014, and Bone & Joint Health Awareness Seminar in 2013). 
  • INSUFFICENT EMPLOYEES:  We will conduct our business in compliance with all applicable FSSA and IAADS laws, rules and regulations for staff-to-adult ratio.
  • Our staff will be mandated to report adult abuse that may occur from staff, caregivers and/or guardians.  This means that any suspected incidences of abuse inside or outside our care must be reported and fully documented to the proper agencies. 


Other Ways To Contribute And Help To Make A Difference

We realize that some people have the heart to give, but may not have the means to contribute at this time, however, "You can help;" we need you to get the word out about our Indiegogo Campaign.

We thank you and greatly appreciate your donations of any amount.

We have been completely self-funded with community support.  We greatly appreciate the support received from the following organizations from the beginning of our business ideas up to our Indiegogo Campaign:

  • Star Media Group
  • The Speak Easy
  • Dreamapolis PitchFeast
  • DRIVE
  • Everything Entertainment Group
  • Flynn Means Business
  • Financial Foundation-John H. Boner Community Center
  • Business Ownership Intuitive (BOI) & Indianapolis Chamber Commerce, SCORE, and The Grindery
story_txt:
We Need Your HelpAre you worried about your elderly loved ones?  In realizing how quality care continues to top the list of needs and aging in place continues to top the list of wants.Mind-Body-Soul Connection LLC, is transitioning from in-home personal care service to a full-fledged elder day services.  In doing this, we will be able to serve a greater number of older adults, and  take some of the responsibility off caregivers. A Research Report by the National Conference of State Legislatures... We need backers.  It would be greatly appreciate it if you could help us and make a donation of $20, and ask 20 social media friends, associates and family members to donate $20 to our campaign, and ask them to pay it forward to 20 others.  So together we can make a difference in empowering and enriching lives of older adults keeping them connected with their family and in the community.Donations comes from the heart and are appreciated and would be acknowledged on our Face Book, Twitter, Website or in our Newsletter in your name or loved ones' name or business.  Refer to campaign list for additional perks.The health and wellness of the caregiver is as important as the health and wellness of elderly loved ones.  Our goal is to serve both through 5 Dimensions of Wellness Program.  Our programs will provide much needed socialization, education and wellness opportunities for older adults with chronic conditions and early stage memory loss and their caregivers as well.  We know that generations of families will benefit from a community program such as this. Serving our aging population is a great way to make a difference in the lives of our aging population and help them to build strong relationships which are a significant component to improve and extend quality of life among people of all ages. Meet Crystal, a Millennial Caregiver shares her story of the stress and frustration that comes with the responsibility of being a caregiver for her 79 year old mother.Meet Shawanta, a Millennial Caregiver express the worried, stressed & frustration that comes with the responsibility of being a Caregiver for her 79 year old grandmother. Meet the Founder
Hello,My name is Janet Y. Mackins.  For more than 10 years I have been serving aging senior citizens.  I have been a Caregiver, Certified Home Health Aide, and for the John H. Boner Community Center in Indianapolis, Indiana, I was the Senior Socialization and Wellness Coordinator.  I want to make a difference in the lives of senior citizens.  I am a passionate advocate for seniors and volunteer my time as an Ambassador for the Marion County Council On Aging.Throughout my life's journey I have had the privilege of living out different career paths that have developed, cultivated, and catapulted me to where I am today.  About midway through my professional career I decided to change direction.  I pursued and obtained a Master's Degree in Gerontology from Ball State University.  Living as a baby boomer myself I began to see firsthand where I could be an asset to redefining the quality of life in aging.  I continue to explore the different facets of issues facing senior citizens today.  Quality care continues to top the list of needs and aging in place continues to top the list of wants.  I believe MBS Connection Elder Day Services addresses both.I am a woman of faith, a mother and grandmother.  My starting point in honoring God is serving others, especially our elders, and enriching every life I touch.  I feel privileged and grateful to be able to pursue my calling through this God-given business, Mind-Body-Soul Connection LLC. What We Need?Mind-Body-Soul Connection LLC hopes to raise $150,000 for the Startup Capital for first year expenses.  All proceeds from this campaign are to be used exclusively for:

4,200 sq. ft. facilities expense includes Security Deposit, Rent, Build-out, Utilities and Internet etc.; for potential location on the Northwest sector of Indianapolis, IN.  
Operating Professional Costs includes Attorney Fees, Liability Insurance, Accountant Fees, and Quarterly Taxes.
Payroll & Benefits includes staff  to be in compliance with staff-to-clients ratios according to FSSA guidelines.
Registered Nurse 
Certified Medication Aide 
4-Certified Nurse Aides(CNA)
Administrative Assistant
Appliances include Refrigerator, Freezer, Range and Microwave Oven.
Office Furniture/Equipment includes Computers, Printers, Fax Machine, Office Supplies, and Marketing Material.
Furniture and Adult Care Equipment includes a mininal of 5 6-ft round tables, 20-cushion arm chairs, sofa & chair, handicapped accessible toilet seats, Dehumidifier, Storage Organizers, Corelle Dishes & Flatware etc.
Television/Entertainment Equipment includes Television, DVR, Stereo Entertainment System  and 5 Headsets (for music therapy).
Medical Equipment includes AED Defibrillator, First Aid Kit, and Blood Pressure Monitor.
Additional miscellaneous equipment and materials to meet the needs of clients.
In addition to monetary donations, we will also be very grateful to receive any in-kind donations of the above mention items.We have a 3-year Financial Projections in place; below is a graph of our first year projection that projects MBS Connection Elder Day Services will generate a net income within a year from our opening date based on serving a minimal of 19 clients per month  and raising $150,000.  



Total Payroll & Benefits:  $96,160Total Facilities Cost:  $36,075Total Operating Cost:  $38,512If we don't reach our entire funding goal we will consider three options:
We will reach out to local churches and community organizations to incubate MBS Connection Elder Day Services in a church or other facility, instead of a traditional elder day services serving maximum of 25 clients in our own facility.
If we raise $50,000 we will be able to provide the basic level services which is non medical, this would decrease staff and other facility expenses. 
We will add intermediate and advance level services as funding and resources increases.
Our last option will be to apply for a business loan from a Small Business Association (SBA) Lender; however this is a last resort as we are hoping to start MBS Connection Elder Day Services debt free. 
If we surpass our goal we will be able to offer scholarships to clients with a combined annual income at or below 150% of the Federal Poverty Guidelines.
We are dedicated to making this a reality for older adults, their caregivers, and the community.We will implement 5 Dimensions of Wellness:SOCIAL WELLNESS -SPIRITUAL WELLNES -PHYSICAL WELLNESS - 
EMOTIONAL WELLNESS - 



INTELLECTUAL WELLNES - 



What will you receive for your donations?We are offering several tokens of appreciation for donations:
Thank You Card
MBS Ceramic Mug
Acknowledgement of contribution on Mind-Body-Soul Connection's Website, Face Book, Twitter, and LinkedIn.
Your name, loved ones' name,  or company logo on our monthly event calendar for 6 months or a year.
Your name or loved ones' name, business listed on a business card size advertisement on our website for a year.
Your name, loved ones' name  or company's name engraved on 1/3" plate on a Portrait Frame Perpetual for display in our facility.
A scholarship for 3 months (3-day week) in your name, loved ones' name or company's name for an older adult of your choice or selected applicant with households combined annual income at or below 150% of the Federal Poverty Guidelines (Value $2700).
