story:
About the project:

We often ask where our food comes from, but what about our clothes? 

Our Goal: To construct a wardrobe using locally sourced fiber, labor and dyes. 

The Piedmont Fibershed seeks to build a regional textile community that fosters and strengthens the "soil-to-skin" concept of clothing construction. Building a local textile culture, and relying on the natural resources the Triangle region has to offer, the Piedmont Fibershed aims to bolster regional economies through education, local sourcing of fiber, local production of textiles and clothing, and by growing and processing natural, locally grown dyes. 

Why is local fashion essential?

  • Cuts down on pollution, big time. The fast-fashion industry is one of the worst polluters of our world, our waterways, and our air quality. There are better ways to produce clothing and textiles that can and should last a lifetime.
  • Supports the local economy by building demand for fiber, production, artisans, dyers, weavers, and consumers of local, ethical fashion. 
  • It feels great to wear something that was organically grown close to home, to know the name of the animal whose fiber was used in the production of the garment, and to be able to wear again and again something that was well made out of quality material that won't need to be replaced after a couple washings. 

A bit about me: I'm Diana, a fiber hyper-enthusiast who is just as passionate about the animals who provide us with the material we need to clothe our bodies. And, fashion. I have a background in costume production and clothing design. I am obsessed with fashion, clothes, and animals. I believe that I can marry these passions to make a statement that, in turn, will benefit my local community.


What's in it for you?

  • If you ever think about "throw away fashion" and its impact on our earth. Or if you think about the animals whose fiber is used to produce the clothing that keeps you warm. If you love the idea of "home-grown" fashion, the potential benefits are unlimited. We're just getting started, and we need your help to dig in our heels and get to work!
  • If you donate any amount, we'll add you to our insider's blog, which will give you exclusive access into how the project is progressing. In addition, we will give you tickets to the fashion show. 
  • Be sure to check out our perks!

How will we use these funds? 

The initial goal of the project will include constructing a wardrobe out of locally sourced fibers, so:
  • $2,000 will pay the farmers for their fiber
  • $1,000 will pay the mill for washing, carding, and spinning the fiber into yarn
  • $1,000 will pay for some of the yarn to be woven into cloth, from which, beautiful clothes will be made (the rest of the yarn will be used to knit some of the garments)
  • $500will be used to pay for high quality photography (at a discounted rate) of the clothing and construction process
  • $500 will be used to pay for the venue that will be used for the culminating fashion show
  • If we don't reach our funding goal, and depending on by how much we miss our mark, we will scale back the project to accommodate for the shortfall in funding. 
We've got our farmers. We've got our fiber. Now, we just need the funds to build this wardrobe!

Other ways you can help:

  • We're grateful for any type of support you can provide, be it financial, moral, or through a blast about this project to all of your Facebook pals! Help us get the word out. 
  • Like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/piedmontfibershed
  • Check out our blog: www.piedmontfibershed.wordpress.com
  • Share this campaign with friends and acquaintances who might be interested!

story:
My name is Brooke Rockwell. I'm the owner of Brooke Rockwell Hair Design.  I have been a hairstylist since graduating high school.  My 2 sisters and I have had our salon in Washington Plaza Apartments for 22 years. 
     I can't imagine losing our salon.  It's been such a huge part of my life. I love everything about it.  We continue to grow our business and have added lots of new services and another stylist, (not a sister) Christina.
     We have clients that we have grown up with.  We share our lives with people as we all move through events, going to college, weddings, having babies, vacations, sharing good and bad times.  My business is totally personal to me not just a leased space.
    NEW UPDATE:  As of July 8, 2015 we were offered a new space by our current landlords. They have offered a space to us in Allegheny Center Mall, the new Nova Place. Our costs are still more than we expected but are more manageable for us.
     It's so wonderful that this platform is available for us and with your help and all of your friends we can continue our mission of good hair for everyone! I feel great that we are able to offer you products and services for your donations. It will be fabulous that we can say so many great people helped us with our unexpected move.

story:
Hello everybody!

My name is Bogdan Santejudean and I am a very active and sociable person. One of my biggest passions is to work with people and established new relationships. I want to prove to everbody that anyone can become a successful person no matter what obstacles have to pass!

In last two years I've worked as a freelancer (here is my online profile and my portfolio). For those who don't know, freelancing is one of the easiest, fastest, and lowest cost ways to start working for yourself. Multiple freelancing websites, like Elance.com and Freelancer.com provide an online marketplace where employers post work and freelancers bid on completing the work in an open market, which is often extremely competitive.

In this period of time I realised how easy is to do something profitable with your freetime when you have perseverence and confidence. My target was to support financialy my family but now I want to help more people who would like to do something new but they either don't have enough confidence in their abbilities or they don't know how to start or where to find the informations they need. So why not to share my knowledge about freelancing with others so they'll be able to achive the succes sooner? If i succeded when i was only 17 years old to work with important companies why you or others shouldnt? And this is the theme for the very first course.

After this, I want to travel my country and why not the entire world looking for instructors, I will help them share their knowledge about business strategies, art of negociation, life, confidence, productivity tips, guitar lessons, programming, traveling tricks,  personal development or anything that could be usefull for your personal development!

I've already contacted few udemy instructors to join my team and togheter to cover a wider rage of themes.

Also I've started working on a website which will present and promovate our products: http://www.yourlifedesigners.com but it's still under construction :)

Our high quality audio(English)-video courses will be published on Udemy, the largest online teaching platform that offers you the possibility to watch them anywhere you are and anytime you want!          

We'll do our best to ensure that you will get the best possible courses presented by the most talented and valuable instructors in the world!

The prices for the courses will be between 80 and 340 euros, depending on the complexity of the course. But if your donation is at least 50 euro you will have unlimited acces to all our courses for free. 

Why fund it?

I do believe in the power of learning to transform lives and even entire communities.        


Exactly like you do sometimes, I had my own difficulties when I tried to do something new, something different. This is why me and my team will do our best to provide you a wide range of excited course about business, programming, cooking, guitar lessons, psychology, personal development, travellling tips and more in order to help you change and improve your life!           

I hope one day you'll join us and become one of the best instructors in the world!

If I reach the minimum €2800 goal, here is where your lovely contribution will go:

- a second hand mid-level DSLR camera for recording

- lenses for DSLR (300 euro)

- a Sennheiser G3 wireless system - lavalier microphone (580 euro)

- additional equipement (lights and lamps, softwares for editing (200-400 euro)

- a second hand laptop so i can take it everywhere i go (300 euro)

- a website to promovate our courses and our instructors (including domain, hosting and designing (400 euro - most of the work will be done by me... but i still need a little professional help)

- facebook advertising campaign and google adsens campaign for first few months (200 euro)

Total: 2800 euro

+personal investments (studio rent, costs of traveling my country and more will be supported by me)

The longterm target is to transform this business in a charitable organisation (next year). And with the money raised from sellings to help children and persons who don't have the possibility to do what they would love to.

I am very confident about this and I do my best to turn my dream in reality even if I will not be founded... because I NEVER give up! 

Thank you very much! and sorry for my English skills... still learning :)

Bogdan

PS: Please leave a messege/feedback/comment, I want improve this concept so every feedback is important for me! Thank you!
story_txt:
Hello everybody!My name is Bogdan Santejudean and I am a very active and sociable person. One of my biggest passions is to work with people and established new relationships. I want to prove to everbody that anyone can become a successful person no matter what obstacles have to pass!
In last two years I've worked as a freelancer (here is my online profile and my portfolio). For those who don't know, freelancing is one of the easiest, fastest, and lowest cost ways to start working for yourself. Multiple freelancing websites, like Elance.com and Freelancer.com provide an online marketplace where employers post work and freelancers bid on completing the work in an open market, which is often extremely competitive.In this period of time I realised how easy is to do something profitable with your freetime when you have perseverence and confidence. My target was to support financialy my family but now I want to help more people who would like to do something new but they either don't have enough confidence in their abbilities or they don't know how to start or where to find the informations they need. So why not to share my knowledge about freelancing with others so they'll be able to achive the succes sooner? If i succeded when i was only 17 years old to work with important companies why you or others shouldnt? And this is the theme for the very first course.After this, I want to travel my country and why not the entire world looking for instructors, I will help them share their knowledge about business strategies, art of negociation, life, confidence, productivity tips, guitar lessons, programming, traveling tricks,  personal development or anything that could be usefull for your personal development!I've already contacted few udemy instructors to join my team and togheter to cover a wider rage of themes.Also I've started working on a website which will present and promovate our products: http://www.yourlifedesigners.com but it's still under construction :)Our high quality audio(English)-video courses will be published on Udemy, the largest online teaching platform that offers you the possibility to watch them anywhere you are and anytime you want!          We'll do our best to ensure that you will get the best possible courses presented by the most talented and valuable instructors in the world!The prices for the courses will be between 80 and 340 euros, depending on the complexity of the course. But if your donation is at least 50 euro you will have unlimited acces to all our courses for free. Why fund it?I do believe in the power of learning to transform lives and even entire communities.        
Exactly like you do sometimes, I had my own difficulties when I tried to do something new, something different. This is why me and my team will do our best to provide you a wide range of excited course about business, programming, cooking, guitar lessons, psychology, personal development, travellling tips and more in order to help you change and improve your life!           
I hope one day you'll join us and become one of the best instructors in the world!
If I reach the minimum €2800 goal, here is where your lovely contribution will go:



- a second hand mid-level DSLR camera for recording
- lenses for DSLR (300 euro)
- a Sennheiser G3 wireless system - lavalier microphone (580 euro)
- additional equipement (lights and lamps, softwares for editing (200-400 euro)
- a second hand laptop so i can take it everywhere i go (300 euro)
- a website to promovate our courses and our instructors (including domain, hosting and designing (400 euro - most of the work will be done by me... but i still need a little professional help)
- facebook advertising campaign and google adsens campaign for first few months (200 euro)
Total: 2800 euro
+personal investments (studio rent, costs of traveling my country and more will be supported by me)
The longterm target is to transform this business in a charitable organisation (next year). And with the money raised from sellings to help children and persons who don't have the possibility to do what they would love to.
I am very confident about this and I do my best to turn my dream in reality even if I will not be founded... because I NEVER give up! 
Thank you very much! and sorry for my English skills... still learning :)
Bogdan
PS: Please leave a messege/feedback/comment, I want improve this concept so every feedback is important for me! Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Growing up, I always had a love for animals. My passion for training dogs was unknown until I rescued our labrador-husky mix, Luna. Luna had a variety of behavioral problems, including destructive behavior, separation anxiety, lack of potty training, dominance, and mouthing. I found joy in correcting these behaviors and helping her (and our family) find peace and happiness.

I have always wanted to have a positive impact on the life of other animals and their families, so I left a stable corporate job in order to make my mission come to life. Over a period of time, I began sharpening my training skills.

I am now in a position to start my own business. I recently founded One Love Dog Training, which I hope will bring other dogs and their owners the satisfaction that I have found in the loving, educational relationship with my dog.

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for $5,000 to assist with start-up fees (mainly training equipment). Allow me to break down the costs for you:

  • Training collars and leashes: I should be able to provide each client with a quality training collar and leash (sized appropriately). The sizes will range from XS-XL (5 total sizes) and will cost anywhere from $60-90 per dog. Each client will be able to keep this equipment so that they can practice skills at home.
  • Bite suit: The average quality bite suit costs $999. These are necessary for personal-protection training, and we will need more than one.
  • Personal training: I would like to receive additional training throughout the process, to further improve my skills and techniques.
  • Company expenses: Uniform shirts, business cards, branding, etc.
As a donator, I would be more than happy to train your dog for free. If you'd like, I will also send you a branded company t-shirt!

The Impact

Your donations will allow me to get this business up and running as soon as possible. I am fully committed to this venture and am confident that it will be nothing short of successful. There is a tremendous demand for these services in every area, particularly where I live in downtown Tampa. I am so grateful for any donation; it means a lot to me that there are people willing to help me make this dream come alive.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your family and friends! Like I said before, anything helps. You can send them this link: http://igg.me/at/onelovedogtraining

Also, if you know anyone in the Tampa, St. Petersburg or Clearwater area with pets, please tell them about my business. They can learn more about the services I offer by visiting www.onelovedogtraining.com.

story:
Hi I'm Gwen Hurt the founder of Shoe Crazy Wine, LLC and PTE LTD. My love of wine and shoes has given birth to a company that my family and I are very proud of.

From IT to Vintner: It's been a Journey of Leadership, Innovation, Family and Passion!

Shoe Crazy Wine is a private label wine company operating in the US and Asia. Shoe Crazy Wine brings you an amazing and decadent collection of 8 Varietals. We believe a great wine is like a pair of fabulous shoes...To be enjoyed over and over again!!! Experience Something Special!!!

We are on a mission to disrupt the traditional wine buying landscape in Asia! In Asia today,the wine buying market is dominated by men! We aim to change that! 

At Shoe Crazy Wine, we are branded to market and sell wine to women.

Women in Asia are part of a growing middle and upper class of executives and leaders and are exerting their independence. They want products, brands and labels that resonate with them and for them. Shoe Crazy Wine is delivering that branded product and experience with our wonderful tasting and delightfully fruity wines. We want to be there when women in Asia take that next step. 

Raising funds through this campaign, we will expand into other Asian countries, specifically Thailand, The Philippines and Malaysia. We are truly on a mission! Just so you know it's not all about us...Our mission also includes giving back. We proudly donate a portion of our sales to children in need and handi-capable athletes who through hard work and determination have pushed through adversity to exceed their physical limitations! We are and will continue to be philanthropists, if we have a lot to give or just a little.

This all sounds great and inspirational but: 

We've been working for the last 1.5 years to get us to where we are today. We trademarked our labels, strategy and brand. We opened our Asia office, acquired all licenses to import, export, sell and market our wines in the US and Asia. We landed a key distributor and 2 supermarket chains in Singapore! We are partnering with two Distributors in the US for domestic expansion. We created and invested in a solid supply chain to support our planned expansion. Our extensive business experience working in fortune 100 companies has been key in building Shoe Crazy Wine. We are now in the middle of a big capital raise push. Don't forget, we're doing this from the ground up and we aren't underwritten by anyone but our friends, family and YOU. Once we finish raising money, we will begin bottling more wine to ship and sell.

So how do you fit in? 

Have you ever invested in a wine business? Well now is your chance to be a part of this amazing industry! Our products are only months away from reaching more customers, but we can't get there without your help. In order to keep that “Global Shoe Print” moving, we need your contribution to help us reach our goal -$50,000!!

This money will help us pay for the export costs, import costs, a few thousand more bottles of wine and marketing. You will help us achieve and spread the American dream which is everyone’s dream... to be an entrepreneur, owning their own business... building something from the ground up…from idea to reality!

What are the Risks?

Our risks and challenges are clear. Men buy the majority of wine in Asia. It will take some time and marketing efforts to change this. We are up to the challenge, but need your help to help us move the needle in the direction of women buyers. 

Asia Is the fastest growing market for American and French wine and spirits! 

We want to capture a percentage of that amazing growth!

Women have money and aren’t afraid to spend it!

Will your investment really make a difference? Your impact is larger than mere words. You will help create the moments that propel life. Think of everything realized, decided and solved over a glass of wine. The good and bad of life. Women exerting their independence and socializing for "girls night out" or in”. After all the concept began when, I made a batch of wine in my kitchen and needed a name for it.. My daughter suggested that I name it after something I love. I love and am crazy about shoes. Done!!!

You will have the chance to be part of the journey of an upstart – Start up! We launched in two countries simultaneously!! We aren’t funded by any of the big wine conglomerates! We believe in “giving back” a portion of our sales proceeds to charity. We aren’t just funded by one single family; we are funded by YOU. And when you see a TV commercial for a bottle of wine with the “Lady in a Shoe”. You'll take pride in saying…I’m part of the family that helped expand Shoe Crazy Wine further into Asia and in doing so make a social difference!!! Truly Wine Redefined!! Please help us to let them "Experience Something Special" with Shoe Crazy Wine...

What else can you do to help?

Thought you'd never ask! Please be our brand ambassadors by sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and E-mail using the Indiegogo tools at the top left of this page. The more we can spread the word about this great campaign, the better.

story:
(Disclaimer: Before you make any conclusions, please go to Updates tab first or click here)

The Overview

The goal is to establish a Filipino website capable of reaching out those who need assistance and those who are willing to lend a hand. It's a crowdfunding site (same as Indiegogo) where people needing help and people wanting to help meet. 

Pinoys (Filipinos) are born having that distinctive spirit of communal unity (hence the reason the word Bayanihan was used). Our team may not have the power to read other people's mind, but we are positive that most Filipinos want this and most Filipinos need this.

  • This campaign was not created for personal gain as we'll be jeopardizing our social integrity. Please keep in mind that whether we meet the target or not, Bayanihan Fund will go live.
  • The community we planned to develop will not be used as an income generating machine. We are not putting up a 'business'. We intend to make a difference. 

The Details

Funding this campaign is optional. What we need from you is to have the mentality that there is a way out of your problem and that you can be a solution to other people’s problem. As John Donne said 'No Man Is An Island'.

This is more of an awareness movement than a fundraising project. We want to impart the message that anybody can touch someone else’s life if the tool is made available to him. Whatever money we accumulate will give us the momentum in facing the bigger challenge of accomplishing that tool, our objective.

Below are a few features we envision for Bayanihan Fund:

  • Unique TLD (not the common .PH .COM or .COM.PH) for it to stand out
  • Neat, sleek, sophisticated, responsive design to keep it attractive
  • Strict security to protect the users and to prevent abuse of the service
  • Diverse local and international funding options which demonstrate our flexibility 
  • Promos and contests to make it more interactive and engaging to visitors
  • Dedicated blog site for important updates
  • Forum discussion so you can exercise your freedom of speech

Just so you know, we are in the process of building our team. If your eyes got you on this section thus far, it probably means that you are showing some interest in what we're trying to achieve. In case you want to become one of us, kindly check the perks section on the right for details on how you can join. We'll be more than happy to have you on board.

The Impact

Think about this. At some point in your life, you've been in a situation almost similar to any of the following:

  • need to buy a new pair of shoes
  • need to feed a beggar on the street
  • need to support a sick friend on his hospital bills
  • need to fund a genius invention

Yet what you have in your pocket is just enough for you or your family to survive the day. You need money, so you turn to social media for help. People within your network were hit by their conscience and were pushed to act or do something about it. They eagerly shared your post ('cause that's all they can really do). You received thousands of likes, views, comments, etc. Days or weeks past, your wish is still a wish. Simply because the numbers you collected are not convertible to cash, that's the reality.

With Bayanihan Fund, things will change. You can create a campaign to raise fund coming from people you know and from kind-hearted strangers. You can check different projects to look for a cause you want to support. You can browse innovative ideas and talents from the Philippines. In addition, you can also meet individuals who share the same interests as yours.

Q&A

Q: What do I get out of this?

A: Campaigning for a drive that would revolutionize the Philippines' social networking may not be motivating enough. We are running these contests to make it more rewarding for our followers.

#bFUNd Top Contributors. The top 3 with the most personal contributions plus your referrals' contributions wins. To make sure your referral counts, please visit How To Participate In A Referral Contest. 

#bFUNd Campaign Video. The video with the most number of views wins. Here are the mechanics:

  1. Take a selfie video and explain why are you supporting Bayanihan Fund. It doesn't matter whether you use Tagalog (local dialect) or English as long as it is catchy and convincing. (Length should not be greater than five minutes.)
  2. Send your material through email.
  3. We will post your video on our YouTube channel.
  4. We will send you your URL link.
  5. Start promoting your video. (Likewise, we will help you get exposure to all our social media accounts.)
#bFUNd Blogging. If you have strong appetite about writing, tell your readers about this campaign. The writer with the most referrals' contributions will be named as the blogger king.

#bFUNd Logo. Email as many entries as you like, however only one winner will be chosen. The following are the requirements:
  • Includes the words Bayanihan Fund
  • Has patriotism or bayanihan theme
  • Accepted formats are PSD, EPS, JPG, GIF, PNG, TIF
  • Must be available in two sizes
#bFUNd One-page Site. Create a Bayanihan Fund landing page hosted in any free webhosting platforms. Your page should have links to our campaign and to all our social media accounts (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Google+, Instagram). One winner will be declared.

All entries must be sent to bayanihan.fund@gmail.com. Successful participants will receive a brand new smart phone, Bayanihan Fund T-shirt, and special invitation to join our development team (if you are residing outside of the Philippines, we'll work out a different prize for you). Winners will be announced days after the end of the campaign. 

Q: Are you competing with Indiegogo?

A: No. Indiegogo is one of the paramount in global crowdfunding. They are up there. Base upon our study, Filipino crowdfunding projects hosted on international websites get minimal exposure here in the Philippines thus only a few of them are hitting their target amount. And most of those who succeeded are Filipino campaigners living in other countries, they were backed by foreign entities. Our target market is mainly the local audience. We want to introduce crowdfunding in the Philippines and how our 'bayanihan' fits into the process.

Q: What makes you unique from other local crowdfunding websites?

A: Our coverage is way more comprehensive. We are not like thesparkproject.com (innovations), philamthropy.com (talents/ideas), artisteconnect.com (artists), proteesproject.com (shirts), or giftlauncher.com (gifts). Any project, campaign, or cause can be created in Bayanihan Fund. Maybe a tall order, but since we share the same goal, we want to work with the site owners above for the possibility of unifying us all.

Q: Some tried, some failed. Will you be next in line?

A: Definitely not. Defunct sites like ibayanihan.com, ideacamp.ph, socialproject.ph, and getstarted.ph are our inspiration. We are passionate about this and we want to stay for good. We don't want to be tagged as 'just another' crowdfunding website so we are mindful of these common mistakes for startups:

  1. Creating website for self-profit
  2. Lack of technical skills and domain knowledge
  3. Poor planning and implementation
  4. Poor management 
  5. Poor marketing strategy

Q: How do you intend to elude these mistakes you mentioned?

A: As stated earlier, we're not here to beef up our wallets. Our purpose is to help the Filipino masses. Most of our team members may not have the necessary expertise to build and maintain a crowdfunding website but all of us are willing to take essential trainings and expand our research if needed. If we have enough budget, we are open to tap equipped freelancers to assist us with the tasks and perhaps venture on paid advertising as well.

Q: Why aren't you using Philippine Peso currency in your campaign?

A: Indiegogo is not accepting Philippine Peso. Banks and payment processors have their own exchange rates. To avoid any confusion due to inflation/deflation, we'll stick with the current exchange rate at the day of the campaign launch. We will only be using below conversion for transactions associated with this campaign. 

Q: What do you think is the key to the success of Bayanihan Fund?

A: The short answer is YOU. Whatever action you decided to take after reading this article will have a direct impact on us. You will define our failure. Our triumph depends on you. 

It all starts here in Indiegogo. Crowdfunding relies heavily on the network you build, the crowd you pulled together. The volume of support, resources, and awareness we gathered after the conclusion of the campaign will carry over to the formation of Bayanihan Fund.

Other Ways You Can Help

Though Philippines has a bloated population, the majority of its citizens does not have a credit card (or shall we say Pinoys are avoiding credit cards due to the temptation they bring). If you belong to the majority but you want to fund the campaign, your alternative is a prepaid debit card. This is being offered in almost all local banks. You can acquire one for as low as P350 from BPI. If you feel this is still a hefty price, you can own a budget debit card from Smart Money for only P100 (less than $3).

It's understandable that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn’t mean they cannot help at all. You can use the magic of any of your social media accounts in broadcasting this campaign #bFUNd. In this era where social media reigns, it has been proven that a single click on that Like/Share button could go as far as being a global trend. Who knows, you might be using Bayanihan Fund in the near future (we can’t imagine how proud that feeling is from your end).

This is a project that will benefit our fellow kababayans (Filipinos). We hope you will do your part in making it possible.

Make a noise, make it loud. Spread #bFUNd like wildfire.

Never interrupt someone doing something you said couldn't be done. 
-Amelia Earhart

SUBSCRIBE NOW

need to fund a genius invention

Yet what you have in your pocket is just enough for you or your family to survive the day. You need money, so you turn to social media for help. People within your network were hit by their conscience and were pushed to act or do something about it. They eagerly shared your post ('cause that's all they can really do). You received thousands of likes, views, comments, etc. Days or weeks past, your wish is still a wish. Simply because the numbers you collected are not convertible to cash, that's the reality.
With Bayanihan Fund, things will change. You can create a campaign to raise fund coming from people you know and from kind-hearted strangers. You can check different projects to look for a cause you want to support. You can browse innovative ideas and talents from the Philippines. In addition, you can also meet individuals who share the same interests as yours.
Q&A
 Q: What do I get out of this?
A: Campaigning for a drive that would revolutionize the Philippines' social networking may not be motivating enough. We are running these contests to make it more rewarding for our followers.
#bFUNd Top Contributors. The top 3 with the most personal contributions plus your referrals' contributions wins. To make sure your referral counts, please visit How To Participate In A Referral Contest. 
#bFUNd Campaign Video. The video with the most number of views wins. Here are the mechanics:


Take a selfie video and explain why are you supporting Bayanihan Fund. It doesn't matter whether you use Tagalog (local dialect) or English as long as it is catchy and convincing. (Length should not be greater than five minutes.)

Send your material through email.

We will post your video on our YouTube channel.

We will send you your URL link.

Start promoting your video. (Likewise, we will help you get exposure to all our social media accounts.)


#bFUNd Blogging. If you have strong appetite about writing, tell your readers about this campaign. The writer with the most referrals' contributions will be named as the blogger king.


#bFUNd Logo. Email as many entries as you like, however only one winner will be chosen. The following are the requirements:



Includes the words Bayanihan Fund

Has patriotism or bayanihan theme
Accepted formats are PSD, EPS, JPG, GIF, PNG, TIF
Must be available in two sizes



#bFUNd One-page Site. Create a Bayanihan Fund landing page hosted in any free webhosting platforms. Your page should have links to our campaign and to all our social media accounts (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Google+, Instagram). One winner will be declared.


All entries must be sent to bayanihan.fund@gmail.com. Successful participants will receive a brand new smart phone, Bayanihan Fund T-shirt, and special invitation to join our development team (if you are residing outside of the Philippines, we'll work out a different prize for you). Winners will be announced days after the end of the campaign. 



Q: Are you competing with Indiegogo?
A: No. Indiegogo is one of the paramount in global crowdfunding. They are up there. Base upon our study, Filipino crowdfunding projects hosted on international websites get minimal exposure here in the Philippines thus only a few of them are hitting their target amount. And most of those who succeeded are Filipino campaigners living in other countries, they were backed by foreign entities. Our target market is mainly the local audience. We want to introduce crowdfunding in the Philippines and how our 'bayanihan' fits into the process.
Q: What makes you unique from other local crowdfunding websites?
A: Our coverage is way more comprehensive. We are not like thesparkproject.com (innovations), philamthropy.com (talents/ideas), artisteconnect.com (artists), proteesproject.com (shirts), or giftlauncher.com (gifts). Any project, campaign, or cause can be created in Bayanihan Fund. Maybe a tall order, but since we share the same goal, we want to work with the site owners above for the possibility of unifying us all.
Q: Some tried, some failed. Will you be next in line?
A: Definitely not. Defunct sites like ibayanihan.com, ideacamp.ph, socialproject.ph, and getstarted.ph are our inspiration. We are passionate about this and we want to stay for good. We don't want to be tagged as 'just another' crowdfunding website so we are mindful of these common mistakes for startups:


Creating website for self-profit
Lack of technical skills and domain knowledge
Poor planning and implementation
Poor management 
Poor marketing strategy

Q: How do you intend to elude these mistakes you mentioned?
A: As stated earlier, we're not here to beef up our wallets. Our purpose is to help the Filipino masses. Most of our team members may not have the necessary expertise to build and maintain a crowdfunding website but all of us are willing to take essential trainings and expand our research if needed. If we have enough budget, we are open to tap equipped freelancers to assist us with the tasks and perhaps venture on paid advertising as well.


Q: Why aren't you using Philippine Peso currency in your campaign?
A: Indiegogo is not accepting Philippine Peso. Banks and payment processors have their own exchange rates. To avoid any confusion due to inflation/deflation, we'll stick with the current exchange rate at the day of the campaign launch. We will only be using below conversion for transactions associated with this campaign. 



Q: What do you think is the key to the success of Bayanihan Fund?
A: The short answer is YOU. Whatever action you decided to take after reading this article will have a direct impact on us. You will define our failure. Our triumph depends on you. 
It all starts here in Indiegogo. Crowdfunding relies heavily on the network you build, the crowd you pulled together. The volume of support, resources, and awareness we gathered after the conclusion of the campaign will carry over to the formation of Bayanihan Fund.   Other Ways You Can Help
Though Philippines has a bloated population, the majority of its citizens does not have a credit card (or shall we say Pinoys are avoiding credit cards due to the temptation they bring). If you belong to the majority but you want to fund the campaign, your alternative is a prepaid debit card. This is being offered in almost all local banks. You can acquire one for as low as P350 from BPI. If you feel this is still a hefty price, you can own a budget debit card from Smart Money for only P100 (less than $3).
It's understandable that some people just can't
contribute, but that doesn’t mean they cannot help at all. You can use the magic of any of
your social media accounts in broadcasting this campaign #bFUNd. In this era where
social media reigns, it has been proven that a single click on that Like/Share
button could go as far as being a global trend. Who knows, you might be using Bayanihan Fund in the near
future (we can’t imagine how proud that feeling is from your end).
This is a project that will benefit our fellow kababayans
(Filipinos). We hope you will do your part in making it possible.
Make a noise, make it loud. Spread #bFUNd like wildfire.
Never interrupt someone doing something you said couldn't be done. -Amelia Earhart
SUBSCRIBE NOW

story:
Help Us Make Our Dream Become a Reality

The aim of this fundraiser is to raise start-up capital for a small business: a vehicle service contract (VSC) company. Hi, my name is Scott Godar and I’m a 30-year old entrepreneur and single father from St. Louis, Missouri. I've only dreamed of owning my own business, but now I’m tired of dreaming. I have everything set in place: I have a business plan and a very valuable co-founder. I have a REAL opportunity to make my dream become a reality! The only thing I need is your help… Which I am now humbly asking for.

(Scott & Jameson (11-Months Old))

I know that not many brick and mortar businesses get funded this way, but I have to give it a shot. I’m humbly asking you for your help. I’m hoping that my fundraiser will be THE exception…

We Know What We're Doing & We Have A Plan

My background is in Sales, Web Development, Business, Marketing, and Advertising. I worked in this industry for several years and know the business in and out. What I lack in industry knowledge, I make up for in technical and business know-how, and my co-founder brings the rest to the table. We are 100% committed to succeeding and providing a quality service to our customers! We have a solid business plan and an office location picked out (it's already hard-wired). All we need is the start-up capital! This isn't an online venture...

(3,964 Sq. Ft. Office Space)

I don’t come from “means.” Everything I've ever achieved, or earned, in my life, I've worked for. I have a strong work ethic - I'm a go-getter. I want to provide a quality service to the our customers and I want to provide for my son in the way that he deserves to be provided for. Also, I want to do something that's bigger than myself. I want to give back to the community and offer full-time jobs with benefits.

We will be able to provide 50+ full-time employment opportunities, with benefits, within 18-months of opening our doors!

This can be a lucrative business, but this isn't a get rich quick scheme. We plan to grow the business intelligently and slowly - putting as much money back into the business as possible so that there won’t be any obstacles or hurdles that we won't be able to overcome. We are in the business of building a business that will prosper and stand the test of time.

With your help, you can turn our dream - this laid out, planned out business - into a reality. Small donations can add up quickly and I’m humbly asking you for your help. We can’t do this without you. This opportunity will change lives and will provide value to the community in more ways than one.

Thank you and God bless.

Sincerely, 

Scott


Breakdown of Start-up Costs for the first 2-months

  • Marketing/Advertising: $4680 per day x 20 days = $93,600 per month (advertising cost for 2-months will total $187,200)
  • 20-Cubicles Installed: $850 x 20 = $17,000
  • 22-Computers: $350 x 22 = $7,700
  • 44 20” Monitors: $100 x 44 = $4,400
  • Small Business Server = $2499
  • Office Supplies/Expenses (including computer chairs, printers, phones, utilities, licenses, etc.): $5000
  • Having the office computers and phones networked and routed, with all the needed software installed: $30,000
  • On-going Technical Support: $6000 per month (support for 2-months will total $12,000)
  • Salaries for 5-employees: $15,000 per month (salaries for 2-months will total $30,000)
  • Office Lease/Rent: $4200 per month (rent for 2-months will total $8,400)
  • Additional expenses: $50,000

Total start-up for 2-months: $354,199

The Startup

  • Closing only 10% of at least 100 potential sales everyday will equate to at least 10 sales per day (we expect to average at least 12-17 sales per day) which will equal roughly $14,000 in net profits per day (Monday through Saturday).
  • My business partner and I plan on taking very small salaries so we can build equity in the business to cushion refunds and expenses, and to reinvest in and grow the business. Most businesses in this industry do not make it past the first 3 years because the uneducated owners keep, and spend, too much of their business' profit and do not build enough equity in their businesses. We are building a business that will stand the test of time.
  • We plan on starting with 5-employees so that we can perfect our marketing and advertising strategy before we begin to scale up.
  • Only major overhead costs will include: rent, technical support, salaries, marketing/advertising

story:
Grassroots Communities Making Change Happen

With your support ComChange will connect communities in the developing world.  ComChange will use a unique web platform as a catalyst to promote dialogue, exchange of information, and sharing of what practices work and what practices do not work.  ComChange will promote innovative practices that emerge and mobilize resources to help develop and replicate these practices.

With the US$2,500 we have already raised through this crowd funding campaign we will complete the development of our website.  But that is just the beginning.  Some concrete ways your generous contributions will be put to work include:

·  $2,800 will support a Correspondent for one year who will be responsible for reporting on stories that are changing lives and empowering communities in South Africa, Ethiopia, Bolivia, Ghana and other countries

·  $1,500 will support one person as part of a team that will visit communities in nearby countries to learn and share innovative practices for changing lives

·  $1,000 will fund the investigation and preparation of a 3-part story on how lives are being transformed and communities are gaining power over their affairs – the Maya community in Belize; or communities in the arid zones of north-east Brazil; or the education and empowerment of poor children and their parents in Kenya; or a community, particularly youth, using bamboo and modern technology to rise out of poverty and build a self-managed community economy in rural Jamaica.

·  $4,000 will fund the investigation and writing of a multi part series on how communities have been working with local governments to set priorities and build consensus on budget for development.

·  $600 will support for one year a stay-at-home mom or one youth, as part of a cluster or co-op, to build and start operating a tropical shade house of hydroponically / naturally grown vegetables. With rapidly increasing demand for healthy food, shade house farmers decrease their food costs, improve their health, and make a living income thus transforming their lives.

·  $500 will allow us to promote our work and the ComChange website to NGOs, community groups/associations/co-ops, institutions, local governments and others in a country

Why ComChange?                                                              

In the developed world communication is an expected part of daily life.  It is mostly seamless, organized, and constant.  In the developing world it is not.  There have been issues with technology, priorities, capacity and a less than inherent culture of sharing knowledge.  However, that is changing.  There is now a desire by communities to communicate, collaborate, and connect with their peers.  As the founder of ComChange says:

“One of the images that has remained with me is the eagerness of people in communities, associations, and local governments in Asia, Africa, the Caribbean, Central America and elsewhere, to learn more about how others solve similar problems as their own. One of their frequent questions is how do others gain influence with institutions and governments?”   -  Franklyn Harvey, Founder, ComChange
 “I aim to help empower children of teenage mothers from the slums of Nairibi by offering a day-school, jobs to their mothers and skills for entrepreneurship. ComChange could not come at a better time. It would help make the world see what we are doing in these slums, connect with us and support the change we seek.” - Elizabeth Ochieng, Founder, Kawangware Kids and Women Empowerment Centre, Nairobi, Kenya, Africa

 

”COEP is looking forward to working with ComChange on its new web platform. It will be an opportunity to exchange our experiences developed over the last 20 years working with organizations and people that are building communities and transforming lives with a paradigm that is more fair and collaborative. We will be sharing practices and knowledge leading to community empowerment.”  - Andre Spitz, Executive Director, COEP, Brazil

What is ComChange?                                                        

ComChange has four components:

COMMUNITY HUB

The Community Hub is an online network that provides grassroots communities with the tools they need to engage in dialogue, build solid connections and exchange knowledge and innovative practices.

The Hub will provide news, stories, developments and other information from grassroots communities. It will include a Marketplace to find assistance and order community-made products, a photo and video library and a directory of community organizations. Radio and TV will also be developed for the Hub.

E-PUBLICATIONS

ComChange will provide three original e-publications sent directly to your inbox:

·  A regular original E-Magazine covering a range of special stories, innovations, networks and community empowerment experiences from the Global South

·  An original E-Newsletter with popular analysis of grassroots actions and innovative developments in a specific country or region of the world, or in a particular area of community action (e.g. food security, response to climate change, education, local governance, etc)

·  E-Bulletins and E-Reports uncovering the voices of grassroots communities on issues that are gaining wide coverage in the established media but neglect the views of communities

 

DIRECT ASSISTANCE TO COMMUNITIES

As ComChange grows, it will provide resources – technical assistance as well as fundraising opportunities and financial support – to local grassroots communities in the Global South. The resources will assist to develop and replicate innovative initiatives to transform lives and empower communities to bring about change.

FACE-TO-FACE GATHERINGS

ComChange will sponsor and host a series of face-to-face networking events and gatherings that will link grassroots communities with each other in a region or sub-region of the world.

Our Partners in Action                                                       

ComChange has started to engage with diverse communities in Africa, the Caribbean and Central and South America.  In the coming months, we will expand our range of partner communities both geographically and within socio-economic sectors.

▪  Farmers

▪  Co-ops and Associations

▪  Micro, small & medium entrepreneurs, and their associations

▪  Youth

▪  Disadvantaged Women

▪  Educators

▪  Workers in various sectors

▪  Indigenous and ethnic minorities

▪  Artisans, artists and cultural workers

▪  Diaspora communities in northern countries

▪  Health workers

  

How does it Work?                                                             

ComChange has begun to create a network of Country Correspondents across the Global South - Africa, Central and South America, the Caribbean, and Asia-Pacific. These Correspondents will work directly with, or themselves part of, grassroots communities to hear and prepare their stories and collect information for the web platform. They will also act as the contact point in their countries for ComChange.

We will also develop Key Contacts and partnerships with various organizations such as COEP in Brazil and the Caribbean Association of Small and Medium Enterprise (CASME) in the Caribbean. We expect that many groups and individuals from both southern and northern countries will contribute information and stories.

At the central operations hub, we have selected a capable and experienced team of editors, web platform developers, development practitioners and management personnel to co-ordinate the virtual operations of ComChange.

 

“CASME is an association of small business associations in the Caribbean region. We are looking to ComChange, as a like-minded partner, to help strengthen the micro, small and medium enterprise (MSME) sector and communities in general. ComChange will provide game changing opportunities for knowledge exchange, networking and transformative development.”  -  Edward Chin-Mook, President, CASME

What Makes ComChange Unique?                                  

·  ComChange is exclusively focused on grassroots communities and community-led innovations

·  ComChange’s primary objective is to help communities transform the lives of disadvantaged peoples and increase their self-empowerment to have confidence, strong voices and powerful influence

·  ComChange is setting up a cross-national network of Correspondents based in developing countries to engage directly with diverse grassroots communities

·  The online Marketplace provides information on available funding and other resources, and space for community enterprises to market their products

·  ComChange will develop radio and television programs on the platform

·  The ComChange platform will provide a user-friendly and reliable directory of community associations, co-ops, groups, etc as well as a schedule of major events directly related to grassroots communities

 

“Through ComChange, we can learn more about agro development and eco-tourism, and we will develop the capacity and resources to make our dream a reality.”  -  Community leader, Women Agro and Eco-Tourism Community Group, Amerindian community, Guyana, South America

What Will The Funds Be Used For?                                 

To complete the ComChange custom-made web platform

To expand our network of Correspondents across the Global South – Africa, Central and South America, the Caribbean, Asia-Pacific and selected countries in North Africa and the Middle East

To promote the web platform and ComChange in southern countries

To begin supporting communities and community organizations in the Global South to implement and replicate innovative and transformative initiatives

To undertake in-depth research on initiatives that are improving lives in communities and leading to the self-empowerment and organization of communities

Our Offer To You                                                                

In appreciation for your generosity and partnership in this campaign, we have a number of fantastic perks for YOU to choose from. Our perks range from e-post cards, T-shirts and art pieces from southern artists to photo albums of communities making change, advertisement on the platform and the opportunity to collaborate with us to support communities in making change.

 

“We have been engaged in activities ranging from after-school programs and camps to credit union, urban community gardening and film making. We see ComChange as a welcome opportunity to overcome some of our challenges, share our situation and experiences globally and communicate with and learn from other communities.”  -  Oba Kiteme, President, Success Laventile Networking Committee (SLNC), Trinidad and Tobago, Caribbean

How You Can Contribute and Collaborate                    

You can contribute to the ComChange social enterprise in at least three ways:

·  Make a financial contribution through this campaign and encourage your family, friends, colleagues and others to do the same

·  Share this page through social media and with everyone that you know who might be interested in joining the ComChange community and send them a personal note. This will help make the campaign a success

·  Write about us in a blog or newsletter or website. Encourage other bloggers and those with large social media networks to help tell our story and the stories of our grassroots partners

·  Engage in dialogue and contribute stories about transformative community-led innovations and change, and uncovering opportunities for collaboration. Share your stories, views, photos, and video clips with us. Visit our social media via:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ComChange?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/2CGrassroots

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/comchange

The Central Operations Team                                          

We have assembled a diverse team with origins from several regions of the world. The core team in the central operations Hub brings to ComChange a total of 150 years of experience in development and communications.

Franklyn Harvey, founder, Managing Director & Editor

Bob Thomson, IT platform support & roving reporter

Majed Rostamian, platform developer & support

Robyn Gordon, Editor

Megan Stacey, Editor

Wycliffe Asalwa, Sub-editor, Africa

Jonathan Taylor Ebanks, social media coordinator

Alex Lim-Sersan, crowd funding co-ordinator

TBA:  co-ordinator of resource development and marketing

Thank You                                                                            

We would like to express our sincere gratitude and our highest appreciation to YOU, our contributors and pioneering partners! Without your support, we would be unable to kick-start the ComChange social enterprise venture. We thank you profusely for being part of ComChange and for spreading the word about us!

· 
A regular original
E-Magazine covering a range of special stories, innovations, networks and
community empowerment experiences from the Global South
· 
An original
E-Newsletter with popular analysis of grassroots actions and innovative
developments in a specific country or region of the world, or in a particular
area of community action (e.g. food security, response to climate change, education,
local governance, etc)
· 
E-Bulletins and
E-Reports uncovering the voices of grassroots communities on issues that are
gaining wide coverage in the established media but neglect the views of
communities 


DIRECT ASSISTANCE TO COMMUNITIES
As ComChange grows, it will provide resources – technical assistance as
well as fundraising opportunities and financial support – to local grassroots
communities in the Global South. The resources will assist to develop and
replicate innovative initiatives to transform lives and empower communities to
bring about change.
FACE-TO-FACE GATHERINGS

ComChange will sponsor and
host a series of face-to-face networking events and gatherings that will link
grassroots communities with each other in a region or sub-region of the world. 

Our Partners in Action                                                       

ComChange has started to engage with diverse communities in Africa, the
Caribbean and Central and South America. 
In the coming months, we will expand our range of partner communities both
geographically and within socio-economic sectors.




▪ 
  Farmers 
▪ 
  Co-ops and
  Associations
▪ 
  Micro, small
  & medium entrepreneurs, and their associations
▪ 
  Youth
▪ 
  Disadvantaged
  Women
▪ 
  Educators


▪ 
  Workers in
  various sectors 
▪ 
  Indigenous and
  ethnic minorities
▪ 
  Artisans,
  artists and cultural workers
▪ 
  Diaspora
  communities in northern countries
▪ 
  Health workers










  


How does it Work?                                                             

ComChange has begun to create a network of Country Correspondents
across the Global South - Africa, Central and South America, the Caribbean, and
Asia-Pacific. These Correspondents will work directly with, or themselves part
of, grassroots communities to hear and prepare their stories and collect
information for the web platform. They will also act as the contact point in
their countries for ComChange.
We will also develop Key Contacts and partnerships with various
organizations such as COEP in Brazil and the Caribbean Association of Small and
Medium Enterprise (CASME) in the Caribbean. We expect that many groups and
individuals from both southern and northern countries will contribute
information and stories.
At the central operations hub, we have selected a capable and
experienced team of editors, web platform developers, development practitioners
and management personnel to co-ordinate the virtual operations of ComChange.


 
“CASME is an association of small business
associations in the Caribbean region. We are looking to ComChange, as a
like-minded partner, to help strengthen the micro, small and medium enterprise
(MSME) sector and communities in general. ComChange will provide game changing
opportunities for knowledge exchange, networking and transformative development.”  -  Edward Chin-Mook, President, CASME





What Makes ComChange Unique?                                  

· 
ComChange is exclusively focused on grassroots
communities and community-led innovations
· 
ComChange’s primary objective is to help communities
transform the lives of disadvantaged peoples and increase their
self-empowerment to have confidence, strong voices and powerful influence
· 
ComChange is setting up a cross-national network of
Correspondents based in developing countries to engage directly with diverse
grassroots communities
· 
The online Marketplace provides information on
available funding and other resources, and space for community enterprises to
market their products
· 
ComChange will develop radio and television programs
on the platform 
· 
The ComChange platform will provide a user-friendly
and reliable directory of community associations, co-ops, groups, etc as well
as a schedule of major events directly related to grassroots communities  
“Through ComChange, we can learn more about agro
development and eco-tourism, and we will develop the capacity and resources to
make our dream a reality.”  -  Community leader, Women Agro and Eco-Tourism Community Group,
Amerindian community, Guyana, South America



What Will The Funds Be Used For?                                 


To
complete the ComChange custom-made web platform


To expand our network of Correspondents across the Global
South – Africa, Central and South America, the Caribbean, Asia-Pacific and
selected countries in North Africa and the Middle East


To promote the web platform and ComChange in southern
countries


To begin supporting communities and community
organizations in the Global South to implement and replicate innovative and
transformative initiatives 


To undertake in-depth research on initiatives that are
improving lives in communities and leading to the self-empowerment and
organization of communities 




Our Offer To You                                                                

In appreciation for your generosity and partnership in this campaign,
we have a number of fantastic perks for YOU to choose from. Our perks range
from e-post cards, T-shirts and art pieces from southern artists to photo albums
of communities making change, advertisement on the platform and the opportunity
to collaborate with us to support communities in making change. 
“We have been engaged in activities ranging from
after-school programs and camps to credit union, urban community gardening and
film making. We see ComChange as a welcome opportunity to overcome some of our
challenges, share our situation and experiences globally and communicate with
and learn from other communities.” 
-  Oba
Kiteme, President, Success Laventile Networking Committee (SLNC), Trinidad and
Tobago, Caribbean



How
You Can Contribute and Collaborate                    

You can contribute to the ComChange social enterprise in at least three
ways:
· 
Make a financial
contribution through this campaign and encourage your family, friends, colleagues
and others to do the same
· 
Share this page through social
media and with everyone that you know who might be interested in joining the
ComChange community and send them a personal note. This will help make the
campaign a success
· 
Write about us in a blog or newsletter or website.
Encourage other bloggers and those with large social media networks to help
tell our story and the stories of our grassroots partners
· 
Engage in
dialogue and contribute stories about transformative community-led
innovations and change, and uncovering opportunities for collaboration. Share
your stories, views, photos, and video clips with us. Visit our social media
via:
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ComChange?ref=hlTwitter: https://twitter.com/2CGrassrootsLinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/comchange



The Central Operations Team                                          

We have assembled a diverse team with
origins from several regions of the world. The core team in the central
operations Hub brings to ComChange a total of 150 years of experience in
development and communications.

Franklyn
Harvey, founder, Managing Director & Editor
Bob Thomson,
IT platform support & roving reporter
Majed
Rostamian, platform developer & support
Robyn Gordon,
EditorMegan Stacey, EditorWycliffe
Asalwa, Sub-editor, Africa
Jonathan
Taylor Ebanks, social media coordinatorAlex Lim-Sersan,
crowd funding co-ordinator
TBA:  co-ordinator of resource development and
marketing

Thank You                                                                            

We
would like to express our sincere gratitude and our highest appreciation to YOU,
our contributors and pioneering partners! Without your support, we would be
unable to kick-start the ComChange social enterprise venture. We thank you
profusely for being part of ComChange and for spreading the word about us!

story:
Hive aims to provide the absolute best live entertainment, service, and atmosphere in Bloomington and to establish itself as a mainstay of Indiana University’s culture and community.

Who Are We?

We are three young entrepreneurs (Ron, Jordan, and Ares) who want to bring more value to the nightlife scene in Bloomington, Indiana. Going out on the town is a personal experience, and it is one with strong roots in Bloomington culture. As great as Bloomington’s nightlife already is, we still believe it can be improved and we want to do more than open another generic bar or club. 

How Will We Be Making An Impact?

There's one thing that is certain, if you want to go out and have a good time, Bloomington is the place to be.

Indiana University (IU) is one of the largest universities in the United States. IU’s home city of Bloomington is known for its great college-town atmosphere. Bloomington’s nightlife is consists of 30+ college bars and pubs targeted at the usual demographic of students, alumni, faculty, and locals. These bars and pubs are regularly packed to capacity, and some of the venues are among the most profitable in the nation. Unfortunately for Bloomington, these current bars and pubs do not meet the ever-changing needs of the community. This has created a significant opportunity within the community. There is a large, unmet demand among students and locals for a nightclub-style atmosphere with live music and dancing.

 How do we know? We asked.

We surveyed approximately 1,000 Indiana University students and asked them to describe Bloomington's nightlife’s weaknesses and areas for improvement.. The overwhelming response: the community wanted more dance clubs. Those surveyed said that Bloomington already has plenty of bars for sitting and drinking. People want a place where they can grab a drink and dance. That is what we want to give you. 

You spoke, and we listened.


When the people responsible for a large portion of the $40 million in spending at Bloomington’s restaurants and bars tell you they want something, you listen. We know what students and locals want and we know that we have a great vision and plan. By leveraging our vision, experience, connections, and social media reach, we plan on building the best nightclub in Bloomington.

With your investment in Hive, we believe that we can provide value to our community in addition to creating a sustainable, profitable business. 

What We Need, Why We Need It & What You Will Get.

How much funding do we need and where is it going?

The total amount of money we've set out to raise is $490,000. It is a large number, we know. Luckily this is not our first time bringing in large investments. Thus far we have been able to secure private investments of $280,000!

What we need is the remaining $210,000 to get this project going. Even that sounds like a lot, right? Not when you break it into small numbers also known as crowdsourcing. The beauty of Indiegogo! 

This will be invested mainly in the design and construction of the place. It's going to be as environmentally friendly as possible. We plan to use solar panels, friendly construction material, including recyclables and a design for an extremely efficient use of utilities. The building will be designed in a twofold setup, with the front half setup as a high quality bar area and the rear as a concert venue. The former area will feature tables, bars, televisions, and other bar necessities. The club area will consist of a thrust stage, several bars, VIP areas, and a dance floor. 


What Are Our Unique Perks?

Where would we be without technology? 

The world has never before been as connected as it is today and there are no limits to the way we share our life experiences. However, social media could never replace a night of going out. Technology and social media can and will enrich the experience of going out, This is precisely something we will be focusing on at Hive. We will use social media to help enrich the experience of a night out and make it a complete experience where online and offline comes together! 

Not only will we be investing back into the city of Bloomington, we will set an example of how business can be used for good. With Indiana University just around the block, knowledge and ambition will be readily available to help build Hive into Bloomington’s premiere nightclub.

By thinking of people and the planet before we think of profit, we'll make an impact. We will also be striving, step by step, to get our energy solely from clean sources like solar and wind energy and to use biodegradable material throughout the daily operations of the club. 


What Are The Challenges?

Our biggest challenge will be the competition. In a town of 55,000 college students, of course, we are not the only one wanting to entertain people. Primary competition for us includes Kilroy’s on Kirkwood (KOK), Kilroy’s Sports, Kilroy’s Dunnkirk, and The Bluebird. They have been a staple of the community for decades.


What If We Don’t Reach Our goal?

If we do not reach our entire goal (of course you wouldn't let this happen), we will be looking to see how far we can feasibly go with the money we do raise. If we believe it is possible, we will proceed, with a projected opening date in Fall 2016, things are sure to move quickly!      

Even with that possibility, 75% of businesses in the hospitality industry go out of business due to insufficient starting capital. Since we do not want to make the same mistakes as some of our predecessors, we will be taking everything into consideration before we proceed.

Do We Have Enough Experience To Do This? We Do!

Ares is an experienced entrepreneur who has been involved in multiple businesses. The former owner of a club in The Netherlands and the current owner of a bar in Belgium, Ares possesses the needed courage and expertise to think bigger in the hospitality industry. Having learned what sets apart the great bars from the average bars is what will give it an extra edge to make all the difference in Bloomington. Ares' European background brings different tastes to the club.

Ron is a current student at Indiana University studying Tourism, Hospitality and Event Management with a minor in Entrepreneurship. Ron owns and runs the now popular Twitter handle @BtownBangers. This page has had great success in spreading awareness of events to the more than 7,500 students at Indiana University and is expected to expand to 10,000 active users by the beginning of fall semester of 2016. His previous work experience involves artists in the Electronic, R&B and Hip-Hop genres! Having the best events is what's going to set us apart from the competition and Ron is known for putting together some memorable nights. 

Jordan is a graduate of Ohio University with concentrations in Finance, Business Law, Real Estate and Philosophy. At just 22 years old, Jordan has accumulated and learned from over ten years of managerial, financial, and startup experience. As a result, he will be taking over a cluster of small businesses within the next two years and looking to expand his portfolio even further. By applying his expertise to the operations of the club, he intends not only to jumpstart the company to a profitable first year, but also implement methods that will prolong its exponential growth and efficiency for years to come.

Add a team of seasoned employees working side-by-side with us and we have a recipe that ensures that we will be ready to serve you, the customer, from day one. 

This is our hobby! Each of us enjoys working in the hospitality industry; we enjoy entertaining people. It would be an honor to take this opportunity to create a place that has the potential to be spoken about for years to come.


Other Ways You Can Help 

Some can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help!

If you can't contribute, you can still help us! Spread the word about the campaign or even contact us if you believe you can add value to the club.

Indiegogo has the best sharing tools right here so make sure to use them!

We invite you to join us in launching Hive!

story:
Short Summary

  • We’re Eric, Sarah & William, the people of SpaceTime Tanks in Chicago, the longest running floatation tank center in North America (and possibly the world!)  After 34 years of providing floating in our Lincoln Park location, we are moving just up the road six blocks, to a new, beautiful and more spacious site- partly because we have outgrown our current space and partly because the building we’ve been in is actually being torn down!  Our fantastic new location is under construction now- we will have a spring 2016 grand re-opening- and this brings us to the point of this campaign.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our perks are a fantastic way for the float devotee to get in on some great package deals, or, if you’re new to it, a nice way to get in for a special campaign-only price and see what it’s all about.  Meeting our goal will determine how many of the new tanks we will be able to begin with at our relaunch and we are so excited to deliver your “Inner-Space Observatory” experience in incomparable surroundings.

    Please check out all our perks - there’s something for all levels of interest in floating.

The Impact

  • We want to continue to provide the best floatation experience to this wider patronage who are just discovering floating for the first time as well as to continue welcoming our float friends who have been coming to SpaceTime Tanks since 1982.  With our new location, we will have a larger facility with more room for both pre- and post-float time,  we will be expanding from four tanks to six, and with your support, we plan of having what may be the most advanced float tanks currently being made.  While we adhere to the traditional idea of floating & have been successful with it, we are very excited about the advances made in float technology, sterilization & filtration systems.

Risks & Challenges

  • We started floating at SpaceTime in the late 80’s and have been devoted fans & advocates since then- so much so that it became our life’s passion & work 24 years ago.  We’ve always strongly believed in the amazing tool of the floatation tank and have used it to further our personal lives - even during the decades when it sometimes seemed almost no one else did.  Despite that, we couldn’t have asked for a more rewarding vocation.  Just about five years ago, floating took a turn - a sharp, wonderful turn upwards as far as an increase in popularity, media exposure and the awareness by the general public, and this rise in awareness has not showed any signs of slowing down.
  • When the campaign ends in April, we will be contacting all
    contributors via email with information on how to redeem their perks.

    If all goes according to the construction schedule, we will relaunch at
    our new location sometime in May.  We will be adding updates here.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We appreciate any level of contribution but even if you can't contribute, we hope you will share this campaign with your float-curious friends.
We’re grateful for all the years of SpaceTime Tanks- all the remarkable people we’ve met, all the extraordinary experiences we’ve had & have been able to help facilitate- and we look forward to being the past, present & future of floating in Chicago.

Thank you for your friendship & patronage.
